После долгого перерыва решил посмотреть во что превратилась игра. Для этого пришлось не мало потрудится т.к. в системных требованиях теперь минимальная Windows 8.  Какова же была моя радость когда игра запустилась, захожу значит на ПВЕ сервер (изучить новинки) и тут.... Кик за мою мышь A4Tech! При том что если с Bloody еще как-то можно что-то сделать (вроде бы), то А4 тупо забанили. Порыв конечно благородный - убрать макросников, но как всегда для нормальных людей вышло боком. С момента выхода х7 я использовал всегда только ее (не только для Раста а вообще) и тут на те! Покупай другую мышь или хрен тебе а не игра. Крайне возмущен политикой Facepunch Studios!!! Вместо того чтобы сделать нормальны античит, просто запорем линейку устройств, так же проще.  Крайне не рекомендую.

Когда я пролистывала список Бесплатных игр, эта меня действительно зацепила, и я даже могу сказать, чем: 1. рисовка очень миленькая, я влюбилась в лавных героев, только посмотрев скриншоты; 2. меня, черт побери, зацепил саундтрек, и я тут же добавила его на свой телефон и ее пару дней подряд слушала его на репите; 3. присутствие в игре озвучки, которая, как я впоследствии узнала, вполне добротная и не режет слух, что лично для меня очень важно; 4. ну, и самое главное, игра бесплатная! за все старания (рисовка, сценарий, озвучка) автор не спросил с нас ни копейки, и это однозначный плюс, учитывая, что я бы не задумываясь заплатила бы за эту игру, будь она платной. Я не говорю, что у игры нет минусов. Однако, пройдя ее один раз, я еще примерно месяц каждый день возвращалась к этой игре, перепроходя ее и заново влюбляясь в персонажей. И хоть я и прошла ее на все ачивки, я до сих пор с удовольствием иногда возвращаюсь к этой приятной истории.  Поэтому огромное человеческое спасибо автору за все старания, и заморочки, и, конечно же, за это чудесное детище, которое действительно радует глаз :) 10/10, однозначно, 10/10

说实话这游戏我也没什么可说的了，但是中规中矩是一款好游戏，记得当年是因为逆风笑和中国boy 湾湾 抽风 舍长 舞叔 小枫 大大巴 墓爷 手残联盟才无脑入的gmod，从优酷到bilibili陪伴了一整个童年，从我小学到高中，六年的欢乐时光，手残联盟真的陪伴了我很长很长的一段时间，他们真的教会了我很多东西，不过蛮可惜的，后来他们再也没玩过这款游戏，我也没有再和朋友一起玩过gmod，记得以前我一直都是去大厅找联机房间和陌生人一起玩，那个时候和他们玩的不亦乐乎，每个人都特别的友好，互相帮助，有说有笑，但是现在我看不到曾经的影子，更多的是相反的，不良的风气越来越严重，玩梗的小鬼越来越多，大部分人都已经忘了玩游戏的初衷，只是愚昧的玩着自己的游戏，说着自己的话，跟你开着你完全笑不起来，没有任何意义的玩笑和梗，他们打不过了或者有一点让他掉面子挂不住了就托关系叫管理员把你ban掉，他们为了赢可以不惜一切代价的来搞你，恶心你，开麦辱骂你（国内和国外都一样，这里特指某些人） --------------------------------------------------- “这还是你曾经熟悉的，你热爱过的那款游戏吗？”

Mad Max очень сильно похожа на Middle Earth и серию Batman Arkham. Но она соблюдает все каноны Безумного Макса все эти бесконечные пустоши, топливо там на вес золото хотя в Газтауне и на разных базах нефть просто рекой течёт. Игра действительно классная передаёт это атмосферу выживания у тебя каждый патрон на счету . Что мне не понравилось так это бои на машинах если на тебя выскакивают враги чуть уровнем больше то лучшее бежать. Качать машину довольно прикольно, из карыта мы делаем машину монстра. Как я уже и отмечал игра напоминает серию Arkham а именно бойовкой захваты, удары, добивания очень похожи. Игра довольно хардкорная те кто не знаком с такими играми как Batman Arkham, Shadow Mordor/War будет сложно освоится но вы привыкните. Вообщем игра мне понравилась, моя оценка 9.5/10   P.S Оптимизация в игре тоже хорошая.

Игра довольно хороша. Много всего можно делать. Я давно ищу игры, где можно самому построить свою деревню и управлять ею от первого лица. Здесь довольно много работы, которой можно и нужно заняться, есть выбор и отдельная ветка бандита, что тоже радует. Да, наверное многого еще нет, но это ранний доступ, и я уверен, что многое добавят. Не могу сказать ничего насчет осад, не вел бои еще, но честно скажу, не хватает боевки именно в плане щитов и блоков. Пока просто тыкаешь мечом противника и отбегаешь. Немного жаль что нельзя расширить стены. Просто я построил стену вокруг поселения, но в итоге у меня лавок и кузниц больше чем домов. Но это мелочи. Радует что дороги строятся сами, ИИ сам строит нужные им здания, а управление поселением и правда хорошее. Можно самому повышать или понижать налоги, назначать главных лиц, указывать сколько жителей пойдут в армию. Жаль дипломатия пока не работает, но это лишь вопрос времени. Очень радует в игре то, что ты сам решаешь где будет стоять деревня, можешь сам строить здания, а если убрать ИИ функцию строительства, то сможешь делать все сам. Они сами идут на работу, в армию, торгуют. В общем игра очень и очень удивила и обрадовала.

Very good game. Best call of duty game i've played! (played it for 1000-1500 hours on ps3)  I recently bought it for pc just to have some old memories back and i loved every second of it! The story is the most amazing story i've played in a long time and i would love a sequel! for example cod ghost 2 Yeah people complain about the graphics but this was made in 2013 and you should not care to much of graphics but more of the gameplay! They made the gameplay in this game so realistic its insane! And finally your able to use a ghillie suit and not be spotet easy any ways if you match up with some terrain. Also you got the exctinction mode and thats truely the most amazing alien story i have played and its so exiting to follow the characters through the whole story and you get too complete it without having to find out different easter eggs and secrets like in the zombies from other games! Just survive and keep going forward!  There are also some down sides with this game We go few people playing the game (on pc, i dont know on consoles) But you can still get 1-3 friends to join up on extinction or a online game to have some fun! You have to pay for the maps to continue the exctinction story so i recommend buying the seasonpass so you don't have to pay to much.   Over all i would say wait till its on sale to buy it cuz of the low player base or if you realy love stories its worth it for the Single Player Campain and Extinction mode!

This game is for RE fans only, but even as an RE fan, I found myself nearly dozing off at certain points in the game.  The story is very lackluster, and has very pronounced plot holes in it.  The dialogue is comically bad, like it's eye rolling - face palming bad.  I really did find the gameplay to be the saving grace of this game, which makes me wonder as to why Capcom abandoned this style completely.    Honestly, if you don't care about Claire or Barry's storyline, then just skip this game.

Lyantei is a casual visual novel from Sweet Slush Games. The main story is about you going to help you're aunt run a tavern, which has you doing different daily task. The story is a bit weird in places and clearly loses some effect in the translation. I wasn't impressed by the story as much as the artwork. The story just seems to try too hard and failed to get the effect it wanted with me.  With that said you can tell a lot of love went into the game and several of the 6 main characters are interesting enough to keep you going.  Each day you can complete 3 task, while other guest will chip in and help complete task as well. Your basically trying to make the Tavern the best place possible. Reputation, cleanliness, efficiency, food, potions and more are all things you can work on during the day to help the tavern succeed. While doing these task other events can spring up and give you more story and paths to follow. Most of the daily choices I ended up hitting the automate option, and that can get old pretty fast, but I did enjoy the story events that would pop up from time to time and I felt like the choices I made in those events changed my story quite a bit. Overall If your into Graphic Novel games then you might enjoy this one. If your on the border I'd wait for a sale and give it a try. 31个小时通关,个人感觉这款游戏还是一贯的继承了育碧快餐游戏的风格,首先孤岛危机这系列我从3代到5代都玩过了,育碧的美术一直都在进步,画质和音乐都很棒,第一人称射击和暗杀结合非常对我的口味,像耻辱系列等第一人称游戏我都爱不释手,我本来对于育碧游戏的剧情不做过多期待,但5代的剧情和人物塑造真的疯狂喂屎,最让我感觉尴尬的就是反派boss的经典语录,这些经常出现在游戏转场的过场画面上,配上boss的写真加上那些装逼语录,是真的尬,其次就是整个哑巴主角,全程不说一句话,真就让我们这些玩家用心感受呗,本作把剧情大量的笔墨放在了反派boss的刻画上,但我感受到满满的神棍既视感,代入感不太行.剧情一直是土豆的硬伤,但远哭5的玩法依旧继承前作(不如说没有一点创新).改变最多的就是暗杀动作,又刀杀变成铲子敲人??不愧是你,舞铲阶级,话虽这么说但育碧骨折价三十多块很是很香的说(顺便一提本作的哨站系统不像4代可以随时随地重玩关卡,而是一键全部重置,马勒戈壁,气死老子)

A wonderfully artistic and atmospheric game. Loved the gameplay and music, and the story was very intriguing and the it constantly has you asking questions and wanting to know more. The only thing that I was disappointed with was the ending. The story leads you on to believe that something big is gonna be revealed by the end only to cut short before anything is. The game also doesn't provide alot of replay value other than experiencing the story again, which leads to a very short game. In conclusion I highly recommend this game for it's artistic storytelling and beautiful story on living life to the fullest, just be prepared to not have all your questions answered when you finish.

By raising $11,000 on Indiegogo, Tormentum: Dark Sorrow proves that point and click adventure games still have an audience. And at first glance, it's easy to see why: not only did OhNoo Studio create a hellishly beautiful game, they lowered the puzzle difficulty so as to appeal to a larger audience.  Speaking of puzzles, let's talk about game design. In Tormentum, players do not control their avatar directly; instead, they click left, right, up or down in order to progress through a series of moderately interactive screens. As to the puzzles themselves, they appear in two forms. The first requires players search for a particular object, such as a bone to appease a hungry animal or a key to unlock a prison cell. Secondly, Tormentum is filled with mini-games. These mini games often possess puzzle elements—for example, adjusting a set of gears to open a door—but not always.  Experienced point and click adventure fans may have noticed that I didn't mention item combinations. That's because there aren't any. OhNoo Studio ditches item combinations in order to lower their game's difficulty while providing a minimalistic inventory system. Does this decision pay off? In the end, I have to say no. The puzzle design in Tormentum never strays too far from easy, and genre veterans will breeze through this game.  That said, easy puzzles shouldn't distract from the game's biggest triumph: tone. All of the art in Tormentum is hand-drawn and disturbingly ghoulish, with many monsters seemingly torn from the pages of a H.P. Lovecraft novel. The world alternates between horrible, bleak, and ravaged. No one finds goodness in Tormentum, a sentiment echoed by the game's ominous and occasionally plaintive soundtrack.  With decent gameplay and strong art, I'd consider recommending Tormentum were it not for the game's terrible story. OhNoo Studio bundles two video game clichés with a vague plot and obvious morality system. Amnesiac protagonist? Check. Absolving murderers good and killing innocents bad? Check. The nail in the coffin is the game's English translation: though Tormentum is more or less devoid of blatant errors, several awkward phrases took me out of the story.  When I think of Tormentum, I think of missed opportunity. What if this game had put a price on being good, encouraging the player to make the evil choice instead? What if the developers had fleshed out the plot? While Tormentum: Dark Sorrow could have left me contemplating life, OhNoo Studio settled for style over substance. This point and click adventure will have its fans, but don't count me among them.  FINAL SCORE: 5.8/10  This review was written for Literary Video Games. To see the original, click the link below: http://www.literaryvideogames.com/2015/05/tormentum-dark-sorrow-review.html

This game is a bit confusing to start, but is utterly amazing. As a fan of emergent gameplay and destructable terrain, this game gives more than most others.  It has a huge amount of content and more is added frequently. But it is well worth the price tag at this time even if no updates would arrive.   At first I felt my deaths where a bit chaotic and even unfair, but as I have learned the game better, it reminds me a bit of Spelunky, in terms of importance of reading situations correctly and efficiently. Sure different runs will have different challenges and difficulty, but for me its all part of the fun and you can always change your playstyle to fit the world you where given.   It also seems to have plenty of interesting secrets and bespoke content to discover, which I feel I have only scratched the surface of.   Highly recommended

it is a pretty challenging FPS with a lot of loot. The graphics design is similar to that used in The Walking Dead series - cartoonish style. You have various characters with different skills and power-ups. You can customize your character's looks but you see it only in the menu screens - shop, inventory.  The game is also very good at playing with your friends. it feels completely different when you play it like this than when you play it alone. You need to take care of your ammo and not waste it so you can finish battles. You can switch weapons in the fight and also buy ammo.  The game is is quest based and feels very close to an RPG game.

Fun and peaceful game. I saw people saying 20 hours, but for me it was a little over 10. This probably has more to do with my in-game hoarding tendencies than anything else. If you're like a magpie and love collecting shiny things like I do, this might be a good game for you.   The pros:  -SUPER beautiful art. Just feel happy looking at it.  -Engaging storylines with lots of interesting characters -Fabulous writing -Collecting base ingredients is fun! -Just an overall relaxing game.  The cons:  -There are no cons. For what this game is, for what I think it's meant to be, it's 99% perfect. And that 1% docked is just because I noticed a couple of spelling errors in the dialogue that threw me out of the game for a moment because I'm a nerd.  The more I think about it, the more I liked the ending as well. I could spend more time going around and playing just for the vibes of the game, so I guess I could say I wish it was longer or had a new game +. Maybe I'll replay it anyway.   Overall a very lovely and tranquil experience.

这是一款桌面宠物集成软件，内含一些小功能，装饰功用居多，现目前来说看起来还像是个半成品。 ui还有待改进，bug也有一两个，模型在躺着的状态时点击会马上瞬移站起来没有动画，创意工坊内容较少且质量残次不齐（大量原神角色），模型边缘仔细看的话是有黑边的，但并不影响使用，VITS对于内存的占用太高，软件本体倒是并不吃什么性能，我的笔记本是MX450（性能相当于1060），占用在9-20%之间波动，如果用台式机玩游戏几乎是没有任何影响的，以上，接下来说一下优点 首先就是上手学习成本极低，傻瓜式操作，而且界面也有小红车的影子，用着比较舒服，且因为有工坊的缘故后续的优质模型和人设模型会越来越多，这就是其他同类竞品无法比拟的优势。令人欣慰的一点也是除了社区内容外，此软件也支持本地模型，vits，还有人设模型等等，未来可期。

Cornucopia has all the classic hallmarks of the farming sim genre, but also includes some very fresh takes on familiar systems. Some of my favorite elements that I found interesting and fun include: [list] [*]Scratch cards that give buffs, quests, cooking recipes, and other rewards. [*]Unique fishing system that works like Plinko. Low stakes and entertaining. [*]Auction house to buy and sell animals and items. [*]Soil quality system that is deep enough to pique your interest  but not so complex that's a complete drag. [*]Diverse marriage candidates and liked item system. [/list]  There's plenty more to like about the game. I personally wasn't sure how I'd like the 2.5D graphics, but I ended up really liking it. Kinda like a mix between Paper Mario and Stardew Valley.   The game is EA and there are definitely things I would like to see (more customization of character and house, more festivals, refined dating cutscenes/events, expanded main story quests, etc.) however the dev is extremely active and continuing to push out content, overhauls, and bug fixes at a rapid rate. I had a ton of fun with the game as it is already and am really looking forward to seeing the additional content that's on the horizon.

This is an old game, but it holds up extremely well. It has the Rogue-like element where you restart from the beginning, but with gradual buffs to your character. These buffs are gradual enough that it is often hard to tell whether you are improving as a player or whether you are performing better due to the power increases you acquire, which is a delicate balance. Surely it is a combination of the two (it is humbling to start a new game and go back to level 0 when you've gotten used to all of your power ups). The game also has a lot of optional added difficulty options as you progress to keep it challenging and fresh. I would highly recommend. This game keeps it simple while still being really fun.

Well, i have purchased the early access package on the same day the game came out, at the time, the game was constantly lagging and you could not play the game properly.   I have decided to give it 1 more day as i expected those sort of issues on the 1st day. In the 2nd day of Early Access, the game was in the same stage, constantly lagging, splashscreen bugs, full servers and queues with around 3000 - 6000 players waiting.  I have stopped trying to play the game, however i have not refunded it. I have came back to the game on the 4th day to find all the above issues resolved. The game still lags in some places, but this is due to the engine that it's running on.  From my point of view, it seems that the developers are really trying their hardest to resolve the issues. They have managed to fix the major problems in 2 days which is pretty impressing. I have played much bigger MMO's before, and have never found developers to action problems so quickly.  For all gamers out there that hesitate to buy the game, please... Don't listen to people like LazyPeon and other Youtubers that are trying to put the game in the bad image. They have judged the game after 15h of gameplay. They have no right to say that the game is trash after playing the game for such short amount of time.  Developers have promised to bring more content in the upcoming weeks, and in my opinion, this game will outplay BDO playercount if the developers play their cards right and keep their promises by constantly working on the game and improving user experience.

Well I played it for about 100 hours now, I must say I have not really enjoyed a game this much in some time. This game has been thought out with extreme detail, and creativity that is apparent once you start playing. There are one or two bugs in multiplayer but not so much so that it breaks the game. Only real annoying bug we found was whoever joins the hosts game has issues with going up high towers where they sort of teleport back down, (minor inconvenience). Aside from that extraordinary game play, and world. I really hope they create more DLC like adding a neighbors yard etc, with the blur on the map seems bigger that what it really is. I have managed to edit game files and turn the blur off, the map is relatively small. But I am hopeful that the devs will create either add-on or more installments of this series/ genre. Seriously this game brings me back to when I was a kid imagining what it would be like to miniature like in "Honey I shrunk the kids" now I can see through this game. Also I hate spiders in real life, so naturally the wolf spiders creep me the heck out..... bad. Just looking into their den under the oak tree sends chills down my spine lol. But yea I just kill every spider I find in a complete indiscriminate manner. I just really hope they make DLC with more areas to explore, having done everything found every tooth etc,( which I found out there is one extra that I am convinced had a hidden purpose). I may have gone overboard completing everything too quickly.

Great [u][b]customization[/b][/u] and quite fun turn-based action. Love how the characters can move up and down the levels via zip-lines, elevators or in case of the Deadeye's instantly slingshot to a higher elevation using their grapple hook for a shoot from above or simply to get out of harm’s way.   But the [u][b]AI is Terrible[/b][/u] and the game do suffers from some random crashes and glitches. Matches can get [u][b]repetitive[/b][/u] as the objectives and settings are recycled through out the game only growing deadlier as your gang progress.   Do I  [u][b]recommend[/b][/u] it? [u][b]I do[/b][/u] if you appreciate to be able to customize your gang in detail and can live with a the incredibly stupid AI. It really feels like the enemies roll a die between all possible options open to them and then act out the result only to keep rerolling and acting until they run out of points.  Ex. Ai engage an enemy close by only to disengage after first strike, run up to an elevator using points to call it down yet instead of taking the elevator they might round the corner and set up a barricade in a random direction. Basically, acting like a [b]Malkavian[/b] on a bad [b]acid[/b] blood [b]trip[/b].

review: good graphics

I think a lot of people would enjoy this game more if they realised there isn't supposed to be a right answer and it's more of a personality test kind of thing. The game even acknowledges at the end that it's placing you in unfair situations with no good resolution, and even implies that free will doesn't exist, which potentially could've been explored a lot more.  It doesn't shame you only to be funny or make you feel bad, I think it's trying to make you challenge your own decisions so you can make a choice that really reflects what you would think is the best outcome.  It does pretty well in posing what is basically the same question at different points but with different contexts. For example, saving 5 by sacrificing 1 is the same as saving a big city by sacrificing a smaller one, but you might find yourself taking a little longer to answer the second question after everything you've been through between the two.  Good game, but get it on CDkeys for cheaper. Not worth full price for the length.

game: METAL GEAR SOLID V: THE PHANTOM PAIN
review: This MGS differs from other entries in the series as it is more open world based. You have to adapt and take a more lateral approach to missions, but because of this it can feel more rewarding than the previous more linear games and there are almost endless possibilities.  Graphically it still looks great today, and in terms of mechanics and AI are way ahead of its time (as usual with MGS games). There is though the small matter that the game definitely doesn't feel as complete or fleshed out in terms of storytelling than the previous games, which may sound like a positive to some, but it feels incomplete.  Also the game is quite tough to get into initially, especially for beginners. It really does little to help you acclimatize to the features or new style of game-play.  Overall a great game, but feels like it could have been even better had the production had more time, but hey, we all know what happened during the making of this game ...

Ehhhh, what can I start from. Well I know now. So...  Start in a huge land where you will be armed in basic tools and a toothpick which can be used only to murder bunnies or squirrels. Die multiple times from weird blobs of goo, that will have 20 times hore health than you can deal damage. Die...  Restart to see that night came and zombies and flying monsters are coming to kill you again, make a box so thoose dummies don't notice you and wait for dawn. Then start building house, so your dumb guide can survive and teach you to make items.   Get underground in quest to get some weak ores, because even tin is better thn wood isn't it? Then find better stuff and even crystals which will help you understand the power of mana.   Make armor, bows and swords or even experiment with magic, so the monsters can understand, that you are the new lord of this land, but think twice or your choices may launch the ancients forces of light and darkness to fight once again over your homeland.   Get better stuff, so you can overcome overcoming hordes of enemies, invasions, bosses and teleporting pink guys or werewolves, skeletons and possesed armors. Destroy demon powers to unleash holy elements which will help you craft magical armors imbuing you with the powers of life, death and... flowers...  Use your powers to unleash even stronger, mechanical contraptions over the world, which will give you HUGE rewards after defeat. Then discover the secrets of the Dungeon and jungle temple, where ancient power lies burried under mud and dirt.   Desintegrate pirates and goblins, which want to take your homeland. Or protect it from neverending terror, endless winter and bad-snowman army.  Get more survivors from compleating tasks, so you can buy even more powerfull arsenal of magic, weapons, armors and buffs to help you evercome the mightiest beings, which are as powerfull as the gods were once.  Set your servers to welcome other plyers and together fight the forces of darkness or light and become the dream team which is unbeatable, or use your knowlage to help other people on online forums and help treads.  Everything is up to you...  10.1/10 would play again, and again, and again, and after next update.

像素风缝合怪游戏。缝进了网络热梗如“工匠精神”、“二次元死宅”等等；缝进了模拟经营、肉鸽探索；缝进了模拟农场、音乐游戏...但...出乎意料的好玩。 +优秀的画风 +多种玩法融合提纯 +配乐优秀 +另类的海洋生物科普方式 -键位不支持自定义 -游戏流程短小 -主角命运着实悲惨，一人兼职潜水员跑堂农夫渔夫外交大使“环保”之敌，颇有身为将军还得天天通十松庄马桶的错觉 当我得知制作方另一款游戏是dnf，简直不敢相信，毕竟毒奶粉名号早已深人人心，顶多算年少回忆，氪金永无止境。但上手了这款游戏后，我对多角度看人又多了一些感悟，亚洲游戏厂商不是做不出好游戏，而是畸形的市场需求卷王社会造就了大批氪金手游。 还是有一些担心在的，比如缝合元素如此之多，后期制作方能否掌控住节奏；剧情弄出了个水下文明，后续处理能否合乎逻辑优秀闭环；主角能否给点正反馈，一个人打N份工老板也不说多发工资，至少寿司店算个技术入股不过分吧？ 期待正式版本的亮相。  ——————————————————————————  更新于正式版本更新第二天凌晨 EA阶段我能给8.5分，正式版只值6分。 抛开首日各种BUG不提，模拟经营主要玩法不多更新一点内容，新增解谜潜行和timing玩法？加顿一族无敌是吧？小加顿无敌，大加顿跟主角上辈子强奸了它全家似的追逐到死。E还有潜入基地那一关，前两层轻松趟过，最后一层那守卫移动速度都特么快赶上火箭了，从冰箱出来要赶紧躲箱子后面规避监控，然后马上躲第二个冰箱，出来还得赶紧赶在右边守卫回头前爬梯子，这中间浪费一秒时间就GG从第一层开始，中间只能暂停还无法存档？我的评价是没活了可以咬打火机，去贴吧一搜大部分都在抱怨这关，引导呢？太有网游开荒那味了。可别再缝了，解谜近似儿戏，想不出来好谜题就嗯塞无敌怪；潜行不看策略，看你的反应速度和背板，疯狂抓timing...咱就好好弄寿司店完善扩大海洋地图抓鱼不成吗？戴夫就是个潜水种地捕鱼端盘子的死胖子，非得给他加啥007的戏份啊？

[b]Foreword[/b] - I really like this game (you should definitly buy it as Dragonball Fan), but even though I would love to sing praise to it, there are some rather annoying issues (that are easy to overlook if you only want to play in Offline Mode or just want to make One Character) which I will list here.  I played the first one on another Steam-Account of mine, around 80 gameplay hours I believe. The Second One is definitly better than the first Xenoverse.  More Clothings for Characters, Ki-Attacks, Combos, an Overall better fighting System then the previous one, and so on.  Though, sadly, there are not only good things to say about this game. Some of them you will only see after you played this game for a while.  [list] [*] If you don't have a really good connection, playing online (aka. actually fighting with or against other players, not running around in the lobby) is nearly Impossible. Many times I was thrown out of Online Battles (In my case Expertmissions/Raids) without even beginning the battle. The connection bar that is shown to you if you join a room means nothing. This is one of the most annonying points.  [*] If you want to create a new Character you have to restart completly form the beginning, unlike the precious game. Every Character you make has to replay ALL missions, Story wise or not. The only good point is that you still have all the Techniques, Clothings and Items you got with your first Character. This obviously kills the want to make other characters.   The Developers threw in one of the last few patches a way to level you Character to maximum, with buying your level ups. Even with the Super Soul that Doubles the Zeni dropped, it still is an intensive grind you will have to go through, since the cost of getting to level 99 are around 3 million Zeni and around 700 TP.  [*] From what I know a Raid appears only once. If you missed one there is no possible way to play them again.  [*] There is no Official Website, or Calendar within the game, dedicated to informing the players about Raids and Events. Just around 6 hours ago (from the time I'm started writing this) a Raid started and if I hadn't subscribed to a Youtuber who mostly uploads Videos concerning Dragon Ball Games, I wouldn't have known there was one to begin with.  [*] Even though it is understandable that the Saiyan Race should have more then only one Awakening Skill, since the Main Characters in the Anime are Saiyans. It is quite sad that the [i]four other Races[/i] each only have [b]ONE[/b] Awakening and two that are a avaible for all Races [spoiler](Kaioken, Potential Unleashed)[/spoiler]. Half of them [spoiler](Purification, Become Giant, Power Pole Pro)[/spoiler] are even so [i]useless[/i] that they can only be used in low/mid-level missions.  TL;DR Race Awakening skills are incredibly unbalanced.  [*] No new Races and only a few more hairstyles for your Custome Character. [/list]  Personally, I think it still is a game worth buying. As said in the foreword they are easy to overlook and don't drag the overall gameplay down (much).

I don't really know what to call this game, its some kind of strategy but I don't really know what to call it.  FTL is hard, and addicting, and fun.  The gameplay is manic enough that it always feels fresh, whether exploring stars or fighting mantis pirates its always just a bit different from the last time you played.  The graphics are simple but very pretty and are in no way a detrement to the game.  The music is great and sometimes I just turn on the game and listen to the menu becuase I like it so much.  The story is fun and the universe is well fleshed out but can be completely ignored if you don't read any of the text, its not important to the gameplay but its interesting if you're into sci-fi kinda stuff.  My only real problem is the unlock system, to unlock new ships you have to get lucky with random events, which is a pain.  Still its a ton of fun  7/10

咋说咧 如果你是跟我一样贝塞斯达的游戏从小玩到大的人来说 你可能会觉得还不错 但是问题也是真不少 1 画面表现 我是amdrx6000m 全高三十帧都稳不住 光照还不错 氛围感也很棒  2手感 第一人称还行 跟辐射差不多吧 勉强及格 但是第三人称真的要命 比辐射要鬼畜太多了 跑起来憨的哈人 跳起来轻飘飘的 3玩法 最最大的问题就是地图跟块吸了水的海绵似的 很多地区都是没必要做的 不过如果你不是想跟老滚那样不读条一直探索的话就还好 4读条和各种杂项问题 读条这个问题我只能说很难避免我反正每次读条两三秒 我倒是无所谓 无不无缝这个我不好说 我不太介意  bug不少 虽然目前为止还没见到啥严重的bug 不过我最好奇的就是很多地方的步骤很奇怪 例如上下飞船 进出对接上了的舰船 为什么要设计成可以选择直接读条或者走下驾驶座然后走阀门过去  总结 未来可期 不大修几次救不活 不过对我来说还是挺有趣的

[아래리뷰영상참고] 플레이방식은 미션별로 있었고, 난이도도 따로 설정할 수 있습니다. 각 미션에 입장할때는 매칭을통해 사람들과 함께 플레이할 수 있는데, 생각보다 매칭이 잘 안되어서 저는 사람이랑은 딱 두판해봤고 나머지 2판은 자동으로 AI(컴퓨터)매칭이 되어  컴퓨터랑 플레이했습니다. 그리고 미션에 입장하면 그냥  시키는 위치로 가면서 에일리언 무리들을 잡는데, 진짜 말그대로 무조건 슈팅하는 게임입니다. 그래도 미션이 끝날때마다 보상으로 화폐와 무기 부품을 받을 수 있는데 화폐로는 룩용 스킨이나 무기들을 구입할 수 있고, 부품들은 무기들에 장착해서  성능을 개조해줄 수 있었습니다. 또한 미션 클리어 후 경험치도 얻을 수 있는데, 여러분이 사용하는 무기들도 경험치를 얻어서 좀 더 강해지는 방식이었습니다. 그래픽도 우수하고 슈팅게임으로서는 나쁘지 않았지만, 왜 사람들이 타격감이 없다고하는지 알거같았습니다. 총기 발사를 하면 발사소리와 피만튀기고 몹이 타격을 받는 소리같은게 없어서 사실 맞는다는 느낌이  거의 안들어서 그런거같네요. 보통 이런 슈팅게임에서 타격감은 생명인데, 가장 큰 단점인거같네요.. 게임은 나쁘지 않은데 어찌되었던  4만5천원은 쪼께~ 비싼거같네요..ㅠ https://youtu.be/u0Y0inXuPko

I used to love battlefield games and was a little concerned about battlefield 1 (turned out to be my favorite), battlefield 5 was ok but never played it all that much. This one is garbage. I'll never buy another battlefield game again, much like I did for call of duty years ago.    Glitches, major features missing and overall just a "meh" game. This is what happens when a giant corporation only looks at a game from an earnings standpoint.  I think the specialists ruined this the most for me; we've even got a "woke" specialist (they just couldn't leave it alone, could they?)  Fortunately, there are tons of smaller game developers out there making incredible games that I'll continue to support. It's just a shame to have to put this series away for good.

I want to point out that I don't actually have 60+ hours played on this game. By the in-game timer I have around 25 hours, but this game sometimes doesn't close properly and Steam still thinks it's running even when you're playing other games. I'm sure you can get around 20 hours of solo playtime if you go for every mission, collectible, and bonus conditions for the missions.  There are a large cast of playable and support characters that each have their own cool techniques and comboes to see. The whole aesthetic of the game is enjoyable and if you're a fan of Naruto, it doesn't disappoint. And, when it comes down to it, you're getting this game because you're a fan of Naruto and you want to relive some memories. It's not a competitive and technical skill-oriented game. It's a simple fighting game with a Naruto gimmick. That was enough for me to enjoy it, despite my numerous other problems.  And believe me, this game has a lot of problems.  - The "story mode" consists of missions you select from the menu, at which point you read a paragraph about what's happening and then do a generic fight. Aside from the boss battles, there are no cutscenes, no real dialogue, nothing to get you invested in the game. You would do much better just reading a Wikipedia entry then trying to care about the story mode. Also they skip Zabuza/Haku, one of the best fights in the pre-Shippiden story. Come on!  - The hub world is pretty awful. It's pretty large, sure, and can be fun to maneuver around with all the cool jumping and free-running up walls you can do, but it's empty. There are maybe 5 stores, and they're mostly clumped together, the rest of the map having nothing fun to interact with. There are a bunch of breakables but even if you aim to buy every item for 100% collection, you will have more money than you know what to do with and breaking objects becomes a waste of time.  - Side missions are awful. They can be fun and offer some cool challenge (compared to how easy the main story missions are) but they unlock as you play the story. When you beat a story mission, it unlocks a new character to talk to in the hub world. You run through the city to find them, and they give you the side mission. You then accept the side mission, and have to run to some other point in the city to actually start it. The hub world is fairly sizable, so it amounts to a lot of wasted time running around to arbitrary points in the city just to get to the actual battle. Oh, and side missions are, to a certain extent, mandatory, because you may unlock the next story mission but it won't let you start it until you've earned an arbitrary amount of XP off of side missions.  - THERE ARE QUICK TIME EVENTS. Screw these things. I went to 100% the game but realized that some of the missions hinge not on actually fighting, like the game revolves around, but there are a few missions that have you do quicktime events and timing specific buttons in a short time frame. These aren't fun. Who actually enjoys these? No one.  - Oh and every mission has 'bonus conditions' which make the mission for challenging to complete... but you don't unlock the bonus conditions until after you beat the fight. You could beat the mission in 20 seconds and then have it unlock the bonus condition of 'beat the fight within 20 seconds' and you have to do it all over again. Which gives you a lot of repetitive game time because if you want to complete everything you have to play every mission twice- even if you already should have fulfilled the conditions, it doesn't count until the second time.  All in all, this game isn't going to hurt you. It's not offensively bad. The fights are still fun, albeit the 'combos' are all just mashing attack every time. It's an easy game. It has a lot of artificial difficulty with weird mission requirements, quick-time events, and silly controls/ai. It's still fun. I still enjoyed playing it. But unless you have a REAL need to play the original Naruto story, just skip this. New games in this series will have better mechanics, a more engaging story, and more characters.

A brilliant little game. This game is a rouge like, you choose a character (each character start with their own weapon, such as: daggers, wand, whip, etc). Then you just walk. I know sound boring but it really addictive. Basically your character auto attack (the direction of the attack depends on weapons/upgrades). As you walk wave of enemies come your way. Cut them down and collect the blue experience points to level. As you level up select a random power up. Throw in a chests that open like loot crate (but actually free and in-game and no micro transactions) and you got yourself a game you will find yourself playing for hours.   I got this game for the Christmas sale ($3.99 USD) and frankly I feel like I should have paid the full price. The game is only $4.99 USD. That is really a steal for such a fun little game.

Ah yes, Five Nights at Freddy's...  The imagry in this game as well as the concept and idea's that truly are scary. though what makes this game truley great is the atmosphere. it's scary, freaky, unsettling and brings the nervousness into play.  The game adapts to your playing style and will only kill you if you screw up by not noticing the tells of the animatronics, thus keeping you on your toes.  My playing style was so erratic where the game was unable to properly mess with me like it did Markiplier and SomeOrdinaryGamers, so I had only gotten killed once in the game the entire time and that one time was due to how I forgot to check the doorlights which caused Chica to sneak into the security station and scream in my face.  This game has some great atmosphere to it which actually made my skin crawl, I got very nervous on the first night due to Foxy surprisingly popping his head out at me with that contemplative look on his face on if he should charge me or not... that's when you KNOW some bad shit is about to go down when you see a animatronic pirate fox peeping out at you and thinking to himself, "Swiggity Swooty, Imma commin fer dat booty~"  This game is a definite MUST HAVE for ANY horror enthusiast's collection!  And now to wait patiently for a demo of Five Nights at Freddy's 2 or the full game to get even MORE terrified than I already am! :D  10 killer animatronics out of 10!

Отыграв уже 100+ часов и начиная заного раз двадцатый за Чжэн Цзян понял что игрушка не так проста как может показаться. ( Говорю про лег. сложность) Тут каждый ход, КАЖДЫЙ надо продумывать заранее, ИИ настолько тут развит что ведет себя как сраный параноик. Я уже молчу про всякие нововведений, фарм репутации, грамотно расставленные постройки и отношения героев.  Перейдем по пунктикам к плюсам: - Как выше писал ИИ, очень даже годный ( с харды до легенды скучать вам не придется). И да, если ты зайчик который любил в Риме 2, топить армии своими карабликами с катапультами то тут моря нет :D В целом вам с первых ходов уже надо будет определится с кем вы будите сражаться ( дабы набивать репутацию, о ней чутка отдельно), а с кем дружить. И поверьте дружеские отношения тут многого стоят. Так что касается ИИ, очень обрадовала реакции коалиции на определенные цели, они действительно ПОМОГАЮТ. xD И руководить ими становится очень интересно.  -Графениус. Шикарный, особенно на Романе (Хроники, очень тусклые и унылые + нет героев.)  Оптимизация так же шикарная, моя старушечка в 2гб тянет ее почти на высоких, что очень меня обрадовало хоть на дворе уже 2019 год. И да, даже на высоких игра выглядит очень презентабельно, я уже молчу что там на ультрах.  -Герои. Да. я понимаю что это фича еще была в вашках, но я не особо фанат это серии, поэтому для меня это был вполне приятный опыт, особенно с системой этой "Отношений" героев. Но это все же неотъемлемая часть механики в игре, которую тоже стоит освоить всем. Дабы ваши полководцы не грызлись друг с другом, кидаясь абосаными тряпками в пулы сражений.  -Музыка. Про нее тут вообще нечего говорить, очень атмосферно вписывается в сетинг игры. Но очень рад озвучке, к русской, для меня все тотал воры были как "немая" игра, формальные выкрики главнокомандующих на команды и т.д., а тут во время сражения персонажи могут начинать диалоги, и они так же зависят от ситуаций на поле боя.  Из минусов тут только одно: -ГДЕ.МОЯ.КРОВЬ. хочу крови!!!!! Но это все же даже не минус, как обычно ее добавят в скорем времени за 100-200 рубасов максимум, хотя если еще и разчлененку добавят то это будет шииикарна :D  Насчет репутации, в игре все фракции стремятся к императорскому престолу, и что бы его получить, вам надо набивать определенный ресурс ( репутацию) она набивается от построек , войн, захват территорий и еще наверное есть много других фракционных плюшек которых я еще не знаю. Это вынуждает вас постоянно что-то да и делать. Т.к. ИИ не стоит на месте и зачастую вы будите сильно отставать от других фракций, сидеть на 2-3 провинциях у вас тут не получится, это сразу проигрышная компания. Надо ко всему подходить агрессивно, но в тоже время грамотно.  В целом у креативов выдался реально годный продукт на несколько лет, надеюсь они его и дальше будут развивать, добавлять новые компании ( ну куда ж без этого :D) и новые фракции. И поверьте если вы любитель стратегий, то 2к стоит полностью этой игры.  Вот такой получился обзорчик большой.  Смело ставлю 10 «ГДЕКРОВЬ» из 10.

[b]Non[/b] Si vous êtes un jeune joueur (- de 35 ans je dirais, mais je peux me tromper), que vous aimez les jeux vidéos, peu de chance que vous appréciez, la version de base est gratuite vous pouvez toujours tenter, sait-on jamais vous allez peut-être avoir un coup de foudre ? Le jeu est bien fait, fidèle à la réalité du flipper, plutôt joli... donc pourquoi pas ?  [h1]À avoir absolument[/h1] Si vous avez passez des heures sur des flippers en attendant les cours avec l'espoir d'en avoir une petite gratuite lorsque vous étiez lycéens, ce jeu EST pour vous. J'ai retrouvé des sensations que je pensaient perdus à jamais, des vieux réflexes reviennent, j'insulte copieusement le flip de gauche qui ne s'est pas déclenché (note : en réalité, c'est moi qui ait fait de la merde, je n'ai pas eu de problème de latences ou de bug jusqu'à présent, mais hors de question de l'admettre !).  [b]Bref[/b] : Je ne suis pas quelqu'un de nostalgique, je ne suis pas à la recherche de sensations perdues, je retrouve des sensations que j'aime toujours et qui sait ? peut-être vous aussi les découvrirez vous ?

Oyunda 3 farklı zorluk seviyesi var kolay normal ve kabus olmak üzere. Kabus yanlış hatırlamıyorsam normali falan biitirince açılıyor. Bu yüzden normalde oynadım. Oyun size çok fazla araç gereç ve mermi verdiği için hiçbir zaman zorda kalmıyorsunuz.Ayrıca çok fazla checkpoit noktası olduğu için çok rahat oynayabiliyorsunuz. Durum böyle olunca da gerginil tamamen gidiyor. Oyun 6 bölüm, ilk 3 bölümünde tek başınıza genelde ormanda geçirdiğiniz için artık bıkıyorsunuz çünkü tek yaptığınız ışıkla düşmanların kalkanını kırmak ardından ateş edip öldürmek. Artık hangi silahın hangi düşmanı kaç vuruşta öldürdüğünü de ezberliyorsunuz çünkü ilk 3 bölüm boyunca tek yaptığınız koşup adam öldürmek. 4 ve 5. bölümlerde ise hikaye biraz daha açıklanıyor  ve hikayeyede açıklanan şeyler sayesinde aklınızdaki soru işaretleri gidiyor. Bu bölümlerde yanınızda en az 1 kişi oluyor onunla birlikte ilerlediğiniz için oynanış üstüne o kadar durmuyorsunuz bu da ilk 3 bölümümn hantallığını kapatmaya yardımcı oluyor ve hikayeyi ön plana çıkarıyor.6. yanı son bölümde ise tek başınasınız yine ve ilk 3 bölüm kadar olmasa da özünde aynı şeyleri yapıyorsunuz ama daha dinamik şekilde ( yürümek yerine araba sürmek atlamak zıplamak vs gibi). Hikaye olarak gayet güzel, anlatımı da alan wake in yazar olmasından dolayı karakter bizle konuşurken daha sanatsal konuşuyor bu da ortamı yaşamanıza yardımcı oluyor ancak yerden topladığım 50 tane kağıdı okumamı beklemiyordur umarım oyun. Hikayenin sonu da daha tatmin edici olabilirdi. Bare en sonunda ana kötü ile karşılaştığımızda uzun anlamlı bir konuşma geçseydi çok daha güzel olabilirdi tak diye bitmesi yerine. Genel olarak aynı şeyi tekrar tekrar tekrar tekrar yaptığınız bir oyun

Game Dev Tycoon, or GDT, is a video game about developing games. Game Dev Tycoon was developed by Greenheart Games and released in 2012.   GDT is a very simple yet beautiful game. The game is user-friendly and it reinforces this by a clean UI that packs many features in a simplistic tone. For example, the menu button would have a research tab, a developing games tab, among others. These features would be packed in a list of sorts where a click to each individual tab brings up another small window. It allows for the player to quickly understand the various features without feeling there is too much.  Creating a game is very nice and rewarding. The development of games is easy in that you have a few sliders and you produce a game to how you feel it would be best. For example, making a music game? Choose the music genre and move the various sliders to how you feel is best in getting a 10/10 on a game. The idea behind the sliders is that the more importance you have on a particular slider, ie. gameplay the more your employees and yourself focus on that aspect.   However, the bigger picture in determining whether your game will be great is the list at the top of the menu that are bubbles. These bubbles mean four different things. One is bugs, the amount of bugs in the game you are making. Another is technology, how much your employees incorporate into the technology side of things in developing your game. Another is design, how much your employees incorporate into the design of the game like story, and research. Research allows the player to research more features to place into a game and to unlock new things throughout the game. But to summarise these four bubbles, they affect your game. You want the least amount of bugs and the most amount of design and technology points to ensure a better chance of getting a higher rated game. The best way to produce more is to train your employees. If you have not noticed it is a cycle that is easy to understand once you get into the game. So the gameplay is simple. In a short summary, you make games. You imprve your skills making games. You hire employees to help on games and you train them to accumulate more design and technology points, which garners you higher ratings for games.   The game is pretty limited. The features list is basic and has less depth than the newly-released Mad Games Tycoon. The You will get a good thirty years in game, which is a few hours, but there is essentially no late game. Just a full-on sandbox experience that has replayability, but not a ton. To use myself as a benchmark, I played about 40+ hours of GDT when it was released then purchased on Steam and stopped at eight hours. So for the price of $9.99, you will get value out of the game.  Overall, the game is a really good game. The clean UI and simplicity of the game allows the user to enjoy playing the game instead of attempting to understand the game for several hours. The gameplay is a cycle and everything is rewarded from continously developing games to hiring employees and even making your own console. The gameplay is basic, which makes it fun and easy. At $9.99, I recommend the game. 8.5/10  ----  Thanks for reading my review! If you like my reviews and care to read more, feel free to join Antwog's Analysis (Reviews). http://steamcommunity.com/groups/AntwogReviews  If you have questions comment below or post in Antwog's Analysis (Reviews) general discussion page. If you liked it, give it a rating.

when there are no good games, an ok game goes a long way .  is this a good rpg? No. A good rpg would have long and interesting sidequests, lots of dynamic dialogues and interesting side events with characters in plot driven dialogues. This game has nothing. it doesnt even have that much leeway for role playing.  Also no proper character customization. you can change weapons and craft items, but they are not really important.  is this an immersive sim? No proper stealth implementation, world feels empty and dead, very few routes for moving and things for you to do. Combat will always be the same. and very rarely you cna get enemies to fight each other,  combat- pretty mediocre dark souls. it implements well the mechanics of blood draining from guard broken enemies, but besides that theres nothing major.  plot: -not as engaging as it could have been. Ambiance gets lacking because of how stagnant the game world is, and how very few things happens or npcs there are in some parts of town.  this is a good game, in a bleak world. it was fun till i lost interest, theres more games to play and it outlived its interest

I have played fallout 4 a lot, and i quite like it, it's the worst of the fallout games to be honest, new vegas beats it in every way besides gunplay.  This game is great, if you've never played a fallout game before, if you have it's a very frustrating experience "why can't i be bad" being a question you ask yourself over and over, your character is forced to be a goody two shoes, [spoiler] besides in one dlc, where you're pretty much forced to be a raider [/spoiler]   Basically, this is a fallout game, but you're stripped of your freedom in the story, and the way your character develops.   Now, heres the really shitty part, if you mod your game, and fix all the mistakes, you'll need fallout script extender, which is routinely broken by new patches for the PAID MODS which are really not worth the money, most of the paid mods, you can get better, more supported versions on the nexus for free, but the patches break F4SE so you have to wait for a new patch...  In short, i do NOT reccomend fallout 4, get fallout new vegas if you want a good fallout game.

[b]~55 hr first playthrough[/b]: 99% walking and exploring, 1% fighting. A hardcore "Breath of the Wild" with alright environment / level design, combat, exploration. Light recommend on heavy sale.  [b]TL;DR[/b] -- Outward is a confusing game to recommend. I like what it's going for but it's just a frustratingly hard game to get into. Not necessarily because of skill but rather it's a constant test of patience. Unless you know what you're doing, you're sinking many hours in just to get to a comfortable place. Even then, it's an absolutely tedious, slow, and punishing experience for even the smallest mistakes. When you do succeed, it is satisfying but not as much as a typical action game. If you enjoy a challenge, you'll get that. But satisfaction, not so much.  Note: If you are hesitant about how hardcore or tedious this game might be, play with debug mode on. You can progress yourself when you feel stuck in a loop or discouraged. Let's you focus on the fun and not the tedium.     [h1]Gameplay[/h1] It feels a bit disjointed in its survival and its action RPG aspects. The survival mechanics are rarely a burden at all, if anything underutilized, and the combat is simple but clunky. It almost feels like you have to stack EVERYTHING you have, not just engage with a handful of solid core mechanics, while empowered by *some* tools to *ease* combat rather than make it *possible*. You can get through most of a Souls-like with ONLY health potions, dodging, spacing, and regular attacks; it doesn't demand crazy buffs because you're advancing in levels but tools still keeps things interesting. In Outward however, because of the lack of level ups, you need to use everything you have or else the simplest of enemies can humble you in the blink of an eye. The poor combat is especially unhelpful; it's clunky and slow. Even if you attack first, an enemy can still hit you first, maybe even multiple times. Some may even spam dodge away and counter attack, punishing you for assuming an opening. Your skills also regularly miss, wasting your stamina and putting them on a very high cooldown, possibly even getting you killed (Counterstrike or Brace for ex. regularly don't block / hit). God forbid you get ambushed and didn't buff up a minute before. Even if you did, you'll only increase your chances by a slim margin for a minute or two. Some of these points aren't necessarily poor design decisions, but preparation and retrying is lengthy and tiring -- food, sleep, potions, spell buffs, weight, durability, farming / trading, resource burns, backtracking, weakness exploiting, body temperature. . .  You can spend your first few hours preparing, set your eyes on a goal, then immediately get humbled by something you couldn't possibly have prepared for, which incredibly slows or discourages progression as you stumble around to recover, retreat, or end up in a loop of death.  You need gear. You need skills. You need money. To get any reliably, you need them all. Otherwise, you're getting smacked or chased endlessly by wild creatures or bandits, spending more time recovering than actually progressing quests or your build. Once you get over a couple bumps, it gradually becomes easier but don't be mistaken, you will still be dying just as easily as you were hour one.  Speaking of [b]builds[/b], they are obnoxious to even begin. You can be gate kept out of certain skills that make a build playable, or at least easier, making you stick with one playstyle until you save up the silver (for hours) to progress. You can't grind level ups and invest into what you need (well you "can", but you're getting drops worth 1 silver, spending a minute killing a handful of enemies). The quests also don't really push you in the right directions to gradually prepare you. You gotta either rely on a guide or suffer constant trial and error. If you don't read up on the game, you will find yourself at a HUGE disadvantage, especially if you're hours deep into a playthrough, such as the limited breakthrough points or timed quests.    [h1]Environment[/h1] The exploration is nice but it isn't my favourite nor is it perfect. The use of landmarks is well done, the minimal realistic map is immersive, and the locations, generally, are unique and interesting. However, most environments just feel like boring, mindless collections of corridors, rooms, or ruins with no real interest in feeling like real lived-in or natural environments. Some locations feel unnecessarily large (like 10 times your height) despite nothing inside justifying it, unless there's some obscure lore just hidden away in a corner. Designs also don't make much sense, unless I'm just missing the inspiration --  Monsoon looks like an abandoned carnival ground in a swamp of dinosaurs and supernatural creatures, Berg's Mayan-esque aesthetic doesn't match its name whatsoever, but Cierzo and Abrassar both at least feel cohesive and interesting. I never felt in awe of anything; the fauna, flora, and landscape sparingly had my attention. Even when they did, exploring it yielded little to no reward or I was just met with immediate death.  My feelings on the [b]open world[/b] are middling between okay and bad. Ruins and natural structures are just protruding out of flat plains with little or nothing to do. The transitions between biomes or landmarks are also abrupt, reminiscent of Horizon: Zero Dawn (minus the lore to justify it), though it's clear they help you navigate and orient. Environments as a whole have no interactivity beyond RNG chests, plants, and water. There are rarely puzzles or obstacles to open up a new location or path, or to take advantage of the environment, like the underutilized weather system or traps and hazards.  Enemies wander around aimlessly with no purpose, especially since there's no experience to gain. Rarely are there friendly NPCs of which have no interactivity besides the occasional trader. Interactions between AI is minimal, with only the occasional chase between prey and predator but never do you see rival factions or bandits fighting, looting caravans, or lost traders and fellow explorers. They're simple obstructions.  Most chests or drops are also randomized, making dungeon crawling RNG dependent. Exploring these dungeons can be a bit boring as well; they're dark with twists, turns, dead ends, and prop clutter of no purpose with the same outside enemies that can insta-kill you, dragging you kicking and screaming, deeper into the dungeon while stripping you of food and burning your resources. Most of the puzzles I encountered were so straight forward or communicated poorly that I fail to see why they were even added, like as a misplaced lever being in the next room over or a key just sitting there with no indication. What I at least appreciate is that some bosses would respawn you at their entrance, even so you'd still need to go through that long and tedious preparation cycle again.     Finally, [b]narrative[/b]. Honestly, my only impressions are that it was uninteresting. You're a part of a bloodline that has inherited debt, a blood debt, that is easily circumvented early on. After, you talk to the three main NPCs who point you in the direction of their respective factions in hopes that you join them. Their offers and mantras aren't intriguing so the choice is a bit "meh". For Abrassar, the Heroic Kingdom, you get sent on okay quests that concern the well-being of the city and its people, especially the slums. How you deal with those conflicts are up to you, even whether or not you fail by death, losing time, or poor decisions.    [b]Bugs[/b] -Locked at 30 fps for seemingly no reason. Had to restart PC to fix. -Stuck in water? Idk if intended but I get stuck the moment water reaches thigh level. Basically guaranteed death in poison water. -Stuck in tent. Had to exit to menu then reload. -Enemies hitting me through walls. -Skills regularly miss

Прошёл игру. Короче, 10  из 10. Цепляет под конец игры. Забавная концовка. Очень даже. На последней трудности игралось простовато. Буду пробовать 1999 мод.   Советую всем пройти игру хоть один раз.  А теперь серьёзно. Я читал все рецензии прежде, чем запустить игру. Говорили, что игра сравнима с книгой, которую можно листать/читать бесконечно. Друзья, сюжет и вправду хорош, но возводить игру на небеса мне не шибко охота. Да, отличное кино. Да, неплохая пострелушка. Это сложно объяснить, но почему то желания листать эту "книгу" не охота. Почему? Я не знаю, что сказать. Я немного зол за однообразность геймплея, но доволен за подачу сюжета. Я зол за некоторые баги, но доволен за великолепное окружение и проработку локаций. И тут я разрываюсь на две части: ругать или любить игру? Я присяду, пожалуй, посередине. И всё-таки она хватает, но и раздражает не меньше.   P.S. Кстати, концовка не такая уж и сложная. После Евангелиона, игра проходится без вопросов, но всё равно, я получил в конце от игры то, что хотел.

Существуют неидеальные, несовершенные фильмы и книги, отчего-то дорогие сердцу, позволяющие почти что вести задушевный диалог с создателем, с автором. У вас есть такие? И есть подобные игры, конечно. Fahrenheit одна из таких: изумительная по задумке, смелая, сделанная с нескрываемым энтузиазмом, однако вместе с тем спотыкающаяся о саму себя, чрезмерно эклектичная, где-то поспешная и невнятная, где-то радикальная, неаккуратная. Подчас ее подводит ее наивность, абы-какая собранность из штампов и ярлыков жанров, которые в самой игре борются за экранное место. Но что любопытно: как бы я ее не ругал, я продолжаю ее любить. Уникальный проект, изобретательный, какой-то родной. Все, что должно вызывать отторжение, не только не губит игру, а иногда и вовсе добавляет шарма. Обсуждать эту игру можно в рамках полноценного эссе. Skip this and get Shantae and the Pirate's Curse instead.

This is the worst programmed game I happened to play in a very long time.  Sure. the graphics are nice - but the functionality of the game and the way it crashes every single time something happens is just annoying. One would assume that releasing a stable game would be adamant when charging 89USD for a game.  First this Tobii crap hangs. How about programming the game without VR crap? I'd really enjoy this game if it gets stable.

This is the business game I've been waiting for. As an entrepreneur myself ive CRAVED a game that dives into the exciting world of starting a business. In this game you get to start multiple businesses which is super fun. As a someone who has started a few companies I really appreciate how you have to research market demand prior to starting a business in order to ensure success. I also like all the manual work it takes to start a company and as your resources increase, so does your ability to automate things. For an early stage game, this is a home run!   Hoping for a future multiplayer, store blueprints, and armor upgrade for vehicles. (Cars take damage way too easily)

Если сравнивать Company Of Heroes 1 и CoH 2, то можно понять что вторая часть интереснее, да и возможностей больше. Множество Фракций(Советы, Крауты/Фрицы, СС, Янки, Британцы), множество нового транспорта и оружия, Огромное количество доктрин со способностями, и наконец-то внутриигровой магазин, теперь можно играть и одновременно накапливать уровень для ящика из которого могут выпасть клевые плюшки. Но есть одна проблема, связанная с оптимизацией, рандомно падает фпс из-за чего и идут задержки в командах для юнитов(задержка от 1 до 120 секунд), не знаю может быть это проблема у пользователей с видеокартами Nvidia и Amd, но это очень не хороший фактор для этой игры.  Пользователи видеокарты Intel отпишитесь, есть ли у вас проблема с оптимизацией.

Bounced off the game in 2017 and again in 2018. Recently downloaded the the latest update and gave it another try. I mean really gave it another try,  Watched youtube videos and everything. And man, I am glad I did.  The tactical aspect of this game is  Xcom and  Xenonauts turned up to 11. You really have to invest and learn the system. Once you do, you will be rewarded with some of the best tactical game play  out there. The RNG is always there but there are ways to skew it in your favor.  Highly recommended. Not for the faint of heart or easily discouraged.  Power fantasy must be earned!  Recommend https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N7KiRU2Wa9A

玩了一会儿潜水员戴夫，前来考古了属于是。  基本玩法非常清楚，快速识别+肌肉记忆的订单/灭火/打地鼠游戏。食物分层做得很细，品类也不少，打字完成的手感极佳。随着升级增加配料种类和售价是非常好的内容曲线。可能唯一“不足”的就是生涯模式下，提升餐厅星级需要20天的节奏有点太慢了，其他条件三五天就满足了，剩下的时间稍稍有些难以打发hhh。  总之目前的体验非常好，有可能不会完全打通，但作为休闲游戏（虽然要全神贯注玩）真的很不错！

[h1]Comentario Analítico: "Grim Dawn"[/h1]  Grim Dawn es un Action RPG de la escuela de Diablo desarrollado por Crate Entertainment, publicado como Early Access en 2014 y estrenando su versión oficial en 2016.  Personalmente entré en este juego con bastante fé a sabiendas de que gran parte de los integrantes del equipo de Crate está compuesto por veteranos que trabajaron en otro gran ARPG al que tuve el lujo de jugar de niño, Titan Quest, cuyo motor gráfico logró ser cedido para la elaboración de Grim Dawn. Y las similitudes se hacen evidentes de inmediato.  Técnicamente son bastante similares, en términos gráficos Grim Dawn ofrece un aspecto más refinado aunque continúa viéndose añejo para su fecha de estreno. La interfaz y el menú principal están tan poco estilizados que podría fácilmente tratarse de un juego del 2005 y la customización visual de nuestro personaje es totalmente nula más allá del nombre y sexo.  No obstante el diseño artístico-estético es fabuloso, dotado de una excelente banda sonora y un estilo visual propio de la fantasía oscura del mundo de Cairn y toda su historia.  Grim Dawn denota la veteranía de sus desarrolladores; el combate es excelente (en función a su estilo de juego), la exploración es apropiadamente incentivada y la progresión resulta gratificante. Esto último es en donde creo que este juego destaca por encima de la mayoría de su género: [b]Las diversas capas de progresión y desarrollo[/b].  Este juego no se limita a ofrecernos la progresión de una clase y sus armas. Grim Dawn nos da a elegir una de entre varias clases y sus habilidades activas y pasivas al comienzo, y llegados al nivel 10 podemos seleccionar una segunda maestría con la que hacer sinergia junto a la anterior y así incentivando la experimentación y la rejugabilidad; además de esto existen también las Devociones, una capa extra de progresión y desarrollo de personaje cuyos puntos se adquieren en santuarios y que nos aportan diversos bónus en función a una constelación a elección.  Así es como Grim Dawn permite que el jugador se exprese a su modo y juegue tal como éste prefiera.  Todo lo demás es bastante habitual en su género, aunque brillante en ejecución.  lo ya visto en el género tal como un complejo sistema de builds, drops, componentes (Adheribles al equipamiento), portales, mazmorras, mascotas, multijugador, dificultades, modos de juego, actualizaciones constantes   [list]     [*]Variedad de builds, equipamiento y componentes adheribles.     [*]Variedad de habilidades activas y pasivas.     [*]Variedad temática a lo largo de sus escenarios y mazmorras.     [*]Varias dificultades y modos de juego.     [*]Multijugador.     [*]Portales y viaje rápido.     [*]Mascotas (Viva el Necromancer).     [*]Actualizaciones constantes con contenido y mejoras de calidad de vida a casi 10 años de su lanzamiento. [/list]   Y un largo etcétera al que se incluye un modelo de juego de base en single player y carente de prácticas de monetización nocivas, nada de gacha, lootboxes ni paywalls absurdos, a fecha de escrita esta reseña está a la venta la "Edición Definitiva" que incluye los DLCs "[b]Forgotten Gods[/b]", "[b]Ashes of Malmouth[/b]" y "[b]Crucible Mode[/b]", todos de altísima calidad.  Es importante destacar que a fin de cuentas esto es un juego Indie que empezó siendo trabajo de poco más que dos personas interesadas en ofrecer una experiencia un poquitín más inmersiva y complicada, por tanto no podés esperar la grandilocuencia de Diablo 4 o la sencillez de Diablo 3.  Se le puede criticar la falta de explicación y la ambiguedad de los tutoriales, pero creo que parte de su magia radica en darle libertad al jugador de experimentar con aquellos árboles de habilidades a los que se le expone desde el comienzo.  [b]¿En conclusión?[/b] Uno de los mejores ARPGs en el mercado actualmente.

Por tanto, está un poco lastrado por sus comienzos ya obsoletos, que lo hacen parecer un  juego un tanto mediocre.  Pero....Ahí se acaban las malas noticias. KF es de esos juegos BRILLANTES, con todas las letras. Tiene una espectacularidad que engancha desde el primer momento, con el combo CLASES-ARMAS. Es dificil resistirse a matar tanto bicho cuando hay semejante variedad. Incluso cuando agotes la jugabilidad con una clase, cambias de clase y tienes que aprender a jugar de nuevo porque aquello que hacías ya no sirve.  Buen doblaje al español, aunque incompleto, que tambien le da un buen toque.   Y muchos, muuuuuuuuchos logros. En resumen: No te dejes llevar por la primera impresión y explótalo un poco, tú tambien caerás...

Never played 2k before? Get this game on sale. It is not worth full price. Played prior 2k games? Maybe do not buy if you aren't dying to play a  b-ball game with a new roster.   I really only play for single player, so I don't have any huge problems with this game overall. However, the story mode was pretty bland - it is "last gen," so there is wayyy less depth to the story. As for game play, it seems easier to excel than prior games. BUT it is definitely going to require you to grind if you do not at least pitch in like 5-20 bucks to boost your overall rating. That is what let me progress, as I was finally able to actually get minutes and become a starter after that (but i also kinda suck at these games so keep that in mind). It has also got some hardcore bugs, some animations are sluggish. It is pretty similar to, if not identical to the last game, but that is a given for most sports games.   Local-couch play is still fun. However, it is the same as last time. Online has its hackers/cheaters. Playing 3/3 and 2/2 has a fair amount of non cheaters, so it is still fun. That part surprised me, but some have had different experiences. It is known that PC is not a priority for 2k, and is shows a lot in NBA 2k games.   Something random but cool nonetheless is the inclusion of WNBA teams. This was cool/refreshing to see as a female player. Long overdue in my opinion, and I know that does not create a huge appeal to the majority of players - but it doesn't hurt.   If you want to play with a new roster + story, and to play with people online, get it on sale.   TLDR: Get on sale if you end up getting it, if you can do with the old games then do not purchase this. Best to focus on career mode. It is the only game of its kind, and this will be the case until there is some competition.

Playing this reminded me of playing Resident Evil 6, or Spec Ops: The Line.  In other words, it felt more like an interactive movie.   Sometimes, that's just what you want.   If I'd paid full price for this I'd be salty, but at less than 10 bucks Remember Me was far more entertaining (and intelligent) than Batman vs. Superman: Dawn of Justice.  Buy at adeep discount. Production values, voice acting, and setting/story are all good to great. Gameplay is passable at best.  A shame we'll likely never get a sequel, I think it would have hit its stride.

Bastion is one of the most acclaimed indie games of the past decade. However, I cannot recommend it, since I encountered a repeated game-breaking crash, which apparently is very common, and has never been fixed. Gameplay is... well, it exists, even though it's simplistic and the keyboard controls are clunky. (Running diagonally requires two buttons at once, but the whole game is isometric, and thus completely diagonal.) The narration and soundtrack are great. And the story (if I could get past the first two hours) has a few interesting characters and twists.  But all that goes straight out of the window, because the devs refused to fix a common bug, thus rendering the game unplayable for a large portion of customers. Screw that!  FINAL SCORE: 8/10 (if I had been able to finish this broken game)

Be warned: this is not a complete videogame. The Store blurb tells you this game is about figuring out the controls for an unfamiliar machine, but that part is over very quickly. After that, you can get some enjoyment out of figuring out the world mechanics and mix-maxing tricks, but there's no real point in doing so: the game will soon just suddenly be over without giving you any real opportunity to take advantage of them. It's a frustratingly wasted potential.   It is very atmospheric while it lasts, which makes it very difficult for me to give it a thumbs down, but in the end I don't think it's worth paying £13 for. Especially considering how awkward the interface is - for some reason, pointing the cursor at a menu item will often not actually have it correctly selected.

Давайте с плохого, ибо накопилось.  Управление и оптимизация - ни к чёрту. Ни подобрать разрешение экрана, ни открыть Стим во время игры, ни тупо свернуть игру. Отдельный поток мата тому моменту, когда закончились слоты под сохранение, и оказалось, что удаление ненужных сейвов в игре не работает. Проблема была решена залезанием в папку с сохранениями и перепрохождением половины главы. Использовать же предметы из инвентаря и взаимодействовать с внешним миром клавиатурой неудобно, мягко говоря. Графика поганая. Нет, это не тот случай, когда "стиль такой", она именно поганая. Смотреть на одинаковое качание фигурок во время долгих диалогов - очень утомительно. Видеть лицо кирпичом у героини, когда происходит эмоциональный момент, раздражает. С перспективой так же плохо, как в жизни Сьюзен. При этом бывают и интересные визуальные элементы, от которых создаётся ощущение, что работавший над картинкой человек имеет представление, что бы хотел показать, но хреново рисует. Разные сюжетные ветки настолько ничтожно друг от друга отличаются, что нет смысла перепроходить игру ради другого развития событий. Даже секретная концовка меняет мало. Отдельная боль меня, ачивкодрочера, что ачивки в большинстве своём не только не сказываются на сюжете, но и занудно зарабатываются. Если рассматривать игру как квест, то квест так себе. Загадок ничтожно мало, при этом они так же ничтожно просты. Ну, кроме тех случаев, когда в здравом уме не догадаешься использовать какой-то предмет ВОТ ТАК. Очевидно, что разработчикам важнее было рассказать историю, но могли бы тогда сделать игру визуальной новеллой, что решило бы многие проблемы. Кое-какие вопросы в сюжете остались, и не все разрешаются тем, что в истории есть сюрреализм. [spoiler]Что всё-таки случилось с Лиз? Как наркоту удаётся вытащить из галлюцинаций? Как Сьюзан и Митси избавились от трупа в квартире? Что не так с няней Ритой, блеать?![/spoiler]  Так почему положительный отзыв, раз всё так плохо?  История и атмосфера. Они втягивают вопреки всем косякам. То есть НАСТОЛЬКО втягивают, что преодолеваешь всё вышеперечисленное. Любитель жанра "всему конец" одобряет и другим советует.

С начало писал отрицательный отзыв...  Но спустя проработки игры разработчиками, можно заявить, что продукт стоит своего внимания.   Полно серверов, в основном иностранных. Но есть и ру комьюнити, достаточно развивающиеся. Каждый месяц проходят турниры, евенты и просто игры.   В самой игре присутствует тактика, открытые карты, атмосферный звук и реалистичная баллистика.  PS для тех кто увлекается историей WWII, ведь амуниция и оружие продумано до мелочей.   Любителям тупого шутера и аркады, игра не зайдет. Так же "под пивко" катнуть не получится, уж больно думать надо. Таким одна дорого, это в HLL

А самое похожее, что Вы купили эту игру. Вы выживаете в этом "розовом мире". Но если присмотреться там летающие камеры. 어.. 한국인 리뷰는 내가 첫 스타트인가...  영어 울렁증이 있어서 뭐가 뭔지 눈치로 때려맞춰야 했지만,  아무튼 새로 신입사원이 됐는데 회사 지하에 내려가서 닥치는대로 다 때려부수고 나오면 돼는 게임이다.  손에 쥐어주는 무기는 사용 한도가 정해져 있으므로 신중하게 내려찍어야(?)하고 사용횟수가 다 되면  무기는 부숴지고 맨손으로 공격하게 됀다. 맨손은 매우 약하고 적들에게 피격모션을 만들지 못한다.  무기는 최대 3개까지 들고 다닐 수 있다. 생명력이 다 닳으면 그 시점에서 그층의 공략은 불가능 해진다.  그러므로 로그라크라고 부를 수 있겠다.  스킬을 여러번 먹어서 게이지를 100% 채우면 스타팅에 스킬을 하나 소지 한채로 시작할 수 있다.  이게임 가격이 20,500원 인데 그만한 재미는 못주는것 같고, 세일할때 노려서 사자..  필자는 예구했는데 예구는 함부러 하는게 아니라는것을 다시 배웠다..  그런데 추천하는 분위기가 뭔가 마음에 들어서...

Well,  let's see, where should I start? Having explored the game thoroughly, spending a lot of time getting to know it's world and growing comfortable to it, I think I'll be able to write up a proper review of this game.  Undertale has lots of qualities that make it so enjoyable. With a mix of RPG Turn-based and Bullet-hell gameplay (thankfully it's pretty merciful compared to most other games that focus on bullet-hell gameplay) the charm of a retro design comparable to many classic games such as the Mother series, and even the Legend of Zelda, characters chock full of personality, and a beautifully composed soundtrack....I could go on about more, but let's just say when you have a very well written story, and said story is in a video game that also just so happens to have all these elements in it....the most likely result is one fine game.  In this game you're given the option to either slay your enemies, or befriend them. This includes bosses. It might sound fairly simple at first, but every single action towards the creatures you face will have some kind of significant effect on the story, there are many things you will miss if you slay some, and believe me, while it might not hurt to slay a common mook or a few, I can practically guarantee you will feel awful after killing some of the game's more significant enemies. These things are what makes Undertale a unique and brillant test of your determination, as well as your view on the world of gaming in general. It's very comparable to games such as the Legend of Zelda which are loaded with monsters, only here, you can see there's a lot more to them than what meets the eye, and that killing them on sight, perhaps, might not always be the right or only solution after all.  As much as I love video games, having had them as my biggest hobby since childhood, video games rarely leave emotional impacts on me through their story and characters, at least not until some big events closer to the end of the game. Undertale on the other hand, is a massive exception. From the beginning, to middle and the end, the game managed to get me feeling saddened, and incredibly joyful on several occasions. I think that says something, does it not?  Some people consider this game to be overrated, but I personally think that it deserves all the praise it gets, and overall, I consider it to be one of the most well-written games I have seen in years. Unless your tastes don't match with Turn-based games or mild Bullet-hell, then I highly recommend picking this game up. Even then, I would at least recommend trying the demo of the game first before deciding against it.

Klasse Shooter. +Actiongeladene Kämpfe +Unglaublich coole Glorykills +Brilliantes Waffenarsenal das sich individualisieren lässt und Waffen die sich zu weiten Teilen wirklich unterschiedlich spielen +Kettensäge +Überraschend bugfrei bei Release (Ausnahme: Manchmal wird nicht korrekt nach Vorsprüngen gegriffen) +....und und und  Doom hat viele Pluspunkte, Gameplaytechnisch sind mir wenn dann die relativ einfachen und seltenen Bosskämpfe negativ aufgefallen. Trotzdem haben sie Spaß gemacht.  Warum also eine negative Bewertung? Wegen einer Zahl: 9.6 9.6 Stunden um ein 60 Euro Spiel auf mittlerem Schwierigkeitsgrad durchzuspielen. In den 9.6 Stunden ist sogar noch über eine Stunde AFK-Zeit enthalten. Schon die Angabe der Entwickler (13 Stunden +) ist relativ schwach für einen Fullprize-Titel, da aber die tatsächliche Spielzeit nocheinmal deutlich darunter liegt ist das leider nicht akzeptabel.  Das Spiel an sich ist klasse und über jeden Zweifel erhaben, ob einem so wenig Spielzeit (wenn man nicht vor hat den Multiplayer zu nutzen oder es mehrfach durchzuspielen) so viel Geld wert ist muss jeder selber entscheiden.  Sobald es einmal für rund 20 Euro zu haben ist klare Kaufempfehlung von mir, aber 60 Euro sind im Moment doch sehr happig.

game: Degradation: Kyomu's Fury - 劣化：キョムの怒り
review: After just finishing my mega difficulty playthrough, I can say that Degradation: Kyomu's Fury is an amazing first person bullet hell shooter with excellent boss battles that are sure to challenge your reflexes. The game is quite colourful and showcases really cool looking visuals (makes me think of a HD version of LSD: Dream Emulator from the PS1) with the use of ray tracing and is complimented well with the games soundtrack.   The story was quite simple but charming and there is three different endings to experience. There is also two unlockable bonus games from the developer included and both are worth a look at.  Overall I really enjoyed my time with this game and highly recommend giving it a go!

Good game, especially if you're a fan of Edmund and enjoy having a chance to look at some concept art and Q&As about the games.  But the games included in this collection really needed to be polished. A few quality of life changes would've gone a long way, like Retry/Menu buttons in Grey Matter, as well as general optimisations for all the games, since the frames dip frequently.  Also, the "Enter the Unknown" achievement in Time F**k is unforgiveable, gating an achievement behind unmoderated player levels is one of the worst game-related ideas I've EVER seen.

虽然我也不敢说我现在玩了多少，这一天下来也才4%，但是想说两句吧，确实开场很拉，剧情演出很拉，即时演算的强制cg也跟不上时代，中文的界面也有些语法和翻译错误的硬伤，例如本应该是轻武器的模组叫做光，英语下都是light，我怀疑直接用的一个翻译文库替代了所有翻译文本，本应代表橡胶的Rubby也被当成ruby直译成了红宝石，所以我也切成了英语。   但  是，我一开始也是有点受不了了，在能比较有底气的自由行动后就去自由探索了，地方真的挺大的，那些高山森林什么的都是拍照模式的好地方，真的挺好看的，能学更多技能做更多武器后游戏体验直线上升，就像辐射一样的慢慢捡垃圾拼武器，现在我在致力于收集所有的抵抗异常状态的套装，对探索更有帮助。   确实现在可能不值这298，但是可发展的空间真挺大的，要是一开场到这墙内就直接开放世界探索，不去体验那些有点尬的cg的话我觉得评价会好很多，音乐和场景建设真的不错，可能就是这头没开好的问题..反正我现在是越玩越觉得有趣，但是估计这剧情的羸弱可能也会让我难以打通剧情，等我在多打一阵子再来改一改评价吧，总的来说还是比较推荐有闲钱有闲时间的玩家来试试的。（毛茸茸也香啊 ------ 缺点确实多，流程也不长，不是很有全收集的欲望，只能说太中规中矩，还有点偏下了，比较失望了
