The controls are clunky as hell. No smooth transition between weapons. Example, when playing with a controller you have to hit the RB button, press down on the d-pad then select grenade, aim with left trigger and release with right trigger. The grenade also does not travel very far so iv'e had them land in the same room and kill me. That's a lot of moves just to get a grenade out imo. It feels super slow when you try to transition between your sidearm and rifle which has cost me my life many many times.  It does not matter whether or not your wearing heavy armor because one shot will put you down. The movement of your character feels very slow and brick like. It just dosen't feel like a polished game or one that game out in 2021.  Not very impressed, I was hoping for something that didn't feel like 2000's Medal Of Honor.

Dishonored 2 a attendu la fin de l'année 2016 pour pointer le bout de son nez, et il a eu raison ! De cette manière, nous pouvons passer à 2017 en ayant terminé un excellent jeu [i]"made in France"[/i] mené par Arkane et supporté par Bethesda. Si le jeu souffre de quelques soucis d'optimisation, il faut en effet parfois bidouiller une petite dizaine de minutes au premier lancement pour le faire fonctionner proprement, il ne faut pas le laisser sombrer avec de mauvaises évaluations : ce jeu est vraiment très bon ! Alors voici mon avis, sans [i]spoilers[/i], sur cette perle vidéoludique de fin d'année.   Bien que nous pouvions d'abord nous attendre à ne pas avoir de suite au premier opus, Dishonored 2 vient très habilement se situer dans la continuité de son prédécesseur. Aucune incohérence scénaristique, vous avez même quelques têtes et intrigues connues qui viennent raviver des souvenirs pour ceux qui se sont mesurés aux DLCs du premier jeu. Peu importe comment vous avez terminé le premier jeu, le début de ce second Dishonored restera bien imbriqué avec votre précédente expérience...  Niveau [i]design[/i] nous avons toujours la même signature agréable du premier jeu, inspirée de l'époque victorienne, avec des couleurs peut-être plus nuancées cette fois ainsi que des détails plus poussés. Ce n'est que du plus, que du positif, à mon avis.   Pour la construction des niveaux, je l'ai même trouvée [b]encore meilleure[/b] que celle de Dishonored, premier du nom ! Elle s'adapte merveilleusement aux différents types d'approche possibles, à tel point que parfois on aimerait avoir énormément plus de [i]slots[/i] de sauvegarde pour pouvoir toutes les réaliser les unes après les autres. De nombreuses fois je me suis retrouvé à douter de ma trajectoire dans le jeu, face aux opportunités offertes pour ce qui est de mener à bien une mission. De petites énigmes se cachent un peu partout, des évènements uniques également ont lieu à certains endroits, menant à des emplacements ou objets mieux dissimulés que les autres... Les chemins menant à votre but sont nombreux, ils sont tous alléchants, et cela donne un autre atout à Dishonored 2...   [b]La rejouabilité ![/b] Dishonored vous propose en effet une rejouabilité potientiellement extrême si vous êtes un vrai fan ! Le gameplay est à la fois très respectueux de celui de son prédécesseur, et en même temps très innovant. Toujours sans vous imposer un seul [i]spoiler[/i], je peux vous dire que [b]vous avez au moins 8 attitudes générales de joueur possiblement adoptables en jeu[/b] pour la durée de la campagne ! Huit ! C'est plutôt pas mal, non ? Quand je vous disais que Dishonored 2 pousse à remettre en question votre manière de jouer... Niveau [i]gameplay[/i] donc, cela offre une très grande richesse à votre aventure dans [b]Karnaca[/b].   Après le [i]gameplay[/i], le [i]design[/i], le [i]leveldesign[/i]... On passe au scénario ? Toujours [u]sans spoilers[/u] !   Pour ma part, j'ai trouvé l'histoire très plaisante, j'ai même adoré en fait ! Le titre de la licence est toujours aussi pertinent, et il prend d'autant plus de sens que vous progresserez dans l'aventure. Le scénario n'est pas "lourd" ou "pompeux" et se déroule plutôt logiquement. Vous rencontrerez de nombreux personnages intéressants et, pour certains, charismatiques, ce qui vous donnera envie d'en apprendre plus à leur sujet. Du début à la fin j'ai apprécié le déroulement de Dishonored 2, j'ai savouré ce que Arkane et Bethesda nous ont proposé, et je recommande vivement ce jeu ! Mon seul souhait aurait été un épilogue un peu plus long et développé sur un ou deux petits points, mais on ne peut pas satisfaire tout le monde ! Avec le peu de recul que j'ai (j'ai terminé le jeu le jour de la rédaction de l'évaluation), je me dis même que peut-être c'était pour me laisser plus de liberté dans ma manière d'imaginer la grande conclusion de la campagne du jeu.   Saurez-vous vous dresser face à vos ennemis ? Aurez-vous vos réponses ? Il n'y a qu'un moyen de le savoir : jouez !

Other enjoyable things are: You can phase through walls, possess cats, possess and influence people,  teleport some little distances and so on. AND, you are in SALEM, which is intriguing.   Overall, i enjoyed the game really. It suited me well.

Dopo 23 ore credo di aver superato abbondantemente la metà del gioco, mi permetto quindi di giudicarlo: assolutamente fantastico!! Raramente ho giocato titoli memorabili in ogni quadro affrontato. La gestione dell’equipaggiamento dà effettivamente buona soddisfazione. Il tema del viaggio in un territorio vasto, devastato è trasformato rapisce totalmente. I personaggi sono molto ben caratterizzati ed è pure scattata la lacrimuccia in un caso o due. Come dicevano, non è un vero free roaming. Fin’ora ho incontrato due o tre “dungeon” rettilinei e tre mappe più o meno estese ma circoscritte alla risoluzione di un “quadro”, con suoi parametri ed emergenze. Superati tali elementi però il gioco, il viaggio, procede, ma vi assicuro che non è assolutamente un difetto. Insomma, un gioco che assorbe ed affascina totalmente. Il migliore della trilogia, in assoluto. Un must have senz’altro!! Aggiornamento: finito dopo 30 ore abbondanti. Confermo quanto sopra. Bomba di emozioni. Grandissimo titolo!! Stupendo finale!! Spero nelle espansioni previste (ma non annunciate).

There is a strong sense of humour throughout the entire game: Many jokes, forth-wall breaking sequences and cultural references make the game enjoyable to play. The art style further supports this, as it's all not to serious and there is colour everywhere. Even the 'dark' dungeons are lush of red, gold, and purple. The game is also not that violent and/or sadistic, although its setting would certainly allow so. An 18+ expansion pack would certainly be an option.  The gameplay itself is varied and has a nice flow to it: Get a basic dungeon, start with some small harassments, and build up from there. This is combined with a nice balance of gameplay and complexity. The game doesn't start off very difficult, but as resources get more limited, it becomes more impotent to make good use of whatever scenario the narrator makes up. Controls are less great, as it is sometimes a little difficult to order accurate move or attack orders. Then again, good army composition is more important the micromanagement, so the game doesn't get fiddly, which I personally like.  Finally, it's a nice, free-time-respecting game. There are no store fronts in the game, nor is there any padding or detrimental content. You get what is advertised without some underhanded dealing, which has sadly become very common in games today.   In summary, I enjoy it and would encourage it to anyone who wants an interesting, humorous game that is fun to play a few evenings a week.

Easily one of the greatest VR games ever made.  Amazing graphics with exception of obscure places no one would normally go to. Physics at time can be jankey but overall it's very well done. You can learn to do 'parkour' if you play around with the physics enough I've never felt motion sickness in the game despite the only way to move is via controllers. (You can't teleport) There's no real comfort options but if you play the game for a little bit over time you'll become immune to VR motionsickness (Except rollercoasters - probably)  The story-line seems non-existent but that is not the case. There are TVs around the map that fill you about the world outside around you. Some cutscenes also play in certain points. Similar to Half-life the game mostly uses subtle storytelling using the world around you that you're in. Why are Omni's shooting at you? Because you are considered an anomaly due to the circumstances you put yourself through. Writings are all over the walls and floor, the most obvious is just before the break room your character (Presumably) wrote on the wall about ideas of immortality. I won't spoil anymore of the lore, it's deep and crosses over to other games (Other Stress Level Zero titles).  Playing the game I've never felt like it was very linear. Even in one of the chapters 'Sewers' (Which obviously is meant to be a bit cramped) there's many detour places you can visit and many wide open spaces. There's always a second solution to every puzzle in the game. As long as you have a decent understanding of the physics and can scale things you can 'parkour' your way out of all of them.   Many fixes have been made toward the combat. It's incredibly well made and polished. (Enemies won't get caught on your arms anymore) This despite Half-Life Alyx has a TON of melee weapons (Shovel, Bat, Barbed Wire Bat, Crowbar, Katana, Pickaxe, etc.) And there's no shortage in guns as well. The only gun you can't find in the vanilla game are shotguns and snipers (There's sighted guns however)  The soundtrack 'Bonetones' is amazing and is perfect for this game. I suggest giving the soundtrack a listen sometime. Ammo is used as money in the game and it is 100% possible to beat the game without using a single bullet  Lots of things to do after you beat the main story-mode such as   -  Finding Collectables hidden around the chapters which can vary in Tools, Weapons, NPC/Enemies (, And Dev weapons/tools)  - Playing minigames such as Zombie Warehouse, [REDACTED], Sandbox, And Fantasy Arena  - Fun achievements to grind for.  - Replaying the game to understand the lore   - Collecting all the ammo to unlock the Grand Prizes  - Finding the batteries so you can fly around in 'Hover Junkers' vehicle   TL;DR The game is 100% worth the price and is a MUST have. This game, in my opinion, is better than Half-Life Alyx (Which says alot since I love that series) I can see from this game Stress Level Zero has a bright future.

game: Sacra Terra: Kiss of Death Collector’s Edition
review: This is a run of the mill hidden object puzzle game with a supernatural/mystery theme.   Click through various screens with hidden object puzzles and other puzzle minigames to unravel the mystery.  Despite being released in 2013 there's no working widescreen support, the game displays in 4:3 pillarboxed (the developers added panels to the sides).   Regardless they're charging $14 for this, which would easily get you a HOG that works in 16:9, or pretty much any other kind of casual puzzle game on Steam.  Unacceptable.

Costume Quest 2 – это вторая часть приключенческой игры на тему Хэллоуина. Зубной врач взбесился и решил запретить конфеты, чтобы создать мир идеальных зубов. Он воспользовался магией и призвал монстров.  Рейнольд и Рен снова одевают костюмы чтобы победить зло.  В игре появились новые костюмы с новыми возможностями. Боёвка в игре изменилась, по сравнению с первой частью, стала более сложной, как мне показалось. Для атаки необходимо нажимать номер атакующего и если успели нажать, то атака улучшается. Также в игру добавили карты «Жуткой карточной колоды», три из которых можно взять в бой. Они дают дополнительные бонусы или ослабляют противников. Хотя игра замечательно проходится и без карт. В записной книжке вы можете посмотреть все доступные квесты и карты «Жуткой карточной колоды». Рекомендую у торговца покупать карту местности, по ней вы можете узнать сколько деталей костюма и секретных мест находится на локациях. Собирайте конфетки, покупайте карты для колоды, улучшайте костюмы. Приятная графика и милая музыка создают праздничную атмосферу. Вам очень понравится!  В игре имеются коллекционные карточки и достижения, которые можно легко получить. Оценка 10/10

Bon, que dire sur ce jeu très surprenant. Déjà, c'est un jeu japonais, ça faisait longtemps que je n'avais pas joué à un jeu du soleil levant. Du coup j'avais oublié la difficulté des jeux nippons. Car oui, ce jeu est dur, et encore, je l'ai fini en facile, le mode normal comporte moins d'items pour aider à la progression et est un peu plus stressant niveau timing, mais les casse-têtes sont les mêmes, car oui, nous avons à faire à un jeu de casse-tête entrecoupé de faux VN, où peu de choix comptent en définitive car tout peux changer dans le dernier étage comportant 5 niveaux. L'histoire est sympathique mais sans plus, les moments au bar ou en cauchemar sont assez excellents, par contre les têtes à têtes avec Catherine sont lourds.  Par contre les passages casse-tête sont super bien réussis, très stressant car en temps limité, mais accompagnés d'une musique sublime (beaucoup de réorchestrations de morceaux de classique très connus) avec une difficulté croissante (sauf le passage du putain de bébé). Bref c'est recommandable, car vraiment bien fait, avec des dialogues souvent percutants sur la morale sexuelle, mais c'est vraiment un jeu de niche.

Classic codebreaking puzzle, with a bit of a twist.  And pretty little monsters.    I've been doing codebreaking puzzles for 40some years.  I started when I was still a single-digit age.  This one is super cute and I like the more complex two part aspect (arena and feelings) of it.  Not so much the diary part, because... why?  (Yes, I did the diary part JUST for the achievements.)  Oh.  Having to lose 3 games just to complete the achievements was torturous to my brain. I had to play way too many times TRYING to lose.  That.. no.  Just don't do that to players.  That's cruel.   My part-time residential small human (7yo) liked to watch me play but found it "too hard" to play on their own.  When questioned further, it seems that there's "too many" choices.  Given less complex, basic codebreaking puzzles on paper, the small one grasped the concept and managed to solve the puzzles quickly enough.  So, while this game LOOKS like it might be for littles, it's not.  (Well, not small human littles.  Maybe big human littles.  No judgement here.)  It might be good for older small humans... maybe?...  but not the smaller small humans.   Yeah.  I recommend it.  I mean, if you like strategy puzzle games and don't get frustrated easily.   If you do?  Nah, skip this.  Go find a more violent game to play or something.

Undertale è un gioco eccezionale e ricco di emozione. All'inizio lo sottovalutavo anche perchè i GDR pixelati non sono il mio tipo di gioco, MA dopo averci giocato una volta sentivo che mancava qualcosa perchè tutta la comunità esplosa nel giro di poco doveva avere un perchè e così lo rigiocai dietro la richiesta di un "fiore" quindi così scoprii il motivo per cui questo gioco è un capolavoro. Undertal è un dating sim, un rip-off di space invaders, un bullet hell, un salto agli ostacoli, un videogioco di commercio, un temmie, un gioco musicale, è BO; personaggi carismatici, divertenti e con una storia profonda pure. 10 € spesi più che bene ed a sapere il tipo di gioco che è avrei speso anche di più.

I love this game but it did something that will make me not play it again. I play in a multiplayer with 1 other person and i loaded the game we left all of our stuff at our base its day 20 and we went to the town not far from our base. We come back at 22:00 and we have no base. It shows our bed rolls but our base it gone. Nothing destoryed it it was a building with two walls going around it. It was a huge building and its just gone. All of our storage, guns, ammo, building supplys, tools gone 1 day before the red moon. I cant play a game where I dont know if I leave and come back that my base is just gone. I didnt close the game and come back to it or crash or anything we just walked back to base after going to the town and it was all gone. I am upset because I love this game but I cant take that risk.

[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1] (Full review follows below)  [list] [*] [b]Game Name:[/b] Final Fantasy 7 [*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 1998 (2013 Steam Version) [*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b] JRPG; Turn-Based RPG; Action; Classic; Industry Jewel [*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] A+ [*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] 20-65 hours [*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] None [*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Established fans of the genre; Those intrigued by the genre; Fans of the intellectual property; Nostalgia chasers; Strong narrative advocates; Gaming industry aficionado [/list]	  [h1]REVIEW[/h1] If you scroll down the (serious) positive reviews for this game, you no doubt see many people expressing their nostalgic love for this legendary piece of their childhood. I stand among these people. For many of us who were kids in the 90s, [b]Final Fantasy 7[/b] was and always will be the first truly [i]epic[/i] game we ever played. So I’ll admit that I am definitely biased to love it, as it was my personal favorite game during a number of years of my childhood. But that isn’t why I’m going to recommend that you consider trying it. You should consider it because [b]Final Fantasy 7[/b] is a classic piece of video-game history that revolutionized the genre and because it’s a kickass game.   At the time it first released, there were a handful of other large RPGs with huge worlds and a lot of gameplay (relative to the era), but they were uncommon and unpopular in the Western world. [b]Final Fantasy 7[/b] reached a pinnacle of awesomeness for RPGs that was unprecedented and subsequently elevated the genre into the mainstream gaming market outside of Japan. Not only did it have sound RPG fundamentals, but the sheer amount of variety of gameplay it offered was quite revolutionary for the genre. Chocobo racing and breeding, the motorbike scene, the snowboard scene, the Golden Saucer, the Don Corneo segment, and more all contributed to shattering the status quo for the genre. A lot of young gamers went from not knowing about RPGs to one of them being their favorite game ever. Not only that, but it became one of the cornerstones which provided a foundation for the genre to grow towards what it has become today. If there was a Video Game Hall of Fame, [b]Final Fantasy 7[/b] would no doubt be in it.   Obviously, with more recent RPG blockbusters from franchises like [i]The Elder Scrolls[/i], [i]The Witcher[/i], and [i]Fallout[/i], it is hard to continue to consider [b]Final Fantasy 7[/b] to be an “epic” game by today’s standards. Somehow it still feels that way to me. Or at the very least: since I enjoy the genre, I still find it quite fun to play.  So I will admit that it definitely has been a long time since [b]Final Fantasy 7[/b] was one of the best games in existence. That said, even after the erosion of the sands of time, the game still feels exciting, intriguing, and massive to me. Even on my 8th playthrough I pick up on new subtleties in the story or discover new secrets and items.   The story is interesting, if not a bit convoluted. (Some of the story was cut away to make it “less confusing for the Western market” or some such silliness. This wound up making it more confusing.) The Materia system is fun and, combined with the traditional XP leveling, continuously offers the satisfaction of progress as you play through the campaign. The world is intriguing and still semi-large(ish) even by modern standards. The characters are perfect clichés of the very clichés that they themselves introduced. And one of the best parts of the game will always be the intimidating boss battles with the signature music. It is doubtful there will ever be another kid who says [b]Final Fantasy 7[/b] is his favorite game ever, but most modern fans of the genre will enjoy this game despite its age.  So there are a few reasons you may want to consider trying this game if you never have.  If you consider yourself a true aficionado of the gaming industry, you will probably want to play [b]Final Fantasy 7[/b] at least once in your life. Even though there is a “remake” on the way (or out by the time you read this), I would argue you should play this version at least once to really experience a legendary piece of video game history in this semi-unadulterated state.  Or: if you don’t care about any of the historical mumbo-jumbo, and just are looking for a fun, turn-based JRPG, then you can comfortably look to [b]Final Fantasy 7[/b] for that as well. It's not a bad game, but I didn't really care for bus driving too much. I got this when I bought the Euro Truck Sim bundle along with ETS 1, ETS 2, Trucks and Trailers, and Scania Truck Driving Sim; so I figured I might as well give it a shot since I liked the Scania Sim and ETS 2 steals my life away hours at a time. If you like this kind of game, then it can be good fun; but if you got the bundle I would say give ETS 1 or Scania Truck Sim a try before this. Still, nothing that absolutely breaks my opinion of the game in the minutes I spent playing it, but it can be boring to say the least. (The frustrating boring, not the calming one ETS 2 provides).

Pros: - The visual is amazing - The soundtrack is kinda good, too - The boss fights! This is probably the best part of the game. The satisfaction you get after you manage to kill the boss is really good.  Cons: - The level! While the level itself is not bad, lack of minimap really put me off from exploring the level. I don't really bother finding ithunn's apples because of this. This is frustating though since the most of your playthrough will be spent on the level.  Overall, while the game has some flaws, the visuals and boss fights make up for it.

[h1]Fall Guys: Ultimate Knockout[/h1] El juego esta [u][b]bien, es gracioso y es genial con amigos[/b][/u]. PEROOOO al igual que en TODOS o CASI TODOS los juegos, [u][b]el problema reside en la comunidad[/b][/u], aquí son altamente tóxicos, no se puede chatear, por lo que es un punto a favor para evitar ragers y demás; pero no paran de [u][b]agarrarte[/b][/u], hacer [u][b]bodyblock[/b][/u], o quien sabe como lo hacen, también [u][b]empujan[/b][/u] muchísimo [spoiler](luego yo me choco con alguien y salgo volando yo)[/spoiler]. Así que si tienes algo de paciencia, [b]es un buen juego para jugar de [u]forma casual[/u][/b], no tan seguido ya que a algunos se le pueden hacer monótono pero esta bien entretenido.  Es un buen juego al fin de al cabo, claramente todos recomendamos comprarlo en rebajas, no viene mal ahorrarse unos €, para mis gustos, este juego tiene un [b]8 / 10[/b]. Le pondría más si la comunidad no tocara tanto las narices, [spoiler]pero nunca viene mal ser algún día [i]el malo de la peli[/i] y joderles las partidas a los que te molestaron.[/spoiler]  Si alguien tiene alguna duda del juego, puede dejarme un comentario en esta reseña.

这是我接触的第一款2D动作游戏，经历长达70h左右（有时候没联网，时长数据不会显示)的流程，我想给萌新一点建议：     1.面对无聊的跑图和不知道接下来干什么的茫然，第一次接触这类游戏的人可能在开始没玩多久就想要放弃，但我希望你能坚持下去，尝试新事物只需要多一点点的耐心。安全度过前期，对未知事物的好奇和探索欲会吸引你前往更深层的世界     2.本作难度是逐渐递增的，而且绝大多数困难的跑酷和boss并非主线必打，更多是留给挑战自我的玩家，如果只是想通关本作，难度并没有想象的那么大，另外面对初见的boss，被虐个十几次是很正常的，摸清套路，查看攻略，都是你击败boss的有力方法。希望你坚持下去。     3.对于难度稍高的跑酷失败几次丢点钱非常正常，手感和熟练度需要长时间的积累，成功并非一蹴而就。相信我，在你不断的尝试与死亡中，你的操作会变得更加犀利。（大多数跑酷只是看着难，慢慢跳着跳着就过去了）    最后我想说一说我对本作的感想： 作为一个重度手残玩家，早期跑图和小怪让我苦不堪言，无数次死于地形和小怪，刚开始玩时甚至都不敢在身上存钱，常常是攒够一个东西的钱就赶快跑回去买，怂的一批。而在赶路途中误入boss房间身携巨款被截胡更是家常便饭，跑尸，被boss虐，这些都让我明白了什么是真正的痛苦。 但这些痛苦都值得。正如我看到steam速报上宣传的，当你在无数次被boss血虐后成功反杀并得到奖励，当你在一次又一次的撞刺掉河穿过险恶地形拿到新护符，当你在跌跌撞撞不知所寻时无意打开隐藏通道，这一切的一切，最终都化作一种叫做成就感的东西，让你欢愉不已，并告诉你，你的坚持和付出得到了回报。 坚持，这是空洞骑士所带给我最大的改观，从救迷妹时大骂sd地形，再到花上数个小时慢慢爬过苦痛之路，从开始时被三螳螂反复教育感叹路途遥远，跑尸不易，再到神居死磕众多boss打过三门，我只感觉自己越战越勇，与过去手残和容易放弃的自己说了再见。 感谢TC的这款高质量游戏，也希望买下这款游戏的你能够坚持下去，为圣巢这个衰落的文明画上句号，为被瘟疫折磨的众生带去救赎。     我忘却了所有悲剧，目之所及皆为奇迹。

Pour la petite histoire... vous êtes un bonhomme fait de papier et d'encre. Vous vous baladez dans un monde entièrement réalisé au stylo à bille (à la main s'il vous plait). Vous rencontrez des gens bizarre et puis vous partez en vaisseau vous battre ! Avec tout ça vous découvrez au fur et à mesure le secret des Logicians, les anciens habitants du monde.  Pour le retour... c'est mignon, on est un peu perdu au début. Mais finalement c'est pas compliqué. Les phases de shoot’em up sont très sympa, se balader dans ce monde flatte la pupille pour peu qu'on adhère à la patte graphique. Le petit vaisseau est customisable et il y a de nombreux objets (schémas dorés) à découvrir pour ceux qui sont atteint de la collectionnite aiguë. Une quinzaine de mission sont à compléter afin de terminer l'histoire. Mais afin de gagner toujours plus d'encre (la monnaie du jeu) il faudra passer par le mode infini qui vous met à l'épreuve vague après vague. Certaines missions peuvent être un peu compliqué au premier abord, mais cela se résume au upgrade du vaisseau. Un bon upgrade vous permettra de passer^^  Bref un jeu qui se laisse jouer avec une forte personnalité graphique.

Здравствуйте господа.  Истоки жанра "Tower Defence" можно найти в пользовательских модах к играм Warcraft III (Sunken, Hero Defense) и Age of Empires II.  Игра Defense Grid 2 встретит нас красочным меню, скрывающем не менее красочную игру. Геймплей прост: вам предоставляются на выбор несколько видов башен (каждая из них обладает своей дальностью выстрела,мощностью и скорострельностью), вы расставляете их на карте, позже выбегают пришельцы и башни начинают безразборную пальбу по ним, траекторию движения пришельцев можно изменить с помощью обычных блоков(самый первый в меню строительства), с накоплением очков улучшаем башни,а конечная цель игры не дать врагам уйти с украденными сферами из вашей базы,либо вы уничтожите их, либо они унесут все запасы сфер себе на корабль. Порадовала динамическая карта, так что со временем будет увеличиваться сила пришельцев и размер карты соответственно,что ставит перед вам задачу перестроить вашу линию фронта. Я кончил.  Спасибо. MrFox

A short review after the playing the game for a bit (I have 600+ hours in XCOM2 and its a permanent fixture on my harddrive; 500+ hours on XCOM: Enemy Unknown/Within - and there will be many more)...  First things first: this is an XCOM spin-off game (not a sequel, so don't think XCOM3 here - think more in terms of The Bureau; which I own two copies of, but am yet to, but intend to play)...  It captures the XCOM feel pretty well (if you can deal with the comic-book art-style); but focuses on a different gameplay mechanic, that I actually find really enjoyable (but would want to see only a limited implementation of in XCOM3: please note 2K!): [b]Breaching[/b].  Turns are not taken per squad; but instead per squad member. You also don't get deployed in one big AO (Area of Operation); but each mission goes through multiple "encounters," each starting with you breaching into an enclosed AO. There's no permadeath and frankly, the characters are a bit bland, so you don't really form any attachment to them and don't have much incentive to keep them going/upgrade their skills, except to advance to the next mission. You lose a character, and you have to redo the mission...  Also, there's a dude with a man-bun. So uhhm. XCOM?  It doesn't really feel like you're standing up to a massive threat; each mission feels more like a day in the life.... and also, after spending 600+ hours fighting off an alien invasion, I personally didn't like having a freakin' Viper in my squad... but hey; I guess if that makes me an alien racist, so be it...  The game is quite buggy; but I don't have a powerful machine to play with, so I'm used to low-res XCOM2 as well... I did have to uninstall and reinstall once already (after the game glitched to a frozen white screen at the main menu). There's quite a bit of clipping through walls as well...  So, should you buy this game? If you're looking for XCOM3: No... As a XCOM fan, I will give this one play-through... then go back to XCOM2.  If you're looking to mix things up inbetween play-throughs of XCOM/XCOM2... Yes; it is fun and different enough to get you psyched for the next installation of the series.

[h1] Nova Drift: Is it just new Asteroids? [/h1]  [i] Nova Drift [/i] is a space themed rogue-like game. Thus it requires a bit of different approach than a normal, story-based game. As you embark on your never-ending intergalactic adventure, you need to keep in mind that replaybality is a key factor for a game like this. However, alongside replaybality, you also need solid gameplay as well as visuals than do not burn your eyes out and music that does not get tiring as you listen to it all the time on repeat. Therefore, let's check if [i] Nova Drift [/i] manages to fulfill these requirements.  [b] Replaybality - 10/10 [/b]  [i] Nova Drift [/i] is extremely diverse and no two runs will feel the same if you so desire. If we look into it on individual levels, you get to choose your basic weapon every single time. followed by a body choice and finally a shield, making sure player never has to encounter completely same two combinations. You might be asking "Is that enough Gwento to keep me entertained?" Well yes, because I did not get to the best part. Every single before mentioned aspect has tons of upgrades you get to choose as you fight wave after wave of enemies, truly ensuring you will never have the same two experiences. To top it all off, you can choose from various modifiers as you progress to make your experience even harder and more challenging. Simple said, even veterans in the rogue-like genre will not get bored of this game.  [b] Gameplay - 8/10 [/b]  [i] Nova Drift [/i] bases its core gameplay on arcade classic [i] Asteroids [/i]. Therefore, edge of a screen is not the end, only a loop to the opposite side. Astereoids will be common hazards as you battle wave after wave of enemies and bosses. As mentioned before, gameplay is driven by the upgrades you choose along your run, which is nothing new or inovative. This puts down the gameplay aspect down a bit, however it definitely does not make the game boring or not fun.  [b] Visuals - 7/10 [/b]  Game overall looks fine and I would say even pretty to look at. However, as it is still in early access, many things are subject to change as some attacks lack telegraphing, sometimes the screen gets insanely cluttere and you as the player have no idea what is going on. Moreover, for older machinet it can be pretty demanding in later stages of the game, as there is a literal bullethell all over the screen. However, this is not saying that the game is not pleasing to look at. It just needs a bit more time and some polishing and I can see myself giving it a higher score.  [b] Sound and Music - 5/10 [/b]  To be honest, the music in this game is nothing special. You get bored of it pretty quickly and end up going to your favourite playlist as you destroy enemies after enemies. The sound design is fine, each weapon sounds different, sound effects for shields are fine, however it is nothing special. After few hours of it, I muted all the sounds and went for my own playlist. Maybe once more tracks get added, I might decide to change my opinion about this point.  [b] Should I get this game? [/b]  It is still in an early access, however let me help you with three easy questions:  1. Are you looking for a new rogue-like experience? 2. Did you enjoy Asteroids back in the day? 3. Do you want a game that does not take too much time to finish?  if you answered YES to any of these questions, what are you looking for?

I really really love this game. I just had to write this as a 101 love for this game (the amount of hours when writting this). Everything on this game is surrounded around you, however you are a nobody. You are weak, have no money, no friends, no special legs or arms. Almost nothing at all. You create your own story. Wheter it be to setup your own town or demolish others. Your choice, your time, your call. Endless ways to play this game. What I also like is that weight, armor and vitality of people impact the game sincere. If you crush your opponents arms, you will be way stronger. If he does this to you, well run. If you are on the ground than pretend you are dead. You were attacked by a dog, game over. They are hungry. I will stop here, otherwise this is going to be an endless book. If you like open world games, you like to be free, you like fight with your head or just want to relax and build. Well than this game is for you! Very much looking forward to Kenshi 2. When it hits the stores, I will buy it immediately :)

Was going to play this but when I downloaded it, it booted up a separate launcher, when installing the game from the launcher, it said something about torrent-file as well as my Malwarebytes started sending multiple notifications when installing that it blocked trojans as well as riskware. All stemming from the crossout\launcher.exe be careful I don't recommend this game just because it seems unsafe.  I may have hours on this game but I also have a new PC that I am taking great care of with Malwarebytes Premium. If anything seems suspicious I will not recommend it to family and friends.

It feels like an unfinished game! Every time I come back to the game, they have a new patch which they claimed they fixed bugs, yet I'm in the main menu and there's already the same bugs in it which I played the game from my first time, what a joke! It's almost like the developers add new bugs in after each patch lol. Game is not optimized at all, very unstable and frames go up and down like a roller coaster! Hackers are everywhere, always getting 100% perfect accuracy on you no matter how far or wide.  Gameplay is never in sync, I could fire a hole magazine from 20 meters at someone, and none of the rounds would hit.   Conclusion: Don't get this game, not worth the money nor the time!

Pretty fun if basic fast-paced old school shooter. Graphics are pretty original and it works well without becoming too visually cluttered. The skill tree gives a little bit of replayability in the way it's handled (you have to choose certain branches that will lock out others).  Only downside I could really complain about would be the level design, which isn't as inspired as some other old-school FPS.  Not a masterpiece, but if you like fast FPS, you'll like this game.

Скорее не рекомендация, а отзыв об игре. Вижу тот же сурс, абсолютно, добавлено просто больше мелочей, из-за которых противник вообще теряется. Персонажи как приклееные к миру, эфимерные, в пространстве. Физика буквально всего, особенно стрельбы и попадания оставляет желать лучшего. Игра на скорость и реакцию превратилась в игру на долгое колупание противника, причем далеко не всем оружием, только пара стволов кого-либо может убить. Пули мажут даже при четком прицеливании летят куда-то в стороны, прицеливание почти бесполезно, на ходу невозможно. Оружие не стреляет, а выплевывает боезапас, не нанося толком урона. Игра "сырая", почти неиграбельная. Выбор карт - чья-то бредовая идея, из моего региона коннекта нет никуда через авто-поиск, верните классическую консоль поиска и выбора серверов!

Kinda clunky and a little rough around the edges, but a great experience for any hardcore stealth fan. It's a really challenging game, so I got a little frustrated after a while because I personally am not much of a hardcore guy. Nonetheless, I really wanted to finish the game and I adore the many possibilites and available different paths in the big open levels. Would have been better to make the game shorter, because it gets repetitive and dull. Still, I'll recommend this game to you if you are somewhat resistant to a little bit of frustration and willing to experiment with the given possibilities.

Came into this game late. Didn't want to get into it with all the bugs, so i waited until the 2.0 update was out.   It's been a ride. Surprisingly really gut wrenching story at times. Heard so much about the story being weak, but it's actually really strong. I love the way that all the side missions have something to add to the main mission, and some can even affect how the game ends. Phantom Liberty has also been a riot so far. Now is definitely the time to play this game if you havent already. I just wish that there were more side missions.

So, as a game, awesome. A bit a product of its time, so compared to modern games it can be a bit simplistic and limited, but the set pieces are great (strong just cause 2 vibe), the story is pretty engaging, the weapon roster and skills are pretty good, my biggest issue is probably how clunky I found the driving.  That being said, this is an Ubisoft game, as as such, it will require Uplay, Ubisoft Connect, and whenever you start the game or go to the menu (which you need to do in order to craft or upgrade your skills), it will try to connect to non-existent far cry 3 server blocking you from doing anything for the next 30 seconds. Even in offline mode. So I can definitely recommend the game itself, but not necessarily as Ubisoft made it.

Enjoyable sequel when you felt like you didn't have enough after the first Dead Space, with some new interesting features as well as useless ones.  THE GOOD -Advice when protagonist calls for help when stuck after a while helps -Mine launcher is a very nice addition to set up traps when entering a dodgy room expecting an event -Refreshing to be in a large space station compared to alone on a ship  THE BAD -Bringing back the regenarating monster was a cheap shot and very annoying -bug with mines, sometimes you can't pick back up -revisiting Ishimura.. too much. Thought I wanted more Dead Space after the first one. I was wrong, too much -vent crawling annoying and pointless -Kick corpses to get goodies very annoying  THE UGLY -None that I can think of

Superb horror platformer in the likes of LIMBO and Inside (I rate LN between them, btw, Inside being the best game of the three). The DLC levels are mechanically quite bad (especially the first and third), and they are EXTREMELY buggy (the game crashed multiple times) but the DLC's ending is so good that I hate it much less in retrospect. If you're not a completionist/masochist like myself, I recommend playing the excellent base game and just watching a playthrough of the DLC.

Great game, highly addictive, match making gems with more than 600 cards to make a 4 card team.  A lot of content, you can pay if you want but dont have to, i play this game since more than 3000 hours and never payed a dime and still have gathered all the cards and reach the endgame players.  Don'y get fooled by people saying its a pay to win, paying doesnt save you much time and isnt necessary. A suprisingly great strategy game that have a lot of room to make the teams in a style you prefer, kill with magic, direct damage, crazy looping teams, etc...   Just a last warning, if you start playing it, you wont stop.  Another great aspect of the game, is that you can play on your pc and mobile with the same account.  10 / 10

DON'T BUY THIS GAME. Imagine this, you like this rougelite (a genre you can usually sink anywhere from 100-1000 hours in if you enjoy it) so you sink 39 hours into it so far with afking being probably 20 hours of that btw and youre really getting the hang of it regardless of semantics, you clear maybe 1/5th of the offered game play loop- you log off,  skip to day 4 or 5 of launch on a none early access that had a beta and a demo and now they patch the game making it god awful with no way to revert, then the next day slightly patch it so dmg numbers stopped registering as 1-3 dmg which causes you crashes you hadnt previously been suffering from (i doubt the demo even accurately represents the game 1:1 now not that it matters.) SO WHAT DO YOU DO HAVING BOUGHT THIS GAME ONLY DAYS AGO? Naturally you should ask for a refund right? Not according to papa steam! "14 days OR 2 hours gameplay" REALLY means "14 days unless 2 hours playtime" See I was under the impression 'or' offered the option of one or the other based on circumstance as they CLAIM every case to be yet here I am being told that 10 days after I made this purchase and becoming unable to use the product provided I am now out of luck for having played 39 hours in a roguelite title?? Yes, I'm the unreasonable one, sure.   Now I know this rant won't change anything and I could charge back and get banned and not lose sleep if 40$CDN was gunna kill me, but god damn I'm just irked by TWO companies offering bad service on one platform (Even if valve owns the platform its no right to bad business.)  I guess I'd conclude by saying I have a library of unplayed or wont-be-played-agains and I'm not ashamed to add more but I can't stand supporting these companies without at least airing my grievances despite what little it will do.

game: Euro Truck Simulator 2 - Krone Trailer Pack
review: I got this yesterday and like it very much. I bought a bunch of trailers of various types, customized them, and customized the paint job on a few. With this pack, the Krone tires can be added to the standard trailers too which would improve fuel efficiency since the Krone tires have a better fuel economy rating than the standard trailer tires. The physics for the double-trailers is very good. I had no problem driving them. I wish there was a liquid chemical tanker to be able to haul hot chemicals, diesel, etc.

Es un juego bastante inmersivo si lo que se quiere es sentirse un mundo post apocalíptico zombie. Pero es prácticamente vital que se juegue con un grupo de amigos, ya que esto permitirá experimentar la sensación de que realmente se está sobreviviendo y que si tu compañero muere tu mueres.  En cuanto al estado del juego sería poco sensato opinar en pro o en contra, ya que constantemente está recibiendo cambios por parte de los desarrolladores. Pero aun así para alguien que comprenda el estado Alpha del juego y que quiera apoyar o disfrutar de vez en cuanto los avances del juego es bastante recomendable.  Espero que para cuando termine el desarrollo todas las animaciones se mejoren enormemente. Porque la forma en que cae un árbol al talarlo es penosa y algunos otros detalles ya que aunque son detalles pequeños tienen efecto en la inmersión.

FPS de los creadores de Duke Nuken pero de la era moderna. No inventa nada y te muestra todas las "posibilidades" desde muy temprano (tanto armas como enemigos). El apartado sonoro es bueno (lo suele ser siempre en este tipo de juegos); la estética pixel esta muy cuidada; abundan algunos bugs y tirones de fps pero nada que moleste en demasía. Los jefes y las armas están bastante bien; destacan sobretodo las "bowling bombs", unas bombas que ruedan por el suelo y que son el icono del juego: muy divertidas. La jugabilidad es exquisita, pero al enseñártelo todo pronto, te hace perder un poco el interés, aunque se sabe sobreponer debido a la diversión que ofrece. Los controles responden de 10. El motor utilizado es una delicia. Hay zonas de plataformas que son bastante "molestas" debido al movimiento del personaje, que parece que se resbala de ellas. Nada que no se consiga tras varios intentos.  Bueno juego, pero sin más. Recomendado sólo si te gusta el género y bajo alguna rebaja (a poder ser). Mínimo te dará 6 horitas frenéticas de disparos y explosiones.

[h1]★短評：很香、超香、香爆，除此之外乏善可陳[/h1]  [b]．推薦給：有玩碧藍航線，只要香其他都無所謂的指揮官[/b]  [b]．不推薦給：除此之外的所有路過鄉民[/b]   https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1999558654  [i]△需注意，就算是以粉絲向的標準來看，這款的誠意也非常不足 △身為碧航老玩家只好含淚給好評，但老實說目前（2/17）褒貶不一的評價還算公正，遊戲本身確實不好，不全然是背刺預購玩家的問題 △總結來說，碧藍航線手遊要比這款好得多，跳過這款幫老婆多買一件live2D或戒指可能都更划算一點[/i]  https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1999564162  [h1]一、優點：[/h1]  1.香  https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1999559922  [h1]二、缺點：[/h1]  [b]（一）設定類[/b]  1.PS4暴力移殖，鍵鼠玩家會很痛苦，xbox手把上AB鍵互換也很錯亂 2.沒有任何畫面設定可調整，戰鬥場景只有爛可以選 3.但就算畫面很爛還是很吃資源喔（i5/GTX950/8G ram 戰鬥掉幀到約45FPS） 4.沒有自動存檔，也沒有任何防呆機制，非常容易忘記存  [b]（二）遊戲類[/b]  1.劇情極短，約4~5小時可全通，且廢話居多 2.過完劇情，剩下的都是在農素材，毫無遊戲性可言 3.戰鬥模式單一，敵人的難度只表現在血量，戰鬥地圖還小到不行，直線跑三秒就撞空氣牆 4.角色不齊全外，還有一半的角色綁支援隊，不能操作也不會出現在戰鬥場景  [b]（三）畫面類[/b]  1.很醜的海景，簡直就像是在果凍上開船 2.很醜的3D建模，人物像是在果凍上漂移的殭屍 3.因為3D建模很醜所以拍照功能也不怎麼樣（要幫L4D2建模組倒是可以利用） 4.立繪照搬手遊還只搬一小部分，所有人都只有一套衣服，改造、婚紗、課金skin通通沒有 5.CG只有11張，還不如上P站  [b]（四）文本類[/b]  1.就算用日常番的角度來看也相當尷尬沒內容的對話 2.斷章（解鎖的小劇情）感覺就是充數的，完全沒體現角色特色，有些還人設崩壞，不如別做 3.好不容易農完素材結婚，結果每人只有3~4句的對白，比照搬手遊還不如  [b]（五）音樂音效類[/b]  1.戰鬥開場會有2秒堪比英聽測驗罐頭背景噪音的廉價音效，非常莫名而且很吵 2.付費DLC只收了一部分的BGM，有幾首我滿喜歡的竟然沒收錄 3.秘書艦的語音過少，只有港口固定幾句，個人語音量大概只有手遊的1/10  [h1]三、總結[/h1]  基於對碧藍航線原作的熱愛，我實在給不下負評 但我光列缺點就整理了五大部分，大家就自己看著辦吧… 優點方面，我無論怎麼想都只有「島風可愛」、「島風瑟琴」、「我好想大聲斥責」 想了很久發現，總結起來還真的只有「香」這點可以拿出來講 但反正這個價格，有在玩碧藍的大概也就是1~2件skin的錢，拿來買隻島風沒毛病，其他東西就當送的就好 不用抱太大期待，或不要抱任何期待更好 就算是以一款粉絲向遊戲的標準來看，誠意方面也是非常不足，或者該說隨便…  碧航玩家可以考慮看看，反正你都幫老婆們買了N件live2D了，也不差這500元 至於路過的吃瓜群眾嘛…個人比較推薦手遊或本子入坑，快樂又實用

game: Sea Dogs: To Each His Own - Flying the Jolly Roger
review: Личный итог: примерно за 200 часов общего геймплея в новом профиле на личной базе был трижды, и то проездом. Че там делать - хз, баба страшная, как атомная война, не дотягивает даже до портовых девок, корабли первого класса не поставить (что для меня, как любителя коллекционировать самовары, огромный минус), всего кораблей засунуть можно только две штуки, склад имеет смысл разве что для плюшкиных или тех, кто не в ладах с Англией, ибо рядом Ямайка. После пары тестовых боев "омфг мега полакр Тореро" отправился гнить в ПУ до конца игры, ибо кроме уныния у меня он не вызвал ничего, на фоне Миражей-Гриффондоров и иже с ними (по соотношению статов к прочим одноклассникам, я уж не говорю про длсишный же Калеуче) смотрится ну очень бледно. Квестовый яд - одноразовый, и рецепта вы не получите, что по моему мнению странно, опять таки приходит на ум Калеуче и одноразовая, но такая имбовая шкура ягуара. Топорик неплох, хотя на момент его получения были варианты поинтереснее, ну да ладно. Что реально убило - это его вид, моделька смотрится так же гармонично, как тюнингованная девятка на улицах Вайс Сити (я думаю, подобные школомоды еще помнят старые задроты, вроде меня) А уж концовка вызвала такой фейспалм, что я до сих пор хожу в очках. Кстати, спойлер для тех, кто играет положительным во всех отношениях "мальчишом-кибальчишом", как я - если у вас есть офицеры с положительной честью - герои/славные малые и тп -учтите, что ваша честь по квесту упадет в глубочайшую жопу, и если вы полагаетесь на статы и перки ваших офицеров - будьте внимательны, и не потеряйте ценных и прокачанных оффов, как по незнанию сделал я (со мной у них даже не появлялся вариант "я тебе денег, а ты остаешься", свалили все), пришлось набирать всяких негодяев, которые опять-таки, с последующим улучшением чести послали меня нафиг. Касаемо сюжета - все итак уже исплевались, ограничения по времени между заданиями это просто финиш, хламосборные квесты без предупреждения для неподготовленных людей - в топку (мне повезло, что до этой линейки я увлекся фриплеем и пришел сильным и могучим, увешанным бусами и пистолями). Квест со спасением Пикара с плантации взбесил - куча СЛивов из-за того, что квестовый персонаж появлялся окруженный противниками и умирал до того, как я тупо успевал к нему подбежать. В квесте Коррида целых три момента, которые вызвали, мягко говоря, недоумение - невозможность заходить в порты, принудительное затопление вашего корабля и поднятие испанского флага. Ребята, далеко не все изучают испанский флаг, многие прекрасно обходятся голландским. А финальный квест в подземелье - это что-вообще-такое, ни логики, ни смысла, плавать в какой-то канализации среди коряво сделанных ваншотающих фонтанчиков это восхитительное сюжетное решение. В течение всей миссии не покидала одна мысль: "когда уже этот бред уже закончится, когда уже я выйду отсюда, сяду на корабль и свалю к чертовой матери." А потом я выбрался из подземелья, расплакался и стал молиться, что отныне я буду паинькой, буду защищать слабых и невинных, не буду грешить никогда-никогда, и в четверти у меня будут одни пятерки, после чего сел на самовар, и, с именем Господа на устах поплыл грабить Сан-Хуан, убивать сан-хуанцев и насиловать сан-хуанок, а иногда даже наоборот.

Yes.  Just- yes.

本篇个人最喜欢的只有空子线，有可能是第一条进的线所以印象有加分。 空子对比珠绪和绘留，个人感觉就是感情描写差太多了。剧透：[spoiler]空子在知道成田回来是为了复仇，并且会毁掉这个“学院”之后，并没有去阻止，也没有告诉其她“皇冠”成员，而是选择了与他一起同行，共同面对，即使要杀死的是自己的父母还有最尊敬的时乃老师。[/spoiler]这种默默在自己身边支持和支撑自己的坚强女性，有男人不爱吗？当然菱吾也是。 [spoiler]到了最后，空子害怕会让自己最爱的成田以后会背负着是自己的杀父仇人这件事情痛苦的活下去，而倒戈与成田对决，虽然双方都受了伤没有死去，但是空子还是决定自己消失，而成田也认识到了自己的真正想法，放下了复仇。[/spoiler] 空子用自己的爱为成田找到了除了复仇之外的道路。[spoiler]私奔[/spoiler] 空子线在剧情方面编排得比较紧凑合理，而珠绪和绘留则是像一见钟情那样，突然之间就发展了。[spoiler]难道是给的钱不一样[/spoiler] 朔线感觉拖沓，虽然是要揭晓一切真相的路线，但却给人一种肉到口边被人夹走了的感觉。到了最后感觉真快要把成田写成超人了，看着都觉得尴尬。[spoiler]明明前一场战斗打到双手都断了，身体快要不行了，后面马上又飞奔起来使出玄间的技能[/spoiler] [h1]最后，我爱成田真理[/h1] 打完本篇推荐马上去玩ND吧，美鸟跟菱吾真的很不错。

06/2020 = Volta e meia eu jogo, e é surpreendente como apenas uma pessoa tem um enorme potencial e vontade de trazer algo bem legal para comunidade gamer! O jogo sempre recebe atualizações, geralmente de 6 em 6 meses, as vezes antes ou depois, mas sempre o desenvolvedor atento para oque o jogadores relatam ou até mesmo querem no jogo com muitas idéias! O jogo é ótimo, traz uma ideia bacana, tem o pvp em servidores dedicados dos próprios players, e a cada tempo que passa coisas vem para o jogo.  Uma imersão bem bacana no modo sobrevivência solo, duplas, clãn grande ou pequeno, do fácil ao difícil, em fim, recomendo, mas apenas se você quer uma experiência da qual possa contribuir para melhorar-la e que você possa sempre se divertir!  2016 = Otimos gráficos,dificuldade de sobrevivencia moderada para hard, Muito bom, sempre atualizando, Recomendo.

This game is by far the game of the century. It has a very capturing story, with highs and lows, exciting gameplay that keeps you on the edge of your seat, and dialogue that is pure perfection. This is my favorite game in my Steam library, if you do not have it, get it NOW. It's made by NASA, who wouldn't want a game made by NASA?  Moonbase Alpha is like Grand Theft Auto on the moon, done professionally. You can repair and drive space vehicles, carry tubes with your friends and play tug of war, jump around with low gravity, and so much more! The gameplay of this game will immediatly get you addicted.  Moonbase Alpha also features an amazing communication system, with ultra-realistic text to speech playback. If you don't feel like talking in game with your microphone, no worries! You can customize your voice so you sound the way you like when you type!  No but seriously, I don't think anyone really knows how to play this game.
If you like Hotline Miami you'll love this!

game: DEEEER Simulator: Your Average Everyday Deer Game
review: this game is the best

Honestly this game changed my outlook on so many things and if you haven't played it by now you need to get on that. Toby Fox is a thoughtful and creative genius who made me fall in love with a unique cast of odd, loveable, pixelated monsters and the magical world they call home. I would constantly revisit this game whenever I was stressed out because I felt like it was a safe place for me, a place I could feel at home and confortable. I highly recommend Undertale, even if you started playing it and didn't enjoy it, pick it up again and really experince it. I promise you'll gain more than what you spent on it. You might even learn a little about yourself along the way.

Personalmente, no soy muy partidario de los DLC en los juegos, pero en el caso de XCOM, es la excepción a la regla.  ¿Por que? Muy sencillo, aparte de los nuevos contenidos que hacen los DLC, Enemy Within añade algo mas que eso, cambia la jugabilidad, de forma radical. Por ejemplo, al añadir un nuevo recurso, la sustancia denominada como "Mezcla" te permite desbloquear ciertas mejoras para tu soldado, que te daran una ventaja muy favorable a la hora de combatir contra los alienigenas, pero en esta vida, todo tiene un precio, y como tal, la obtención de esta sustancia no es para ni mucho menos facil, ya que el contenedor en donde se encuentra tiene un temporizador de autodestrucción, por lo que te plantearás si en muchos casos, vale la pena o no arriesgarse en buscar estos contenedores.  Además al añadir los CEM (humanos mecanizados) y los mutantes, a la hora de luchar contra los aliens, cambia mucho, permitiendo crear un sinfin de combos que te permitirá destruir a tus enemigos, sin embargo, ellos también sacarán la sustancia mezcla en su beneficio, teniendo a los Mecatoides (Seciotes con armadura cibernética) y los Buscadores, que son unidades mecanizadas que tienen como objetivo localizar y aislar a tus soldados gracias a sus sistema de evasión y camuflaje.  Para remate, si te parecia ya bastante con esto, también tendras que lidiar con EXALT, una organización de humanos que simpatizan con los invasores, y vosotros dieris "bah, se matan como a los demás", si, pero que pensarias si te dijera esto:  1º Pueden piratear tus investigaciones, por lo que supondria un retraso a la hora de finalizar tus investigaciones. 2º Pueden piratear tus reservas de dinero, por lo que te podrias quedar sin dinero. 3º Pueden propagar el pánico en cualquier pais miembro del consejo. 4º Pueden mejorar su arsenal, habilidad, armduras, armas, modificaciones genéticas....  Y esto solo lo puedes evitar usando tu dinero para realizar análisis en busca de las células de EXALT, pero claro ahí no está todo, ya que tendrás que localizar su base de operaciones, y creedme, no es fácil, ya que las operaciones encubierta, el agente XCOM encubierto solo puede usar la arma secundaria, es decir, la pistola, por lo que nos planteamos a la hora de decidir a quien mandamos a ese riesgo.  Esto y muchas otras cosas, además de una misión especial (no haré spoiler, pero si dire, que es una misión clave, que si pierdes, se acabo la partida), han hecho de XCOM el mejor juego del mundo, ya de por si que para mi, personalmente, ya lo era.   10/10

Very boring game. The game by itself is very hard and 75% of your gameplay consists of trying to do basic tasks such as finding food, and crafting same things over and over again. I played it with my friends and started multiple worlds, each time the playthrough was the exact same. Dying in the game is very punishing, and dying is pretty easy. There are so many things you need to know before you start the gameplay, and its easy to make mistakes which will punish you heavily. Even after you learn how to play, most of the time you will do same things over and over again with little room for improvement. The thing that i like about this game is the characters with their unique skills. Its very hard to orient in the game, you have to keep track about a lot of things... The game lacks essential things in a survival/multiplayer game, which you will need to obtain by installing a lot of mods. I played about 3-4 worlds, and I quit trying to play any further since 8/10 hours of my gameplay was just eating random food that i find on the floor. I heard that there are a lot of bosses, but i dont have the patience to eat food for another 8 hours. Something will just pop out or there is some event that will happen that will lead to your inevitable death. Resources in the game are pretty easily obtainable, but the quantity that you will need them in is enormous. I can't spend more time in a game where I know i will be bored. You can play this game if you want, but I would never recommend it to anyone.

[b]TL;DR: This is the Destiny of kart racers. Far from a Mario Kart clone, it's one of the most mechanically polished, viscerally thrilling, and aurally & visually breathtaking contributions made to the kart racing genre. It'd possibly be the undisputed greatest of all time… were it not buried under the most insurmountable pile of microtransaction-heavy live-service BS in existence. (Except for offline singleplayer and splitscreen, where everything is unlocked, thankfully.)[/b]   [b]The good[/b]: Somehow the developers have managed to create the most mechanically polished and fully-featured kart racing game since Mario Kart, easily trading blows with the legendary franchise, if not blowing it out of the water completely. Polished racing feel, a vicious sense of speed, a badass cinematic camera that ebbs and flows with your kart's acrobatics, tons of new mechanics (Burnout-style slams and takedowns replete with slow-mo camera, a boost meter that recharges on drifts/drafting/takedowns, Hero abilities)… mechanically, it is a pitch-perfect game and by far the most innovative and meaningful contribution to the kart-racing genre in nearly a decade. There's still some polish to be done in the balancing department, but this will no doubt be worked out in due time.  And that's not all they nailed. The artistic [i]oevure[/i] is [i]iconic[/i]. Tons of characters from across the entire Disney pantheon—from beloved favorites like Mulan and Mike Wazowski; to live action heroes like Jack Sparrow and Elizabeth Swann; to animated classics like Belle, Beast, Hercules, Megara, Mowgli and Baloo; to surprising deep-cuts like Figment of DisneyWorld fame. You even get tons of side characters from every franchise, like Celia Mae and Randall. Every character is lovingly animated and voice-acted (by what sounds like the original actors, if not extremely talented soundalikes) and overflowing with personality. And the SOUNDTRACK ABSOLUTELY SLAPS. It's brimming with fantastically mixed and designed traphouse / electroswing remixes of all your favorite Disney classic music, plus plenty you've probably never heard.  All of this is tied together by a slick and flashy UI that's beautifully rendered/animated and carries a strong sense of attitude and style.  [b]The bad[/b]: They took all of this graphical and gameplay [i]perfection[/i] and buried it under a mountain of live-service BS. Racers AND their performance upgrades are locked behind pay-to-skip grinds. There's a confusing smorgasboard of currencies and crafting materials. There's a battle-pass and dozens of time-limited events. It is a GaaS nightmare.  [b]The silver lining[/b]: [u]Great news for split-screen or quick-play players! None of these pay-to-win mechanics are present in local multiplayer.[/u] All characters are fully unlocked and leveled right from the get-go if you play it offline. So the split-screen experience is basically perfect. Get it for that alone. The same can almost be said of the "Regulated Multiplayer" playlist. All characters are fully leveled with all performance upgrades unlocked. The only thing not unlocked is the characters themselves, but it does give you a rolling set of guest characters that you can play.  [b]Minor quibbles[/b]: Visually, the boost meter is visually way too small on the screen, so it's hard to keep track of your boost status without taking your eyes off the action. You can't revisit any tutorials. There's no in-game encyclopedia for things like character classes.

Galactic Civ III ist ein runden-basierendes Stragiespiel im Weltall. Man kann verschiedene Rassen wählen, um den Weltraum zu bevölkern. Dabei führen unterschiedliche Wege zum Ziel. Z.B. kann dieser Weg friedlich, durch Ausbau vom Einfluss oder kämpferisch, durch Erobern anderer Planeten mittels Invasionen aussehen. Planeten können durch verschiedene Gebäude verbessert werden. Durch erforschen von Technologien werden Schiffe und Gebäude stärker. Die Wirtschaft reguliert man durch setzen von Schwerpunkten. Durch Diplomatie mit anderen Bevölkerungen können Abkommen, Allianzen oder den Austausch von Technologien erzielt werden. Als Extrapunkt möchte ich noch das Erstellen von eigenen Schiffen erwähnen, die der Phantasie kaum Grenzen setzt. Die KI ist auch bei normalem Level einiger maßen schwierig. Es braucht etwas Zeit, um alle Möglichkeiten und Zusammenhänge zu verstehen. Aus meiner Sicht eine klare Kaufempfehlung und ist sein Geld alle mal wert. Bei Rabatt auf das Spiel unbedingt zuschlagen.

game: Total War: ROME II - Emperor Edition
review: Sıkı bir Total War oyuncusu olarak ilk izlenimim doğal olarak olumlu Rome 2 size bir strateji oyununun verebileceği her şeyi veriyor oynadığım en iyi strateji oyunlarından biri diyebilirim , gelelim ayrıntılara aslında 2 tane çok önemli ayrıntı var ;  Klasik şehirden asker üretimi kalkmış komutan birim üretiyor .  Eyalet sistemi ile birlikte klasik şehir geliştirme yapısı değişmiş olumlu ve olumsuz tarafları var .  Şimdi ben sadece olumsuz noktalara daha doğrusu beğenmediğim şeyleri açıklayacağım yazacaklarım dışındaki şeyler gayet iyi ;  Bu Eyaletler genelikle 4 şehirden oluşuyor örneğin Romayız ve İtayla eyaletinin durumu bizim iki şehirimiz var bu Eyalette ve bizim memleket ile Etrüskler aynı Kültürden geliyor yani Eyaletin %100 ü Latin kökenli buna rağmen bizim şehirlerimizde mutluluk oranları asayiş oranları çok kırılgan iken Etrüksler hep bir mutluluk hep bir güzelliklerle dolu burada bir sıkıntı var diğer taraftan farklı kültürlerinde bulunduğu eyaletler var orları yayıldığınızda ortalık yıkılıyor isyan isyan üzerine belkide ben zorda oynadığım için ama aşırı bir hoşnutsuzluk var .  Her Şehrin her Eyaletin sağlam olduğu bazı konular var kimisi Çiftçilikte kimisi ziraatde kimisi hayvancılıkta kimisi Sanayide daha fazla kar elde ediyor yani herkesin anlıyacağı şekilde Bu Bursalılar Tekstilde çok iyiler Konyalılarda Tarımda Konyaya Tarım yapmalıyız Bursayada Tekstil atölyesi değil mi işte bunu bize söyleyen yok bu tarz bonus öğeleri oyunda çok ulaşılır noktalarda değil ve şehirlerimizi genişlettiğimzde hangi binaları kullanmalıyız noktası hep bir muamma daha açık olabilirdi zaten şehrin ürettim maddesi dışında çok çok çok önemli bir fonksiyonu yok en azından eyaletin tamamına sahip değilseniz , eyalete sahip oluncada Alinin takkesini Veliye giydirip sounları hallediyorsunuz olmadı Tebliğ yapıp sorunları hallediyorsunuz velhasılı kelam Şehir geliştirmede o Eyalete hangi bina lazım sorunu bence en büyük sorun .  Muharebe sistemindeki en büyük değişiklik Limanların ve Denizcilerin fonksiyonlarının artması çıkarmalar gerçekten etkiliyici olmuş onun dışında aynı tas aynı hamam , Bir askerin gözünden savaşın içinde gibi olacaksınız geyiği de tamam çok güzelde öyle ahım şahım bir şey değil gene kim kime dum duma savaşıyorlar çok dikkatli inceliyeceksiniz ki o hengamede güzel bir kafa koparma ne bileyim bir bağırsak dökme herifi kalkanla sesemletip kılıcı böğre sokma gibi cinematik özellikeri yakalayasın .  Romada ve Kartacada 3 er tane hanedan var belirgin öellikleri ve bonusları olan onun dışındaki dlc dahil tüm ulusların Hanedanları yok hepsinde bir diğer aileler şeysi var İç Savaş çıkma ihtimali var Empireda ki gibi güzel o en gelişmiş yapay zeka diyorlar bu oyun için diğerleri 3+3=6 diyorlarsa bu oyun 3.2=6 diyor öyle çok şey beklemeyin ama sağlam pusu kuruyorlar bazen zorlaştırma şeyleri hep güzel ama dinamizm sağlıyor  Savunma Müttefiki ile Askeri Müttefiklik arasında ne fark var birde bu sorumu sorduktan sonra ben kaçar ,

I am not sure where this game gets off putting content behind a pay-wall, for a single player game with a laughable mulitplayer mode.  This game reminds me of a Full Sail students game project final, and feels totally unfinished, shallow and clunky/clumsy.  It lacks a decent interface, the gameplay is basic and repeatitive, and a couple of buildings, and many ships. are behind a pay-wall, which I find absurd, even more so with the overall quality of this game.  Lots of clicking while trying to pretend to be an RTS.  Just put a $1.99 pricetag on this clunker, and call it a day.  Don't be greedy.  This game should never be transaction based, very poor choice, but I see what you did there.  It is like being given a free hotdog, the cheap kind, and having to pay for most condiments, and leaving the meal with food poisoning.    2/10

Przeciętna gra. Nie jest na tyle zła żeby ją zmieszać z błotem, ale też nie ma w niej nic nadzwyczajnego. Średniej jakości menedżer tenisa, w którego trochę można pograć.  Wcielamy się rzecz jasna w menedżera akademii tenisowej. Możemy założyć swoją i piąć się w górę od samego początku, lub objąć którąś z istniejących. Staramy się pozyskać odpowiednich zawodników i personel oraz rozbudowywać akademię.  Plusy: - jest oczywiście Iga Świątek :) - interfejs jest dosyć przyjazny użytkownikowi - dobrze rozwiązany trening  Minusy: - animacja meczu makabryczna, po dwóch meczach korzystałem wyłącznie z symulacji żeby tego nie oglądać - trochę zbyt duża losowość wyników - szybka nuda. Grałem kilkoma akademiami i żadną z nich nie dotarłem dalej niż do końca pierwszego sezonu. Po ustawieniu wszystkiego na właściwe tory gra staje się monotonna.  Kciuk w górę, bo pograć można, byle nie spodziewać się nie wiadomo czego. Cena jest przynajmniej o połowę za wysoka, dlatego zakup polecam wyłącznie na dobrej promocji.

game: Mount & Blade: With Fire and Sword
review: Despite what people may say.. I personally think it's really good.    Some of the Pros is that they have firearms. Outfits look really nice, HUGE map, and have a few story modes you can partake in (I believe it's Sweden, Russia, Commonwealth, and Crimea). Plus you can actually feel like you're in a line and if you know the commands.. Can win a battle in a single volley. Just as Carolus Rex, I was outnumbed in this battle against Russians. -4 Battle advantage. Didn't look promising for me. But I had a strong musket infantry line. And as Cavalry charged, most went down. And then the infantry came. Took out a large portion of them in two volleys.    Now there is cons.. You can't create your own kingdom. Apparently the economics are bad(I haven't noticed, looks the same to me), can't recruit from villages(as far as I can tell), the huge map makes you look like an ant. So if you zoom out, you're gonna lose yourself. Or where you're trying to find.   Though overall, I love the game. Very fun and unlike the Custom Battles for Napoleonic Wars of M&B, the AI can actually shoot their guns. The rating I give is Recommend and a 7/10. I think they could've done more to Fire and Sword. But it's still a good game. Don't buy into the negative "The economy is shitty" or "Glitches everywhere". Because I haven't found a single glitch yet. Or at least one I haven't noticed.  EDIT - After playing for WAY more, I'll edit the review some more.   The Story modes are The Polish Commonwealth, Russia, and The Cossaks.   And you can technically "own" a kingdom. You just can't name it, or be for one paticular side. The fief you capture will be called the land you took it from with "Rebels" at the end. (For example, if you conquered Warsaw, it would be "The Polish Commonwealth(Rebels)". Though, unfortunately, you can't do anything with it besides own having it for yourself. Regardless, it's still very fun.

Serious Sam shows that VR is actually quite simple: take a 90's classic, add enough options so people can play the way they like, and you're done.  This game has made me feel more like a dumb action movie hero than anything else ever has. Are you listening, Duke Nukem? Serious Sam is what your series is supposed to be.   Now for the downsides of 90's style gaming:  There are some navigation problems, as teleporting takes away my sense of direction, and there's a lot of hidden corners that have to be found in order to procede. I don't need Call Of Duty style handholding, but a few more clues would be nice. Maybe after you've been stuck for a while, a critter could run through the maze, leading the way.  Serious Sam has always had the coolest monumental environments, so I was dissapointed that so much of this game is set in a drab, crumbling slum that looks more like a rented movie set than Egypt.   Needs a quicker way to switch weapons - something with the trackpad, for example. And please, when I run out of shotgun ammo in a face-to-face shotout, don't auto-switch me to a rocket launcher.  aaaaaaaaaaaAAAAAAAAAAA! Best monster ever, for an extra challenge, try putting your earbuds in the wrong ears.   Bug report: In chapter 7 the keys didn't spawn.

游戏真的有个好底子，类似腾讯代理的流放之路（POE）+D3的高清重制版，这才是应该有的暗黑3的样子，这价格绝对不亏。。 前前后后玩到第二章开头，但发现还是存在不少BUG期待官方修正。。。 1：掉率很迷，各个守关boss的掉率和宝箱的掉率还算正常，但是地图上的普通精英蓝怪黄怪的掉率还不如普通怪是什么情况。。。？ 2：第二章开始学会变身，为啥我一个战士面板DPS900+，平砍暴击1200+，变身完了平砍200？？技能没伤害？？？这是啥变身？？？？ 3：“嫡球”（类似赫拉迪姆方块，用来刷新物品附加属性的）翻译错误，掉落在地上显示是个XX油 4：永远链接不上服务器是什么情况？挂上科学上网都连不上。。。。 如果官方坚持更新版本，绝对是潜力股。 最后，更加期待暗黑4了。。。。。。。

Un ejemplo mas de que los Videojuegos son un medio de Arte.  Nunca me imagine que tan aterrador -o bello incluso- podría ser sufrir de psicosis, y oh rayos, Ninja theory parece haber logrado trasmitir de una manera increíble lo que una persona con un grave caso de esta enfermedad  pudiera llegar a experimentar.   Como dije, esto es arte, y de gran calibre. Las vistas, el guion, la historia, las actuaciones de voz y especialmente quien interpretó a Senua merece miles de premios porque sinceramente es espectacular.   En cuanto jugabilidad es bastante sencilla, no te vas a encontrar con árboles de habilidades ni nada de eso. Por supuesto es debido a que lo que realmente importa es experimentar lo que Senua siente, escucha y ve. Somos como otra vocecita más en su cabeza que comanda sus acciones. El combate de todas maneras se siente muy bien y es super satisfactorio.   Lamentablemente me encontré con algunos bugs u otros desajustes que me sacaban de onda y de la inmersión pero en realidad no es mucho de que preocuparse.  Puntuación: 9.5/10. Recomendadísimo

Simply said it's chess with mechs.   You need some runs to get into the mechanics but after that it's exciting to think about all the possible moves evaluate them and search for an even even better because every move counts. Any mistake could cost you the run and you have to start all over again. But thats ok because most of the time you'll recognize that it was your own fault. So take your time and enjoy this masterpiece.

ЕБАНЫЕ ВЫБЛЯДКИ РАЗРАБЫ, ЗДРАВСТВУЙТЕ. НЕНАВИЖУ БЛЯТЬ ВАС ВСЕМ СЕРДЦЕМ И ДУШОЙ НАХУЙ. ЭТО БЫЛА АХУЕННАЯ ИГРА, НЕТ СУКА ВАМ НАДО ДОБАВИТЬ АННУ, ДОКТОРА, ЛЕГИОНА БЛЯТЬ И ТД. ПОФИКСИТЬ В ЛУЧШУЮ СТОРОНУ МАНЬЯКОВ И ПРЕВРАТИТЬ ИГРУ В ПОЛНОЕ ДЕРЬМО НАХУЙ. ПОЛНОЕ ИМБАЛАНСНОЕ ДЕРЬМО. КАКИМ НАХУЙ ХУЕМ Я СБЕГУ НАПРИМЕР, ЕСЛИ ВЫ ДАЛИ ВОЗМОЖНОСТЬ МАНЬЯКУ  ЗАКРЫВАТЬ ЛЮК, А Я ЛЕЖУ НАХУЙ В ПРЕДСМЕРТНОМ СОСТОЯНИИ??? А НАХУЙ? ЧТОБ БЛЯТЬ ВЫ ИЗ ДОМА ВЫШЛИ И КЛЮЧ НАХУЙ ЗАБЫЛИ, ЧТОБЫ ХУЙ ЗАЙТИ ДОМОЙ. ЕБАЛ ВАС ВСЕХ ТРЕХМЕТРОВЫМ ШЛАНГОМ, ПЕДИКИ ЕБУЧИЕ. УЙДИТЕ НАХУЙ ИЗ ЭТОЙ ИГРЫ, ЭТО НЕ ВАШЕ БЛЯТЬ. ВЕРНИТЕ НАМ СТАРЫЙ ДБД, СТАРЫЙ АХУЕННЫЙ ДБД, УЕБКИ ССАНЫЕ. А ТОТ КТО БЛЯТЬ ПРИДУМАЛ КАРТУ МЯСОКОМБИНАТ ГИДЕОН ВООБЩЕ ПОХОДУ ОТБИТЫЙ НАПРОЧЬ. ВООБЩЕМ ВЫВОД ИЗ ВСЕГО СКАЗАНОГО: ВЫ УБИЛИ СВОЮ ИГРУ И ТЕМ САМЫМ УБИЛИ ДОВЕРИЕ ИГРОКОВ ЭТОЙ САМОЙ ИГРЫ. ЖЕЛАЮ ВАМ СЧАСТЬЯ БЛЯТЬ В ЖИЗНИ И НАДУЮСЬ ВЫ УЙДЁТЕ ИЗ РАЗРАБОТКИ ИГР. СПАСИБО НАХУЙ.

game: Mutant Year Zero: Road to Eden
review: I'm with some that if there is nuetral rating I would give it that. I was dissappointed in how linear it was. I felt painted into a single path road that does not have any intersections. The only thing XCOM like about it is the turn based combat.   PRO:  The realtime movement/exploration with turn based combat is creative. The stealth mechanics are interesting and mostly good.  CON: Very Linear. No (or non perceived) incentives from a strategy level Each location is a visit once, done.  Frustrating combat progression.   Others have mentioned how small in time investment the game was but I have uninstalled it before even making it 1/2 way though. I don't often uninstall a game without even attempting to finish it.  I think some people may enjoy this game with that said which is why I think I would just put a sideways thumb. More of a meh

Honestly I had a rough time starting out in this game; this is probably due to the fact that i've never even touched a different dark souls game. Now even though this is without a doubt the hardest game I've ever played, I'm absolutely in love with it. The best thing about the game in my opinion is that you get to decide what you want to do instead of the game telling you what to do and where to go, all while holding your hand down the yellow brick road. Don't get me wrong, this game infuriates me half of the time I play it, but the satisfaction that comes with defeating a hard enemy or boss is definitely worth it. Almost everything about this game is top notch although there are a few things that bug me when playing. For one my pc loves to just randomly shut off sometimes so when I started out with my main character my pc shut off and I was never able to recover it; I have a new character now but Its frustrating that 15 hours of a game can be erased simply because the game shut off. The fps drops are pretty bad sometimes which can be frustrating especially when in the middle of an important fight. I play with a controller so I have no complaints about keyboard and mouse not working but I can definitely tell that it needs to optimized for the keyboard and mouse only players. It might be just me but whenever I'm updating Elden ring, it always takes forever regardless of how little sized the update is. Overall those are my only complaints. Even with those I'd still give this game 10/10.

-[b]TL;DR[/b]- +Great open-world, good atomsphere (yes it's better than Far Cry 5) +Mostly Interesting and meaningful quests +Impfactful choices  -Overly grinding middle-game -Awkward spear movements (seriously) -Helix points, I know it's not necessity but I just dislike it -Enemy radar leaped from one extreme to the other; you're detected too easily that stealth is a useless system overall -Merc system is not only much more trivial than Middle Earth, the infamy thing is beyond simply 'bad design'  ~Some abilities are ripped off from Middle Earth and have really awkward visual performance in AC context ~Heavy RPG emphasis means level difference = nearly everything in combat ~System requirement can be quite high, but for one of the best graphic performance around  ~quite some contents are about the same to Origin (about 1/4)  Overall:8.5/10  【[b]About This Game[/b]】 Odyssey appears to be a compiliation of the most acclaimed features in many games, but fails to be the unique piece of itself.  Don't get me wrong; this statement doesn't mean Odyssey isn't a good game - the fact that it successfully merges all of these features into one game is already worth endorsing. It's simply too difficult to call it an 'Assassin's Creed game' when you find more Witcher and Middle Earth in it than any other AC predecessors.  It seems to be another 'Ubisoft formula open-world' at the beginning but soon you realise it isn't. Ubisoft didn't lie on this: Odyssey is defintely their largest installment in at least three years time. The world is large, well-crafted and filled with contents, and both protagonists have their unique dialogues and some features.   It's just different. This is the only word I find suitable; it's different from the early ACs, and even different from Origin. You can sense the obvious 'referrence' to Witcher and Middle Earth (I just find it funny: Middle Earth began its title by coping many features from AC, and now the table has turned), so much so that the original 'AC style' has been nearly completely disregarded. If Origin at least kept a valuable part of it, Odyssey seems to have discarded all of them without mercy.  Still, I like the new quest system (personally I find it even better than Witcher), the ability trees (well some of them really feel awkward but overall is fine) and the story development (it falls trivial at certain points, but not entirely flawed).  I won't say everybody will like Odyssey because I already know lots of people, especially many who liked the old ACs, would not. I also agree that this series might really need a longer rest to figure out where it's heading.   But come on - we all know there's only one Altaïr, one Ezio Auditore da Firenze. Their stories, no matter how epic and stunning, would not and should not be successed by just some duplicates differed by only cloth designs (yes I AM talking about Syndicate and Unity).   I'm very glad that Ubi has tried, and to a great extent successfully accomplished, to present something different.

Get on board, load the cannons and set sail across the vast ocean in online first-person shooter multiplayer fashion. Arm yourself with the perfect loadout with a primary, secondary, tertiary weapons and a miscellaneous tool.   With the wind in your favor, as Captain of a mighty vessel, command your men and control and conquer the seas with your crew of wretched miscreants.  As a crew member. Operate and maintain the cannons, repair the ship, restock ammunition, spot enemy ships, board enemy ships and fight your way to victory, grab the booty and battle the elements of mother nature's wrath.   In my opinion, Blackwake is the magnum opus of pirate simulators.  10/10 Part of the ship, part of the crew.

game: 通神榜 Noobs Want to Live
review: [h1] [quote] [table] [tr] [th] 　欢迎加入 [url=steampowered.com/curator/41787395] 百度游戏鉴赏团 [/url]　 [/th] [/tr] [tr] [th]　海量新游内测资格，助你清空愿望单 🎁　[/th] [/tr] [tr] [th][b]　素质击剑[/b]　|　[b]白嫖游戏[/b]　|　[b]开黑吹水[/b]　|　[b]犹豫败北[/b]　[/th] [/tr] [/table] [/quote] [/h1]   要说2022年给我留下最深刻的印象的游戏，那《吸血鬼幸存者》一定是其中之一。而无数的仿《吸血鬼幸存者》游戏中，这次我要介绍的《通神榜》又是这之中我认为做的最好的。 	客观来说，《吸血鬼幸存者》在我心中的分数已经是最高的那一档了。因为以我对游戏的评分标准来看，这是一个近乎完美的游戏。而他最大的优点概况为一句话就是，有让人一直玩下去的动力。而它剩下的诸如美术粗糙，毫无剧情，垃圾UI的缺点在我看来完全是瑕不掩瑜。 	而作为一款仿制游戏，取其精华，弃其糟粕做出差异化自然是必须的。（不然就是纯纯的抄袭创意的行为了。）而如何做到有趣的差异化，便是游戏好坏的评判了。 	很巧的是，我去年在玩过《吸血鬼幸存者》之后，便有幸找到了一款仿制手游。我只能说，除了优化了美术，其他的真的是完全照抄，从基本机制到每个技能具体的效果。甚至连美术风格也不能说非常优秀，甚至更新进度都追不上人家《吸血鬼幸存者》。（要不是上课摸鱼没事干，我真不会玩这个手游） 	聊了这么多其他游戏，终于要回到正题了。既然我觉得《通神榜》好，那肯定就如我前面所说，它不仅保留了《吸血鬼幸存者》的优点，还做出了优秀的差异化，使得它能在我心中的地位能和原游戏在同一档水平了。（《吸血鬼幸存者》有什么优点我就不赘述了，可以去参考别人的测评，本测评仅讨论差异化的地方） [h1]1、眼前一亮的美术风格[/h1] 	这个美术风格特指游戏把角色和怪物做成纸片人，是真的纸片人。在一个3D俯视角中，你控制的角色还有出现的怪物都是一张纸。你也可以说制作组美术偷懒，但这不失为一种独特的风格，它确实让我和我的室友眼前一亮。游戏内角色都是Q萌像素风，但是每个角色都有精美的独特立绘（女角色画的是真涩啊）。 	美术风格这种东西还是见仁见智了，就像我完全不喜欢《吸血鬼幸存者》这种美术风格，当然也不排除我很喜欢，但是有人觉得很难看的情况，但不可否认的是制作组确实做到的差异化，而且比较用心了。 	但是我觉得比较遗憾的一点是，游戏的角色怪物甚至召唤物都是这种纸片人风格，但是唯独技能特效不是，比如龙卷风，冰锥，冰墙，火球这些。我觉得这些特效完全也可以做出差异化，和角色一样做成纸片那样的特效。现在的特效就给我一种Unity素材库里的免费特效的感觉，而且与整个游戏风格格格不入。美术组有能力做角色和怪物的差异化，我相信也能做出这样的特效。唯一要考虑的问题可能是，诸如龙卷风这种大范围涉及面积的特效如果做成纸片，在视觉上可能会和碰撞箱有出入。但是我觉得这一点是有办法解决的，比如缩小龙卷风的大小。或者说在这种游戏中，到后期特效满天飞的情况下，这个小瑕疵是可以忽略的。所以如果作者能看到这条测评，真心希望能重做一下技能特效。 [h1]2、有剧情[/h1] 	我们都知道《吸血鬼幸存者》是完全没有剧情的。而本游戏是有剧情，但是仅限有了，内容上既没有深度也没有广度。但是能加进来就可见制作组还是有这方面的想法的。那我的建议是构建一个大的世界观，然后把角色放进去，就以现在的漫画的表现形式就挺好。可以以不同难度的开始或结束为节点，来展开新的剧情。然后再通过不同角色的视角来串联起整个故事。而像凌魂华首这种打破次元壁的角色，完全可以安排一些支线小剧情来增加趣味性。 [h1]3、要素过多[/h1] 	作为一款休闲类小品级游戏，在一些地方玩梗能让玩家会心一笑，比如有个技能叫金钱鼠，底下有行小字介绍“鼠鼠我啊，最喜欢钱啦”（我不好说），还有一个升级技能叫九转护盾。还有其他技能名字，用一个很古老的网络形容词来形容就是太无节操了。但是这样做的问题也是很明显的，像我这种天天网络冲浪的抽象怪来说，这些玩梗都能接受。但不是每个人都能接受，不排除有人看到这些不明不白的东西非常反感，所以张弛有度是非常重要的。 [h1]4、形形色色的怪物[/h1] 	要说《吸血鬼幸存者》最让我遗憾的就是怪物除了长的不一样外完全一样。就虽然刷怪很爽，但是越到后面越无聊，因为“我在一级的时候拿普通木棍打普通的小怪，我在一百级的时候拿普通木棍+10打血量巨厚的普通的小怪”的感觉。但本游戏不同，加入了BOSS机制以后，每个机制不同的BOSS带来的游戏体验是不同的。每个小怪的机制也略有不同。让我印象最深的是一个白色的带翅膀的小怪，它的特殊之处在于一段时间后会翻面（因为怪物是纸片的，所以这种转换非常合理和自然，我觉得这个怪物设计的非常优秀）然后变成黑色并且加速，从人畜无害的感觉变的极具压迫感。  总之，我认为《通神榜》是一款非常优秀的休闲类游戏，虽然目前游戏内容不算太多，但好在持续更新（在笔者截稿时，刚好有一次大更新）。我还是很期待未来能更新什么内容的，毕竟这种游戏想出新角色新怪物新套路理论上是可以无限制的出的，就看开发组的灵感和想法够不够了。
