Ich habe bisher eine Stunde gespielt (plus ein paar Minuten in der Demo) und schon jetzt zeichnet sich ein episches Spiel ab. Die vielen Details, die wunderbar lebendige Welt, so viel zu entdecken...man kann in Secrets of Grindea versinken! Es erinnert mich wirklich an die alten RPGs aus den guten alten NES/SNES Zeiten. Die 13.99 Euro ist das Spiel wirklich wert. Die Demo hat mich vollends überzeugt und zum Kauf bewegt.  UPDATE: Nach über 5 Stunden Spielzeit hat sich an meiner Einschätzung nichts geändert, ein wunderbares Spiel.  Einzig negativ anzumerken ist die im weiteren Spielverlauf starke Häufung von "Endgegnern". Das liegt aber - da bin ich mir ziemlich sicher - am frühen Entwicklungsstand des Spiels und soll dem Gesamteindruck nicht schmälern.  I have just played an hour so far (plus some demo minutes) but already at this point an epic game is looming! There are so many details, such a lively world, so much to discover...you will drown in Secrets of Grindea! It really reminds me of the great rpgs from NES/SNES in good ol' times. I paid 13.99 Euro, which is totally worth it. The demo version convinced me to buy!  UPDATE: After 5 hours of playing nothing changed my opinion. It is still a lovely game. There is only one small thing that bothers me. In further game progress one "end boss" comes after the other. Guess it is because of the early game status and doesn't make the game less good!

If you like Bethesda RPGs and like Sci-Fi games that will give you similar feelings to shows like the Expanse...this game is probably for you. If you're looking for No Man's Sky, Star Citizen or Elite Dangerous...go play those games.   This game is probably the pinnacle of what they've achieved with this ancient engine and it has so many bolted on bits that it is legitimately impressive to have as many features as it does. This is a VERY Bethesda experience, with the least buggy launch I think any of their games have had in a decade. It's optimized poorly, but it *can* run on things like the Steam Deck if you are alright with tweaking settings. I'm excited for the Creation Kit being released for this one, but the base game is more than worth playing through already.  I eagerly await what the modding community comes up with for this release.

review: There's a lot I want to say about this game, from the sessions I had playing this game on stream.  Initially, I thought it was funny and weird - but the more I played the game the more I felt the emotional weight of it, it always feels playful in it's ambivalence. I couldn't recommend this game more.

"Once upon a time a priest comes to Hell....." - this is not a start of a joke. You are Ted, a minister who wakes up in a weird fairytale like land which has some interesting residents, one of them being Mr. Pinstripe, the ultimately evil guy who stole your child... now it's your time to get your daughter Bo back. If you like rather short logic adventures with a nice coherent story, Pinstripe is a perfect fit for you. The graphic is fantastic, the art is just beautifully done and it goes very neatly together with the soundtrack. The story itself is dark and emotional but yet kind of light-hearted, sad and nice at the same time. Heartfelt. The climax of the story hit me right in the feels, even though I kind of suspected it, this is how much emotionally charged it is! And there is a dog! Georgie! You've just gotta love this game. The game is quite easy to navigate, the puzzles are not too hard and it won't take a long time to finish the game.  For completing the achievements you'll need multiple runs (at least two) as you'll be able to unlock some secret rooms in your second run. I enjoyed this game a lot, did multiple runs. I found the good/bad speach choices really funny, along with some of the characters in the game. Even though I don't feel the need to repeat this game in the near future, I am happy I got to play it and can genuinely recommend it to anyone who likes such little adventure games. This one's worth it.

[b]After playing for 30 more hours, I'm changing my review from "Not Recommended" to "Recommended". At the time of my change, 32 people found my review helpful.[/b]  [h1]Here's why I'm changing it[/h1]  My previous complaint boiled down to two major issues I have with this game: - Terrible UI - Terrible AI  Both of those are still true! However, as I dive more into this game I'm learning that Egosoft is actually putting an effort into making both of these better. I'm finding lots of changes from old forum posts where these two elements were much worse. I also previously shared a scenario where I was trying to board and take over an enemy ship and my AI did nothing to help. I haven't had any issues since that initial issue and I've determined it was because that ship was a story ship and wasn't supposed to be taken over.  In my additional 30 hours I've been getting so much enjoyment I cannot justify my "not recommended" review any longer. There's so much to do in this game, it's so deep, and I keep wanting to peel back the layers that I find myself wanting to keep playing more. It's been a while since I've been this engrossed in a game for this long that I just can't let the negatives overwhelm the positives.  [h1]Here's my initial unedited review, for reference[/h1]  I've been playing this game on and off for a few years now and played a lot of X3 before it.  HERE'S WHAT I LOVE: - The depth to the simulated universe is amazing. I keep wanting to peel back the layers to learn more about what's happening around me. - You actually make a difference. I love the fact that X4 lets you be more strategic in your approach to warfare. During war in many other 4x games, you win by having more forces and engage in a full-frontal assault. In X4, you can also do that, but you can also prioritize raiding supply lines, taking out miners, and starving the enemy of resources. As a single pilot in the early game, you can join a faction and help them in their wars immensely by doing these small strategic things. - The visuals are pretty solid. Given the amount of simulation that's happening in this game, any level of visual detail left to squeeze out of your system is respectable, but X4 does a pretty good job at making the game look and feel good.  AND HERE'S WHAT I HATE: This is really why I cannot recommend this game. After all the hours I've invested in this game, I still find myself online Googling and watching videos to help me figure stuff out. I'm not just talking about the complex mechanics that are difficult to figure out, I'm also talking about game breaking bugs and poor AI that just make the game unplayable.  In regards to complex mechanics, the game does a really poor job at explaining how things work. And the UI does not do it any favors, so you'll spend a lot of time watching videos and reading to learn what menu you need to access and when in order to complete anything.  In regards to the game breaking bugs and poor AI, I finally, after many hours of playing, have enough fire power and knowledge to start boarding and capturing large ships. After spending hours reading, watching, learning, and earning money in-game, I finally have a wing that can stand up against the big ships. I find a ship, fly to it, and start shooting it to take it over. It's one class above my own, so it's going to take a long time to poke through the shields. I'm alright with that as I did my research and I know what I need to do to be successful. I also have a wing to help me get through the shields faster.  After I start poking the ship, I command my wing to start attacking it with me. And they .... do absolutely nothing. One of them flew directly into the enemy ship and got stuck, so I had to reload to a previous save before he blew himself up. I'm shooting the ship for about 20 minutes trying to get through the shields and keep pausing the game and interacting with my wing to figure out why they won't shoot. I do what I've done for every other issue in this game and I go online to see if I can figure it out. Come to find out, I'm not doing anything wrong.   The AI just sucks.   So I finally find a mod that supposedly fixes this. On one hand, it's great there's a way to enjoy this aspect of the game since the devs don't seem to care to fix it. On the other hand, why the heck won't they fix it? The sad part about these mods is you also have to have all the DLC and you bet I'm not going to throw more money at this game to use a mod to fix the game when it should just work to begin with.  ---  It pains me to have to not recommend this game. It's truly unique in this genre and really a gem. There's just not enough polish to the core gameplay mechanics and I see devs pushing out more DLC when the core game is still broken.

I don’t think that anyone would play Slender if it came out today. The craze of indie micro-budget chasing simulators has grown stale, the market too saturated for even quality titles to stand out. Despite my distaste for Slender‘s lack of gameplay and YouTube-bait scares, I can appreciate it for being a fun little title made by fans with more enthusiasm than game design experience.  It spawned a genre, but Slender‘s style lacks legs. You can debate about the respective spookiness of whichever specter or boogyman is chasing you through this week’s forest/abandoned park/haunted house. As far as gameplay goes, it’s not terribly hard to replicate “walk around and hunt for items while being spooked.” Improving on this formula is simple, as any interaction and/or variety is new.  Wick is Hellbent game’s most recent attempt to evolve the genre. Normally, I wouldn’t have interest in such a title. There are countless new Slender permutation every year, and I can’t go through them all for sake of my time and sanity. They tend to be games I play when I have absolutely nothing else to do, and fall to the farthest back burner on my to-do list.  Still, I’m nothing if not a hopeful, cheery gamer, and every once in awhile one of these titles catches my eye. For reason’s I can’t quite pinpoint, the Steam page for Wick proved such an occasion. Maybe it was the slightly more cartoonish art style? Hell, it’s likely that I was just overcome with holiday cheer/dead time boredom. Whatever the reasons may be, I decided to go into Wick without the usual cynicism I have for Slender-likes. Yes, the Slender clone is a tired genre, but I can’t exactly hold that over every similar title’s head forever, can I? At some point, shooters had to stop being considered all Doom clones.  Wick goes for a minimalist approach to direction. Dropping into the game, you play a nameless blindfolded teen being led to the area where you will play a game called “Wick”. It’s a permutation of the teenage game where friends go into the woods, leave a friend behind with only a single light source, and retrieve them in the morning. Presumably, spooks of some kind or another occur in the interim. I refer to this as a “plot device” game, since no person I know has ever felt the need to willingly get lost in the woods and fuck with ghosts. Maybe people were more desperate for entertainment before the invention of the computer.  Of course, just standing there and waiting for the morning would make for a boring game. Your only light source at the start is a set of matches, but candles spread throughout the forest serve as more lasting illumination. Light can be transferred from candle to candle, and distant candles can be seen as sparkling dots on the horizon. It isn’t terribly hard to keep yourself perpetually lit, so it serves more as a trail to keep you on track to interesting landmarks than a real restriction. Personally, I kind of like this. Resource management definitely has a place in horror, but the more narrative style of Wick lends itself well to this less stressful approach.  Running out of light is suitably dangerous and spooky, spawning all sorts of terrible noises and making you a target for the various fiends. That’s not to say that you are perfectly safe in the light. Certain triggers will cause more persistent enemies to spawn, which must be fled from to survive. As the night goes on, different enemies will pursue you, each with their visual style and method of assault. The variety it offers is refreshing, and while we don’t see anything truly revolutionary, it’s enough to require you to mix up your play style and learn through trial and error.  The meat of the game comes from discovering a large assortment of collectibles. Notes, documents, and items all serve to flesh out the game world through little snippets of story. The notes are generally drawings, and serve as hints/instructions while also building some spooky tension. Items are all suitably unsettling, and come with a little snippet of audio narration to further up the creepiness factor. The documents stand out as the most unique part of the package, and add a dual layer to the narrative. A series of police interviews with the group of friends that left you in the woods allude to the fact that something went wrong during tonight’s game of Wick. It reveals that there’s something special about your experience, and this isn’t just something that all the other kids have done and inexplicably got through just fine. It colors the events of the game in a more questionable light, and what you see might not be what actually is happening.  Alas, that’s all there is to talk about with Wick. It’s a scavenger hunt Slender clone with more variety and legs. Sure, it innovates, but all that can be said about the title is still doable in just a couple paragraphs. It’s an inherent weakness to the genre, and one that prevents me from really getting fully into it. Some visual bugs and awkward spawns will take you out of the experience. The jump scares are also a bit too frequent, with almost every turn or new location prompting some kind of screaming child or demonic arm to dart out. It’s too rapid-fire, which makes the roughness of the seams more glaring.  Still, none of the bugs ruined the experience for me. What is there is good, delivering scares in a unique environment. I had fun figuring out how to survive, and really enjoyed piecing the story together.  It’s the perfect example of an average game that I find enjoyable. This isn’t a big budget title pulled down into mediocrity by a clipped production cycle or inexplicable design choices. This is a small game that does a single thing pretty well. People that like this kind of thing will like Wick. If you absolutely adore Slender, you’ll find Wick to be a familiar experience with some innovations. It’s an indie game total worth checking out, I do recommend.

Backstory: Loved Resident Evil as a child, when I seen RE2 at a friends house when I was 12. I almost despised my Nintendo 64 immediately, with the realistic effects/sounds on PS1. (At leave for the time) No game was like this on N64!  (RE2 Came out WAY later on N64)  Present Time: Fast forward to this Remake controversay: This game caught a decent amount of back and forth between the community wanting tank controls. I wanted them as well. I wanted them because RE1 HD is phenomenal with atmospheric focus on locked angles in the rooms.. How could RE2 not be just as good?  Here we are, over the shoulder. And I don't have a single gripe about it. It works, it works very well. I LOVE it.  Pros: (Mind you Hardcore Difficulty) Your weapons are tools not toys. Ammo conservation, or knowing when to stun an enemy and run is the type of tension and Decision making that is Necessary for this game to live up to it's successor.  The games design is familiar, yet very fresh. I played on Hardcore mode as Leon, and my Health was in Danger 80% of the game with a sense of dread around every corner. I loved it! I had some incredible near death experiences with the Tyrant in the mansion, in pursuit while avoiding double licker leap attacks due to luck, a zombie or 2 catching a knife, just to jump off the broken roof ladder in time for the Tyrant to stare at me for 3 seconds with disappointment, before him proceeding to find another route tofind and kill me. I Wish I recorded that moment! These types of moments were so good, my wife had to leave the room as she was scared at the immersion and suspense of being Stalked by what she called "The Boogieman"  Graphics: Brilliant. (Took some setting adjustments here and there on my 1080 to get the frame rate I wanted without any dips, but thats ok) The zombies look sooo incredible, and the way they move, and take chunks out of you and corpses... just wow. Stunning work, Art/Animation Team! Physics: Quite good. Not perfect, the ragdoll still does some weird things sometimes but I've accepted that at this point across most games. The strange ragdolling isn't often.  For Example: such as lab coats having seizures on zombie bodies, hair doing weird things, and the occational clipping. Again, nothing to give a downvote on. The immersion kept you in the zone plenty of the time.  Content: Now, the game has Multiple playthroughs. 2nd Story (I have not tired, yet) and I have Claire to go through. I played this game on Hardcore. Boy was that fun! Limping in Danger 80% of the time, 3 bullets in the handgun, 1 knife almost broken, and 2 shotgun sells. NOW THAT IS SURVIVAL HORROR.  I played the game with the Nostalgic Original Sounds/Soundtrack. Man, that was wonderful!  Conclusion: Well, I can continue to fanboy over this game, but I won't any further.  It is a must buy, it is a fantastic remake. It shows Capcoms got what it takes.  Lets be patient, but Lets see a Resident Evil 3 through the streets of Racoon with this kind of Treatment!  Good Job CAPCOM!!!

Definitely enjoyed this installation of the series. It was fun and challenging trying to figure out the various ways to get away with murder (should you choose that path). I would have enjoyed a bit more depth in the main character's story but understand why it's a bit abrupt. There was a lot of characters in this game and all had very interesting backgrounds (some more than others). I am a big fan of games that allow for various endings, and this one offers it in a short, bittersweet way (as no ending is truly "good"). I loved the setting of the game and thought it was also well done (although, like the MC's background, there really isn't much to it).  Overall,  definitely recommend this to fans of the Deed series as well as to fans of games with multiple endings.

100 скрытых котов 2 - игра, где нам просто нужно найти на одном, вытянутом вниз чёрно-белом экране, 100 спрятанных котов и кошек. Для меня это уже тринадцатая часть "бесконечного" поиска. Помню в детстве я любил порешать в какой-то газете или журнале подобные вещи, мог залипнуть над лабиринтами, поиском 10 отличий между двумя одинаковыми картинками, разгадывать ребусы и прочее. По-началу глаза разбегаются, хочется выделить всех и сразу, но когда остаётся штук 15, уже начинаешь приглядываться более тщательно. А когда осталось пять, стал разглядывать буквально каждый пиксель. К рисовке претензий нет. Каждый найденный объект выделяется красным цветом, а внизу расположен ориентир, сколько всего осталось найти, если сбились со счёта. По сравнению с первой, вторая часть поиска котов не претерпела каких-то глобальных изменений, но и хуже от этого не стала. Понимаю, что далеко не все одобрят, но лично мне зашло, о проведённом здесь времени не пожалел.

A game made by Shinji Mikami and Suda. Two industry veterans. I was expecting to fall in love with this game in the first level but on the contrary I hated it. First of all it's an on rail shooter which I don't have a problem with that. I played great on rail shooters. Unfortunately this is not a great game. Actually this is not a game. It feels like an interactive snuff film. Gameplay is boring and controls are clunky. Trying to move your character, or aim, or reload feels like a nightmare. You have to shoot enemies' glowing parts to instantly kill them, this is the whole gameplay. It got boring after first level. Stupid puzzles that requires you to equip the correct ring and interact with the object. This is not what you call a puzzle. Terrible camera angles that is designed to test your patience. Classic Suda dialogue that doesn't make any sense in some parts and tries to be very weird. The best part is they ported this game to PC after years later but in game prompts are showing you controller buttons. So, get ready to spend an hour on the tutorial trying to figure out which button on the keyboard you are supposed to press. This is what you call a lazy port.

C'è stato un periodo, qualche anno fa, in cui il genere degli sparatutto in prima persona ha disperatamente cercato di ridarsi una dignità guardando al passato. Abbiamo così assistito all'insorgere di un'opposizione, rappresentata in prima istanza da Hard Reset, Serious Sam 3, Duke Nukem Forever, Shadow Warrior, Rise of Triad e altri titoli che, vuoi per reale vocazione, vuoi per opportunismo, si fregiavano orgogliosamente di ispirarsi alla vecchia scuola.   [h1]Abisso senza fine[/h1] Devil Daggers potrebbe apparire come un vile clone di DOOM, ma in realtà è molto, molto di più. Perché è sì un gioco che si rifà con una riverenza ai limiti del calligrafico al padre putativo del genere e altri classici limitrofi , ma è anche un gioco che non sarebbe stato possibile se non nel post-Super Meat Boy, Hotline Miami e volendo anche trip audiovisivi e sensoriali come Dyad. Perché nel gioco non c'è alcun livello da superare in vista del prossimo, su cui eventualmente tornare per migliorare il proprio punteggio, ma un'unica arena dove affrontare ondate di abomini di ogni genere, che sembrano usciti dall'incubo di una notte di mezza estate del '93 avuto da Adrian Carmack. Il destino è già scritto: alla fine avrà sempre lui la meglio. La differenza è quanto a lungo si dovrà farlo aspettare per avere la nostra pelle. Un successo la cui unità di misura è quella dei secondi, decimillesimi compresi, e che spesso, spessissimo non supererà ordini di grandezza a due cifre.   [h1]Semplicità sopraffina[/h1] Devil Daggers potrebbe apparire un semplicistico esercizio di sadismo da parte di alcuni hipster nostalgici, ma per quanto rimanga indubbiamente una delle esperienze più spietate e brutali si possano sperimentare mouse e tastiera alla mano è tutt'altro che un esempio di sperimentazione fine a sé stessa o un prodotto tirato via. Ci sono delle ragioni se come molti in giro per la Rete, tra i forum e le recensioni di Steam e, non ultimo, chi scrive, vi ritroverete a premere compulsivamente R per riprovarci a seguito di un tentativo di pochi secondi, ancora e ancora, salvo poi scoprire che ci state macinando sopra un quantitativo indecente di ore. Il sistema di controllo è di una precisione e di una reattività esemplari, prevedendo anche un set di movimenti avanzati implementati a regola d'arte. Il bello è che in realtà le gemme vengono attratte automaticamente dal giocatore, entro certe distanze, ma solo se non si sta sparando. Un perno piccolissimo, di una banalità sconcertante, ma che nel turbinio dell'azione finisce per assumere il valore di un fattore rischio/ricompensa davvero ficcante. Lo stesso audio è ricco di effetti meticolosamente studiati per aiutare a interpretare meglio cosa sta accadendo, se si pone la dovuta attenzione, permettendo di valutare al volo certe variabili che si pongono come base per quel nugolo di piccole ma determinanti scelte tattiche che influenzano in continuazione lo svolgimento della partita. Questi sono solo un paio esempi del livello di attenzione riposto in una formula in grado di arrivare a mettere in scena una delle rappresentazioni del caos più scioccanti di sempre in cui però nulla sembra essere stato lasciato al caso. Poco o nulla invece è spiegato, tant'è che meccaniche come queste vanno scoperte con l'esperienza e in molte community si è instaurato uno spirito solidale e collaborativo per certi versi simile a ciò che si vede per i Souls, aumentando l'appeal ermetico ed oscuro che ammanta l'intera produzione, già a partire dall'identità dei suoi autori, avvolta da un mistero che odora di zolfo.  Pro [list]     [*]Gameplay semplice ma estremamente rifinito     [*]Caratterizzazione retrò irresistibile      [*]Spietato ma assuefacente [/list]  Contro [list]     [*]Assuefacente ma spietato [/list]  Voto finale: 8,8/10

game: 太吾绘卷 The Scroll Of Taiwu
review: 首先这是个还在开发并且完成度不高的游戏，界面简陋，音乐略单调，可以保持期待但是别对现在要求太高，盲目跟风很难确定游戏是否能对你胃口，所以跟风的还是等游戏正式版好一些。 现在游戏机制并不完善，而且对新手不友好，没有一个合适的新手引导，新人很容易蒙圈玩不懂，另外开始阶段很难，需要慢慢去研究或者看前人的攻略，还需要良好的心态和耐心，才能享受这个游戏，不然会各种抓狂烦躁玩不下去。但是耐心玩下去可能就会享受到游戏的乐趣，经营，策略等等。 不过玩不下去也不要紧，这个游戏也叫太吾故事会，去论坛贴吧nga看一圈游戏杂文，你就会开心起来。

[h1]«Briquid»[/h1] [b]Головоломка с физикой. Переливаем воду, используя блоки и изменение гравитации.[/b] Геймплей (30 первых уровней из 100): https://youtu.be/dHtOmYZ4PPk  Наша задача – меняя гравитацию, уничтожая и строя кирпичные блоки, заполнить водой определенные области экрана. Для этого нам дают некоторое количество ходов. Они тратятся на любое действие, но их можно отменять. Это очень удобно. Во многих головоломках дают отменять только последний ход, а тут можно перемотать партию до самого начала.  [code]Обратите внимание на то, что в «Briquid» [u]физика воды не совсем реальная[/u]! Вода не переливается в полости, если сбоку стоит блок, хотя в реальности должна заполнять все пространство. Кроме этого, падая, вода разбрызгивается. Надо понаблюдать за переливанием воды в игре и понять механику, чтобы решить многие головоломки. Если будете ориентироваться на реальную физику, то не сможете пройти часть уровней![/code]  В игре 100 разнообразных уровней разной сложности. На каждом свои условия. Например, на некоторых не дают использовать гравитацию, на поле присутствуют области, в которых нельзя строить блоки или появляются различные препятствия, которые невозможно убрать.  [code]Отличная головоломка. Рекомендую в коллекцию. В поисках оптимального решения игру можно проходить снова и снова, чтобы побить рекорд на минимальное количество ходов + есть редактор с поддержкой мастерской. Вы можете создавать свои уровни и загружать их в Стим или выбрать и пройти уровни, созданные другими игроками.[/code]  [i] Обзор был написан для группы [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Obzzor4ik]Обзоры Онлайн[/url]. Почитать другие отзывы можете[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28776273/] тут[/url].[/i]

La mezcla entre un juego de gestión y un "tower defense" era algo que valía la pena probar, pero sinceramente no es ni lo uno ni lo otro. juegue los 3 primeros capítulos de la campaña (de un total de 5) y solo pude pasar la primera batalla en modo manual, todas las demás las tuve que poner en automático para poder ganar, incluso con ventajas ofensivas de más del 70% perdí en modo manual.  En los 2 primeros capítulos de la campaña no hay prácticamente nada para poner en el tablero. lo recursos solo te alcanzan para 3 o 4 torres y apenas mejorarlas, el resto se lo lleva todo la reparación. Creo que el balance de esas batallas es pésimo y finalmente no quedan muchas más opciones que ponerlo en automático para poder continuar. La parte de gestión no está mal, pero no destaca en nada, los eventos son pocos, repetitivos y no hay mucho para hacer con ellos. Algo que destaco es el humor. realmente me reí mucho jugando y aunque con el pasar de las horas se vuelve predecible, no dejo de ser gracioso.

最后两个结局，结局一极其敷衍，演戏很假，家长反应假，教官，校长的反应甚至记者的反应全都不符合常理，最后成为反思大会，一瞬间大家都明事理了，最后的结尾像是换了个初中学历的编剧一样，前面你有多入戏，最后的结尾就会多么恶心人，极度的敷衍，如果说中间还能有一些共鸣，那最后一点都没有了，特别的恶心人，更像是骗玩家的钱顺着玩家的意来编出来的结尾，毫无共鸣的感觉，只有被恶心到的感觉，让我感觉之前的投入时间和情感很可笑。

Global Offensive is definitely a Counter-Strike sequel -- it looks and feels familiar, with minor tweaks here and there to help balance old issues and surprise longtime players. This is a demanding, skill-based multiplayer game that's as satisfying now as it ever was, but it's for a specific kind of player. If you're not willing to learn to play different than you're used to, look elsewhere. Otherwise, this is a top-tier tactics game that will probably share the long-tailed legacy of its predecessors.

Por cincuenta minutos y despues de completar las 6 primeras misiones (No quise continuar al ultimo por apuros del dia).   No presente ningun error, ni bug que me arruinara el juego (excepto en el Nivel 5).   Tampoco dificultades para los controles.  Ya que, use solo el teclado.  Lo que SI, he presenciado, son cosas como:   Una rara caida de fps, Pasando de los 60 a los 15, en determinados momentos.   Aun teniendo 16 de ram y una GTX750 TI.  Los marcos y la resolucion. Siendo injustamente incomodos.  En el quinto Nivel, cuando usamos el paracaidas de manera constante (spoiler, perdon) para descender cuidadosamente.   La camara, no se ha movido, como se deberia, y por ende, me terminaba muriendo, y no avanzando de pantalla. Aun estando nivelado por el paracaidas mismo.  Como si fuese un bug de pantalla, como en los clasicos Nes.    7/10 - Un Port mediocre, pero NO injugable. Algo disfrutable (personalmente)

[h1]Отличная песочница на космическую тематику.[/h1]  [b]Плюсы:[/b] + Прекрасно сбалансированный геймплей - еще не симулятор, но уже и не казуальная леталка.  + Огромное количество модификаций различного содержания - будь то части или новые\альтернативные элементы GUI или же модификации влияющие на игровую физику - найдется все. Многие моды добавляют в игру столько интересных вещей, что порой жалко что разработчики сами до сих пор не включили этот функционал в игру.  + Игра, насколько могу судить, активно разрабатывается и дополняется новым контентом.  [b]Минусы:[/b] - Отсутствие поддержки Steam Workshop, очень неудобно каждый раз искать обновления для модов, соответствующие версии игры.  Не жалею о потраченных деньгах ни разу, игра способна подарить немало приятных впечатлений, надеюсь что работа над ней продолжится и все не заглохнет на стадии бета-версии.

我当初买的时候 只是为了享受暴力的开放世界 但没想到正是这暴力的游戏给我带来了平静 每次我刚玩线上模式开始屠杀其他玩家时 我就立刻被强制退出战局 变成了洛圣都上空的一朵白云 我此时能眺望整个洛圣都了 哦天哪 我从未见过如此美丽的城市！ 我的身后是飘打下来的雨滴 它们纷纷往洛圣都落下 只为了能在地面上溅起它们破碎的身子 在我欣赏洛圣都雨景时 雨神不知何时收敛了调皮的把戏 我身后的乌云驱散了 阳光从熙熙攘攘的云层中投射  洛圣都大楼的影子互相交错 车的灯光在街道上流动  过了不久 夕阳落幕 皓月当空 洛圣都此时此刻如待嫁般的少女那样文静 但内心却火热得跃跃欲试  我开始深深自责——为何我要令这个美丽城市变得污秽！ 无论我什么时候登陆线上模式 R星都会让我漂浮在苍穹间 它似乎在保护我 保护一颗封闭了多年并且破碎的心不再堕落 我破天荒地没有在家长的叱责下离开电脑 而是自己从电脑椅上站起 走到父母面前： “爸 妈 能带我去郊外玩玩吗？” 我父母的神情由漠然、失望转变为惊喜 他们满怀欣喜地看着我  因为两耳不闻窗外事的我 居然主动要离开这个虚拟世界 去接受大自然！ 感谢R星 让我不再颓废

По рейтингу игры можно подумать, что игра представляет из себя бессмертный шедевр. Но это далеко не так, поэтому я пишу отрицательный отзыв, несмотря на то, что получил от игры некоторые положительные эмоции.  Игра представляет собой необычный сплав карточной игры с боёвками от третьего лица. Изначально игра меня очаровала этим сочетанием и шикарным оформлением игрового стола с таинственной фигурой Сдающего. Я с удовольствием считал встревающиеся карты и планировал колоды для новых приключений. Однако, чем больше я разбирался в игровых механиках тем меньше оставалось энтузиазма. Оказалось, что значительная часть заложенных в игру идей просто не работает.   Перед каждой партией вы собираете колоды событий и предметов, которые определяют, что встретится вам на пути в очередом приключении. Проблема в том, что большая часть карт слишком похожи, а их появление в игре и эффект - слишом случайны. В итоге нельзя создать колоду, которая будет реализовывать продуманную страгию. В любом случае вы получаете набор случайных событий, зависящих не от вашего планирования, а от случанойсти. Причем большая часть событий будет повторяться из партии в партию и к концу игры основательно вам наскучит.  По ходу партии вы снаряжаете своего персонажа магическими  предметами и благословениями, дающими различные эффекты. Теоретически, это позволяет усилить персонажа и заточить его под бой с очередным боссом. На практике, большая часть эффектов незначительна, а любого босса можно без особых проблем вынести со стартовым набором снаряжения.   Боевка довольно скучная, очередная "перекувыркать смерть". Все бои происходят на компактных аренах. Доступных действий в бою очень немного. К концу игры все схватки за исключением схваток с боссами, вызывают зевоту.  Резюме. Прекрасная идея налетела на посредственную реализацию.  Игра любопытная, но не доведённая до ума. Купить её стоит, но на распродаже и без DLC.

[h1]Written after having played the entirety of the game[/h1]  We all have that moment, where if we could go back in time and change it we would.  This is the whole concept behind the game called "Life is strange". You step into the shoes of Maxine "Max" Caulfield. An 18 year old girl and aspiring photographer about to enroll into blackwell academy, a school specialized in science and art. While there she discovers her ability to bend time and change what has happened; and Max has things she wants to be undone, just like the rest of us.  You'll be going through a vast series of events, you'll be given choices upon choices along with opportunities to change them when you see the outcome of your actions. You will constantly question whether you made "the right decision" or not.   Life is strange isn't quite like any other game I've played. It's a really engrossing story, something that can; and most likely will; keep you glued to your screen for longer than you were planning. The artwork is somewhere in between cartoon and realistic animation, it's not either one entirely but that doesn't matter one bit. It's beautiful in its own way and you can tell they put a lot of effort into it, so looking past the sometimes 'clunky' and roughewed faces, hands, and unsynched lip movements isn't very hard.   On top of that the choice of music fits the game very well, adapting to the different moods of the storyline without interruping dialogs, sometimes making you want to just sit back to relax and listen. Along with this you have a diary in which you can keep track of the events you've been through. Read up on characters you've met, and keep track of photos you've taken (and those you haven't). You'll see how the diary changes depending on what you find out while at blackwell, which for me places this game somewhere between being an rpg, a visual novel, and a "traditional" adventure game.  I can't guarantee that you'll love this game, all I can say is that I do. I don't regret buying it and I'm genuinly glad to have played it.   Life is strange is different, but in a good way.

O jogo apresenta uma jogabilidade envolvente, com uma história intrigante e desafios complexos de hacking, tudo isso combinado com uma trilha sonora eletrônica cativante.  Uma das coisas que tornam o Hacknet uma experiência positiva é sua interface intuitiva e realista. O jogo simula o uso de um terminal de linha de comando, com comandos e ferramentas de hacking que parecem autênticos. Isso ajuda a mergulhar os jogadores na experiência de se tornar um hacker, e pode ser uma ótima oportunidade para aprender mais sobre segurança da informação e programação.  Outro ponto forte do Hacknet é sua narrativa envolvente. A história do jogo é apresentada por meio de mensagens de e-mail, arquivos de texto e conversas com outros hackers virtuais, criando uma atmosfera de mistério e intriga que mantém o jogador envolvido do início ao fim. A história também é bem escrita e apresenta reviravoltas inesperadas, tornando a experiência emocionante e imprevisível.  Por fim, a trilha sonora eletrônica do jogo é uma verdadeira obra de arte. As músicas de Hacknet são intensas, cativantes e combinam perfeitamente com o tema de hacking do jogo, criando uma atmosfera de tensão e mistério.  Em resumo, Hacknet é um jogo eletrônico excelente, com uma jogabilidade envolvente, uma história intrigante e uma trilha sonora eletrônica incrível. É uma ótima escolha para jogadores que gostam de jogos de estratégia e que buscam uma experiência imersiva e autêntica de hacking.

Listen. This game back in Early Access HAD potential. I came back to it with friends a few weeks ago to give it whril since they noticed it was fully released. If you can get this game for free, then grab it. If not, don't waste your time.   -Its glitchy as hell meaning that one key you need? yeah its under a sofa in a locked room that unlocks that door anyways. -If you pick "random map" selection you play the same 3 maps. If you leave that lobby and join another who has it set to random, again, same 3 maps right away. -Lobbies are pretty much non existent. there's always like 3, and if theres more they are all private for friends. -The "ghosts" or whatever they are called are kinda lame. The scare factor is 0. -If you have Insanity turned on, Garry's Mod looking heads flash on the screen.  All in all it's just, bad. Again, it HAD potential to be a great game but fails to deliver.

----------2019 年 9 月 1 日 如果您以前没有玩过任何一部《家园》。 那么请您先回忆一下自己在电影、电视中见到过的各种各样的太空大战。 再将这些元素糅合成一部即时战略游戏。 那大概就是《家园》的样貌了。 还比较小的时候就听说过家园这个系列，当初还是在贴吧的签名图里看到一些凤毛麟角，听说是即时战略(RTS)，但我分明能从那些动态的GIF中看到，战斗机实实在在是在“乱飞”，没有固定在一个平面。而且还确确实实能确定，是游戏的时候就能做到，不是动画，也不是即时演算。 而等到我拥有了自己的电脑，安装上家园2，通了一次战役。在这段时间，了解到家园拥有的众多mod。曾经安装过高达的星尘回忆录，不过遗憾当时该mod没有电脑AI，只能开高达打维格尔或者希格拉；再之后是seed，强袭自由秒天秒地秒空气；然后是FX，虽然玩的时候也有很多部分没有完成，不过该mod给我最大的印象不仅仅是增加了阵营，如萨尤克、泰坦等等，还可以在游戏菜单中打开一个资料页，其中记录了家园系列的“游戏内历史”，各种单位的介绍，原画设定，可以说十分良心，依靠这个mod，我也就对游戏有了更深入的了解。 而这次家园重制版的提升，相比当初的家园2已经有特别大的改进，譬如画质方面，战斗UI，场面特效等等。所以抱着当初的情怀，我补上了正版的票。 但RTS游戏逐渐没落的如今，再加上家园本身的冷门，大概不会再有3了吧。 总而言之，如果说哪一个即时战略游戏给我最强的震撼感的话，那便是家园 ----------2021 年 12 月 11 日 家园3竟然出了，有生之年加油冲冲冲！

Fun, funny, and lovingly crafted brick by brick, this game is a must have for anyone looking for a casual Lego gaming experience. Deceptively simple at first glance, the beautiful modular worlds you explore are filled with secrets and surprises, and while tiny, much care has been put into both the presentation (which is expert-level MOC-type building) and design to utilize every brick in sight. I went into this expecting an experience and difficulty akin to the early Lego Star Wars games and was pleasantly surprised. Early puzzles will be familiar to most, but later ones up the challenge considerably by limiting brick selection and placement, and while your first collectibles are right out in the open, by the last few you'll be in full on Lego rage mode, spinning the world this way and that screaming "How do I get to the bunny rabbit!"  This doesn't even get to the remarkably robust building system that works about as well as one could hope to. Each puzzle has you building something from a parts list, sometimes with loose bricks and sometimes with prebuilt modules, or a combination of both. Challenges are well-crafted and have what feels like a pretty robust physics system, and while some seem to really only have a narrow band of solutions, you do get the impression most of the that your solution is perhaps the only one in existence to be built exactly the way you did it. Once completed, you get the satisfaction of seeing and using your creation as you explore the level for the duration of the game, and it makes the backtracking that could be tedious in another game into a satisfying experience. You also unlock Sandbox mode, which gives you unlimited bricks from your in-game collection as well as unlimited bricks specific to the challenge. Sometimes it's hard to place pieces, but eventually you'll get the hang of it and by the end of the game you'll be returning to your early creations with new bricks, new colours and new ideas to make great creations even better.   As a parent I also love that this game takes a constructive approach (literally) to problem solving. I love gaming with my five-year-old, but it's hard to find games that are fun to play as an adult but don't involve shooting or fighting things. Outside of zapping some rumba-loving robots into another dimension, problems are solved through creativity, communication, kindness, and classic Lego humor. My kid was always excited to see who we'd help next, and liked helping design things in Sandbox mode. (Every world's unlockable brickset includes animals, and we used them EVERYWHERE. So many snakes and spiders.)  Overall, great game, get it for a main adventure, get it for the kids, get it for the occasional hour of chill time, get it because you're tired of slogging through a nightmarish onslaught of relentless foes in a bleak and uncaring world filled with meaningless radiant fetch quests, Everyone will love it from age 4-99.

Hollow Knight. The best game I've ever played.  The first game on my Steam account, after a search for "[i]the best indie action platformer game[/i]".  Played for the 1st time during confinement, dozens of hours on it, and a promise: [b]Finish all the game's endings, all the achievements, and only then will I review this masterpiece[/b].  And here we are, after hundreds of hours, and a victory over the Pantheon of Hallownest, I'm finally complete.  Thank you Team Cherry, for putting quality and high standards at the heart of your game.   At last, I can wait patiently for Silksong in peace now.

雷服7000场玩家路过，只能说蒸汽平台亚服环境是在是太棒辣，有歪果仁菜的要死，打到七 八级依旧不会走位摆角度，就算会说英语还是无法沟通交流，血压嘎嘎就上去辣，有歪果仁强的要命，压一棵树就三发炮弹飞过来辣，玩个stb被打了6发头包，服务器之子是伐，要不是390代理的国服连狗屎都算不上我是不会来碰蒸汽这第二坨狗屎的，现在坦克世界都不能叫坦克世界了，改名叫金币弹世界和卖头世界吧，BZ-176这么穿模不放在9级金币放在8级金币，7 8级银币车练车环境堪忧，收益和隔壁战雷有的一比了，只不过战雷的吃相比你难看罢了，那2S38和BMP2M加72AV简直阜南专用开线队列，不说了，吃降压药去了。建议玩这游戏的多备降压药，魔法服务器怎么滴都要恶心你的，没玩的千万别来玩了，有这个时间多看点书建设祖国才是王道。最后说一句，白毛子的马一直和bvvd的马在银河系之外，希望得到坦克世界蚊子腿的玩家千万不要感恩戴德，到时候服务器魔法你你就会有杀人的心的，你不氪，我不氪，明天这游戏就倒闭了（bushi）

1代题材特别新颖，玩的爽。2代的人设超棒（主要是柏枝和七海），玩的也不错。V3除了结局以外，没有给我一种惊艳的感觉（最后是吓傻了，全程张着嘴玩完的），5个案子下来，印象比较深的就是第4个案子，可能或者是因为这类游戏玩太多，审美疲劳了。  又到了我最喜欢的评价人设的环节：   部分涉及剧透。   赤松：呜呜呜，女主性格好好，我也想和你一起弹钢琴。 中医：3代里最不喜欢的主角，没有苗木萌，没有创哥猛，看着就是个撸多了的肾虚青年，你也配当主角？ 百田：刘海不错，但这种热血青年的人设，好烦啊。 春川：一开始给我一种1代那个谁，（百度中），雾切，对，的感觉，感觉两人的性格也差不多，就是智商好像差了一点点，动不动就是生死看淡不服就干。这么一说本作全程都是主角一人carry啊，惨。 权太：这种莫名其妙的角色不懂为什么要做出来，很讨厌。 王马：我总感觉这个人物的设计挺奇怪的，从头到尾都不懂他到底在想什么，这样的人设可能很契合游戏主题，但是总感觉不是很饱满。也可能是我理解能力不行。 龙马：和一代Leon，二代那个厨师一样，超高校级的推进剧本工具人。 斩美：很喜欢的一个角色，声音超好听啊。这种全能的角色为什么不能做配角呢，嗯。。。。 秘密子：三年起步，不聊。技能很强。 机望：超高校级的工具人。案发现场没灯，你说你的眼睛可以照明；找不到决定性证据，你拍了照。被人类歧视却不敢反驳，只因为自己是机器人的身份。最后还为了大家，自爆把学校拆了，到了结尾都没人缅怀一下他。太惨了，3代里最惨人物，惨哥。我觉得小高就是故意安排一个这种角色，以便于写剧本。你们考虑过机望的感受吗！！！ 入间：女司机。我前期还一直怀疑她和江之岛有关，因为学籍裁判的时候的立绘太像江之岛了。没想到。不过这一代的黄段子太那啥了，都不能说是黄段子了，明明就是耍流氓，不太喜欢。 天海：第一眼见到他就觉得，这应该是男二吧。啪！疼。 安琪：混乱善良。一开始觉得她好烦，神神叨叨的。后来死了以后真的觉得她只是想帮助人啊，对不起，安琪小天使。呜呜呜。 转子：本以为这种性格和一代朝日奈，二代终里差不多，应该能活到最后，没想到。 白银：最没有存在感的人物，不懂说啥。 真宫寺：我觉得这人好恶心，那段描述动机的剧情都都跳过了。居然杀了小天使呜呜呜，该死。  总的来说，这代的人物设计，真的没啥亮点，一代雾切、十神，二代七海、泊枝，都是促使我玩下去的动力。但这一代没有喜欢的角色感觉就很不爽，不过看了结局也觉得还是挺合理的吧，没有被喂屎感觉。果然二代是不能超越的。  哦对了，小高你再飞一会儿吧。

ol是赠品！ol是赠品！ol是赠品！  ========================== + 有趣的单机剧情，人物生动，印象深刻，任务有意思，配音满分 + 开放世界自由度高，还能线上和好友一起游玩，玩越野，游艇趴，看风景 + 神优化，画面极好，4年前的游戏放在现在一点都不差  - OL模式连接有点慢（起码可以裸连，一旦连上就很顺畅），偶尔遇见外挂 ==========================  GTA5的单机绝对好玩，任务每样都不重复，有枪战、有追逐、有送货、有暗杀、有角逐、有跳伞、有开车、有跟踪、有潜水、有跑步、有瑜伽、有捉奸、有限时战、有啪啪啪。。。  大概很多人都被一开始的直播平台玩毒图影响了，单机剧情很棒，联机一起做任务也很棒，而不是玩那些狗屁毒图。 我有朋友过了序章就玩OL模式了？心疼。  GTA5，4年一直出现在销售榜、在线人数榜上，（偶尔出现几个妖作，但GTA5很快又回到榜上），直到现在，制作组还在更新内容。（2017年12月7日更新《末日抢劫》新任务、新载具、新模式）  2017圣诞史上最低价75元，还不赶紧买买买？  （如果不是天朝禁播GTA5，真没有吃鸡什么事情。GTA5也有大逃杀模式，地图、武器、载具比吃鸡强几倍吧）

This is the perfect game if you are a fan of the old classic Azure dreams.  Even though this is an rpg maker made game, there is quite a bit to do with an amazing sound track!  You can build your town, have romantic interests, explore a large dungeon with difficult monsters, and then show your wealth by upgrading your home.  There still seems to be a few bugs, as anticipated, but I haven't seen anything game breaking yet.  The storyline will give you 20+ hours of gameplay, and can go far beyond that if you are a perfectionist.  Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

Un muy buen juego de supervivencia que en solitario ya es una experiencia muy disfrutable y rejugable, pero que entre amigos se llega a disfrutar más con tanta variedad de personajes y un sin fin de estrategias. Un juego que no deja de sorprenderme, con mucha investigación y mucha prueba y error acabando con una recompensa bastante placentera que es el saber como avanzar y aguantar más días, cuya experiencia se hace más amena y divertida si lo disfrutas con amigos, y eso los compañeros de Klei lo saben, por eso, si adquieres una copia de este juego desde Steam te regalan una que se te guardara en el inventario de tu perfil de Steam para poder regalárselo a un amigo tuyo, un pequeño detalle que se aprecia mogollón. Totalmente recomiendo este juego si buscas una aventura desafiante con tus amigos y queréis algo diferente. <3

Likes: - Constant service and updates given to the game, including massive game modes that take the game to entirely new directions. - A massive array of warframes, weapons, enemies, and environments. - Extremely in-depth weapon mechanics and effects. - Rich story and lore that keep players engaged. - The gunplay is extremely satisfying for many weapons. - The community is very friendly and incidents of toxicity are rare.  Dislikes: - The grind may cause burnout over the (very) long run, especially for players who want to get everything. - No in-game market or auction house means players will have to complete trades manually using third-party websites. - Occasional connectivity issues - though they are not as bad as publicised.

[h1]Roguelike …..de bolas y clavijas?  SI. [/h1]  [i]Adictivo y tranquilo, relajante y estratégico, algunas de las palabras que definen este entretenido juego. [/i] [hr][/hr]  [b]Jugabilidad: [/b] deberemos lanzar desde arriba unas esferas con diferentes efectos para impactar en las clavijas del escenario y acumular daño para lanzarle a los enemigos y derrotarlos. A medida que avanzamos en el juego nos topamos con diferentes eventos que nos darán nuevos objetos con pasivas y esferas para ir formando una estrategia y así ganarles a los jefes.  [b]Gráficos: [/b] cuenta con agradables gráficos dibujados.  [b]La variedad y los enemigos: [/b] Lamentablemente este juego cuenta con solo 3 niveles y 6 jefes en total, lo cual hace que el juego sea bastante corto. Además, no hay tanta variedad de enemigos, esferas u objetos diferentes.  [hr][/hr] [i]Creo que es justo por la cantidad de plata que vale y da unas buenas horas de diversión.  Hay que tener en cuenta que al día de la fecha se encuentra aun en early access por lo que se espera que el juego aun se desarrolle mas.[/i]

- General quality-of-life is a massive downgrade from MW19 - Buggy, stutter-riddled (even on a high-end PC) and restrictive UI that somehow manages to be both generic AND confusing - Myself and friends have all had numerous completely random crashes - Keybinds are reset to default every time the game closes, AND each mode has its own set of keybinds...  - Can't save private match game mode settings - After every private match you get kicked back to the main menu, forcing you to literally start from square one - Campaign is fun overall but has many sequences that feel artificially difficult and/or needlessly tedious - Progression system is an interesting idea but ultimately far too complex for its own good - No way to customize scope/optic reticle in any capacity, further limiting your choices - No way to use custom loadouts in co-op - Only 3 missions in co-op, out of which only ONE provides a decent variety of curated weapons - Matchmaking that almost always feels rigged by design, whether you win or lose - All these issues and more in a $70 game that expects you to buy battle passes and skins too  At its best, this game is genuinely good fun. The moment-to-moment gameplay is rock solid, and props to everyone who contributed to those aspects of the game! But unfortunately, it rarely shines as it should, and often gets in its own way. I'd say to wait for a sale, but let's be real, this is going to be $70 until 2050.

> METRO EXODUS <  One of the best narrative story driven shooters I've ever played. The story really makes you feel a part of Artyom's family. Over the course of the series you bond with Artyom's mates in a way that feels closer than family. You care about everyone's well being and you want to play through the story to make sure everyone remains safe. Not only that, but the development of each and every individual character is wonderful. There's a lot of depth to them and you hear it in random conversations when you stumble upon them or smoke with them on the train ride. Hearing every word that everyone has to say any time really does mean a lot. The Soundtrack. I can not justify verbally how incredible the soundtrack is for this game. The emotion, the feeling, the atmosphere, the intensity is something that sounds like it was composed by a supernatural deity who knew music better than any human composer. The soundtrack perfectly harmonizes with the atmosphere of the game and setting that you find yourself in. The story is incredibly immersive as you encounter real problems you would expect to see in a post nuclear wasteland for example radiation, drought, and lack of supplies. The PC version of Metro Exodus is a genuine game-changer for graphics technology - a vision of the way in which developers can take real-time rendering to the next level.   > THE TWO COLONELS <  So heart touching… A Masterpiece !!! cried so many times at the end..... two stories, two different times, through metro they bend together and it will twist your emotion so hard...a must buy DLC to complete Metro Exodus main story line, a perfect classic Metro experience. Around 2 hours at it was all over. Game lean heavily into the horror aspect of the survival horror experience found in the Metro series. The excellent sound design and clever gameplay balance choices made with the inclusion of the flamethrower create some genuinely tense sections. Your flashlight is removed, instead replaced by the flickering yellow flame of your weapons pilot light. The reduced visibility and arsenal, coupled with the slower aiming and reload times force a more cautious pace. Hats off to the writer of The Two Colonels DLC.  > SAM'S STORY <  The final DLC for Metro Exodus brings players a brand new open-world level to explore, filled with intense gameplay opportunities and stories to tell. a next level experience, it's 10 times scarier than Metro Exodus. The character of Sam is a lot more upbeat and feisty than the perpetually silent Artyom, so following him as the leading man of the story proves to be a much more engaging experience. Some of his lightheartedness occasionally feels like the situations call for it, while a few story developments feel somewhat rushed, but by and large, this DLC tells a solid narrative.Beyond narrative strengths, Vladivostok impresses in other areas as well. For starters, it is perhaps the single most visually impressive location I’ve ever seen in a Metro game. The city is half sunken and fallen into ruins, with water flooding the streets and seeping into the buildings, while an overgrowth of plants on structures and roads and layers of moss in the water give sections of the city a bright, green aesthetic. Design-wise, too, Vladivostok feels fresh and exciting. Traversing through the city in a boat and finding new areas to explore or points of interest to check out is constantly engaging. The unique properties of the environment also pave the way for some excellent encounters, like wading through waist-deep waters in the corridors of a dark and half-sunken building, while underwater enemies camouflage themselves in the moss and suddenly jump out at you. The trademark tight, claustrophobic corridors of Metro feel even more oppressive in Sam’s Story. A great mix of linear and open-ended missions.

review: 游戏总体来说还是不错的，无论是创意还是细腻度，都是值得一玩的游戏。当然，制作组也无愧一个新人的称号，很多缺陷也是显而易见却又迟迟不肯改的。例如枯燥无味又不停重复的后期，更要命的是竟然也不给个加速功能，对于一些毫无意义的显而易见的十分明确的能取胜的战斗也不能加速或者跳过。而制作组就是不改，也不给出解决办法。不愧是新人制作组，有着自己的倔强。

If you are looking for achievements then sure this game can give you many but it is a dull grind to do so. Otherwise, if you are looking for a fun engaging puzzle game then this is not it. After the first few levels you have seen it all. Most puzzle games in my experience give you a good handful of levels to understand the basic premise and then slowly add in new mechanics, this game does not do that. So if you are okay with 100 levels of the same repetitive puzzles then sure get this and the others. Lets hope you did not do what I did and buy all three without trying one first, but that is on me.

Gra z Myszką Miki w roli głównej. Minnie porwana, trzeba ratować, blablabla. Oczywiście wszystko jest piękne i na koniec musi być gruby happy end. Ale najpierw trzeba się do niego dostać. I jest to banalne - gra na parę godzin, wyzwania prawie nie ma, jedynie niektórzy bossowie mogą na chwilę zatrzymać. Biegamy, czasem rzucamy - nic ponadto, podstawa. Ciekawiej jest, jak się chce zebrać wszystkie znajdźki, bo niektóre są ukryte bardzo perfidnie i zdobycie wszystkiego już nie jest tak proste jak reszta, więc nie zdążymy się znudzić. Nawet na 100% przejście to mniej niż 4 godziny.  Są też, niestety, wady. Najbardziej przeszkadza mi budowa części poziomów pod kątem zbieractwa. Często ścieżka jest za nami blokowana i jeśli coś się pominie, trzeba powtarzać całość, bo nie ma opcji cofnięcia się. A zdobycie przedmiotów zaliczane jest dopiero po przejściu planszy, nie można sobie wyjść w połowie. Inna sprawa - kolizje są momentami dziwne i miałem wrażenie, że czasem spadam z platform lub do nich nie dolatuję, mimo że powinienem spokojnie na nich stać. Ale to drobnostki.

Fél órányi hiperaktív agysejt holokauszt. Igazi WTF?! Egyszerűen nincsenek szavak erre az alkotásra... Annyira iszonyúan pusztító mocsok, hogy néhány olyan országban, ahol még van halálbüntetés, ezt megnézetik az elítéltekkel, akik a végére a halált megváltásként fogadják. Azért pár dolgot felsorolok a teljesség igénye nélkül: lézerraptor, farkasháton lovagló minigunos viking hölgy, Thor, gyilkos játékautomata, időhackelés, nácik, Triceracop, Kung Führer és a végére hagytam a legjobbat The Hoff 9000. Igen, jól gondolod, az a bizonyos Hoff. A HOFF! És innentől kezdve már nem is merem nem ajánlani. Ja és ráadásul ingyen van. Mehetsz azt nézheted. De ha mindenáron fizetni akarsz érte, akkor keress meg engem és majd én megadom neked a számlaszámot, ahová utalhatod a pénzed.

Die Feldschlachten sind okay, was gar nicht geht sind Belagerungsschlachten, hier haben die Entwickler vieles vereinfacht. Sprich, jede Einheit der Belagerer verfügt automatisch über Leitern, was Mauern ziemlich überflüssig macht. Ebenfalls stört, dass jeweils nur einen Ausschnitt der Siedlung verteidigt werden kann. Wieso wurde nicht wie bei Medieval 2 eine ganze Stadt eingefügt? Die Garnisonen der Städte sind ein schlechter Witz und helfen nicht wirklich bei der Verteidigung, zb. können viele Einheiten gar nicht auf die Mauern steigen, da es sich um Monster oder Kavallerie handelt. Was diese bei einer Belagerung verloren haben ist schleierhaft. Leider wurde auch bei der Kampagnenkarte zu viel weggekürzt. Nimmt man eine Siedlung ein, wird der Gebäudeskin nicht mehr abgeändert, sehr schade. In Nebensiedlungen lassen sich neben dem Hauptgebäude nur 3 weitere Slots füllen, viel zu wenig. Auch die Hauptsiedlungen glänzen nicht mit vielen Slots. Wiese die Entwickler schon vor ein paar Jahren vom bewährten Modus von Medieval 2 abgewichen sind steht in den Sternen.

This game is very fun, and based off teamwork and coordination. The lag in this game is non existant because of the smooth servers. The hitboxes are very accurate and the maps are all different and show a variety of close quarters, mid range, and long distance engagements. The 3 gun classes are very balanced and I like what they did with it. Though this game may seem pay to win with it's RL money shop system offering super strong weapons, in the long run, teamwork prevails and theres is a lot of unique emphasis on building things with your blocks to accomplish certain aspects. the community for the most part is filled with nice people who are striving to have fun and get better in the game, making the game that much more easy to approach and enjoyable. Overall this game is thoroughly enjoyable and at least worth a donwload. Thank you for reading my review!

This game is amazing! It might only last you for ~20 hours but you leave satisfied. It is extremely story rich and its full of feels. I love how Toby knew what the players were going to do and how even though you delete your progress it leaves behing traces of your of your old file. I love all the characters and they each have unique and real personalities ranging from weaboos to over protective moms. My favorite part is that there are multiple paths for you too pick, will you be a pacifist and never harm anything? or will you be a muderer that comences a mass genocide? I recomend this game to anyone and everyone who has steam. Its worth the price, a great buy, and it leaves you very satisfied.

Tenía pensado jugar GRIS desde el momento en que salió a la venta. Sin embargo colgué con otros juegos, y la vida misma, y pude jugarlo recién, habiendo olvidado todos los trailers y reseñas que me la habían recomendado. Y debo decir que me llevé una enorme sorpresa.  Es una breve, pero justa y necesaria, aventura gráfica de plataformas 2D que en parte recuerda a Journey, en donde empezas sin saber nada y solo tenes que adentrarte en unos apabullantes paisajes, que en este caso, son creados por la sensible imaginación de una chica trastornada por una pérdida de un ser querido.  A nivel jugable, solo tenes que resolver algunos sencillos puzzles mientras vas atravesando un proceso de superación a nivel emocional. Te lo podes pasar en una tarde, asique recomiendo jugarlo de corrido para no desentonar de la experiencia.  Su banda sonora es tan espectacular (a la par de Ori and the Blind Forest/Will of the Wisp y Hollow Knight) que recomiendo jugarlo con auriculares para deleitar tus oídos en la inmersiva aventura.  Tanto imagen, sonido y jugabilidad se va acomplejando a medida que avanzas así como también su hermoso arte que es simplemente magnífico.  No necesitas saber más nada, todo se cuenta a través de los sentidos. El resto es un proceso, una delicada experiencia perfectamente acompañada por unas animaciones de dibujos simplemente espectaculares!  Que más se puede decir ante semejante orquesta visual y sonora, donde las emociones danzan al compás de ese proceso tan personal y especial todos tenemos o tendremos alguna vez?  Todos tus sentidos van a agradecer haberse expuestos ante esta imperdible obra de arte!

Pourquoi donc est-ce si bien ? Qu'est ce qui rend le jeu si unique par rapport aux autres jeux indépendants ? C'est ce que je me suis dit lors de ma toute première heure de jeu.  Outer Wilds est un jeu d'exploration avec une jouabilité minimaliste mais ingénieuse: le titre vous propose de débuter l'aventure avec tout les outils en main (un oscilloscope, et une balise qui fait appareil photo). Le jeu vous donne une liberté totale dès le décollage de votre fusée, s'en suit une aventure qui ne durera que 22 minutes avant que le soleil explose, puis recommencera encore et encore jusqu'à obtenir les réponses au gigantesque puzzle qu'est le jeu.  Je note cependant une optimisation convenue, et une énigme en particulier un peu trop tiré par les cheveux.  Pour conclure: une pépite dans l'univers indé est né, et c'est Outer Wilds, un jeu qui ne paye pas de mine au départ mais qui dévoile un univers riche et cohérent: chaque planète possède ses propres loi, sa propre gravité, sa propre histoire, et c'est tout ces éléments qui font de ce titre, un jeu très bien pensé.

A game where a bunch of girls with positive vibes have friendly competition by putting a high-powered motor between their legs and get wet...because they're racing jet skis of course.  The gameplay mechanics are pretty deep, though you'll find you don't have to get too good at them because the difficulty is rather bare-bones. In one regard it's kinda nice to play an arcadey racer that doesn't want to throw every cheat in its toolkit to make you rage, but some may find the lack of difficulty adjustments lackluster.  The story is very simple but upbeat which is nice when most racing games every opponent wants to let you know your existence is the worst thing to ever enter the planet.  If Senran Kagura was too raunchy for you, this is much more toned down in the base content (though there's some good cheesecake there for you to unlock).  Overall it's not something that's gonna wow more intense gamers, but as something that just wants to be fun and endearing, it's a good time.

I've completed the story and most if not all secrets, as well as played a fair amount of Julianna (rank 45), so i feel that i am definently qualified to speak on this game.  Personally ive had next to zero performance issues. I've only had 1 crash, and my fps has been at a pretty sturdy 70-80 all the way through. I only have a 1080 gtx and a i7-8700k cpu, so i was expecting much worse.  The gameplay of deathloop is very much "high chaos dishonered with guns", and its exactly as fun as it sounds: very fun. There are some new additions that make et even more entertaining, like for example the dedicated kick, new abilities (especially Karnesis), the Hackamajig and the new and improved Bonechar- i mean Trinket system. All this makes for some good old Arkane fun, while still keeping it fresh. Admittetly there are some shortcommings. Like for example there is no timestop ability, which was one of the coolest in Dishonered, and you can only have 2 abilities pr. mission. And when i say 2, i actually mean Blink & 1 of your own choice, since blink is such a no brainer you would instantly be throwing by not putting it on. The gunplay feels good, and there is an okay amount of choice when it comes to your armory. There arent a lot of guns, but the guns there are have different varients with different abilities. The trinket system also brings an extra amount of customization into the game, and it actually doesnt feel like an afterthought. Though, as many people have already said, the NPCs are VERY basic, which is a dissapointing. They just kinda look at you and and shoot.   The Rouge-lite/timeloop mechanic is also handled pretty well. Though i will admit that i was starting to get a little tired of the same 4 maps at the end of the game. The open world is really big, and there are a lot of secrets to find. Alot of which you have to go look for. By the time i had completed the game, i had only found 2 of the 4 legendary weapons. One complaint i do have with the exploration in the game is that almost if not all secrets give you A) a trinket, or B) some lead to kill a visionary. This might not sound like a problem at first, but i found myself very involved in the story (no doubt thanks to the amazing voice acting and great banter between the main antagonist and protagonist). And the ending just didnt really give me the answers i was looking for. So when i came back to follow up on all the leads i didnt finish before i beat the game, i was pretty dissapointed to find that they were all just "DID YOU KNOW: YOU CAN SNEAK INTO X's HIDEOUT VIA THE HIDDEN X LOCATED X OF THE X! Specifically i was following up on a lead that seemed to be something big. It took me a while to figure it out, and when i did the reward was literally just an archive of hints to get close to all the visionaries (and, admittedly, a short but lore filled dossier on an important character). My point is that pretty much all the secrets are irellevent, because all they do is either give you a trinket or a new way to kill a visionary that you probably already know how to kill. In the end i found myself with almost more questions than i did at the starting of the game, and let me tell you, you do not know shit at the start of the game.  Then there is the PvP invasions. This is arguably the best content in the game... when it works. Its incredibly tense and you get that adrenaline RUSH. The game immeadiatly slows to a crawl with Colt being super careful, since Julianna could be hiding around every corner, only for it to explode into all out combat once someone has been spotted. Eternalist flock nearby camps when colt has been spotted, and its all around a pretty good time. The catch is that 35% of the time, the game is so unbearably laggy that you're literally rubberbanding so hard that you cant even turn 90 degrees and face your enemy. And not only that, the game is violently unbalanced. The nexus ability is next to useless in PvP while Karnesis with the Suspension upgrade can literally incapacitate and enemy in the air for a solid 3 seconds, leaving them wide open to an explosive sniper shot in the head, oneshotting them instantly. Or a couple of shotgun shells which will completely desintegrate any living thing withing a 10m cone in front of you. Not to mention the genrall jankiness of PvP, which makes it hard to hit an enemy 10m infront of you if you dont live next door.  The game obviously isnt a 10/10. Dont trust game journalist. Period. But the game definently isnt bad either. If you can somehow escape the terrible performance issues like i have, its a blast. Id give it a solid 7/10. Im a bit worried about the replayability of the game, considering that the whole game is solving the murder puzzle. Its like rewatching a whodunit movie. But we'll cross that bridge when we get there

Graveyard Keeper is very quest focused, and progress is often locked behind doing a quest. On the other hand it also has an ending and you can just stop playing, unlike many other similar games. It's pretty chill, but you definitely NEED 20 wiki pages open more than games like Stardew Valley and Don't Starve. The biggest difference is that many things in Graveyard Keeper do not come as naturally and you're often left confused with how to progress or achieve the next goal (or just what the current quest is because the overview is not always helpful), where in other games you open 20 different wiki pages because you want to know 20 specific details.

Played more time on RU servers.  The game is fun at times and very pretty to look at. Nearly everything else is awful. This game screams gratuitous monetization (yes, I know its F2P) like those annoying mobile games that shove multiple currencies and timegated content in your face.  MMOs tend to have cluttered interfaces and menus but this is one of the worst offenders. Very overwhelming.  There's no sense of "leveling up" as you start off very powerful and mobs pose no threat whatsoever. In fact, there's no point in killing them as they offer very little XP. If you're expecting a Diablo-type loot system this ain't it.  The zones consist of small corridors and hallways. Extremely linear for an MMO. I can't even tell you details regarding the story as its so bland and generic.

From an atmospheric and story-wise standpoint this game is great, especially for Harry Potter fans. But from a purely gameplay perspective there is much to be desired. 1. The fights are either too easy, or you just get stunlocked and have to spam heal, because you can't dodge/parry the next attacks. 2. The movement feels a little clunky too often for my liking. Especially in buildings, you will constantly stop sprinting and for some reason start to walk very slow. Also sometimes you just can't get over some fences which are literally the height of your kneecaps. 3. A lot of the side quests feel more like chores with mediocre rewards just to keep you busy until the next main quest appears, which will sometimes take a few minutes. 4. The, for me, most important point. You have WAY too little gear slots. Even after unlocking almost full capacity, I can't even do one main quest without running out of gear slots. Therefore I would have to travel across half the map to the next merchant to sell my stuff every like 10 minutes or so. This is extremely frustrating and imo is really counter-rewarding for a game that has so much options for exploration.  All in all this is not a bad game. Especially the setting, the graphics and of course the spellcasting is very satisfying. But for me the gameplay flaws just kinda ruined it. I can't even play the game for more than 20 minutes at a time anymore, because I get too frustrated with one of the points mentioned above.

Firewatch is a masterpiece. A fantastic hand crafted mixture of story, voice acting and visuals. It is safe to say that It is one of the best games I've ever had the joy to play.  Not only are the graphics simply beautiful but the whole atmosphere and all the sound effects create one of the most stunning games ever - free from the itchy-scratchy realism most AAA games attempt to acheive in today's game industry. One thing is for sure, and it's that Campo Santo have done a fantastic job here, creating a game that taps into all of your senses and delivers a story with both precision and mystery, matched by no other.  But despite all this fantastic work, the game is rather short. So if you want an experience? Get this game. If you're just looking for something to pass the time doing, it might be too short for you.

A good small programming game. I personally prefer my games of this style to be more gamified(or obfuscated), meaning straight up using a limited programming language to build puzzles around doesn´t really work for me. I have done some programming before(really random training stuff) and as such TIS-100 very much felt like stuff I have done before, as opposed to Spacechem or Infinifactory that feel fresh.  Now that said TIS-100 was plenty fun enough to (mostly)go through escpecially thanks to the early learning curve with the manual and such. But this was the first and last game that, for me, gets away with just using a simplified programming language for math puzzles. I know I have been and will continue to ignore Human Resource Machine because of this for example. If you have played that one prior you might still get quite a bit out of TIS-100 since this is a significantly harder game(from what I have seen), but be aware that the early/mid game stuff is going to be a whole lot of the same/similar math problems.

I will concede that it gets a little monotonous, but that's only because the levels are about 40% too long. But the game is fun as heck and if you like combos and juggling and casual play, you won't regret buying this!

It’s classic Ms. Pac-Man in computer format. What else is there to say? I got it for a dollar and some change on a third party website, but if you like the classic as much as I do, it’s still worth full price even if there’s no deal (it was considered as a retro classic even when I was a little kid, but it became a huge part of my childhood because I played it over and over so often on a game machine my older brother got me). The keyboard controls are smooth and unconfusing. My one complaint is I couldn’t find a mute button for sounds and music. I was easily able to mute it myself from the sound mixer on my computer, though, so I’m okay, but it is something to keep in mind. It’s a great game to play on the side while watching a show or talking to someone when you need a little something more to do. It might just be the childhood nostalgia, but I really do love this game even now. If you also like Ms. Pac-Man, this is a pretty solid version I’d say.

Игра хорошая, только до момента когда ты становишься к примеру королём или императором огромной державы. Кто так делал эту часть игры я хз. У меня голова просто пухней от кол-ва действий которые вылезают за минуту времени. Почему я не могу всю мелкую хрень скинуть на советников ? Почему я не могу нажать кнопку и вопросы налогов, замужества родни, мелкие вопросы скинуть на советников и доверенных людей.  Какого хрена я правя огромной державой должен заниматься вопросами кому как подтереть жопу, особенно заколёбывает когда у меня многолетняя война и у меня просто нет дела до внутренних дел в государстве. А так сержант графоуни хороший, но при наличии огромных территорий производительность игра начинает лагать и падать фепес. Багов в игре особо замеченно не было.

At first I thought this is just a fun little game to have a look into and see, what it is all about. Then you learn more and more about why the game is the way it is and even though the story gave me a little discomfort, it was way to interesting to see how the events turn out to stop. In the end it is less a game with brain-frying puzzles; it is more a story where solving the little game-chunks is like turning the Pages of a book.

Не знаю второй игры, в которую бы я мог так самозабвенно всаживать свои вечера.  Это что то среднее между Left 4 Dead, корейской ММО и старым добрым Thief. Вот только приправлено все отличным антуражем, прекрасной музыкой (авторы игры особо постарались и с этим спорить глупо), постоянными обновлениями (баланс игры меняется в лучшую сторону, заметил это, так как играю с предзаказа) и тонной батхёрта по поводу чьей-нибудь криворукости. Игру рекомендую всем - и любителям пострелять и любителям спокойно пройти миссию, предварительно потратив на изучение карты минут 10.  Есть ли у игры минусы?  Их несколько: Обилие DLC, которые вам, конечно же, захочется купить. Скудный интеллект ботов-напарников. (играть лучше с живыми людьми) Не сильно оптимизированный игровой движок (тот же Source мне нравится в разы больше).  Лично в моем сердце для этой игры есть место.  10\10 (субъективно) 7.5\10 (объективно)
