This charming, if slightly crusty, masterpiece of a game is simultaneously beautiful, terrifying, and strange all at the same time. I've never seen a game that gives off such a genuine feeling of wonder at discovering new areas and scenic vistas  or terror at imagining the horrors that wait over the next hill and behind the next corner. This game is brutal, and will punish you for not religiously saving at every possible moment with surprisingly frantic combat and tense platforming. I absolutely recommend this game, so much so that I would almost consider it an insult to wait for a sale. This is most certainly a game where you are recommended to not think too hard about anything and just let everything wash over you, because it is insane, and I love it.

Долго я мучился с этим DoS 2, скачивал-удалял её по несколько раз и всё никак не мог понять почему же игра НАСТОЛЬКО не заходит. Жанр мой любимый, боёвка вроде интересная и вариативная, да и игра в целом-то, наверное, хорошая, но, как по мне, огромная её проблема - сеттинг. Куча красок, умение *смешно* болтать с животными, юмор к месту и не очень, какие-то карикатурные персонажи - всё это создаёт впечатление какого-то ДнД 6+. DoS 2 вышла примерно в то же время, что и PoE 2, и (естественно) заработала гораздо больше популярности, за что мне слегка обидно, хоть и ожидаемо, и по делу. Но лично в моих глазах PoE и по сюжету, и по стилистике выглядит гораздо более взрослой, что ли.  UPD. Лучше бы и дальше не пытался проходить этот кал. Это вообще не игра, а какая-то дебильная душная пародия на партийку. Возможно дело просто в том, что я играл в соло, потому что настолько душных механик по типу "в экране бартера нельзя на стол положить шмот за всех персонажей сразу, поэтому будь добр складывай весь лут постоянно в одного персонажа" я нигде ещё не видел. Вообще напарников как таковых кроме как *в бою* тут нет, потому что ты постоянно за них играешь. Этот момент полностью рушит отношение к своим спутникам как к внутриигровым личностям, которые тебе *неподвластны* и могут с тобой посмеяться, поспорить, поругаться и так далее. Как я могу воспринимать какую-нибудь Лоусе как полноценного *обособленного* персонажа, если я могу за неё вступать в диалоги? Если честно, вообще непонятно для чего это сделали.  Зачем в этой игре есть возможность разговаривать за своих спутников? Чтобы кому-то вкачивать спич-навыки и за него со всеми болтать? Почему тогда нельзя выбрать персонажа, с которым будет разговаривать НПС, когда сам НПС начинает диалог? Была у меня ситуация такая, связанная с квестом по сбору пиратской брони, где мне нужно было снять проклятие с каменного круга, а благословение было доступно только за Лоусе. Я кинул за неё благословение и скелет из сундука СРАЗУ начал диалог с ней. И естественно мне пришлось с ним драться, потому что у неё абсолютно не прокачано красноречие. В итоге, чтобы этот ебучий капитан джек воробей поговорил именно с моим персонажем, мне пришлось грузиться, бежать в другой конец острова за истоком, набирать этот исток, возвращаться и прожимать благословение за себя. Очень классно, а почему просто не сделать отдельную кнопку перехода диалога к другому персонажу? Не по РП? То есть не может быть ситуации в ролевом отыгрыше, когда персонаж просто сам вклинивается в диалог и становится полноценным его участником? По итогу все эти свистопляски с выбором персонажа для диалога идут только на вред. Я не чувствую, что у меня есть в игре компания друзяшек, которая со мной проходит сквозь огонь, воду, медные трубы, кислоту и прочие ужасы. Я чувствую каких-то карикатурных марионеток, которые созданы, потому что мне должно быть с ними весело и интересно.  Ещё в игре просто ужасная камера и графика. Я не знаю, почему нельзя сделать просто обычную симпатичную 2д-изометрию, нахуя делать вот это богомерзкое страшное юнити-3д с ужасными карликовыми мультяшными 3д-модельками, это же кошмар просто. Из-за этого 3д им пришлось ещё и камеру сделать как в СИМС блять вертящуюся. И вы это реально хвалите?  В принципе я перечислил несколько вещей, из-за которых играть в дивинити просто невозможно, то есть проблемы с камерой, бартером, персонажами вырубают на корню вообще желание запускать игру. Естественно в ней полно проблем поменьше, менее критичных - отсутствие как таковых диалогов например. Здесь персонаж, за которого ты разговариваешь, не говорит прямую речь НИКОГДА. Он говорит "сказать, что". Я не шучу, там когда тыкаешь на вариант диалога, персонаж вместо "я дебил в дебильной игре" говорит "сказать, что я дебил в дебильной игре". Почему такую систему не сделали для всех игр вообще в мире? Инновационный прорыв в области диалоговых систем. Да и в принципе содержательных диалогов тут на самом деле мало. В основном смехуёчки для шестилетних с перком "друг животных".  Это, кстати, ещё одна проблема игры - дебильный юмор, чаще всего вообще не к месту. Конечно, забавные моменты в ней есть, например можно сделать Красному Принцу лицо довольного петуха и рофлить с того, как он пытается всех попускать своим дворянским положением. Но вообще юмор в игре ужасный, можете даже посмотреть кучу хвалебных обзоров на игру в ютубе - там каждый первый будет говорить о том, как классно тут "целоваться с пауками", "разговаривать с бочками", "сношаться с котами", "спорить с философом-скелетом". И собственно весь юмор тут такой, нелепый и идиотский, построенный на якобы *смешном* взаимодействии с чем-то, с чем ты взаимодействовать подобным образом по идее не должен. Кошмар.  Но, конечно, в игре есть несколько хороших и реально качественных моментов, всё-таки большинство людей не настолько больные, чтобы настолько яростно нахваливать игру, в которой нет вообще ничего хорошего. К примеру, дивинити очень вариативная во многих моментах, начиная с драк, где, как правило, у тебя достаточно много опций (хотя часто горит очко с того, что в любой драке ты должен принимать бой в изначально худших для тебя условия, т.е. враги уже все выставлены как шахматные фигуры на выгодных и лучших для себя позициях, а ты просто бежал кучей и драться тоже так должен), заканчивая в целом прохождением игры, где достаточно много вариантов развития событий. В ней очень много различного интересного лута, вообще лутаться тут приятно достаточно. Музыка тут очень забавная. Не знаю даже как это описать, как будто очень попсовые мелодии переиграли на фентезийный мотив, реально смешно. А в остальном игра очень плохая, не понимаю откуда столько фанатов. Скорее всего это синдром "рпг с текстом = шедевр".

Le jeu de Resident Evil - Revelations est la tentative de Capcom de créer un jeu moderne de «survie-horreur» et prétend revenir aux racines de la série. Ce n’est pas tout à fait vrai, mais cela ne signifie pas non plus que ce jeu ne vaut pas la peine d’être joué.  Resident Evil Revelations se concentre principalement sur Jill Valentine avant les événements. Chris est porté disparu et un signal de détresse a été émis pendant une croisière sur un navire laissé sur une mer agitée. Jill et le nouveau venu Parker entrent pour enquêter. Et ce qui commence est probablement l’un des complots les plus fromagers qui existent dans toute la série. Resident Evil n’est pas quelque chose de nouveau, mais cela est généralement dû à des voix ou à des portes insensées. L’intrigue du jeu est tout simplement ridicule, avec des rebondissements exagérés, des personnages extravagants, même au regard des standards de la série. Mais cela ne veut pas dire que c’est mauvais. Dans le sens de B-Horror, c’est plutôt amusant, mais je suggère que vous ne veniez pas à ce jeu pour un drame profond ou une histoire sérieuse.  Le jeu est complet, divisé en 12 épisodes, qui ont chacun deux parties. Généralement, dans chaque épisode, vous en interpréterez une partie sous le nom de Jill dans le «présent», explorant le navire et ses horreurs. L’autre moitié change chapitre par chapitre de ce qu’elle contient, mais elle met généralement en vedette un autre personnage, dans le présent ou à un autre moment, faisant quelque chose d’autre qui est d’une certaine importance pour l’histoire. Ces chapitres sont généralement beaucoup plus chargés d’action que les chapitres de Jill, et honnêtement, ils ne sont généralement pas aussi bons que les chapitres de Jill non plus, mais ils ne sont pas terribles. Et comme le jeu a une structure épisodique, les épisodes se terminent généralement par une falaise, et lorsque vous commencez le prochain épisode, il commence de manière amusante avec un récapitulatif "Précédemment, sur Resident Evil Revelations ...".  Il y a aussi des changements qui donnent l’impression que le jeu est différent. Il n’y a pas d’herbes rouges ni de vaporisateurs de premiers secours, mais seulement des herbes vertes dans ce jeu. Le jeu comporte des zones de natation où vous ne pouvez pas tirer avec votre arme, mais nagez autour des zones inondées et assurez-vous de respirer de temps en temps. Vous disposez d’un scanneur d’objets, que vous utilisez principalement pour rechercher des objets cachés ou pour scanner un ennemi afin de remplir un pourcentage (lorsqu’il atteint 100%, il vous donne une herbe verte gratuite et se réinitialise à 0%). Tous ces changements donnent à ce jeu le sentiment d’être très différent.  Le navire est atmosphérique et de mauvaise humeur, et bien que linéaire, contient le type de suivi en arrière et de collecte des clés que vous attendez. Les casse-têtes sont malheureusement sous-estimés, mais le jeu comporte des rebondissements intéressants et vous permet de suivre le cours du jeu pour que les choses restent intéressantes. Les ennemis sont également assez variés. La musique est en fait plutôt fantastique. Quelques excellentes chansons contribuent à l’atmosphère et préservent la sensation de froid de l’océan et le charme mélodique. Il y a plusieurs morceaux qui se démarquent, mais l’ensemble est plutôt bon.  Le jeu montre sa nature de plusieurs manières, mais les graphismes ont été considérablement mis à jour depuis la sortie de 3DS. Beaucoup d’options à personnaliser, et cela fonctionnent plutôt bien. Honnêtement, le seul problème que j’ai vraiment eu avec le port, c’est parfois que, lorsque vous cliquetez beaucoup en mode fenêtré, le jeu risque de tomber en panne, mais c’est une chose très mineure, à la fois assez rare et la le jeu enregistre automatiquement la progression assez régulièrement.  La seule autre chose à prendre en compte est le mode Raid, qui remplace le mode Mercenaries dans ce jeu. Ce mode, vous parcourez des endroits du jeu (soit seul, soit avec un partenaire coopération en ligne), puis chassez et tuez des créatures, obtenez un classement, et gagner du butin. armes, mods, etc. Vous pouvez déverrouiller une assez grande variété de personnages du jeu, chacun ayant ses propres compétences (certains utilisent mieux certaines armes, certains récupèrent de la santé avec le temps, chacun a un style de frappe différent et une attaque en mêlée, etc.), et un style unique. Le système de niveaux est comme un RPG, où vous gagnez de l’expérience et un niveau augmente des choses comme votre défense et votre puissance d’attaque.  Le mode Raid est absolument addictif, et probablement ce qui vous fera revenir à ce titre surtout si vous vous plongez dans cette recherche. Il y a 21 niveaux, et chacun devient de plus en plus long, de plus en plus extravagant, et au fur et à mesure, commencez à ajouter des éléments comme de multiples zones à explorer et même des monstres de la campagne. De plus, chaque niveau comporte quatre difficultés différentes, qui ne les rendent pas simplement plus difficiles, mais modifient la disposition de chaque endroit où les ennemis apparaissent, où se trouvent les objets, etc. Mais vous devez terminer toutes les étapes d’une difficulté pour débloquer la difficulté suivante. C’est-à-dire, sauf le 21e niveau, qui est une sorte de niveau de bonus qui n’est recommandé que si vous êtes au maximum. Le dernier niveau est un régal en soi que vous devez travailler dur pour vous attaquer. Il s’agit essentiellement de tout le vaisseau du jeu principal transformé en un parcours d’obstacles en monde ouvert infesté d’ennemis, avec de multiples points de fin, de multiples chemins dans le vaisseau et de nombreux cadeaux à collectionner, y compris une créature cachée exclusive pour cette étape. C’est très amusant et très stimulant.  Les révélations peuvent avoir une histoire compliquée, un dialogue ringard, une collecte de clés, un suivi, et d’intéressants ennemis inhumains ... Mais cela ressemble également à un mélange de nouveau avec l’ancien, et non pas à un véritable rappel général à la survie classique -horreur de la série. Mais cela ne signifie pas que c’est un mauvais jeu et qu’il vaut vraiment la peine que vous passiez votre temps à apprécier la série ou à apprécier ce genre de jeux d’action ou d’horreur. C’est très amusant, et à une bonne quantité de répétition. Vous obtiendrez 4 cartes de colection et 50 succès difficilement gagnés pour certains. Ce n’est peut-être pas le meilleur de sa série, mais en périodes de rabais, ce jeu vaut largement son prix...   Amicalement. Le pasteur

Wow, just wow. I was quickly engrossed by the world that the characters are forced to live in. No zombies, no apocalypse. Just three friends trying to survive a war that is right outside their home town. The city is under seige and everything is scarce. Food, water, medicine, even things that you wouldn't normally need going through the day to day become valuable.   You feel something for the characters as they struggle to survive. They feel regret when forced to take a life, and you see it in them when they burry their face in their hands and another tries to console them. Every desicion matters, where to scavange, what to take, what to keep, who sleeps, who stays on guard. It's tough and compelling storytelling in the simplest way. Play it should you get the chance.

It doesn’t seem like that long ago that the only city-builder games were simply building a city and trying not to run out of money. Now we have city builders of all sorts that venture into completely new genres and the resulting city is more of a product than a goal. Pile Up joins this ever-growing realm of games where you’re chasing scores and placing what are almost puzzle pieces where the result is a pretty cool-looking city – except here, you end up with a giant arcology of interwoven buildings and structures.  Abbreviated Review: https://youtu.be/De8-V3M_4c8  [h1]No City is an Island[/h1] The premise of Pile Up is very straightforward. You’re presented with a relatively small platform out in the ocean and given some non-descript boxes to place on it. These boxes, initially, are represented by different styles of homes that will increase your population when placed. There aren’t any physical manifestations of people or any need to accommodate for their travel or general well-being. You can just toss those housing structures of various shapes and sizes wherever it is most advantageous, and the people will be happy. Well, sort of happy.  The determining factor of whether a building full of inhabitants is satisfied depends on whether their required needs are met. Each building’s population can desire up to two of the four amenities: electricity, gas, water, and gardens. These are generated by respective buildings that each have a small caveat to their placement. All have spheres of influence, and the gas and electric generators have slightly smaller spheres that, if overlapping, will result in the gas plant exploding. Water has no such interaction, but the water tank itself is always “leaking” and thus if you don’t place it on a surface labeled “solid,” it will destroy it and the water tower you placed. Gardens are the most lenient but must be placed on a roof which takes up valuable space for future buildings. This delicate balance of resources is one of the earliest and most persistent challenges you find in the game and is one of the primary factors that dictate how you build. If the happiness of your population sinks below an ever-decreasing margin, your building endeavor ends.  Yet, it’s not the only way you can hit a ‘game over’ screen. All of the buildings you receive to place are generated from factories that you receive and must also be placed in your limited building area. These don’t require any amenities but can receive certain benefits from other factory-related buildings you unlock. You receive factories primarily at the beginning and at each of a series of population milestones – usually allowing you to build everything you need to get to the next milestone. However, if you lose buildings to explosions or deadly water leaks, you may not make it that far and face another ‘game over’ screen for an “economic crisis.”  [h1]I Can Go Twice As High[/h1] With the limited footprint of your starting island/platform, the need to raise your platform higher is inevitable. This is a relatively slow process, and you may not even notice you’re up several levels as you try to squeeze buildings into every nook and cranny and stretch to overhang the edge to maximize space and ensure everyone has what they want. Whether you succeed at this all the way up to the maximum population of the island or fail from a social or economic crisis, you’ll get some special points for the progress you make. These points can then be used in an area called Blueprints that will let you unlock a diverse variety of buildings to mix into your potential collection. Things like Casinos that, when placed, will spin a slot machine of outcomes that will net you a building with a free 500 population, a basic ‘solid’ platform’ you can plop down, or a bundle of dynamite you must place since all cards have to be used each round. Others are more straightforward like special building platforms that increase the production speed of factories placed above them or buildings that limit the effects of a lack of population happiness.  These additional building unlocks don’t just let you build more with less effort though; they add to the dynamic nature of how and where you build. Some have effects that only trigger when they’re destroyed, and this is made more useful by buildings that allow you to destroy things in controlled ways. One of the earliest examples of this is a watch tower that, when placed, causes the last building you put down to be destroyed. If the last building you built was a slum, it’s duplicated and now two slums are available to build again. The more buildings you unlock in this Blueprint tree, the richer the game becomes and the more you can accomplish within it. With this progression, it doesn’t take long before you can hit all of the milestones of the first island and unlock the second much-less-uniform map to start over again with tougher goals to reach.  [h1]The Pyramid Schematic[/h1] Unlocking the second map with its irregular shape and “two rather than one” island structure adds a nice variable to the mix. However, given that it’s the only other available map currently available in the early access adventure, it can be a little disappointing when you complete it. Though I have no tangible idea, I’d have assumed islands would be an easy thing to add since they don’t factor into the balance of the game as much as the many structures you unlock. I also discovered in my endeavors on the second map that isolating the factories on the smaller island in the available pair got them out of the way and had no negative effect on the game. The factories seem like a bit of an afterthought since all they have to do is exist to give full functionality. You’ll ultimately unlock some interesting buildings that change their production speeds a bit and react to their eventual exhaustion, but it feels like building two separate cities once you figure out how little they affect your population.  Outside of those issues though, the core gameplay loop of Pile Up feels decidedly complete for an early-access title. When you notice the way buildings seamlessly morph together as you add them into what ultimately becomes a giant arcology, it feels even more complete. Combining all of that with a mellow (though a bit repetitive) soundtrack and a pleasant little environment with dynamic day/night cycles, it is absolutely a lovely game. Although it’s one of many “relaxing city builders” with an inevitable future in high score chasing, it fills the role without many issues and, according to the roadmap, has a solid future ahead. It’s definitely worth giving a shot for its fairly modest price.  [quote] If you'd like to see more of my reviews, check out my curator page here: [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28346672-Endyo-Gaming/]Endyo’s Indies[/url], [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/38271367/]Abbreviated Reviews[/url][/quote

[h1]Curadoria: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32096236-NerdTrash/]Nerd Trash[/url][/h1]  Fiquei muito feliz quando soube que esse jogo havia sido lançado no Steam. O joguei pela primeira vez no começo dos anos 2000, através daqueles cd-roms cheio de jogos e softwares, que vendiam em bancas de jornal. Gostei tanto do jogo que até hoje nunca me esqueci! Sempre jogava, pois amava as frases bizarras do cadáver delicado.  Esse jogo é um point and click educativo, no qual você deve alcançar o maravilhoso através de uma jornada surrealista. Há MUITO conteúdo para leitura, além de ter o curta Un Chien Andalou. Jogue com calma para aproveitar tudo o que o jogo oferece.  Surrealidade é muito datado, com um visual bem ultrapassado e uma mecânica de movimentação bem ruim, mas mesmo assim super indico a experiência. Primeiro, porque é um jogo no qual mesmo sem querer, você vai aprender muita coisa! Culturalmente falando, é uma vivência muito rica pois você aprende se divertindo. Acredite, você vai zerar e mesmo não intencionalmente vai ter absorvido muita informação. E segundo, porque é muito interessante ver uma produção nacional, um jogo totalmente em português e do começo dos anos 2000 - uma época onde não era muito comum jogos brasileiros, ainda mais produções independentes.  A cereja do bolo é o conteúdo extra, com making off do desenvolvimento. Um registro histórico muito importante para a história dos jogos brazucas. Recomendo fortemente esse jogo para quem estuda game design, mesmo sendo um estilo de nicho, é um ótimo artefato de estudo.

Справжня Історія. World War Z  -Як це все почалося? Як це давно було... Спочатку Zешники зійшли з глузду і поширилось по всьому світові. Людство дає гідну відсіч, але все ж вірус занадто сильний і багатьох обернув на Zешників. Чому так їх називали? Вижішві дали їм найменування "Zешникі". Ні, не через те що вони сиділи на нарах. Всі ознаки мертвого мозку були очевидні - "Zombie". Але щось змушувало їх рухатись і та ригати звуки по типу "можем павтарить", "на Бєрлін", і ще багато різного щось схожого на людське, та воно точно таким не було.  Що ми знаємо про вірус? Насправді поки що небагато. Тільки те що він смертельний. Поширився він з підземних бункерних лабораторіях на Московії, під кремлем. Наскільки відомо, нульовий пацієнт був добровольцем - Володимир Путін, єдиний президент, що був на росії з часів розпаду Совєта. Деталі емпіричних експериментів та досліджень поки що всі не розкрито, але все те що злили мордорські професори анальних наук Російсьої Педорасії про експерименти над нульовим пацієнтом, ось записи в оригіналі мертвою мовою:  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                           Засикреченный Проект: Черная дыра День 1. Субъекту 001 ведена бутылка 0.5 живчика, анально на глубину 56 см. Результаты положительные, в перспективе объект сможет мутировать и увеличить свою суперспособность до невозможного. Он сможет с легкостью "проглотить США анальным проходом". День 856. Объект 001 словно бешеный, эпизодами слышно ругательство на немецком. Вероятно из-за того, что за все время экспериментов он так и не может проглотить США своей, как мы ее прозвали "Черной Дирой". Несмотря на то, что субъект мог "поглотить" объекты размером "Лады Калины", этого было недостаточно для цели эксперимента. Для того, ради чего все это было. -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Після, довгих 934 днів. Експеримент було заморожено через масове розірвання анусів у всіх суб'єктів над якими робили експерименти. Після невдалого масштабного експерименту, минуло багато часу. Та коли одному з приближених Путлєра прийшла геніальна на їх думку ідея, як заволодіти всім світом, та зробити так, щоб існувала лише одна єдина нація - Сросія. Проєкт знову відновили з невеликими змінами. Тепер суб'єкту анально вводили скляну пляшку "Оболонь" або "Чернігівське". Привозили пляшки контрабандою тоді з України. В чому полягав сенс, пляшок вводили стільки, доки вони не лускали прямо всередині з секретною рідиною. Після чого, суб'єкт починав кричати "Za мир, Za росию, Za VDV, а 8 ЛЕТ, а бамбас".  Все б нічого, світ був готовий толерувати їх, як один із 50-ти гендерів. Та якщо б вони це робили виключно на своїх болотах та не лізли за ці межі. Але вони почали лізти. Спочатку жертвами стали: Грузія, Молдова, Таджикистан, знову Грузія - Абхазія, Ічкерія, Дагестан, знову Ічкерія, знову Грузія - Осетія, Абхазія, Кавказ, Крим - Україна, Донбас, Сирія, і остання капля стала - повномасштабна атака України. Zешникі були повсюди. Проповідували свій "Мир". Але він нікому не був цікавий, тому людство зібралося проти цього культу розірвання анусів, що поширювалось на московії. І почало запеклу боротьбу, яку тепер ви знаєте в історії як "World War Z". Війна стала масштабніша за першу і другу світову разом взяту. Близько 150 мільйонів практично вмерли. Якщо точніше, вмер їх мозок. Але вірус "направляв" їх тіло нести "Мир" у весь світ. План нульового пацієнта і головного командувача Путіна, повлягався в тому, щоб підсадити все населення планети на розірвання анусів за допомогою скляних пляшок і секретної рідини в ній. Після чого все населення вимре. Та вони вийдуть з бункерів, і зможуть заселити планету виключно розумово відсталими - нацією Сросія. Поки сам він сидів на Уралі в бункері з величезними запасами пляшок. Народ сросії, скаженів від недостачі пляшок і тим що було в них. Цей пляшковий голод був влаштований проти народу звісно штучно як і планувалося. Цю ідею схоже вони поцупили у Сталіна. Тому коли влада сказала: хочете більше пляшок? Вони є на заході, йдіть та заберіть їх. І вони пішли. Тепер, коли Zeшникі в пошуках пляшок у всьому світі, наша місія прорватись через ці великі орди на Московію. Шлях лежить через Японію лайнером на Камчатку, а там на Московію. Головна місія, дістатися лабораторії в бункері під кремлем, та розшифрувати секретний ключ до дверей, де вони зберігають антидот проти рідини, яку додавали в скляні пляшки, після чого вони лускали всередині і народ скаженів та хотів ще, поки не помирає від лускань.   Шлях буде непростий. Орди Zешників великі, та буде здаватись що нескінченні. Але якщо не ми, можливо світ буде втрачено таким яким задумав його Бог. Ми очистимо планету від Zешників. Вперед.

Even if I have a huge variety of arrows at my disposal, I simply find myself sneaking around all the time, occasionally hitting some guard over the head to silence him. This does get boring. Constantly opening all drawers, boxes and chests also gets boring. You simply never find anything really exiting. No new weapon or cool upgrade. Only 'collectibles' that I simply don't care about.  Others have complained about the map and I second that. It is impossible and frustrating to find your way in the city.  Overall, I played this game for a few hours and it gives me the been-there, done-that, seen-it-all feeling. I'll probably not finish it.

It's really difficult to talk about this game and review it based solely on its merits as a video game considering the confusing way Striking Distance have handled its sales, so I'll split the review in two: first part is about the game, second about everything else.  The game (including the actual ending, which was cut off and sold as DLC, I'll cover this later):  It's a solid 7/10. It most definitely isn't Dead Space, and I don't think it wanted to be Dead Space. It feels like a good sci-fi B-movie in the spirit of Dead Space- the plot doesn't revolutionise storytelling in any way, but it carried me through to the end. It also helps if you're a sci-fi aficionado. Visually, this game is superb. The level of detail is downright impressive at times, especially as far as character design is concerned - most characters look photorealistic, the enemies are detailed and guresome, animations are fluid, and it all really serves to bolster immersion. Sound design also gets top marks.  The story unfolds through solid cut-scenes, gameplay moments, and audio/text logs. Voice acting is solid all around, with the cast doing an awesome job with the material at their disposal. Unfortunately, if you're anything like me, the audio logs will just leave you wanting for more, as there's not a lot of them peppered throughout the game -they're also pretty short in and of themselves. In terms of the base game's ending, it would've been good enough as a sequel hook, but the DLC capped everything off and made it irrelevant.  The gameplay is good, although somewhat lacking in variety, which leads to some sequences feeling repetitive. It's primarily melee-focused, with timing-based combos and an interesting dodge mechanic which falls short of being great due to, as mentioned, lack of variety. The gun play takes a backseat for most of the game. The weapons themselves are diverse enough to not feel lacking, but they don't really have a lot of punch to them, even after being fully upgraded - from my experience, they are most useful as combo finishers and during some boss fights.  The game economy is tight and money is hard to come by, which means you won't be able to fully upgrade all weapons during a single playthrough. It does serve to add some replayability, but most upgrades aren't really useful enough to justify focusing on this as a main hook to get you through New Game+ - I actually didn't manage to buy all upgrades during my NG+, but I did manage to grab what I was missing while playing the DLC (progress carries over from the 'fake' ending save). Inventory management is... a thing, although relatively basic - all items take up the same amount of space and you have a limited amount of slots - these get expanded down the line, but not enough to ever leave you over-equipped (although if you focus on melee, you'll be flush with ammo for most of your playthrough). Personally, I've spent a lot of time doing shop runs to sell off loot drops and hoard cash, so your mileage may vary.   The DLC is noticeably more refined than the base game, with combat sequences having improved pacing and structure, and the story having fewer moments of dead air. It adds another type of enemy which is a logical extension of what one can find in the base game, as well as a satisfying new melee weapon, but the length of this final chapter doesn't leave much room to thoroughly enjoy either of the new additions. It may just be the reduced scope of the DLC, but it's encouraging to see that lessons have indeed been learnt. The DLC's post credits scene is... questionable, however.  In terms of performance, I've been running this on a 3060 with 12 Gigs of VRAM, an i7-9700k, 32 Gigs of DDR4, and I have it installed on an SSD. I've tried running it with ray-tracing, but needless to say I had to sacrifice quality in most other areas in order for it to be playable. Without RTX, however, I'm able to run it at 1440p, no upscaling, with everything but Volumetrics (which I have set to Low and, to be honest, it's barely noticeable) cranked up to High. I'm getting pretty consistent 60+ FPS, with occasional dips under 30 FPS in more effects-heavy areas - this is a personal preference, but it didn't bother me much.  All in all, I'd say this is a good proof of concept - I would be interested to see what this studio can create with more experience under their belt and with the player feedback they've received along the way, but only if they stop selling a full game as multiple pieces...   Everything else:  This is where most of my complaints are focused. To start off, I own all DLCs as I've pre-ordered them at launch through the Season Pass, which means my version of the game also includes the extra animations (they're nice, but I wouldn't have bought the DLCs for them). I find that selling the actual ending as separate DLC is a predatory move and left a bitter taste in my mouth. This also applies to the DLC which adds Permadeath mode. From what I've gathered, this was done due to poor sales figures, but I think it's a chicken-and-egg problem - they've advertised the DLC ending from the beginning, which I'm sure drove down sales significantly.   I haven't played the Riot Mode or the Contagion Mode as I'm not really feeling a third playthrough right now, but they sound interesting on paper - these feel more justified as DLC, but... not by a lot in my opinion.   The cosmetics are a nice detail, but they don't really add much variety to the game, as they're mainly just reskins of the default items - I'd say they're most certainly not a selling point for any of the available DLCs.  Leaning so heavily into the studio's history with Dead Space only served to further dent the game itself, as I've seen a lot of people saying they expected something closer to Dead Space than what was actually delivered.  I feel these decisions served to damage their reputation and image, as well as sully what could've been a pretty good sci-fi survival-horror with cool visuals. As a result, I would recommend checking this game out when significantly discounted and only if you can grab both the base game and Final Transmission for less than the base game's full price. The other DLCs are negligible in my opinion, nowhere near vital for the full experience. The game would've been a much, much better product had they sold it as a whole from the start.

game: Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris
review: Today's Review: Lara Croft and the temple of Osiris (I was about to say Tomb Raider but nope)  Let's start. Poorly optimized, INCREDIBLY BUGGY, lagging as hell, this is the next installment in the highly nominated and amazing first part of the adventure "Lara Croft and the guardian of Light", as many of you know the first game was fun and also clever, you need to shoot as much as you need to think, enemies are not the only obstacule, you need to solve puzzles to get to the very end. If you remember correctly the game was impecable, being the only fault of the game not having a window mode, the very rest of the game in particular was fantastic, this is not the case. LC:TO it's a hideous title in witch you will struggle not to fight the final enemy but to attempt to play with friends and enjoy it (if you get pass the connection problems) and you own a really powerful rig, since having less than "Required" will result in really really low fps (minimum are just a joke, game won't run with that). The game is filled with bugs (and they are not the enemies from the game, but the enemy it's the game itself) and runs with a horrible optimization, it's a shame for all those (like me) that happend to have such a good time playing the first title, and the 4 players coop really grap you tho you're gonna find IMPOSIBLE to make it happend.  Metascore: 24/100

Picked this up as part of the Namco Bandai Humble Bundle (which included all the DLC for the game), and I have to say, so far I've found it pretty dang enjoyable. After investing a large chunk of time into Split Second on my PS3, Ridge Racer: Unbounded felt immediately familiar, but different enough to make it stand out on its own. Split Second was super fun as racing games go, but I found the handling on the vehicles to be... not necessarily as advertised based on their stats. RR:U vehicles seem much more true to their description. Although a word of warning: A high drift score is, in my observation, not a sign that a car handles well under drift, even if it has a decent handling score. Rather, the drift score seems to indicate the willingness of the back end to swing out, so a car with max drift almost wants to drive in reverse after every single corner. These high drift cars require a delicate touch, and you'll end up facing the on coming field a lot until you get the subtleties down.  Continuing the Split Second/RR:U comparision:  While I loved the destruction in SS, merely placing in many SS tracks required that you hit every single destructible. And to win, you often needed to having the timing of using the destructibles down just so, rather than just relying on your skills as a driver. RR:U gives you the option to destroy, and it's definitely encouraged both by adding to your score and it's potential for shaving a little off your lap times. And of course, it's just fun to do. But in the end, placing and winning comes down to what you do behind the wheel. There will be moments of frustration, like when you're in the lead and some AI jerk three positions back starts a chain reaction accident, costing you your hard earned spot at the top, but even that feels fun and exhilirating, and makes you want to try again. Gotta say though, the SS soundtrack was better IMHO. RR:U has this very generic bassy electronica that I would rather have than be without any music, but it definitely doesn't evoke anywhere near the same kind of emotional pulse pounding rush that the SS tunes did.  Many will complain about the death of the online server, and I can understand that. But when I just wanna pick up and race, I don't really care. My only gripe is that the game was never updated to stop looking for it, so you waste more time than is necessary when the game first loads up, as it looks for a non-existent thing. It'd be nice if they came back and fixed that, maybe rewrote things so that the player community could host servers so we could still play online. But meh.... it's a small thing in my book, and I'm not a ginormous fan of online gaming to begin with, especially when play is strictly competitive.    Havent' played with the editor yet so I can't speak to that, but I think it's a cool feature. Again, many will say it's nearly useless given the demise of online play, but I'll be interested to see what I can come up with anyway.  Overall, as long as you're not looking for multiplayer mayhem, I definitely recommend it, though you might be well advised to pick it up on the cheap, or as part of a bundle. Lots of single player fun to be had, as long as you don't go in expecting the world. Give the demo a shot.

Tja was soll man da noch zu sagen?  Ich halte es kurz.  RPG Elemente, Towerdefense, L4D, Crafting Systeme von Minecraft.  Definitiv Potenzial das Spiel und werde mal den weitern Verlauf verfolgen. Das Spiel ist zurzeit Alpha 7.11 und ist wunderbar Spielbar und macht echt Spaß.  Was mir am besten gefällt:  Ist man in der Nacht nicht genug ausgerüstet mit Verband und Waffen, kann man einpacken, da die Zombies sich in der Nacht schneller bewegen als am Tag. Also muss man am besten am Tage looten gehen und hoffen das man vor dem erreichen der Nacht ein sicheren Unterschlupf findet. Ist man aber zu laut, provoziert man eine Horde und man ist auf einmal von einer Horde böser Menschenfresser umgeben die gerne mal an einem knabbern wollen.  Am Tag sich eingraben und in der Nacht versuchen zu überleben. Wie geil ist denn das bitte? Dazu kommt eine riesen Spielwelt wo immer wieder neue Gebäude von den Entwicklern dazu kommen.  Das war nur ein kleiner Einblick.  Probiert es selber mal aus.  Kann es nur empfehlen

One of my favourite Jackbox packs of all time. Haven't touched Zeeple Dome, out of lack of interest in it mostly, and have only played a little of Split the Room, due to it not seeming that great with 4 people which has been my groups usual number for this pack.   But the other three games are amazing.  You Don't Know Jack is back and it's wonderful. Screws are so much more interesting now than they used to be, doing fun things like zooming in your opponents screens to 300% or removing all the vowels from the answers, and it will affect all players who haven't answered before you activate it. Questions are great, complicated in how they're asked as per usual, and not too obscure or too general knowledge-y.  Patently Stupid is a lot more fun than I first expected it to be, as long as everyone is willing to buy in to whatever ridiculous solution you propose to an equally ridiculous problem you're given. The final round where everyone is solving the same problem is probably the best part of the game, as you get to watch just how different, or similar, your friends think compared to you.  Mad Verse City is probably my favourite game in the pack, and definitely one of my favourite Jackbox games ever. It's quick, it doesn't take a whole lot of skill to come up with a good rhyme, and the autocomplete/write-for-me is some of the best I've ever seen in Jackbox. The only issue is that it is sometimes unclear what your line will be about when you are asked to give a word, and whether that word will be about you or your opponent, negative or positive. This can really mess you up, when you inadvertantly say that your own face looks like it has been hit by a truck. The worst case of this was when my friend was asked to name a Wizard of Oz character, and he chose Cowardly Lion, figuring he would be calling his opponent that. His first line was then "You're the Cowardly Lion, I'm the Cowardly Lion". Hard to come up with a good line to follow that. Still an awesome game though.

After nearly 100 hour in this game, i can say i am totaly stunned. I did never expected a publisher could do such a good work, after messing up a hole game serie. But actually they did turn arround and focused on the strong points of Assassins Creed. First of all they show an amazing world. The view is great and you have the feeling to be really back in time. You do not have to go to towers anymore to see whats arround you, you only need to go to these places to fast travel. The game gives you the option to finish it in different ways. You want to fight against 20 enemies sure, or no one should see you also possible, or you let your enemies fight themselfs no problems. I needed these 90+ hours to actually use all option of fighting in this game. And when i talk about fighting they make it so much better than this parry conter thing before. The side missions are often the same but somehow they managed, that you never get the feeling they are. So to put all together. This game brings nothing new, but put all good things together what an open world game should do and is pulling out the best out of this. I can not wait for the DLCs to come and to see if they keep up with this great work or not, the future will show. I say get the game and see it yourself, i am sure its worse the price (and ofcause even more worse it on sale ;) ).

The game is fun and addicting once you learn how to survive, tame, and build.  Ark is very difficult at first, you'll probably die a handful of times in your beginning moments. Every time you adventure farther you'll likely die a new way from new threats. The game remains fairly difficult, but doable with prep work and dino minions. The best part of the game is taming and building your dream settlements. The game can be beautiful, when terrain behaves. (like Skyrim occasionally grass floats, textures stretch, etc.) Multiplayer is spotty, ranging from good fun to glitchy annoyance; primarily dealing with random dungeon warping in multiplayer. Overall, I think this game is a necessary experience for those that enjoy sandbox crafting games.

This game is legendary. I've played many episodic games and many survival games, but this game tops them all for me. I can't have a full opinion on the overall story because I have only completed the first episode of the story mode and I know there is still episodes to come. I can however say what I've currently played of the game had me absolutely immersed into a horrific and morbid survival situation. The graphics and art style is amazing and very pleasing to the eye, along with very mysterious and great characters with great voice acting and animation!  I played this and took on the assumption I was playing some couple million dollar triple A title, but to my understanding it was a kickstarted project if I remember correct.  I absolutely loved the episode introductions, very artistic and the music throughout the game is amazing - you hear it play suddenly and you feel like youre in a movie like the grey. The mechanics and gameplay are excellent and there are many different things you have to look out for to survive - there are many different ways of doing things and many different types of dangers, probably as close as you could get to a real life survival situation in a video game. The open-world aspect as well is really well done and makes you feel so small in such a large scenic world. When all episodes to the story are out I think it certainly does live up to its normal price tag, and its replayability value is also worth it. I have had nothing but fun in the 6 hours it took me to complete episode 1.  I could go on and on about how great this game is but if you like open world replayable survival games, story campaign games or netflix episodic type stuff - then I highly recommend this game - It has all of that.

This series (it is a series, so if you're reading this and looking to buy it, then you should get all 3 games) is the closest I have come to filling a void left by the disappearance of a great genre from gaming. In fact, this game didn't just come close, it did the job perfectly. If you too played some of that last generation of 90s point-and-click games (Curse of Monkey Island, Toonstruck, Discworld) and want something that matches up to that greatness, then this game is it!  Sure, it has a few tiny issues (mostly translation issues from German to English), but these can be very easily forgiven since Daedalic got the mix of funny cynical charaters, story, puzzles, dialogue and story just right, picking up where these great games left off and drawing on everything that there is to be learned from them. If you like classic point-and-click game you WILL NOT be disappointed. They haven't fiddled with the genre or tried to bring it to thr touch screen like certain other devs have - they left perfection as it was, focussing instead on what matters in these kinds of games instead of trying to re-invent a genre which doesn't need to be re-invented.  Perhaps the only thing I am annoyed with is no native Linux support and wished the devs would port this like they have with some of their other games. If you do use Linux, all three games run well on Wine - but obviously there is no guarantee or oficial support, so I would wait for a native version.

Are you ready for an epic fantasy adventure that'll leave you laughing and cheering in equal measure? Then look no further than Total Warhammer 3!  As a long-time fan of the Total War series and the Warhammer universe, I had high hopes for this latest installment - and I wasn't disappointed. From the epic battles between armies of fantastical creatures to the hilarious banter between your legendary lords, Total Warhammer 3 delivers on all fronts.  First off, the game's graphics are absolutely stunning. Whether you're marching through snow-covered mountains or battling amidst the ruins of ancient cities, the attention to detail is impressive. And the diverse range of units at your command, from demonic beasts to mighty dragons, means you'll never run out of ways to wreak havoc on your enemies.  But what really sets Total Warhammer 3 apart is the sense of humor. Whether it's a goblin shaman spouting ridiculous spells or a vampire lord bickering with her undead minions, the game's dialogue is full of laugh-out-loud moments. And even in the heat of battle, there are plenty of ridiculous moments that will keep you entertained - like when a giant frog leaps into the fray and starts swallowing enemy soldiers whole.  The game's campaign mode is also a blast to play, with multiple factions to choose from and a wealth of quests and challenges to tackle. And the addition of the Chaos faction as a playable force adds a whole new level of strategic depth and challenge to the game.  Overall, if you're a fan of either the Total War or Warhammer series, Total Warhammer 3 is a must-play. It's a perfect blend of epic battles, engaging strategy, and hilarious humor - what more could you ask for?

Kampagne:   10/10 Nostalgische Anspielungen auf die alten Modern Warfare Teile, gute Missionen, auch abwechselnd, natürlich ist hier auch die ein oder andere langweilige oder in die Länge gezogene Mission dabei, viele Missionen erinnern vom Ablauf an alte MW - Storymissionen, an sich aber eine der besten Kampagne der letzten Jahre, storytechnisch, sowie mit den "neuen" alten Charakteren. Ghost und Soap grandioses Duo in der Kampagne, auch Price kommt gut. Alejandro auch sehr geil gespielt. Wo ist Roach?! :´)    zum Multiplayer:   Leider fehlen mir im Multiplayer die nostalgischen und OG Maps der alten MW Teile,  hatte hier eig. die Hoffnung, als ich die Anspielungen und Dialoge in der Kampagne gehört habe, dass wir evtl. die ein oder andere Karte aus MW2 oder MW3  für den Multiplayer direkt zu Release erwarten können, da es für mich ein bisschen so rüber gekommen ist, als würden Activision und Infinity Ward die guten alten Zeiten wiederbeleben wollen.  Schön und gut, dass in Warzone 2.0 Karten wie Highrise, Terminal oder Dome eingebaut sind, das sollte uns aber als Community meiner Meinung nach nicht zufrieden stellen, die in WZ 2.0 eingebauten Karten zu Release als MP-Karten, hätten bestimmt richtig bock gemacht und wären meiner Meinung nach für die vielen enttäuschenden Teile der letzten Jahre ein geiles entgegenkommen und "wir haben verstanden" Signal von Activision/Infinity Ward gewesen.  Die aktuellen Karten sind meiner Meinung nach viel zu groß, da es mehrere Ebenen gibt.  Lädt viele Spieler einfach zum campen ein und führt dazu, das Spieler, die gerne ein aktives schnelles Gameplay erleben möchten, einfach mal eine längere Zeit durch die Map rennen, um dann ehrenlos von Frank, 41, mit der S-Mine in der Ecke sitzend, schön weggecampt zu werden.  Meiner Meinung nach sind Karten wie: Breenbergh Hotel ( viel zu Groß, absolut verwinkelt, unübersichtlich)  Santa Seña Grenzübergang (hinter jedem zweiten Auto liegt jemand mit Shotgun, ein Weg, kaum Bewegung, wer läuft stirbt)  Taraq (offene Map, nur Sniper die in irgendwelchen Ruinen am Campen sind, hier ist man ebenfalls als aktiver Spieler das Opfer und wird kaum spaß haben)  die schlechtesten Karten im ganzen Spiel.   Meine persönlichen Favoriten sind momentan  - Farm 18 - El Asilo - Al Bagra Festung  Eigentlich relativ kompakte Karten, die auch etwas an alte Teile erinnern, vom Aufbau bzw der Optik.  Die restlichen Karten sind Okay, kann man spielen aber fesselt nicht.  Es fehlt mal wieder das Mapvoting..    Zu den Waffen:   Finde es ziemlich Schade, dass anscheinend viele Lizenzen fehlen und Waffen dadurch einfach komplett anders heißen. Kann sein das ich was nicht mitbekommen habe, was die Namensrechte angeht, aber Namen wie MP7, SCAR, ACR, P90, Vektor etc. gibt mir einfach ein anderes Feeling und fühlt und hört sich besser an :D  Finde das komplette Waffenlevelsytem auch ziemlich kompliziert und unübersichtlich gestaltet, hätte man bestimmt auch kompakter und einfacher gestalten können, man will einfach zocken und nicht 100 verschiedene Varianten einer Waffe erstellen können. Wenn man an die alten Battlepässe aus MW2019 zurückdenkt, wird bestimmt der ein oder andere zusätzliche Bauplan für M4 und co. dazukommen, der das ganze System noch weiter ausschlachtet und unübersichtlicher macht.    Sonstiges:  Sound und Droptime finde ich eigentlich ganz gut so, Movement auch in Ordnung, könnte aber besser sein, was schnelleres hinlegen bzw. auch dropshotten angeht.    Fazit :  Ob das Spiel stand jetzt 70€ Wert ist, mag ich zu bezweifeln, ich wünsche mir eigentlich relativ schnell Karten aus MW2 und MW3 und nicht erst mit einem möglichen Map DLC im zweiten Jahr.  Sollten die Karten für längere Zeit so bleiben wie sie jetzt sind, wird der Multiplayer nicht lange überleben und die meisten Leute werden zu Warzone 2.0 abwandern, bis wieder ein Update kommt, um die Map absolut zu zerstören oder eine neue, beschissene Map eingeführt wird und dir vor die Fresse gesetzt wird, ohne Wahl. Entweder du spielst das, was wir sagen oder Pech gehabt. RIP Verdansk an dieser Stelle.  Kann man sich geben, um abzuschalten und zu zocken, hoffe auf baldigen Content, der den Namen MW2 verdient hat ( auf Multiplayer bezogen)   EDIT: Stand 31.10.2022  Nicht empfohlen, alle 15 Minuten crasht dieses Game, 70€ verlangen und dann so einen Müll rausbringen.  Wenn ihr geldgeilen Säcke nicht sofort Patches und ordentliche Maps rausbringt, hoffe ich, dass ihr nie wieder einen Cent verdient, IHR SCHEISST AUF ZAHLENDE KUNDSCHAFT, HAUPTSACHE DAS FESTGELDKONTO STIMMT

После противоречивой, на мой взгляд, 5-ой части, Capcom попытались угодить всем игрокам и охватить побольше аудитории совместив хоррор с экшеном, добавив кооп. Понятное дело экшн выиграл с огромным противовесом. Хотя бы по одной из причин что игрока будет сопровождать напарник, и слава богу не такой тупой бот, как это было в предидущем выпуске. Однако игра заточена под совместное прохождение, что крайне рекомендутся. И как бы сильно 6-ой выпуск не утратил свой жанр, дух Раккун-Сити будет о себе напоминать. Все же смело можно заявить что большая доля запланированного исполнилась. 6-ой Обитель зла, с оглядкой назад, оказался просто бешеным (в хорошем смысле). Пускай это не совсем то, что мы ждали. Однако игра подкупает всем остальным, что у нее есть, что и в праду удалось. Тут 3 компании, плюс одна бонусная, которые позволят полностью раскрыть сюжетную линию и взглянуть на нее с разных сторон. Соответственно 7 играбельных персонажей. Каждая компания по своему уникальна. Первая ориентирована на неспешный хоррор, вторая является чистокровным боевиком, ну а последние даже не поддаются чему то определенному - так много в них напихано. Разность так же в миссиях, в местах действия, в стилях рукопашного боя, оружия, да и вообще с каждой новой компанией меняется характер игры. Все это на фоне кинематографичного экшена, который так и хлещет со всех щелей. В Resident Evil 6 весьма интересные и увлекательные миссии с задачами, решения которых во многом будет зависить от взаимодействия с напарником. И подобраны такие моменты и впрямь не дурно. Еще шестая часть примечательна наличием дополнительного контента в который входят несколько режимов. Небезисвестная режим на очки "Наемники" в котором теперь еще можно играть персонажами из знаменитой Left 4 Dead 2! Дебютировал еще один интересный режим - "Охота на агентов", в ней можно подключиться к игре других геймеров в качестве монстра. В ообщем после прохождения есть стимул задержаться в Resident Evil. Новая часть оказалась все таки крутой, получилась очень хорошая игра привлекательной разнообразием во всем, с очень приятной графикой, и сюжетом. На этом пожалуй все... Играйте в хорошие игры.

在線上也能體驗到實卡的樂趣，甚至讓我有想買實卡收藏的意願。 先攻優勢大於後攻，這一直是卡牌遊戲的通病，這沒有辦法。 接著是語言問題，目前遊戲裡沒有中文，在牌局中對我們華人玩家而言，比較沒有那麼直觀，雖然打到一半去Google搜關鍵字、查對手的牌，在極短的時間內閱讀文章並對對手的牌組有一定的理解，對我來說這是很有挑戰性和樂趣啦。 然後再來是Solo模式的預組牌，我只能說是真的搞，也許是官方的惡趣味吧。 這裡許願抄牌能方便一點，例如打一串代碼就能複製別人的牌組，還有希望推出圖鑑功能，找牌、找卡包比較直觀，才不用再點進去牌組裡找牌。

Я не рекомендую покупать эту игру. Купил игру в комплекте с другими и из-за визуального стиля отложил на потом, так как гипертрофированные груди мне никогда не нравились. И вот освободился вечерок и решил всё таки попробовать данную игру и пожалел. Очень хочется сделать рефанд и вот почему: 1) Персонажи максимально картонные и манера поведения у них как в самых дешёвых порно фильмах. Из-за этого абсолютно неинтересно следить за сюжетом.  2) Накопить 1,000,000 без ухода во все тяжкие кажется вообще нереально. Я вообще не понимаю как в таких условиях героиня до начала игру умудрилась сохранить невинность. Её умудряются абузить все кому не лень. И она вообще не сопротивляется фактически. В моей голове это вообще никак не складывается. Единственный персонаж в игре у кого нет сильного желания поиметь главную героиню так это её парень.... Какого хера... 3) Здесь вообще не ощущается тема постепенного развращения главной героини или майндбрейка. Каждый встречный первым делом начинает наяривать её грудь как будто у них в городе это абсолютно естественное поведение. Героиню это вообще фактически не смущает. Так ради приличия возмутится, но абсолютно никак не мешает.   Из-за описанных выше факторов у меня пропал весь интерес к игре. Куда увлекательней и дешевле просто посмотреть видео 18+ онлайн сайтах чем тратить своё время на эту игру.

I just finished my first run. The high playtime is mostly attributed to time spent AFK, or in the My Palace mode, actually getting through the game took closer to 150 hours and I attribute that to my generally slow reading pace in social portions of the game combined with grinding in dungeons and mementos.  This game has tons and tons of story, with over a dozen of characters to build relationships and interact with. The amount of those story sections that are voice acted is less than half, but there's still enough voiced content to where it makes Persona 5 seem like a season or two of an anime, take that as you will.  I mentioned that it took me a while to read this but that's owing to my switching all of the language options to Japanese to familiarize myself more with the kanji and kana. The kanji doesn't have furigana, but that isn't too surprising considering how uncommon it is to see in Japanese media that isn't directly aimed at children.   As for the more gameplay focused aspects of the game; the build of your party becomes more diverse as you make it through the story, so it's going to be a couple dozen hours before you have a full party of 4 characters and longer still before you can start swapping them out. In addition to leveling up your party through combat, finding/buying new equipment for them, the social aspects outside of dungeons can unlock confidant bonuses that can grant new abilities be they buffs/resistances, attacks, or Persona transformations. Completely maxing out your relationships with party members and side characters widens the pool of Personas you're able to create in The Velvet Room.  The Velvet Room is a hub that can be accessed at the entrances of dungeons and in several areas of the overworld. From there you can access combat challenges, but the main reason to visit is to fuse two or more Personas into stronger Personas. You can also drop off Personas to boost their stats in the Velvet Room. Unfortunately, it's possible to get incredibly powerful Personas for free very early on since this is a complete version of Persona 5 that includes unlocked DLC as part of the new game, so it may be difficult to ignore a free high-level Persona if you want to trivialize a majority of the game.   The plot of Persona 5 is divided fairly well into arcs that cover themes of power harassment, sexual harassment/assault, suicidal depression, an over-arcing theme of free will, and quite a bit more, but the juxtaposition between those heavy topics with the fantastic ideas of changing someone's will by going through a literal mind palace and defeating their dark shadow keeps the tone from becoming too heavy. The core gameplay mechanics of using Personas is also fairly whimsical. The Personas themselves are all anime  personifications of deities, monsters, and figures from folklore or ancient religions so the idea of collecting them like Pokemon and using them to ultimately change the minds of awful people is one of the great appealing factors of the Persona games in general.   If you're interested in achievement hunting, this is one of the easier games for that. It's lengthy, but much easier to unlock all of the achievements for this game than Persona 4 Golden.   If you're interested in playing this game as a learner of the Japanese language, there are multiple voiced scenes that can be unlocked and replayed as you go through the game. Again, there's no furigana, but since a lot of terms are repeated, it's not terribly difficult to familiarize yourself with which words correspond to which kanji. Even in voiced scenes that can't necessarily or easily be replayed, there is a log function. It's restricted to giving you a log of that scene and that scene alone, but you can use it to repeat lines as long as you don't advance too far.   I played through this game a couple of times on the Playstation 4 before it was available on Steam, and I can see myself playing it again in time. It's a really engaging game, the characters are really likable, and the presentation is fantastic. I picked this up for full price on Steam and was highly satisfied.

Put simply; its a cute game that I feel kind of guilty giving a thumbs down too, but at the same time in its current state I don't really think it deserves a thumbs up. I would really only buy it on sale.  To start with the pros, firstly, is has a very cute artstyle. I have a weakness for pixel art and this game didn't disappoint. I really appreciated how each character's sprite had a unique idling animation; it helped make them feel a lot more genuine and expressed a lot of character. Backgrounds were very nice as well; all the locations felt pretty polished and sweet. A lot of the quests were just fetch quests, but they were plenty fun and I enjoyed the little cutscenes I was rewarded with for completing them. The minigames were relatively simple, but enjoyable little distractions.  Now for the cons... I would say the biggest and most pressing issue is when you're done, you're done. The quests were all fun but then I finished them all and now... There's nothing. You wake up, cure the patients that are sick in the clinic, maybe go gather some ingredients and then go to bed. Repeat ad Nauseam. Now, I know this can be the case with Stardew Valley too, but Stardew also had lots more features to it that made it feel less repetitive; collecting new items, seasonal events, customizing your farm and house, ect- Here? Not so much unfortunately, even the dating/marriage system, which is a staple of the genre has basically just been relegated to 'give the character you like a brooch and get a 10 second cutscene whenever you press the date button; it feels like an afterthought really, which wouldn't be the WORST thing ever if it weren't for the fact that there is so little else to do. Basically the game feels unfinished. Hopefully the developers will take note of this and release future updates to make the game more enjoyable.  In conclusion its a sweet, cozy sort of game, but also its lacking a lot of the depth that I'd usually attribute to the sort of 'farming and offshoots of farming sim' games, and unfortunately the lack of content is VERY noticeable, especially near the end of the main storyline.

¿Que pasa cuando mezclas plataformas, lanzacohetes y Synthwave? Tienes este juego con mucho potencial para una secuela que jamas llegara  Este no es precisamente un juego que explore de manera profunda la psicologia humana, tecnicamente es un plataformero con claros elementos de juegos como Quake y Get To The Orange Door. ademas de poder saltar, arrastrarnos por el piso raspandonos el culo y correr a mil kilometros por segundo, tambien contaremos con la habilidad de correr por las paredes y usar un lanzamisiles, con el cual podremos romper paredes, hacer "Rocket Jumps" y lo que a mi me gusta llamar "Wall-Rocket Jumps"  Un aspecto que me gustaria recalcar de este juego es la estetica, que claramente tira a lo ochentero con entornos llenos de juegos de luces y tematicas distintas en cada fase y la musica... ¡FENOMENAL! Ese sintetizador frenetico es el que realmente le da vida a este juego con freneticas melodias que encajan perfectamente con el estilo plataformero FPS y por eso me parece una pena que tan solo existan 4 canciones en todo el juego  No es para nada perfecto, la jugabilidad se puede pulir bastante ademas de que muchos niveles con objetos moviles estan a desatiempo forzando al jugador a esperar quieto cuando la gracia es no parar nunca, tambien les advierto que no es un juego que de horas de diversion, tiene 36 niveles (Mas sus versiones oscuras que reducen la iluminacion aumentando la dificultad) divididos en 3 mundos diferentes y te lo puedes pasar en 3 horas (5 como mucho) aunque pueden ser mas si intentas conseguir las medallas de Neon (Que son un dolor de huevos)  Conclusion: Neon Boost es un juego que toma lo que mas me gusta de dos generos y los combina para crear una jugabilidad muy original, me parece que una secuela estaria fenomenal para exprimir aun mas el potencial de esta formula, te lo recomiendo si quieres hacer "Rocket Jumps" sin el riesgo de volarte en mil pedazos 7/10

Po necelých šedesáti hodinách jsem tuto hru dohrál a už od začátku mně hodně bavila.  Parkour je ve vynikající a běhání po městě je čistá zábava.  Soubojový systém proti lidem se oproti jedničce hodně zlepšil, proti zombikům je to stejná zábava jako v jedničce a díky tomu že upravily zbraně tak jsem ve hře také hodně používal kromě jedno ručních zbraní i zbraně obou ruční které jsem naopak v jedničce nepoužíval vůbec. Příběh je oproti jedničce o dost lepší a bavil mně až do konce. Moje rozhodnutí mají skutečnou váhu a doteď některých z nich lituji. Samotné město je různorodé a ani po delší době mně neomrzelo jeho prozkoumávání. Hru ještě vylepšuje úžasná dynamická hudba.  K tomu si ještě přičtěte menší a větší DLC která v budoucnu vyjdou. Po celou dobu mi hra běžela plynule bez záseků nebo poklesů FPS. Za mých šedesát odehraných hodin jsem navíc narazil je na 4 závažnějších buggy (dvakrát jsem se zasekl na místě, jednou jsem propadl skrz budovu a mám rozbitý jeden úkol), zbytek problémů bylo třeba občasné mírné klipování skrz textury nebo jedna nebo dvě rozbité značky na mapě. Celkově jsem si hru moc užil a už se nemůžu dočkat až se dočkat až se do ní zase vrhnu. 11/10 DOPORUČUJI!

Пройдя эту игру на всех сложностях(1е прохождение - Survival, 2е - Nightmare, 3е - Акуму, 4е - расслабленный спидран без прокачки на Casual), со всеми DLC, могу сказать - эта игра определенно стоит своих денег(особенно тех копеек, что просят за нее на распродажах) и вашего времени.  Плюсы: -Отличные боссы; -Запоминающийся локации; -Геймплей взят с tLoU, но намного интереснее в связи с добавлением арбалета "Агония" и наличием предыдущих 2х пунктов; -Прекрасный саундтрек, как боевой(хоть вне игры его не послушаешь), так и мелодия в хабе, которая дает истинное чувство безопасности; -Графен приятный(какой он с технической точки зрения - плевать, ибо стилистика тащит); -Оптимизация в наше время уже не должна быть проблемой, но даже владельцам более слабых машин не стоит волноваться, в игре нет даже намека на статтеры или инпут-лаг, даже при низком фпс.  Минусы: -Стрельба из пистолета и магнума, основанная на рандоме, т.е. прицел представляет из себя точку с кругом, и твоя пуля будет лететь в рандомную точку внутри круга, это исправляется прокачкой меткости, но бывает бесит, когда целая обойма пролетает у врага над ухом; -Когда стреляешь вплотную к противнику пули могут пролетать сквозь него(хоть в такой ситуации ты почти никогда не окажется, если будешь осторожен).  Общая оценка: 9,5 из 10. Игра - "мастеркусок", недочеты слишком мелкие чтобы отнимать больше пол балла.

The Bloons Tower Defense series has easily given us the best tower defense games out there. Bloons Tower Defense 6 takes the crown as the best game of the series yet, making it arguably the best tower defense game. The variety of towers is insane and leaves plenty of open room for creative and versatile strategies which makes for an awesome and long-lasting experience.
Graphically it is beautiful, it has a lot of content to enjoy for hours and a great support team that is constantly updating the game adding new things and fixing bugs.

Um dos jogos mais empolgantes, divertidos e imersivos dessa geração. Você é transportado para um mundo onde tudo pode ser tocado e mesmo as montanhas mais altas podem ser escaladas. Lute contra um dragão pela primeira vez e descubra o que é uma batalha épica!

아직도 그래픽겹치고 게임튕기고 UI불편하고 별로인데 어쨋든 끝까지 다했다 100시간 넘게해도 추천은 못주겠음.  게임에 생각보다 기대를 많이 했다. 이래저래 말이 많았지만 직접해보니 실망감이 꽤 큼 게임이 만들어지기 시작한지 5년이 넘어서 그런걸까 요즘의 깔끔한 시스템이 아닌거 같음.. 먼가.. 먼가 구림 상호작용도 잘안되고.. 게임하는데 은근히 불편한점이 많은데다가 이래저래 버그가 많이 발생함 특히 몰입을 확 깨는 버그가 메인퀘에서 발생했을때 진지하게 환불각을 봤어야했는데 못해서 그냥 한다.ㅠㅠ  아무기대없이 하면 무난하게 즐길 수 있는 평작이라 생각함. 할인할때 삽시다.ㅎ

Reseña del 10º DLC de SE Resumen de lo que trae: -Una nueva Skin para pintar bloques -Nuevas apariencias para [transportadores, cajas grandes, Propulsores de hidrogeno, tanque de hidrógeno (solo para naves grandes) y una resking para las columnas para hacerlas redondas en lugar de un palo raro ] -Nuevos bloques para las placas magneticas (uno para bloques grandes y otro para las pequeñas) -Nuevos bloques de refinería industrial y ensamblador -Nuevos bloques de vigas de soporte (son decorativos)  Desde un punto de vista objetivo, es un buen DLC por el precio, además tiene muchas posibilidades para hacer que tu base parezca más una fábrica en lugar de una caja gris clarito.  Sin embargo, no le puedo dar al botón de recomendado porque ya he dejado bastante claro otras veces que no me gusta nada la dirección que ha tomado Keen Software House, hemos llegado a un punto en el que estoy pagando una mensualidad de 1€ (que no es mucho pero no tiene ninguna gracia comprarte un juego nuevo y tener que pagar el doble de lo que te ha costado para tener la mitad que te falta del juego) para que no abandonen el juego como han hecho otras veces (miner wars, medieval engineers ...). Es una pena pero tengo que darle a no recomendado hasta que encuentren una solución a que el juego cueste 17€ y tengas que pagar otros 32€ para tener todo

Pros: 1) Great mechanics. 2) Storyline is amazing. 3) Graphics are excellent. 4) Music is outstanding. 5) Voice actors do a phenomenal job making their characters come to life. 6) Highly addictive.  Cons: 1) The main storyline is way too short for the money paid. 2) The battles for the storyline are so easy that it ends the storyline too quickly.  I could have finished the storyline in approximately 20 hours of gameplay but I instead just kept killing creatures. 3) The cost should be around 29.99 instead of the 54.99 (Canada) pricetag.  Cudos to the company for convincing us that the pricetag would be worth it.   4) Although overall, the graphics are amazing, there are some significant glitches:  creatures stuck in wall so you can't kill them for your quest (have to restart); and creatures that start flying in the air (that are not meant to be flying).  I will not be purchasing the expansions considering the lack of a longer developed storyline.

Tja Fussball mit Autos ^^ Das Spiel lässt sich leicht lernen und schwer meistern. :) An und für sich lässt es sich schön für zwischendurch zocken. Jede Runde geht nur 5 Minuten und es gibt inzwischen auch mehrere Modi und Maps, welche man allein oder im Team bis zu 3 Mitspielern gegen Bots oder echte Gegner austesten kann. Das Gameplay ist recht schnell und wenn man erstmal etwas Übung hat, lassen sich auch schöne Spielzüge herrausspielen. Das einzige, was ich bemängeln kann, ist, ähnlich wie bei CSGO, die Community. Jedes Kind, welches bei euch im Team spielt, denkt, locker als Progamer mithalten zu können. Dementsprechend ist auch jedes Gegentor erstmal eure Schuld, was euch oft auch ausführlich mithilfe des Hotkey-chats klar gemacht wird.  Sucht euch anfangs am besten ein paar Kumpels oder jmd, der nicht gleich nen Herzkasper bei Fehlern bekommt, dann macht die ganze Geschichte auch spass. Hände weg von Random-mitspielern ;)  Da kann aber das Spiel an und für sich nichts dafür. Daher Daumen hoch!

This game is randomly generated megavanian. You will control a knight (every job is basicly a knight) and everytime you die your son/daughter will replace you. all the equipment and stats from previous generation will be carried by the next generation. It has a lot of upgrades, I have played for 20 hrs++ I need a hundred or two -- generations about 4000+ years in game to finish the game :D  There are a lot of grindings for this game, but somewhat it isn't boring at all.. kinda remind me of binding of isaac. maybe because the developer made a lot of templates for the room/level design. It also have 2 mini games. if you played Poo yan (a nes game) you might find a track in the game is inspired from that game  I beat this on ps4 and when it was on sale few weeks ago, I bought it again so I could play on my notebook. I highly recommend this game. I think the GUI was slighty different or maybe because on ps4 I play it on 46" inch screen and only sit about 2 metres from the TV

After an hour of faffing with settings and optimisations (INSTALL THE GAME ON AN SSD!!! This should be a system REQUIREMENT!) I have a decent frame rate at decent quality settings with my rig (setup in profile).  It's great, I am enjoying the new challenges the game offers.  Most of my stuttering issues were solved moving the game to an SSD as HDD just had awful stuttering apparently lots of textures are streamed in from the drive so zooming in an panning a HDD can't keep up.  Might help a few folk out.  I'm using the CO optimisations from their post.

It has good potential, but at it's current state, not worth the asking price. There's barebones gunplay and level design, barely anything to interact with, doesn't have any well-established SCP lore, some of the mechanics are buggy at best. Inability to scope in at random times, grenades not seeming to go off, kind of critical for a FPS (even if it is still in Alpha).   TLDR: It's a more polished Left 4 Dead 2 equivalent in the SCP universe, without the modding.  Recommend to continue to monitor its roadmap if you're interested.

※このレビューは本編の序盤の内容に触れます。  百合ミステリーノベルゲー。結構ボリュームがあります。 Tipsまで全部読んで20時間くらい。  犯人はお前だ！というようなミステリではなく、 どうなってるんだろう？とぼんやり考えながら読むようなタイプ。 ---  この作品は佐知子と貴呼(ﾀｶｺ)の百合カップルのお話です。 しかし、早々に貴呼が失踪してしまいます。 佐知子は貴呼の幻覚を見るようになり、友人に助けを求めます。 幻覚の治療をするうち、貴呼は失踪ではなく、実は亡くなっていたことが明らかになります。 と、ここまでがプロローグ。  そして第一章。貴呼視点です。 いやいや、君さっき死んだじゃん！と思い読んでみると、 貴呼は貴呼で記憶障害を患い療養中なことがわかります。  さて、こうなると「どっちが現実か？」が分からなくなってきます。ここがこの作品の大きなミステリー要素なわけですね。  百合要素の方ですが、ただｲﾁｬｲﾁｬを描写するのではなく、 「あの子と一緒にこういうことをしたなあ」 「あの子のこういう部分が好きだったなあ」 と、お互いがいなくなってしまったお互いのことを思い出しながら語ることが多く、なかなか切ないです。 ただのｲﾁｬｲﾁｬが見たい人には向いてないかもしれません。  終わってみてじんわりと「あぁ、やってよかった」と思うような、 そんなゲームです。オススメ  本当にただの余談ですが、「深く深く、誰にも見つからない場所」 というこのゲームのキャッチコピーがすごく好きです

Don't listen to those haters out there who don't have the patience in games in the working. This game is a very fun and addictive game to play, you just have to give it some time to develop and put in the time to actually play the game. The game runs very smoothly and has great graphics. I could play it for hours and hours. The only bad things are the taxes, completing a mission yet, it still thinks you haven't completed it, killing innocent people on accident instead of robbers, (but in the game you can upgrade your guy and one of them is not zapping an innocent person ever again) the tutorial needs some working on and should actually show how to do those things because I still haven't figured out how to build  tables and get plants, and OMG, THE REPAIR REPAIR REPAIR TAKES FOREVER!  Overall: This game has great potential and I can't wait to see how it grows, but it can't grow with you getting the game, so get it to help the developers develop the game more. There are way more pros than cons in this game, and I didn't feel like listing all the pros. And remember, THIS GAME IS DEVELOPING AND IT ISN'T QUITE PERFECT SO DON'T GIVE UP ON IT, BECAUSE IT WILL GET BETTER. IT IS DEVELOPING.  P.S. This game is a GREAT STEAL! it is only for 4.99! how many great games can you get this good in development for only 4.99? most games in development cost way more.

一周多一点玩了50小时来说一说  一开始也是跟着评论区的说法走，尽量不要跑，真的GP不要跑，我就要跑，前期因为怕跑一直在走同样遇不到怪浪费了很长时间。  其实很简单，你只要相信两个东西，一个是声音一个是屎，只要不是背风你永远可以放心跑直到出现警告叫声就不能跑了甚至走路都会把动物吓跑最好蹲下走，毕竟动物的警告叫声说明你距离他在150m到200m左右了，这时候你如果停下来看不到他也可以蹲下走两步看看，毕竟这游戏的步枪大部分150m以内已经指哪儿打哪儿了，不需要追求太近。不过如果不是你想打的动物也不用管，其次多看看网上关于动物的习性喝水进食休息的区域，这样才能提高效率。  跟踪脚步这东西不是很推荐，只有打中了再去追脚步效率会更高。 因为脚步只能靠屎来判断距离远近和时间，其次你掌握不了动物到底和你有多少的距离因为在运动中的动物很大概率不发警告的叫声，所以单靠追脚步往往要追很久可能都看不到动物的样子，所以！！！！！最应该相信的还是叫声！！！！！！ 加重点   ！！！！！！！“叫声”！！！！！！！！  玩了50个小时我觉得我可以算入门比较快的选手了，我已经在追求钻石满体重最佳鹿角赤鹿，满体重钻石灰熊，钻石白化狮子这种了，反正玩游戏仁者见仁智者见智，这游戏作为一个开放世界，他的风景真的我觉得截图都能做壁纸这点是真的很棒。  dlc推荐 地图除了新西兰和西伯利亚我觉得都可以入门就购买。 最适合新手和刷钱的还是silver peak动物多到把我吓到了 武器不需要额外购买武器包，育空给的.300攒钱买到就能打到毕业，加上全民都有的.270永远的神 帐篷和车也是必买的，车用来开图赶路，打猎你就别开车了要不然你是看不到动物的 这个游戏我反正是第一天就上上瘾了

(PRE AUGUST 2019 PATCH) Twice now I have purchased additional ships.  Once the game flipped out on me and put me 2 hours back before I bought the ships.  I went through the process again.  Bought two extra ships again to go along with my starter ship.  I came back to the station and they were gone.  So...  Why did I spend all that time and effort when the purchases I made with in game currency disappear?  No, I don't recommend this game at all.  EDIT: After vowing to dump this game and never play it again, (and deleting my saved games), I started playing this game again.  It still has it's little quirks here and there (MENUS! Right click or Esc?  Which is it? CONTINUITY PLEASE!!!)  The X menu!  A little more time there please! ... and the ships...  my biggest gripe.  They are really there!  The X menu is your friend!  I have yet to buy a ship and I have 4 (including the starter) and a Class A freighter!  I found 3 fixer-upper ships just by exploring.  Claimed them and fixed them up.  I got the freighter by saving it from an attack FOR FREE!  (Maybe a quick tutorial on where your ships hide in the X menu?) Oh...  and a little more time on the X menu, please?  There are some video glitches here and there and the game play does still feel a bit clunky in spots, but this game is polishing up nicely and is turning out to be a very pleasant gaming experience!  Gone are the missions to get the research specialists!  WOO HOO!  Kudos to whomever came up with the Nexus/Hub where you can meet and interact with other players!  WOW!  What a place!   I retract my earlier negative review and I can now recommend this product.

Eines der coolsten und innovativsten fps coop games die es je gegeben hat. Teamplay und Strategie sowie die eigenen Fähigkeiten als Schütze stehen hier eindeutig im Vordergrund, jedoch warne ich: Als Anfänger hat man wahrscheinlich ziemliche Schwierigkeiten und muss erst vieles lernen und üben, außerdem sind K/Ds unter 1,0 vollkommen normal. In den ersten ca. 20-40 Spielstunden hat man meistens eine K/D zwische 0,35 und 0,7. Schade finde ich, dass sich Steam nicht richtig mit planetside 2 verbindet und desshalb die angezeigte Spielzeit bei Steam bei weitem nicht der echten Spielzeit, die man zum Beispiel auf Planetside2.com/players einsehen kann entspricht. Bei mir ist es zum Beispiel so, das ich zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt bei Steam eine Spielzeit von 41,6 Stunden habe allerding in Wirklichkeit schon fast 200 Spielstunden (um genau zu seien 187 Stunden und 12 minuten) habe. Dieses Spiel ist definitiv zu empfehlen!
