Solarix - хороший научно-фантастический хоррор переносящий игрока в мир неизученного и ужасающего!  По сюжету игры главный герой с неприметным именем Уолтер приходит в себя в своей темной каюте посреди какого-то футуристического жилого комплекса. Разумеется, страдая от амнезии. С протагонистом тут же связывается местный искусственный интеллект A.M.I. и сообщает о том, что практически всю колонию поразил таинственный недуг, а Уолтеру необходимо разобраться в царящей неразберихе... Ничего не напоминает?! (System Shock 2) Большая часть истории в Solarix подается двумя способами: через аудиосообщения двух искусственных интеллектов и немногих выживших со станции, а также с помощью всевозможных электронных писем. Сценарий, несмотря на всю свою вторичность, является единственным, что способно удержать игрока у экрана. Он неплохо прописан, а озвученные диалоги оказались на удивление приятными. О System Shock напоминает и интерфейс, и даже визуальный стиль. Впрочем, нет ничего зазорного в том, чтобы ориентироваться на признанную классику! По началу Solarix держит атмосферой. Мы видим последствия распространения вируса в виде разбросанных тут и там трупов, жилые помещения в полной разрухе, а из-за угла доносятся какие-то ужасные шорохи и мелькают тени. В Solarix приходится на протяжении невыносимо долгого десятка часов заниматься только одним: высчитывать элементарные маршруты безликих врагов, а затем оглушать их шокером в спину. И повторять это до бесконечности... Система скрытности проста и банальна: на свету вас хорошо видно, в тени же можно хоть под носом у мутантов ползать. Обязательно - на корточках, потому что звуки шагов и бега имеют строго определенный радиус слышимости. Если не повезет и вас обнаружат, то можно пустить в ход пистолет с дробовиком. Но будьте внимательны: вооруженные солдаты и роботы обладают молниеносной реакцией и за долю секунды способны обернуться в вашу сторону. Мутанты и киборги, завидев героя, быстрым шагом и с ужасающей (в плохом смысле слова) анимацией направятся к вам для расправы врукопашную. Проблема Solarix в том, что она не предлагает никакой вариативности, а имеющиеся геймплейные механики реализованы плохо. В нашем распоряжении лишь три вида оружия: шокер, который действует только при ударе в спину, а также пистолет и дробовик. Если вы попробуете воспользоваться последними двумя, то обнаружите все недочеты местной шутерной составляющей. Ощущения выстрелов нет и в помине, как и чувства попадания по противнику. Сами враги дергаются, словно в первых шутерах с «рэгдоллом» конца девяностых. Но еще большая беда - это местный искусственный интеллект, а вернее - его полное отсутствие. «Огромные локации» тоже не делают процесс интересней, поскольку представляют собой полупустые широкие коробки, где нет ничего примечательного. К тому же из-за размытой постановки задачи и совершенно неинформативной карты абсолютно не ясно, что от нас требуют на данном конкретном участке.  Амбициозные стремления разработчиков можно только похвалить, но им явно нужно больше опыта. Solarix - проект с хорошей задумкой, для реализации которой стоило поупражняться на чем-то более простом. Но я думаю, что разработчикам все-таки нужно дать шанс и они когда-нибудь создадут шедевр! Сыграть же в Solarix любителям данного жанра игр я все же рекомендую!

I hate to say this, but for the moment, I would not recommend buying the game as it is today, at least not the PC release. If you're thinking of getting the game on PS4..then absolutely. Until the crashing issues (among other issues that I haven't experienced personally) are resolved, skip it.    In the time I've been playing it, I've had over 10 crashes and I've not gotten very far because of it. My current playtime says 2.7 hours, the time I've actually spent playing it is more like 1.5 hours (benchmarks, editing settings, remapping keybindings, etc., have taken up the rest of the time). That's a lot of crashes and with each one I've lost progress and had to restart quests and such. It's pretty bad at the moment.  Edit: After the latest patch I haven't had any random crashes, but no matter what I do, I will get random frame drop for minutes at a time for no reason. These will be so bad as to make the game unplayable for a time. In addition the memory leak is still an issue.

Had the opportunity to play for a few hours, so this review might change down the road once I get around playing some more.  LOVE the graphics and the overall idea of combining formation gameplay with a simple drawing mechanism and RTS. Given I have little time for most games, it's perfectly paced with small fast missions.  Now having played the early release version, it might be rough around the edges, but the devs already put out an update that fixed a lot of issues. So that's a very good sign the game's overall stability keeps improving. TBH I didn't encounter that many bugs that some here claim, maybe I got lucky or some just focus on the negative *shrug*  Highly recommended if you like: SciFi, RTS, spaceships and especially drones, and enjoy short-time fun missions (compared to overlength combats)!  It also reminds me a bit of "Deserts of Kharak", which I also liked a lot.

Full review: http://www.cublikefoot.com/review/probably-archery-game-review/  Well, this is certainly unlike anything I've ever played. Think QWOP and Surgeon Simulator, but with archery and an extreme increase in difficulty.  I can't even play the game properly. I cannot fire an accurate shot to save my life. I spent a good while in the target practice mode and not once did I hit any of the targets. I had some luck in another mode, where there were these apple-headed humans running towards me with swords. I would fire my arrow just as they were in front of me. That worked up until the game sent two of these guys at me simultaneously, then I failed, just like I did in every other mode.  Both hands need to be manipulated in order to fire an arrow. The left hand wields the bow, while the right wields an arrow. There's several different methods to adjusting your aim, but good luck getting anywhere with it. It takes some serious skill to be anywhere near good.  There's plenty of modes to try out, even a multiplayer zombie soccer mode, which I was not able to play due to lack of players online. There's actually a few multiplayer modes, including team deathmatch and a co-op wave-based 'horde' mode (all of which I was unable to try). I had the most fun with the target practice mode though. So many objects to hit, yet I missed every single shot. I was amused at my abysmal performance. I'll probably never be good at the game anytime soon.  Probably Archery does support gamepads, so maybe I would have had more luck there, but the game is fun nonetheless.

This game is your best bet at Dungeons and Dragons video game experience.  Unfortunately cost too much real money to play and the game is too dated for this amount of money to be worth it.    At the moment, you'll need at least 185$ to get the full experience (15$ for 1 month VIP subscription, 20+40+40+60$ for all the expansions, 10$ for 1 permanent NPC party member)  If you don't want to pay monthly VIP fee, you'll need about 370$ because quest packs are sold separately to the expansions.  You can play other, more modern sub-based games of similar genre, for 1 or 2 years with this amount of money.  Even LOTRO, a game by the same company, doesn't cost as much and VIP benefit unlocks are permanent.

Öncelikle bu oyun tam bir zaman süngeri olup hele de oynayan yakın arkadaşlarınız varsa oyunu sevseniz de sevmeseniz de 100 saat ve üzeri gömmeniz çok yüksek bir ihtimal.Ben bu incelemeyi oyuna 450 saat üzeri gömmüş bir insan olarak yapıyorum ve bu oyuna 1000 saat gömmüş arkadaşlarım var.Ne var bu oyunda da o kadar saat oynuyosunuz diye sorarsanız bunu hızlıca birkaç kelimeyle özetleyebilirim:rekabet hissi,rank sistemi ve en önemlisi arkadaş etkisi.Ben bu oyuna normal şartlarda en fazla 50 saat gömerdim ama arkdaşlarım oyunu oynadığı için 450 saate kadar çıktım.Oyundan yüzeysel olarak bahsettiğime göre biraz ayrıntıya girelim  Bu oyunun bir hikayesi falan olmadığından direk oynanışa geçelim.Şunu söyleyeyim oyunun oynanışı aşırı tekdüze.Zerre ayrıntı yok oyunda.Gördüğün adamı vur.BİTTİ.Tabi bu adam vurma işi oynadığınız silaha,bulunduğunuz mekana göre değişiyor ama mantık hep aynı.Vurmak."Ne bekliyodun sanki bu bir multiplayer FPS oyunu"derseniz eğer size direk Rainbow Six Siege örneğini veririm.O oyunda mantık sadece vurmak değil çünkü.Oynadığınız mapi etkileyebiliyorsunuz.Yapacağınız taktiğe göre şekillendirebiliyorsunuz.Ayrıca oynanış her maç aynı kalmasın diye operatörler var ve kendine özel bu operatörler.CS:GO da çeşitlilik sayılabilecek tek şey silah seçimi o da yetmiyor.Silah çeşitliliği aslında yeterli ama oyunu tek başına kurtarmıyor.100 maç girdiyseniz 100. maçın diğer maçlardan tek farkı rakipleriniz ve belli bir takımınız yoksa takım arkadaşlarınız.Çeşitlilik bu kadar kıt.Diğer mekaniklerden de bahsedersek:vuruş hissi yeterli sonuçta bir wolfenstein kalitesi falan beklemek saçma olur.Haritalar fena değil ama aşırı yüzeysel.Oyun modları yeterli.Grafikler yeterli.Oyun içi satın alımlar oyunu kesinlikle pay to win yapmıyor sadece oyunu kişiselleştirecek skinler veriyor.Oyuna düzenli olarak gelen güncellemler yetersiz çünkü sadece skin ekleniyor.Özellikle de Rainbow Six Sİege ile karşılaştırıldığında orda her ay başı yeni operatör gelmesi CS:GO'nun güncelleme ve yenilik yetersizliğini kesinlikle gösteriyor.  Sanırım bu oyuna karş içimi yeterince döktüm. Umarım beğenmişsinizdir.Ben bu oyunu hala oynuyorum ve sanırım bırakamayacağım :D.Şimdi hızlı bir özet geçip,puanı verip incelemeyi bitiriyim.  ARTILAR +Rekabet hissi +Takım olma hissi +Oyun içi satın alımların pay to win olmaması +Fiyatın düşük olması  EKSİLER -Çeşitlilik -Oyuna doğru düzgün yeni içerik gelmemesi -Troll oyuncular -Diğer multiplayer FPS oyunlarına yani rakiplerine karşı zayıf kalıyor 75/100 SON KARAR: Tavsiye etmiyorum çünkü günümüzde CS:GO'dan daha iyi FPS multiplayer oyunları var ve CS:GO bunlara karşı zayıf kalıyor.

Paladins, o jogo que se autodenomina "grátis", mas que, na realidade, drena sua carteira de forma sorrateira e engraçada! É como se os desenvolvedores sussurrassem: "Ei, essa skin incrível vai te deixar 100% mais legal. Você realmente quer ser o único sem ela?"  Uma das coisas mais viciantes em Paladins é a impressionante variedade de skins disponíveis. Cada uma delas parece mais incrível que a outra, e é impossível resistir à tentação de ter um guarda-roupa completo para todos os campeões. Quer você esteja lutando com um guerreiro medieval ou um personagem do espaço sideral, Paladins tem uma skin para satisfazer todos os gostos (e esvaziar suas economias).  E, oh meu Deus, as vozes personalizadas! Paladins se supera ao dar a cada skin uma voz e personalidade únicas. Você não está apenas jogando com um personagem, você está interpretando um novo papel. O cavaleiro pode ter uma voz nobre, enquanto a androide pode soar mecânica e fria. É como se você estivesse interpretando em um grande filme de ação, e cada frase soa como uma citação de filme clássico.  Claro, a verdadeira comédia começa quando você percebe que todas essas skins e vozes maravilhosas estão disponíveis para compra. Você começa com a ideia de apenas "dar uma olhada" nas skins, mas rapidamente se vê adicionando fundos à sua conta para "apenas mais uma skin". E outra. E outra.  E antes que você perceba, você está vendendo órgãos no mercado negro para conseguir a última skin lendária. Mas ei, a vida é curta, e ter um dragão cibernético com uma voz robótica é inestimável, certo?  Em resumo, Paladins é o jogo que faz você rir, chorar e gastar seu dinheiro com skins fabulosas, mas sempre com um sorriso no rosto. E, no final do dia, a única coisa que você realmente precisa é aquela skin que faz seu personagem soar como um vilão de filme de ação, porque quem não quer parecer um herói nas batalhas de Paladins? The game is not for the beginner, the game does not save as it is , you can't find the exe file anywhere or where you would normally look for it because it won't be there. I played for 3 hours won a few skirmishes against bandits., but unfortunately after logging out and then returning to play found that nothing saved. I had a difficult time getting the game to launch as well but after going into my anti virus settings I finally got the game to launch, however the game will not save and I had to create a new character and play another 2 hours only to find that it still will not save. It seems like a lot of trouble and money to lay out for a game so woefully plagued with bugs and problems and after 2 years is still broken, save your money and spend your time elsewhere.

I downvote because I play MKB, if you play controller you can skip my review because I'll only complain about the MKB support. I didn't have framerate issue and the gameplay is great so far. Graphics suck but the art is great.  So I played DS1 with MKB and struggled with the controls but that's fine DS1 is a 2011 game. I skipped every other fromsoftware game and when I got elden ring I thought they would have improved things in 11 years. Nope, things got worse.  First time loading the game every command is showing controller (first time a game doesn't detect that I don't have a controller plugged in) then I find the settings to display keyboard prompt. Of course accept is E and cancel is Q, no way to bind it. Sure why not .. Then I try to create my character, I struggle through the E and Q keys (escape/enter don't do anything), and there's no key to turn my character around. Any other game would have supported dragging the character to turn it but here you gotta click the tiny arrows. So I rush through these steps to get in the game. But first I need to do my keybinds. For some reason G is not mappable. I play ESDF so G is very important for me, it's my "use" key. But in Elden Ring G is bound to "map" for some reason and there's no way to change that. I looked in the config files and there's only graphic options there. So I set "H" which sucks but at this point I just want to play.  Also I was thinking about what I could use to switch targets and realized that the mousewheel would be ideal.. You guessed it: can't bind the mousewheel.   So I get in the game and of course I need to set my sensitivity to something lower. I took one look at the bar and knew immediately that the lowest settings would not be enough. So I went through the razer interface to set up a lower DPI (from 400 to 200) it's the first time I had to do this in my life. On the razer viper ultimate the DPI button is below the mouse so it's not the most convenient setup.   Then I get to move my character and the first thing I notice is that when moving from left to right the camera doesn't move with the character, instead it stops and follows the character. Which is idiotic because if I want to strafe left and move my mouse to the right to rotate the view around my character then the movement of the camera counteracts the movement of my mouse and the view end up not rotating at all. In short if I want to walk towards something and suddenly look behind me I have to stop moving for a second, 180 the camera real quick and move backward. I cannot do it progressively because when I start strafing the camera will get stuck. It's especially annoying in an open-world environment with great art because I want to look around while heading somewhere, but because of this the view is choppy and gets stuck. It's a horrible experience. I read about this issue and it was in previous DS already but it could be fixed by mods. Of course there probably won't be mods for elden ring because of easy anticheat so I'll be waiting on devs to fix that (spoiler alert : they won't)   Finally i got to the point where I need to equip items in the quickslots. The keybinds for quickslots are (I kid you not) H+Q, H+W, H+V and H+C (remember, H is my "use" key...) . I wish I could rebind them to 1, 2, 3, 4 but the game doesn't allow me to.  So yeah I don't think a single QA from FromSoftware tried to play the game with MKB, they didn't fix a single issue concerning MKB in 11 years of developing games and I feel sad rewarding them with my money for this disgusting state of a game

더서지를 만든 회사에서 만든 액션알피지게임.  이름없는자가 신비의 건틀릿을 만나고, 세상을 탐험하면서 구하는 이야기를 가진 게임으로 드넓은 사막/황야를 탐험하는것이 캐치포인트인 게임이다.  지역이동으로는 총 4개의 맵을 이동할 수 있고, 월드로는 3개의 월드가 있으며, 각 월드마다 메인퀘스트를 진행하면서 중간중간 사이드퀘스트 및 수집요소등을 찾아갈 수 있다.   이 게임 처음 트레일러보고 재밌을 것 같아 예구를 지매했지만, 생각보다 많은 단점과 버그로 인해서 재미를 느낄수가 없었으며, 스토리도 그렇게 재밌지 않았어서... 대충대충 넘겨서 그냥 대략적인 스토리만 아는 수준이다. 따라서 다른 평가에서는 스토리를 그래도 한 문단 길게 적긴 했는데, 이 게임은 그렇지 못하였다.  장점이라하면 그래도 드넓은 오픈월드를 탐험하는 재미? 이 정도 인 것 같고... 이 게임이 복합적으로 평가받는 이유를  보면 다음과 같은 단점 떄문인 것 같다.  1. 집나간 타격감 일단 이 게임 타격감이 없어도 너무 없다. 그냥 애들 떄리는 거에서 타격감이 무슨 뿅망치로 떄리는 것 마냥 타격감이 없어서 전투에서 일단 재미가 떨어진다. 심지어 패드로 게임을 진행해도, 진동을 전혀 느낄 수 없기 떄문에, 패드로해도 전투에서 손맛을 느낄 수 없었다. 이런 액션게임에서는 손맛이 상당히 중요한데, 이걸 못느끼니 재미가 반감 될 수 밖에.  2. 각종 버그들 게임을 진행하면서 각종버그들이 꽤나 많이 보였다. 심지어 게임 초반부에, 병사가 문 열고 들어가라고 하는 부분이 있는데, 그 부분에서 문은 열렸는데 진행이 안되었다. 결국 이거는 게임을 껏다 다시켜니까 해결이 되긴 했는데, 이러한 버그들이 생각보다 꽤나 많았다. 아니 게임 시작  10분만에 버그 터지는데 당연히 짜증이 나지 않을까 싶다.  3. 속도감 부족 트레일러를 보면 모래를 슬라이드하면서 횡단하는게 상당히 맛깔나 보이는데, (본인도 그것때문에 구매한게 큼) 실제로 해보면 별거 없다. 속도감도 많이 느껴지지 않고 밋밋한 느낌만 들었다. 뭔가 좀 더 속도감있게 만들었으면 괜찮지 않았나 싶었다.  4. 기타 그 외에도, 미니맵이 없어서, 매번 지도맵을 크게 틀어 봤던 것이 불편하였다. 안그래도 이 게임 수집요소도 많은데 메뉴 들어가서 매번 맵 보는게 귀찮았다. 또한 가끔 게임진행하면서 퀘스트라인이 먹통이되서 다시 재설정해주는 것도 짜증났으며, 56000원짜리 게임인데 엔딩까지 이것저것해서 보는데도 13시간이면 끝났다. 분량이 무슨 소태도 아니고 짜도 너무 짯다.  더 빨리 클리어하면 메인스토리 10시간이면 엔딩 볼 수 있을 정도. ..     물론 유저들 말로는 그래도 더 서지에서 나왔던 단점들은 좀 보완이 되었다고 하는데,,, 막상 해보니 정말 별로였던 게임이었다.. 스토리도 그렇게 재밌지도 않았고... 이것저것 문제점들이 더 많으니 게임이 더 별로였던 것 같다.  그래도 해보고 싶은 분들은 세일 왕창할 때 구매하는 것을 추천. 정가로 구매하기엔 돈이 너무너무너무너무 아까운 게임.

game: METAL GEAR SOLID V: THE PHANTOM PAIN
review: I kept you waiting huh, I feel like I have completed enough of mgs 5 to give a review now. In short... It is a Hideo Kojima game, and so-far it is my game of the year.  At length...  negatives -story has some call backs that new players won't understand  -Konami, I don't need to say more -long game(at 24% completion at 34.7 hours) -Multiplayer(turned it off)  Positives -Game play is challenging AI adapts to the way you attack the enemies -ex if you use gas grenades too much the enemies will wear gas masks. -Open wold with 2 large maps -Story is easy to follow for new players  -Tons of guns/tools/vehicle/buddies to approach combat in different ways -You can play Ride of The Valkyries on your speakers as you fly into the battlefield(or what ever music you like) -Soviets like western music in the 80's  -long game (tons of hours to experence the immersive world) -can go the whole game with out killing a soul or make rambo look like a sissy -can steel a whole tank with a balloon (Do I need to say more?) -get a petting zoo -and a puppy    Special to Kojima studios(all who were involved) in making this game that is a blast to play, all your hard work made a game that I have fun playing for 34.7 hours in a week, with college. Props to you

A very cool idea, that I'd be happy to pay for if not for the fact that too much work still needed for it to be usable.  1. Additional nodes; - like for example a node to create solid angle gradients with multiple modes; - or/and a node to reproject photometric data from a picture + parametric ways to create pictures to reproject from. etc. 2. More modes for mix node (at least add Subtract) 3. Fix rendering and export node so that to preview changes in the graph you don't need to delete and recreate it every time. 4. Shortcuts and menus (Backspace to delete a node = heresy) 5. Architecture. You don't need multiple processes to do what this thing does. It's not Chrome, cool. Moreover, they persist after I close the app and i think you have a memory leak somewhere in there. Bad. Very bad.  I hope this recent 20k grant will help you to whip this thing into shape because it really can become a very good addition to any CG toolbox.

game: Vampire: The Masquerade - Shadows of New York
review: While visual novels aren't usually my cup of tea, I found myself quite enjoying this story. The background art was amazing, and the music worked quite well. I am not familiar with the World of Darkness that this story takes place in, but the glossary the game provides is a nice way to learn more. There is also the function to quickly skip through dialog which makes exploring the different decisions and their outcomes super simple. As for the story itself, I enjoyed it, even if I got the bad ending my first playthrough =)

I'm not quite finished yet (half way atleast) but so far so good.  Gameplay itself is mediocre to be fair but the atmosphere, the graphics, the sound, the music, the lore, the story and last but not least the topic of mental health make it a clear recommend.  The hardest battles are indeed fought in the mind.

Hmm....As a person who loved the Dune games of the past, I'm like 70/30 with this. 70% negative, 30 positive. I went and bought this game blind, so that I can be surprised by every element of the game. I know it's early access, but there is not a lot going on in the game. It's like a mixture of Civilization and any RTS game. If they are intending to add vehicles and flying units later on, I feel like they should've done that before releasing the early access.  If you're looking to experience things from the old Dune games, this is not it. I feel like they made it more complicating than it has to be. Too many different currencies, no vehicles, and it gets repetitive, really fast. You just run back and forth with soldier type units. You can trade with factions that you're  attacking, which I found to be weird. Every area around you will attack at random, so I'm not sure why treaties are even a thing. They should've chosen either Civ style completely or RTS because I love both genres, and it just doesn't mesh well here.

Как Spec Ops: The Lyne, но ещё и с интересным геймплеем и в киберпанк-сеттинге. Тем не менее сражаться с ними интересно, особенно с боссом-мотоциклом. Вообще погони являются сильной стороной игры, особенно если подрубить пхонк XDD Да, на самом деле саундтрек подкачивает :р Сама игра проходится быстро - у меня на прохождение на нормале ушло 11 балдёжных часов. I am absolutely in LOVE with the OL series.  Our Life: Now and Forever was the first one that I played albeit being just a demo as of now. However, when my friend mentioned about Our Life: Beginnings & Always, I was immediately interested and I was HOOKED. The choices and customization is something I haven't seen for a game that's completely free besides DLCs. I don't think I can play any other visual novel dating sim the same way again. It's just so replayable and I have spent money on the Baxter and Derek DLCs which were incredibly worth it. I have gotten many of my friends into it which just proves how lovable it is.  Our Life: Beginnings & Always had me at the childhood friends to lovers and I just completely fell for Cove as we grew older together. Loved him so much that I had bought the wedding DLC which couldn't have made me happier, I teared up with friends as we read the vows. This game is just so sweet, it feels like a warm hug. I COMPLETELY RECOMMEND GETTING THE GAME.

Стоит ли  в это играть?Вопрос не простой.Фанатам серии дарк соулс рекомендую,но если вы не испытывали сложности хотя бы на половину сложности серии игр дарк соулс,то я крайне не рекомндую вам это играть.Причем здесь дарк соулс и мать его платформер?Ответ прост,обаигры очень сложны и требуют скилла.  Из плюсов:  -Редактор -Музыка -Простота -Аккаунты и его сохранение -Мультиплатформенный  Минусы:  -Надоест вам после 2000+ часов  ВНИМАЕНИЕ! Если вы все таки решили играть в это исчадие ада,то крайне рекомундую вам запастись чем нибудь вкусным.Будь то чипсы,конфеты,газировка.Ибо тушить пукан чем то нужно,а то сгорит стул.В крайнем случае за место вкусного,можно использовать банальный огнетушитель.  Вердикт: Рекомндую! ДЕСЯТЬ ГОРЯЩИХ ПУКАНОВ ИЗ ДЕСЯТИ

Overall, this game is a big fun time consumer. This game will for sure scare you, but it is also fun, with friends, this game can be hilarious, making jokes at the ghost, calling their mom homosexual, but this game will for sure scare you, I have had this game since October 2020, about a month after it came out for early access. I still get scared, I hate being in a room alone, mostly its because I don't wanna lose my cash and tools but its just scary because if you are in the Ghost's room and a hunt begins, you'll shit your pants if you aren't out of that room in time. Not a professional game reviewer but if I had to give this game a review at the moment it is in Early Access and the direction it is heading, I would definitely give it a 10/10, this game is just so fun, sure AI is sometimes shitty and glitchy but players have to make it that way.

review: -Counter Strike Global Offense is another one of those Team communication games. If you dont communicate, you lose 16 rounds in a flash.  Kill someone with a P90 - "You're noob!! Noob weapon!!"  Kill someone with a P90 through a smoke - "You're a hacker!!"  Kill someone with a AWP - "You're a noob!! Noob weapon!!"  Kill someone with a AWP through a door - "You're a hacker!!"  In a 1 vs 5 you die - "You're a noob!!"  In a 1 vs 5 you win - "You're a hacker!!"  Kill someone with a headshot - "Hacker!!"  Get headshoted by someone - "Owned!!" and get teabagged  Kill someone with a grenade - "Luck!!"  Get killed by someone with a grenade - "AHAHAHAHA"  Get teamkilled by someone - "Get out of the way you idiot!!"  Accidentally teamkill someone - "You're a idiot!!"  Blocked by someone - Dies  Accidentally blocks someone - "Get out the way you idiot!!"  Decide to save - "You're a coward!!"  Decide not to save - "Save you idiot!!"  Kill someone while defending the bomb - "You camper!!"  Kill someone while defending the hostages - "You camper!!"  Someone dies - The deceased one starts to rage  Your team lose the round - Your team starts to rage  Your team is losing 10-2 - Someone rages quit  Go to the balcony in Italy - "You hacker!!"  Worst guy receives a drop - "Are you serious!?"  Warm up - Everybody tries to spawn kill  Score is 5-1 in your favor - "This is a T map!"  Score is 1-5 againts you - "This is a CT map!"  Lose the first 2 rounds - Someone asks to get kicked  Last round - Everybody buys Negev  Your team is loosinh and you are in last - Someone vote kicks you  Win a match - All enemy team rages  Lose a match - Yout team rages  Someone's Internet crashes - 30 minutes ban  Your Internet crashes - 7 days ban  I feel like CSGO has literally turned into a rage simulator.  Thanks Valve....

独立游戏打折前各种免费更新！打折后更新1点就改成低CL卖？本身也不如巫师3这种的三A内容多？  抢先体验的出低LC不知道是你妈什么东西？哦对了-现在都流行光速正式版了！应该不是某30%贵族教唆的。  dot和C爱死够和这群独立游戏真恶心--以后宁可索任起码人家都是完成品 独立半成品不更新或者更新点出低LC各种欺骗？ 因为30%罩着就可以说小工作室啥的各种道德公平？ 到塔2本身就火好意思说录啊录太火不好？然后火不好火的都跟风却自己还想更火？送steam那么多钱还骂腾讯？  倒塌2和c爱死够在steam平台就可以说别人火不公平？自己火带动别人玩单机？ 是啊--带动人们玩单机--独立那点内容那么贵？疯狂地隘路C？  坑着30%钱拿小工作室当v爹的挡箭牌？  这种狗绝对比腾讯还会请水军吧？大学生都不要！至少名校研究生博士吧？ 不然怎么现在渲染的steam贵族感那么大？ 爹宁可玩的少-宁可井底之蛙！-也没钱了解1堆半成品游戏-宁可看书去 宁可去玩索任起码没这么多独立挡箭牌起码没贵族2和全球开箱精英 宁可去玩网游养老  玩那么多送那么多钱-耗那么多生命-就为了游戏圈不是井底之蛙？ 你以为谁管你是啥东西？  反正我觉得只玩录啊录的这辈子也不会无聊了。那么又何必玩那么多？玩给谁看？  正常的是想玩的多的去玩--想只1个玩精通不墨迹的就玩1个--难道不对吗？ 非要都玩的多吗？-简直比高考要求都高？你考你妈清华北大呢还是玩游戏呢？  某30的狗是坚定渲染玩的多的人是正常人--希望你们有那么多钱当正常人吧.  希望你们有足够的青春去当正常人吧.  索任肯定也是如此宣传-但steam就像上边说的还有其他恶心的地方半成品低LC+只想玩单机却有贵族2吃鸡吃S够啥的碍眼-谁让我已经习惯玩那么多了-到时候忍不了也只好去稍微恶心程度小点儿的索任了

From my limited amount of time playing, i have found it very enjoyable. Its a very enjoyable game which can be extremely scary at times especially with having to manually load mags and being the first game I've played that has weapon jamming.  However in my small time playing I have come across several problems, crashes being the biggest. The first mission I chose was to go to the supply depot and get any artefact and while I was approaching the gates and had killed the first fragment the game had a fatal error, after restarting the game I explored the hangers and knelt down to open a supply crate and refill mags when I crashed again after restarting and trying to refill mags again I crashed a second time. only message I got was along the lines of "fatal error UF4 has crashed".  On the plus side on the restarts I didn't lose any progress.  The pistol handling with griping with a second hand is also annoying, you have to bring your second hand from the bottom of the grip not the side inline with your primary hand otherwise the gun will swap hands. its very annoying.

[h1]Что такое Goliath?[/h1]  Это игра в которую стоит поиграть. А почему? Сейчас узнаете в этом обзоре.  Про игру узнал где-то 1-1,5 год(а) назад. Мне она очень понравиласть. Когда появилась в стиме я её сразу же добавил список желаемого и ждал с нетерпением.  [h1]Об игре:[/h1]  Goliath - это Action/Adventure от третьего лица с элементами RPG. Основу игры составляют сражения с гигантскими монстрами при помощи самодельных роботов, собранных из различных материалов. В игре достаточно много внимания уделяется крафтингу и исследованию мира. При этом в игре много квестов, как сюжетных, так и побочных. Разрабатывается и дорабатывается русским разработчиками из Новосибирска Whalebox Studio.  [b]Да да[/b] русскими редко увидешь ,что бы игру разрабатывали (покрайне мере я знаю мало игр разрабатываемые русскими). По мне игра заслуживает вниманиея. Графика в игре смесь don't starve и borderland. Выглядит всё приятно,глаза не режит от неё. В игре мы имеем тех самых голиафов. Имеется много кастомизации для них. Тут и деревяный ,угольный,каменый и т.д. Помимо двух ударов: обычный и сильный,есть способность. У основных голиафов: деревянный,каменый,бронзовый и кристалический. Они разные. Квестов предостаточно. Они всячески разнообразные от обычных (убить,принисти и т.д до похода в пещеру за приключениями). Присутстует и юмор у персонажей который интересен и премлен для такой игры. Мир заселёи разнообразными противниками и персонажами. Имеются несколько фракциий. Прикотором получаем репутацию. Она же влияет на игру. Разработчики незабывают про игру и исправлют баги,глюки и т.п. Помимо всего перечисленого как же не упоменуть удобное управление на геймпаде (по мне удобнее чем на клавиатуре) и то ,что будут выходить [u]бесплатные[/u] dlc (прям как в ведьмаке :) ). В том числе один из dlc долгожданый мультиплеер ,которые многие ждут. Когда я играю у меня появляется небольшую чувство гордости тем,что разрабатали игру именно русские. Спасибо разработчикам за игру. Буду продолжать играть и наслождаться ей.

100% the game in 10h. The game itself is nice, you have 4 characters with 2-3 different build options per character. 3 things I didn't like:  1. The animations are really slow. When you queue your quick attacks, the feel like they are taking forever. The enemy debuff effects trigger 1 by one, so you have to wait additional few seconds every turn and this really kills the vibe 2. Hard to build a specific build, since the game doesn't tailor your build per the cards you selected. You are dependent on the RNG gods sometimes 3. Final level is buggy. Whenever you choose to summon an ally, the camera won't freely move anymore. It becomes stuck to you, which is really not a good experience.  Apart for that the game is a nice, simple story to complete.

Walking simulator pretending to be a puzzle game. Get Dreamfall or Ether One instead.  Syberia 1 was good, tedious at times but good. This one... so much walking. I'm actually playing other  games on my phone while waiting for the aptly named Ms Walker to walk to her next destination. After about 45 minutes of gameplay I mostly stopped listening to the conversations she has with the AI because I'm getting further with guessing than following the conversational clues and cues.  I got it on sale bundled, I don't recommend buying it otherwise. At least it has trading cards.  For the first 20 minutes of Syberia 1 I did not know running was possible but, still, I persevered and I finished it, and enjoyed it (mostly). When I saw that I could run in Syberia 2 I was elated... then really disappointed that it was still so slow.  Each screen has a set number of steps that it takes to get across before it switches to the next one and it starts all over again - cross the screen, switch to new screen,cross the screen, switch to new screen, cross the screen, switch to new screen, end up at a screen where you have to do one thing and then make your way back the way you've just come.  The issue is that so many of the screens are just ornamental. And when you have to pass through four screens of pointless (but good looking and enjoyable at least twice) scenery for the fifth time just to check on if you might have missed something before having to run back the same way... that's not fun.  Walking simulator, power-walking simulator, scenery simulator - still not fun.

Co mogę powiedzieć o tej grze? Pillars of Eternity jest grą przyjemną, fabuła wciągneła mnie jak tornado, w pewnych momętach nie potrafiłem wcisnąć Esc, by z niej wyjść, ponieważ nie chciałem zostawić niedokończonej misji. Rozgrywka mi się podobała, choć niekiedy postacie potrafiły robić rzeczy które nie były do końca normalne (potrafiły przejść połowe mapy po to by dotrzeć do wroga od tyłu, w trakcie walki, kiedy można było się zakraść w bardziej łatwiejszy sposób...)  to ogółem cała rozgrywak jest całkiem dobrze dopracowana, jak na na klasycznego rpega przystało.  Najlepszym aspektem tej gry dla mnie był system zadań. Większość zadań była bardzo ciekawa, ponieważ zawsze opowiadały ciekawą historie. Czasami zdażały się zadania zabij to lub przynieś tamto, jednak były one zbalansowane i się nie nudziły. System tworzenia postaci jest naprawde dobry. Mamy do wyboru kilka ras i klas oraz życiorysu jak i pochodzenia, Bardzo mi się podobało to, że każda stworzona przezemnie postać była INNA. Mało to wprowadzono w Pillarsach system historii. Każda misja oraz nasze zachowanie, wybór w grze, jest rozpisywany w osobnej karcie którą zawsze możemy przeczytać i zobaczyć jak wykreowaliśmy wzorzec postaci, co zrobiliśmy, jak to wszystko zostało opisane. Czułem się jak bym czytał naprawdę dobrą książke. System rozwijania postaci jest też dobrze wykonany. Jest dzięki niemu ogrom opcji np: Zrobić maga który posługuję się bronią białą lub barbarzyńcę z różczką. Gra jest dobrze zrobiona i ogromnie ją polecam.  + Świetna fabuła + Muzyka + Grafika jest bardzo miła dla oka + Całkiem dobrze stworzony system tworzenia postaci oraz jej rozwijania. + System historii + Zadania + Ciekawe postacię + Trudność + Możliwość resetowania klasy postaci  - Si towarzyszy - Źle zrobiona postać = nie skończenie gry

New Players: Your name can include a space. If your favorite name is taken, consider adding a space followed by a surname. You don't need to cram them together, add numbers, underscores, dashes, or anything else. You don't need to spend several hours trying to come up with some random combination of words that isn't already taken (I'm looking at you, BDO). Yes, names have to be unique, just like in most MMO's, but I'm sure that with proper utilization of your space bar, you'll be able to work out something you like.  Also worth noting: If you give your character an inappropriate or offensive name, it may (very likely) get reported.    So, at this point, I've owned the game for a little over a day, and have played for 21 hours of that. Good game. It's been a while since I've gotten that "new MMO" feeling, and this one's only been out a week. Sure, there's beta testers that hit the ground running, and people like me who marathon new games, but generally speaking, you're not the only n00b in a world of several-year-veteran players. Literally everybody is fairly new, so it's doubtful that you'll feel too out of place as you learn.    I have to say, I'm truly impressed with the game overall. It's open world with a unique setting. I've had to tweak the keymapping a little bit to suit my taste, but overall, it doesn't feel too cumbersome. One recommendation: by default, swapping weapons is two different buttons (1 and 2), one for each equipped weapon, but there's a function that simply swaps between the two. You should map that instead (so you don't accidentally hit 3 and eat a piece of bread in the middle of a fight).    IF YOU ARE COLORBLIND, like I am, you'll be happy to know that New World offers several colorblind modes to fit your particular chromatic limitations. It's honestly the most options I've ever seen a game offer in that regard. The audio is absolutely fantastic. I'm very impressed with the level of detail given to ambient sounds, which really makes the world feel immersive.    At this time, you can't change your character's appearance once you've created them. There's a popup that explains this when you go to finalize your character, but I've still seen people ask. Also, you can't currently change servers, but there's a rumor that the option may become available soon. I don't know any more detail than that. There's already several guides, an interactive resource map, and HOURS of footage online, so you should have plenty of resources to look up anything you may need to figure out.    There's some opportunities to get some custom skins for your equipment, so you don't need to run around looking like a hobo (unless that's your thing). Unfortunately, a couple of the opportunities were exclusive to the closed beta and launch day (but I didn't like those outfits anyway), however, there's a Twitch drop event going right now that'll get you some sweet weapon skins. If you get the Deluxe edition, you get an additional set of armor skins, AND if you're an Amazon Prime member, there's another free set of armor skins for you (which is what I currently use).    So, I'm sure you're probably wondering about subscriptions, micro-transactions, PTW, etc. At the time of writing this, there aren't any. The only things you can get in the cash shop are cosmetic items (weapon and armor skins, emotes, that kind of thing), nothing that will help you in any way at all. I can't speak for the future, because we've all been burned before, but right now, Amazon seems to be doing this whole thing right.    In all: Highly recommended for human players. Probably not the right game for sharks, they're not very good at operating keyboards.

Now there's a reason why just about every reviewer you've read says that this game is the best game out there, and I'm glad they made this an all-VR game, too, since it's so superb that any hard-core "flat-screen" gamer will be an immediate VR convert after having played only five minutes of th, is. For once inside, you'll be wandering cold, wet, slimy caverns deep underground (some will be made of cinderblock and fluorescent lamp with Soviet-era rubble strewn throughout, others will have so much alien biological overgrowth that you can scarcely move around it). You'll be fighting zombies or plucking off Combine combatants from an elevated position on a bright, sunny afternoon, figuring out how to work a switchboard consisting of nothing but a 4 x 4 grid array of pushbutton switches while in a rotten swamp of corpses, filth, and walls with very strange, glowing alien hieroglyphics, and having meaningful conversation with Russel, your guide for this game*.      *Note: I am currently at Chapter 4 (of 10), meaning I haven't even played half this game yet.       You will be hard-pressed to find a visual effect that does not look photo-realistic. The entire game is like this: the detail is quite astonishing, and many scenes are so true-to-form that you will wonder if you're watching actual video footage. The effects are that good. Physics effects are equally as detailed: empty cardboard boxes land with a soft thump and rock back and forth a couple times before coming to a complete rest; heavy objects can be thrown farther and are louder on impact. the rustling of your clothes can be heard when crouching down or investigating. Echo and reverb give a good sense of room size and position. Hand weapons are very accurate: if you're missing shit then it's not the game, you really do suck at aiming. Your laser-sight will produce a bright red spot that nervously flutters on the target, with a round fired from the weapon landing exactly where the red spot was. The laser spot becomes more composed and relaxed as you hold your arm out in a more controlled manner.  The file size is just enormous at 70gB! Although this game is six times as large as my next largest game (Lone Echo; 13gB), this game plays like it. It plays like something large ad grand, like a superbly-written, 5-Star movie that has a running time of days (broken up in volumes) rather than hours, only unlike the movie, you're playing the main actor!  Will you like this game? Yes. I don't need to know your likes or preferences, this game really is everything to everybody, so you will lie it without me needing to know anything more of you. It is a firearm/action game, but not excessively. It's a horror game, too, since therre are countless sequences that will have you shitting your pants and taking blood pressure pills. An adventure game? Yes, you can say that Half-Life Alyx is first and foremost an adventure game. And what an adventure it is, where, by the time you're done, will make you feel as if you've explored about half the city of Soviet-era Moscow...

One of my favorite RPGs, great creepy settings, a variety of vampire types, and unlike most RPGs your faction has a real effect on game play. You do need to get the latest unofficial patch, but it is totally worth it. It is an older game and was dropped by it's developer as they were going out of business, but the community, and some former Troika employees volunteered their time to finish it and make it great. If you have any interest I recommend trying it.   I met Leonard Boyarsky, the game's art director, who also worked on Fallout 1 and 2, and many other great games. I tried talking to him about Bloodlines, but it was apparently a sore subject. I don't think he knew how good it became after release. But anyway, he was a really cool guy and the game is a lost gem.

确实很柏青哥了，真实赌狗游戏。 80%的弹珠都是废物，只是看上去机制很有趣，但是要不是数值上判死刑，要不就是被机制坑死 获取新弹珠的手段过多，移除的方法却寥寥无几，还要占用弹珠升级的机会 套路极度依赖个别遗物和弹珠，衔尾回声流碰不到？事件直接不成立，炸弹流碰不到刷新背包只会慢性死亡，升级流根本不要升级弹珠而是套娃和升级遗物等等 最糟心的一点是苦痛难度只剩1颗刷新钉，开局没有+1刷新钉的遗物可能连森林BOSS都见不到 而制作组似乎明白自己的设计缺陷，慷慨地给出了应该是所有肉鸽LIKE游戏中最大方的RELOAD机制，玩家可以肆意退出读档来获得更好的道具、更有利的局势，但结果就是游戏大半时间都在为了在废物中捞取那一两个关键物品重开读取，如果不这样，仅靠被硬塞进手的石头根本无法前进，这样显然并不能认为是有趣 =============================================== 经过更新之后虽然之前的问题还有存在，但商店的加入解决了玩家一直被石头困扰的困境，想走石头流派也更容易找到关键道具（虽然我承认我根本不想拿着一堆石头去等方尖碑），不再如之前那般急需某些强力物品才能通关了
其實還好只有外星人有特殊技能 其他都是在玩道具跟任務而已 個人覺得至少要有三種像是外星人以特殊能力的職業

game: The Gallery - Episode 1: Call of the Starseed
review: In short, this is what an adventure game in VR should be.  Great use of scale and lighting. The environments are pretty rich and interactive (including objects that don't serve real gameplay purpose), but this does mean that when you actually find an object you want to move and can't, it's disappointing. The story is just getting started so I don't know whether it'll be a selling point, but it's a good hook so far imo.  The inventory and locomotion systems take just a short while to get used to and then are pretty good. Stowing items over your shoulder and retrieving them from the backpack handles the large inventory cleanly and is more immersive than a menu.  I hope episode 2 is a bit longer and has trickier puzzles but this is a great introduction.

Com temática espacial e um Design de Universo maravilhoso, Warframe consegue trazer uma experiência de jogabilidade fluida no combate e um pouco menos fluida no desenrolar das missões do "modo história", entrarei em detalhes em relação em breve. Seguindo em frente o jogo possui diversos sistemas para as mais varias funções, o que traz muita profundidade ao game mas, ao mesmo tempo, complexidade que, em conjunto do sistema de acúmulo e drop de materiais/itens faz com que se torne um pouco massante para o player fazer algo fora da missão principal, já que ele possui muitas opções nas primeiras horas de jogo e não possui o conhecimento total do que lhe fará bem nas missões que estão por vir e pelo motivo que o próprio jogo não lhe incentiva, nem o penaliza por repetir missões para o chamado "Farm", tais fatores trazem confusão aos players novos mas apartir do momento que os players já conhecedores ajudam passa a ser fácil. O jogo também possui um grande problema de buracos de explicação mais clara, para o que se deve fazer em determinadas opções de ações no jogo, o que faz necessário que se utilize com frequência a wiki do jogo o que, convenhamos, não deveria ser como os novos player adquirem conhecimentos do jogo. Voltando no "modo história", chamado de "Jornadas", nada mais é do que um método para tentar organizar a progressão do player, já que em versões anteriores a atual de Warframe, a progressão do jogo muito mais confusa. Essa tentativa deu "certo" já que se feito de maneira minuciosa é possível fazer as primeiras 3 jornadas corretamente(onde estas te dão noções básicas e liberam inúmeras funções básicas). Embora obtiveram sucesso com a organização do progresso do player, isso foi ao custo de uma sequência cronológica para a "história" do jogo que é muito ignorada pelos players, não que os players estejam errados por ignorar, mas sim pois, os players entram no jogo multiplayer onde pensam que só é um FPS Alienígena e em nenhum momento é explícito que o jogo possui uma história e o player possui um propósito naquele universo. As tais jornadas lhe dão explicações sem muito início e apenas lhe dizem que vc é o meio para o fim de determinada missão. Embora Hajam muitas críticas ruins nesta análise, recomendo esse jogo pois é um jogo que, passado estes problemas e encontrando as pessoas certas pra lhe ajudar no jogo, se torna atrativo e lhe incentiva a querer ter mais warframes para poder jogar em diferentes estilos.

This game almost got a thumbs up...BUT.... The main core mechanic, which is ..well..platforming...sucks. The controls feel floaty and annoying and just generally induce rage.  Also theres  this weird 'fear' mechanic which just sends you running off into pits of doom.  Feels like early broken alpha release.  Everything just floats around the screen, feels like they smeared the physics engine with butter.  A real shame since I really do like the premise, pixelart and music  It has charm but sadly its not enough. It shows the developers put alot of effort into this, but I have to judge this game based on how enjoyable it is to play and not just for development efforts.  The game is just A$$ to play.  I think this would have worked a whole lot better as an adventure game instead.

AC:O has really exceeded my expectations. I'm not a devoted player of the Assassin's Creed series, only dabbling in the early games, but Origins is much more of an open-world RPG and offers a really amazing mix of gameplay elements. The world is absolutely beautiful, blending Ptolemaic and Alexandrian archietcture and cultures into a rich world that is ripe for exploration.  The voice acting and character development is good and does a good job of alluding to the culture of the era without being overly appropriating or inaccessible.   There are plenty of opportunities for "wow" moments as well as humor and memorable spontaneous moments. I'm also encouraged with out Ubisoft is supporting weekly events with the Trials of the Gods, which are a fun way to add value for players who have already explored most of the game's content.   I have personally completed less than half the game at this point, but am full expecting to get 100+ hours of total value from this title which I would classify as really worth purchasing!

This game is great , however it is not a amazing and memorable as Alan Wake if you were to compare the two. While i think that the gameplay has more added features than Alan Wake in the way of abilities that you can use in combat , this games story wasn't as good as what was done in Alan Wake. I think that Remedy had a good idea with the way the story is told and you can watch some of your actual choices effect on some streaming episodes (which are about 20mins each) and while I did enjoy them they felt like there could've been more time spent on actual story within the game. By the end of a less than enjoyable boss battle... Quantum break just left me with feeling like there was a lot of information that should've been explained and there is a lot of missing details regarding characters, our full decisions , and more information on the story! Unless these details were left out purposefully to make us want a Quantum Break 2.   Overall it is a great game for anyone who is a fan of time travel, good story in general, and good acting.  9/10

Review edited after looking into this in further detail and changing to positive with recommendation as I simply have not been able to put the game down and only jumped out of the game to buy the Legendary edition. The game is so addictive I know I will be playing this a long time, it's just enjoyable.  I am enjoying this immensely save for the performance issue as mentioned by many before me. After reading that it is purely RTX that is broken I have disabled RTX and the game performs great.  5950x, 4090, 980 Pro NVME, 64GB RAM, 4k 120Hz and it can sit at the 200fps engine cap until certain things happen that drag the 99% to 2fps if you have RTX enabled!   With RTX off I can just crank everything to max and enjoy. I guess RTX will be fixed at some point but it does not bother me right now.  So keep RTX off for now, yes even if you shelled out for a 4090 like I did, it's the game not your GPU.

Sempre ouvi falar muito de Inside.  Não sabia do que se tratava, apenas tinha a certeza que a sua jogabilidade era semelhante a Little nightmares e Limbo. Decidi portanto comprar o jogo e experimentar. Não tinha ouvido nenhum spoiler e não sabia nada sobre o jogo, apenas tinha visto um pequeno corte de uma gameplay num dos canais de youtube que costumo ver.  Comprei o jogo numa promoção com ele a 75% de desconto, achei que como apenas queria ver do que se tratava e talvez me divertir um pouco provavelmente não faria mal. Eu não me quero enrolar muito mais, apenas queria dizer o quanto este jogo subiu as minhas expectativas. Adorei a forma como ele começa de uma forma direta. Não nos dá tutorial, não nos apresenta a historia e porque de estarmos lá. Achei simplesmente magnifico. First and foremost, I will say this. I wanted to wait until I got at least 10 hours into the game to write a review for it.  This is a simple review, and I won't go super in-depth, I'll tell you the things this game does right, and the things it does wrong.  Firstly. The gunplay, and overall gameplay is pretty phenomenal for a F2P shooter. My buddy convinced me to play the game for the first time, and I was pretty skeptical but after giving it a shot, I'm convinced this game has the best gunplay of any free FPS out there, as far as I can tell. The only free game I know that competes with this game's gunplay is APB: Reloaded, but that's a 3rdPS.  There's no sense of team work in this game though. No VoIP, and even if there were, your team mates probably speak a different language. It's best to play in a party with some friends because unlike some games that you pay for (Dead by daylight, looking at you), it's actually possible to play this game in a party without getting a headache from sitting in queues for 25 minutes. It's almost instant, every time, without failure.  The worst part about the game is by far, without doubt, the map design. Almost all of the maps are far too simple. There's no complexity to any of them. They're basic af. Secondly, every map panders to spawn campers. Anybody who has played a solid FPS game before (CoD4, CS1.6, CS:S, CS:GO, Rainbow Six: Vegas 1/2, or really any well made shooter) is going to be able to spawn camp for the entire match in this game. You'll easily end up with a score of 45/<10 in team deathmatch. Your games will likely empty out quick.  The only other bad part I've noticed about the game thus far is that it takes VERY long to rank up. Very, very long. Attachments cannot be bought. you have to unlock them. The good news is that this is permanent. Most guns I've used are permanent too, but to be fiar there IS a in-game shop that has guns that aren't permanent I think.

game: Dark Nights with Poe and Munro
review: Dark Nights with Poe and Munro is less of a game and more of a very loosely 'interactive' television show. The package consists of six disconnected vignettes where you occasionally get to click on choices to influence the direction of the characters, but none truly have any lasting impact and are more about progressing the scene slightly differently than anything of significance. The only connecting story branch is Poe and Munro's relationship which is critically underdeveloped within the small timeframe of episode length.  While I enjoyed the episodes to varying degrees, the project feels more like something you would find a YouTube channel Netflix special, or some small timeslot on Adult Swim. For for the entry fee, it is horribly overpriced. No episode lasts longer than 30 minutes and your interactivity is limited at best. Perhaps the most odd episode is the callback to their first game with Dr. Dekker where there is the most amount of interactivity, but truly seems out of place and more of an addon patient to said game rather than its own episode. It certainly does not have the same level of questioning as all you do is select questions and answers from a panel in the side rather than interrogate your patient.  Ultimately while I enjoyed it, I can't flat out recommend it, especially for the price. There's too little content for your time. Perhaps pick it up on a sale if you want to do something on a movie night

game: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Special Edition
review: Game looks a little bit better but suffers from the fallout 4 performance issues. It runs fine for me now that ive done the same fixes i did for fallout.       -Change the resolution to 1080p, i had to do this in the .ini, dont know if you will have to as well      -Turn of the terrible TAA      -Set Shadow Distance to Medium      -Set Distant Object Detail to either High or Medium EDIT: - Set iVSyncPresentInterval=1 to 0 and control the framerate in your GPU's control panel      -Also setting the shadow resolution to 2048 also helps, and doesnt look much different  The game runs better after these changes for sure, and i also have no problem with running the game on my 75Hz monitor. Granted i have a computer meant for gaming/rendering, if needed my specs are   i7 4790K  AMD R9 390  16 GB RAM  If youre running a lower spec copmuter you might have to turn godrays down or off.
Still one of the best games out there and it's held up over time.

GOSTEI MUITO DESSE!!!!  Sofri mais que jesus em alguns momentos mas nossa, bom demais, estou FECHADA com Iljime.  Todas as mulheres lindas, perfeitas, meu deus. A Yurin é tão gostosona, ela tem uma aura de gostosona, uma vibe meio sugar mommy (perdão por essas palavras mas meu coração falou mais alto) A Seoyeon eu tenho uma adoração por ela, principalmente por esse sprite dela que parece que ela esta constantemente :| Juhee as vezes da vontade de deixar ela sozinha mas a gente aprende a amar... e AHHHHHHHHH ILJIME, sou muito suspeita para falar pois amo gentle thief, amo essa coisa meio Robin Hood e ela é tudo, tudo para mim. Apesar de eu ter ficado meio A com o final, gostei muito...  Esse jogo é um grande dramalhão e realmente te ensina muito sobre a Coréia medieval, o dicionário ajuda bastante e muito estileira as roupinha.   MAS O MAIS IMPORTANTE: as mulheres. eu já falei delas ali, mas nossa, gosto muito delas... queria faze 1 cafuné na seoyeon unhe unhe.  Os finaizinhos alternativos (os fracassos) são engraçadinhos, cada um mais absurdo que o outro!  Ah é, o servo de Heesoo é tão... um grande porre, deus ajude...  ps: Um cara comentou sobre a tradução estar meio mais ou menos, e confesso, trombei com algumas coisas estranhas enquanto eu estava jogando mas só segui em frente...

What at first glance seems to be another game in the increasingly crowded genre of deck based rouge-likes, manages to create a niche of its own by adding more RPG elements such as equipment and level ups as well in addition to adding a strong positional element to combat.  While there are certainly some elements you can recognize from other games, such as your equipment representing part of your deck, which nicely allows for a upgrade system separate from character level ups. As well as the system of playing cards using "willpower" which is managed by discarding unused cards.  Though the world map is somewhat uninspiring, the battles have a critical element that is not present in Slay the Spire or Monster Train, a hex based grid board. (Though I am looking forward to see how Gordian Quest turns out as it falls into a very similar genre.) Trials of fire however allows and encourages the use of flanking and positioning much more in encounters that may have environmental hazards or choke points. Combined with the ability to choose a party (and how they work together) it scratches the itch of the tactical party based adventure game.  Its no D&D, but each character has a few different builds that are viable. My favorite right now is focusing on summons and bonus actions. Though it has been in early access for a time, there are still frequent updates, which have addressed both balance problems as well as added new features, including a new campaign, characters, and cards.   I would love to see something like a dynamic party or a start with only one character and then choosing between randomized party members in game. Other than that I think the world map could use some more features on it, such as roads that provide faster travel (to contrast forests that are slower) and more variety in the events.

I really wanted to like this game. Games are one of the best language learning tools for me after all. But turns out it's one of the most annoying experiences I've ever gone through here on Steam. Just to give you an idea, did you know that enemies can be programmed to pop up randomly on rpgmaker? You do this by setting a percentage counting your character's steps at the map, and it seems like this game programmed enemies to 100% appear every 3 steps you take. In a maze. A big one. Where you don't know where you should go. Three steps, a pointless enemy (because he doesn't even attack you), you escape, more three steps, another enemy, you escape, three steps, another enemy, you escape, three steps(...). I'm sorry, but do not buy it.

Demenzialmente spassoso! Uno dei giochi più divertenti ai quali abbia mai giocato. Chivalry infatti offre realismo, immersività, variabilità, personalizzazione e tattica, tutto questo unito a tanto umorismo e ad un motore grafico efficiente. Gli aggiornamenti infatti escono da anni con alta frequenza e rendono questo gioco sempre più fluido sia da un punto di vista delle prestazioni, che da un punto di vista del gameplay. Potrebbe essere ancora corretto qualche bug grafico e sopratutto potrebbe essere inserito un programma interno di chat vocale posizionale; già così com'è in ogni caso risulta un ottimo titolo: adatto a soddisfare le esigenze sia di giocatori arcade, che prediligono l'azione buffa e sfrenata, sia dei giocatori più riflessivi, che avranno l'opportunità di battersi in un realistico duello contro degni e nobili avversari. Insomma, più che consigliato!

买真人快打X就是为了玩剧情模式。剧情有点稀里糊涂，和MK11的剧情没法比。 几个年轻人最后当主角拯救世界，让蝎子、零度、强尼、刘康、公主等等这些老人物当配角衬托。还让凯西打败古神，简直离谱。不过体验感还可以，期待MK1的剧情模式！

+ 2D动作游戏，手感不错，操作简单。 + 画风极赞，靠镜头的拉升展现出景深效果，场景气势恢宏。 + BOSS战的设计很巧妙，既不会让你无脑砍砍砍就过了，也不会难得让你抓狂到扔手柄。 + 纯正北欧风格，全程维京人的古代北欧语音，拿着巨斧的肌肉女主其实也很可爱。  - 地图太大，游戏内容相较于地图大小显得不够丰富，没有升级和装备系统，每一关的任务无非是找到和解开封印，收集加血量的金苹果，干死BOSS。 - 战斗不够多，大部分时间都在赶路，我的巨斧一直饥渴难耐。  结论：闲暇打发时间的小游戏，口味较清淡，素质还行，绝对不属于进包货。 不推荐原价购入，目前圣诞33%off的折扣也一般，想尝试的同学可以等将来50%off入手。
Понравилось ставить хетшоты. Красивые скины на оружие. Красивая графика.

Polecam, dzięki tej grze mój dziadek Antoni Cejrowski w Peru zrzuca dzieci w beczce po czym wszystkie te kondory i sępy to jedzą. Pozdrawiam, Wojciech Cejrowski- Boso przez świat

I'm writing my first review in a very long time because of how masterfully this game was designed.  Seriously, this game was a breath of fresh air that I haven't had from a game in what felt like forever. I'm by no means an expert on game design by any stretch of the imagination, but Hyper Light Drifter absolutely captivates me. The narrative, combat, and curious nature of the world that is strewn before you compliment each other in a wonderfully unique experience. The simple but unique aspects of this game are woven together to portray a narrative that, at least to this player, were reminiscient of other titles such as Journey, Dark Souls, and even Link to the Past.  The game is an experience. Below are two upstanding pros and a con of mine, short and sweet to keep spoilers at a minimum.  Pro) Combat. The combat is akin to the perilous life-or-death nature of Dark Souls (although simplified for the top-down Zelda-esque nature), exemplifying the brutal, unforgiving world the Drifter finds themself. With limited tools, your own skill as a player will largely affect your traversal of the world.   Pro) Sense of discovery. This game is crammed with more secrets than you can shake a stick at. Replayability is a given here, even I am still going strong. I highly advise the use of NO walkthroughs, at least for your first playthrough or two, just to come to appreciate the amount of meticulous craftmanship and beauty put into this aspect of the game. Hearkening back to my repeated Zelda example, this is where I feel the relationship is exemplified the strongest. I whole-heartedly felt as fulfilled searching for upgrades or secret passages or buttons (all the while, exploring a world with joyous eye-candy aplenty) in Hyper Light Drifter as I did playing Link to the Past or Minish Cap as a child. If you're a fan of that, this game will keep you entertained for ages (and have you crawling back for more.)  Con) Lack of Direction Sometimes, the open nature of exploration is too overwhelming at first, and perhaps the learning curve could be too much for some players. I can recall several instances where slight frustration arose because I could not find "the last damn purple thingy" for a long stretch of time, effectively breaking the flow.  Ultimately though, the reward of finally succeeding was enough for me. I honestly don't have much here. This was like pulling teeth for me, but I have to do my best to be fair and bring up at least one thing that may turn some players away.  9/10. I absolutely adore this game, and hope for more games to follow in it's footsteps.

This is a really good loot and shoot game with branching skill trees that help you adopt and cater you to new play styles. Each character can be really fun to play, given the appropriate knowledge about your loot, skills and downfalls. The story, while boring at the beginning, picks up as you progress into the game with some memorable characters, but the best one being the main antagonist the our story, handsome jack. There is a lot to explore in this game, and with the given time, you can learn about the lore and backstories of many places and faces you meet in the wasteland, exploration is often rewarding knowing what it is you're looking for. Post story content makes you stay and play a bit more every time, completing side missions, collecting logs that give even just a little more information about seemingly interesting facts and stories about characters and places, and the raid bosses are though and require you to go fetch your buddies and some good loot before you take them on, but with the right gear, can be solo'd, even on the highest difficulty. Speaking of difficulty, the game increases difficulty as you level up, the way it does so is that once you enter a new area, it sets the enemies in the area to a certain base difficulty, and levels them up as you do parallelly, until they reach a cap, then the process repeats until you finish the game and gain several levels more than what's available. The game at this point offers you to start a "new game plus" which is called true vault hunter mode which resets the game, resetting all story and side missions but keeping all your gear to level up even more, which again can be repeated again with ultimate vault hunter mode, letting you grind for more and more levels and much better loot. The DLCs, while essential as far as in game loot are concerned because a lot of good gear have been added to the DLCs , are a mixed bag. While tiny tina's assault on dragon keep and torgure's campaign of carnage, and the latest iteration, commander lilith's fight for sanctuary are fun dlc's with good yet short stories and fun side missions and raid bosses, the remaining dlc's, sir hammerlock's big game hunt and captain scarlet's pirate booty feel underwhelming and sometimes a bit empty, as in the case of the former.  Keeping it short, this game is a must play and the game goes quite cheap during the various steam sales. I whole heartedly recommend this game. For what its worth, your money will be rewarded handsomely.

Bought it in the Humble Bundle like most people for a couple bucks.  It started out okay. Horrible screen tearing and frame issues, so I had to use Adaptive VSync in the Nvidia control panel to get it to work well.  Worked fine for a couple missions, until I just couldn't do them anymore.  Yeah, it turns out it's a well documented bug where you can just straight up be unable to do missions.  The mission marker will be there, and you can run over it and stuff, but never trigger a mission. As far as I can tell, there is no fix for this issue aside from starting completely over. If I knew this would be an issue, I would've refunded it before my 2 hours were up. But I can't, so I'm just going to warn you that this is a pretty buggy game that's not worth your time, even if you bought it off the humble bundle.

game: Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun
review: I just finished the game. I would give this a solid 8/10.  It is worth the asking price full price. It is a steal at the sale price. It is a polished gamed.  It would have gotten a 10/10 but the controls are very clunky. And Character models get stuck on eachother when trying to group up. So the quick split-second decision making you need to do sometimes fail just because characters get stuck on eachother or objects.  Overall, the story is good (kind of predictable). The characters are really good. Sound/Voice are top notch. Graphics are ok but could be better. Its a solid game if you love those old Commando games.

我没有遇到xbox登录不上之类的麻烦，不过朋友遇到了，我帮他解决的步骤写一下，希望能帮到更多的人。 1.首先无法联机的看一下设置那边权限开关开了没，如果开启失败或者登录出问题的试试下面的步骤 2.退出游戏，加速器加速“win10 xbox游戏下载”（以UU加速器为例） 2.登录“xbox主机小帮手”（不确定是否有影响，没有的win10商店可以找到此应用），打开游戏登录微软账号，之后应该可以设置开启联机的权限了（朋友到这一步后就可以和我联机了），开启完后记得退出游戏，加速器加速游戏。  希望上面的对大家有帮助，下面说一下游戏联机方面        联机还是很稳定的，没有出现高延迟或者网络波动的情况，部分地方和预期的不太一样，不过依然很好玩，联机时搜刮资源，能搜刮的地方会分成主机和客机两部分，不会共享，主机是黄色标记点，客机是蓝色（大概吧，我有点色盲，哈哈哈哈哈），不过可以互相扔或者放在汽车后备箱给朋友拿        游戏里的资源仓库主机和客机是独立的，比如你是客机，你搜的东西转移到基地的话，那个仓库是你自己的（背囊会自动捐献给主机，客机想要背囊里的资源的话只能把背囊拆解），客机可以使用主机基地的设施，资源还是消耗客机自己的，游戏会给客机额外奖励，客机回到自己存档就能收到了（算是一种给打工仔的补偿）        稍微难受的地方是客机不能离开主机太远的范围，没仔细注意过，四五百米 ？超过距离会被传送到主机旁边        祝大家游戏愉快！

A análise anterior dizia alguns problemas que foram resolvidos, o edit a baixo foi feito antes deste aqui. O balanceamento tornou o jogo divertido de se jogar, porém ainda é muito frustrante em alguns momentos, como hitboxes erradas em ataques inimigos e bosses, que as vezes podem fazer você perder uma missão. Mas no geral o jogo tem melhorado a questão jogabilidade e newbie friendly, a curva de aprendizagem está mais suave, possibilitando o ingresso de novos jogadores ao game. Mas conquanto a questão de conteúdo, todos ainda esperam um personagem novo ou algo inédito. Os servidores da américa do sul está vazio praticamente todas as horas do dia, mapas como Áton fica vazio de manhã, de tarde e de noite, achar alguém online é raro em alguns mapas.  Veredito: Vale a pena jogar pela experiência, mas não recomendaria investir dinheiro no jogo. O jogo irá te render algumas horas de gameplay, quem sabe você possa fazer amigos dentro do jogo, o que torna a experiência mais agradável.

Plenty of bugs- Fell through the floor a few times, watched npcs walk through walls and at one point over the ocean, and dead bodies sometimes just wouldn't appear at crime scenes. Despite this, I can't recommend the game enough. It's incredibly entertaining and the bugs aren't super common and therefore more amusing than frustrating. Solving crimes is so satisfying, and the whole style of the game is appealing. It's got some bug fixing to go through, but it's early access and to be expected. Even just messing around with the npcs in the downtime between cases is fun! I also love how you can customize the size of the city, makes it much easier to run the game.  Most fun I've had in a while, and a very unique experience.

A Way Out is a story about two men in prison. Leo, who has already served 6 months, and Vincent, who is just arriving. Both men vie to break out, each for their own reasons. Leo already has a plan in mind and Vincent wants in on it. The players will have to figure out how to work together to not only break out of prison, but determine and carry out their goals once they are free. The are multiple choices throughout the game that can not only affect the gameplay and decisions of the other player, but determine how the story will continue.

If you are looking for a PC building game, prolly not the one.  Albeit there is accurate depictions in the game, it leaves a lot to be asked for.    Pros: Great for starters Good to general education for starters Over all fairly covering on parts and various makes and models of various company parts Tells you what is and isn't compatible  Cons: Slow! game: 仙剑奇侠传四(Chinese Paladin：Sword and Fairy 4)
review: 一共玩过4遍，第一遍在六年级，对这些情感不咋感冒就想砍砍砍，当时梦璃离队感觉很好（说服自己有个正当理由不玩柳梦璃，当时感觉她完全是拖油瓶）最强三人组，但玩到最后还是泪崩了。第二遍印象不深，第三遍是在去年，仙剑四的品质放到现在确实不行了，当时室友看见还说这是什么远古游戏，的确除了剧情这游戏真的不行了，这剧情虽说是三刷，但是让我中了2个月的毒，感觉梦璃和菱纱真的很可怜。有一段时间喜欢柳梦璃不得了，经常幻想结局以后的故事，非常渴望能够有个续作。（不得不说梦璃的台词太少了）。第四遍是开发出梦璃新玩法，才发现哇塞这才是效率之王，经常拉小怪爽一波。

My experience says: Shogun Total War 2 -- three times improved in graphics, from the Dinasaur Epic Shogun Total War, is the most challenging, with exotic apeal, TW game to date. The consistant game crashes, patch issues, mechanical changes of Rome II are condescending to our Life, Liberty, Pursuit of Happines much like the Obama Care website conundrum. Why not purchase Shogun TW 2 or its Complete Collection option, enjoy Japanese Samurai culture, read Sun Szu's Art of War, conduct exotic naval battles, fight ferocious land battles, experience breathtaking Japanese landscape, conscript gunpowder units, kill (Tom Cruise) the Last Samurai, until the bugs are fixed in Rome TW 2 (My bitch) or Medieval Total War 3 miraculously becomes available. Or replay Rome Total War gold Edition. My reccomendation: Alexander TW, when phalanx warefare dominated Antiquity.

Un début plutôt sympa qui m'a BEAUCOUP rappelé resident evil 4 (d'ailleurs il serait peut être temps que son créateur essaye d'inventer autre chose, on dirait franchement qu'il est resté assis sur ses acquis), dans ses bons ET ses mauvais moments. C'est LOURD, le perso est lent, sprint comme une m*rde désolé du mot, mais franchement être essouflé au bout de 5/6 mètres de course, alors que c'est un détective, euh... bonjour la crédibilité ensuite il y abeaucoup de die & retry, ce que je déteste.  l'upgrade des armes se fait un peu au pif, puisqu'on ne sait pas ce que l'on va trouver, surtout niveau munition.  Bon courage pour le chapitre 4, débile à souhait (ps ne vous emmerdez pas à tuer le boss, on ne peut pas, et non, ce n'est expliqué nul part dans le jeu. En plus c'est du one hit= death, magnifique...) bref les japs font de plus en plus de jeux pourris, de gros copié/collé des anciens, SANS JAMAIS FAIRE D'EFFORT SUR LA JOUABILITE  quand je vois d'où on est parti avec les tomb raider et la jouabilité d'avant, et celle de maintenant, au moins on peut dire que OUI, il y a du progrès.  Chez les japs, ben non, pkoi se faire chier? Sans compter la caméra à l'ouest assez souvent (alors quand vous avez un monstre qui vous tue en un coup, c'est super pratique) heureusement que je ne l'ai acheté que pour 12 €, AUCUN intérêt, vous pouvez retourner sur RE4.

Every time Stardock touches this game it gets worse. First there were the bunny slippers, and I just said, "Eh, so they released a DLC without the Elemental flavor. I can deal with this." Then they released the "ULTIMATE EDITON," and I continued to struggle through longer and longer AI turns until the game inevitably locked up around turn 200. Now they released support for high-end screens, and my not-high-end screen can no longer display the game properly.  Well done, Stardok. Well done.

FTL: Faster Than Light is a very poorly designed game. Simple as that. There is absolutely no progression in terms of difficulty. Your very first encounter might be with an enemy ship that you can't run away from and are powerless to destroy. Even if you manage to survive for a while and upgrade your stats, then maybe your tenth encounter will be with an enemy ship that you can't run away from and are powerless to destroy.  FTL is all about luck and obsessive min-maxing. If that sounds appealing then go for it, but only the most hardcore gamers will find something to enjoy here. And as if the awful gameplay weren't enough, the visuals are incredibly weak and the music, while it is at least trying, is mostly forgettable.   Not recommended at any price.

Die Story ist echt gut, kann man deswegen auf jeden Fall schon mal empfehlen. Die Waffen sind echt cool und die verschiedenen Arten hinterlassen kein Wunsch einer Tieferen Vielfalt. Von MPs und Sturmgewehren, zu Kampfbögen und Plasmasalven ist alles dabei. Neue Waffen zu sammeln und immer stärker zu werden kann einen echt mal für 2-3 Stunden die Zeit vergessen lassen, doch leider, um echt die best Gear zu erreichen die man haben kann, muss man unglaublich viel grinden und Challenges vollenden, die ohne Freunde sehr schwer oder einfach blöd zu machen sind.

game: Why Is There A Girl In My House?!
review: 劇情不長，跟貓娘貼貼就完事。

Simple concept well executed, cute bunnies, very relaxing and a hint of acting out some creativity. It is very easy to get into and make the little progress that is to be made with the money: Simply save up for a couple of butterflies (the helpers in this game) and then you can let it run in the background for a bit until you have enough money to buy a bunch of butterflies, so the gold keeps rolling in at a constant pace for you to spend on decoration. Now you can build a little park for your bunnies while cutesy music plays in the background! It is well worth the price in my opinion, also since the developers still seems to update the game. On that account I'm looking forward to new decor since the map is so big that I'm personally not quite satisfied with the variation just yet. Though it would be nice to keep the seasonal items purchasable undefinedly.

原作は知らんし英語もできないけどそれなりに楽しめる。 内容はまだまだ薄いので安いうちに買ってアプデを待ちながらやれる人なら買ってもいいと思う。  英語がわからない初心者の方は内容が分かってくるまでイージーが無難。  あとは、ごくごくまれに喋りかけられて答えられずにいるとFFしてくるやつがいる。  ゲームモードのARCでは鉱石？の青い液体を運ばないと全くと言っていいほど防衛拠点の建設ができないのにホード状態に進行してしまう黄色い液体の運搬をさっさと終わらせてしまい、スカスカな拠点で押し負ける場面もある。  ホード中の修理をおろそかにしている人が多い。 スコアに修理が入ってるかわからないから明確にわかるキル数を稼ぎに行くのはわかるけどね。 せっかく修理とかあるんだからそっちもスコアわかるようにしてほしい。  まぁ気にせず防衛失敗からの撤退戦も良いけどね。  バグもちょこちょこ起こります。 アーリーアクセスだし仕方ないよね！ でも毎回ゲーム起動するたびにオペレーター以外のロードアウトがリセットされるのはめんどくさいので早急に対処してほしいかな。  あとはラグがひどい時もあります。 ザ・ワールドを食らったり敵が無敵化したりします。 アジア鯖ないしオンラインゲームである以上しょうがないよね！

Empyrion is an amazing survival crafting space game.   The upsides are the scale, absolute freedom, easy to use controls once you've played for a couple of days to get used to them, and the blueprint system.  The downsides are all multiplayer related (even though the multiplayer is my favorite part of the game). Don't get me wrong because I've spent 90% of my time on servers with other players in Empyrion, I enjoy it immensely. The PVP is unstable because of lag shots, lag with big ships, and unstreamlined combat features involving more than 1 person on the same ship.  635 hours at the time of this review and I'll play many more, I'm sure. As well as buy Empyrion 2 if they make one.  8/10 would recommend to anyone who didn't like Space Engineers but wants to find a better game along the same lines.

10/23 101 hours in. I like base building and Mars but for some reason the screens and videos just weren't bringing me in. I bought on a whim and boy was I wrong. It has been a lot of fun even in its current got a ways to go stage. It has a bleak look...It is Mars... I thought when I hit the current edge of tech I would shelf it until an update but it still has me going. There are a number of bugs but not to the point of annoying. Area loads need optimization, documentation on how things work is still lacking.  There is a lot of potential here. TL;DR Worth a buy yes. Will be super awesome as it evolves.

[h1]Sombrio, frenético, divertirdo, mas nada de estratégia[/h1] Eu achei bastante intenso, quase desorganizado, com gráficos e física fantásticos. A jogabilidade também está ótima e certamente será um dos meus top 10.  Na minha opinião, Killing Floor 2 não lembra muito do seu antecessor, cuja ambientação e humor eram seu ponto forte. Agora ficou mais sombrio e violento, além de não dar oportunidade de criar estrategia, uma vez que na maioria do tempo fiquei dando tiros a esmo.   Apenas reafirmando, esta é minha opinião, sobre o que senti do jogo. Indepente disso, é diversão garantida e grana muito bem investida.  Veja um vídeo que fiz com minhas impressões sobre o Killing Floor 2:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uVYr97eH2wM

TLDR: Play the first game and ignore this one.  The game isn't bad first and foremost. The core is strong as it's the same core from the first game but I just don't know what they have really done to this one. There's less creatures, less biomes, less vehicles. You don't go nearly as deep and the story is just totally soulless. The story in the first game was the main driving factor to keep playing and going deeper to get more gear and uncover the mystery. This game presents most of the story sections out of order and it just falls completely flat, there is no mystery at all.

Ich habe es als Quest 2 (bald Quest 3) Besitzer im Glauben gekauft, dass man es wirklich als Solospieler zocken kann. Ich mag den Stil und in VR sieht es echt schick aus und mit der Steuerung kann man sich leicht anfreunden.  Leider kommt man allein nicht wirklich ins Spiel rein, sodass es schnell in Frust endet. Man kann sich natürlich Gruppen anschließen (Discord ist da hilfreich), aber ehrlich gesagt ist das nicht so mein Ding.  Somit wird das Spiel bedauerlicherweise an mir vorbei ziehen, da mit meiner Gruppe ziemlich schnell Feierabend ist, wenn die Feinde mal wieder sehr schnell in der Überzahl sind. Eine wirkliche Storyline ist leider nicht vorhanden oder zumindest habe ich sie nicht entdeckt.  Schade drum. Technisch ein gutes Spiel, aber als Singleplayer sollte man davon eher die Hände lassen.
