La seconda stagione di TWD firmata da TellTale è una produzione dal profilo contrastante, mostrando da una parte i frutti del percorso di stabilizzazione della formula diventata poi tipica della casa produttrice, ma dall'altra incomprensibili scelte collocate nel cuore stesso del concept del prodotto, bastevoli per renderlo una spanna sotto il suo predecessore. TWD 2 abbandona del tutto i rimasugli della "prima TellTale" amante dei puzzle emergente nei primi episodi della prima stagione per concentrarsi fin da subito su un obiettivo del tutto narrativo, formando in definitiva un'esperienza elegantemente uniforme, logica, e intrigante. Quello che si era proposto alla fine della prima stagione come l'inizio di un Bildungsroman incentrato sulla figura di Clementine subisce una rapida approvazione nelle prime battute del titolo, togliendo alla bambina le ultime figure definibili come "tutrici". Un frettoloso scarto narrativo e temporale di qualche mese non è sufficiente a giustificare il ruolo che Clementine, all'età di dieci anni, è chiamata a ricoprire nel corso del gioco, ovvero la protagonista. In un brillante articolo chiamato "How not to care for characters. The Walking Dead Season 2 analysis" trova forma esplicita la sensazione che ho provato durante il mio playthrough: metterci alle spalle di una preadolescente, con tanto di telecamera abbassata e punto di vista "rimpicciolito", è stata una mossa di marketing puntata all'empatizzazione dell'utente che non ha tenuto conto di pesanti contraccolpi che questa porta inevitabilmente alla struttura del gioco stesso. Per la sua stessa ontologia, il protagonista inteso come avatar di un prodotto videoludico deve partecipare, in qualche misura, agentivamente all'interno della vicenda. Ciò crea un principio di interazione che è alla base stessa del gameplay, sia che questo consista in frenetiche sparatorie, sia che si realizzi nell'osservazione partecipante alla Proteus. Il nocciolo duro delle meccaniche di gioco di TWD 2 si basano sulle sessioni decisionali, mano che ritaglia la storyline secondo il profilo del giocatore stesso. E' da questa necessità strutturale che si apre la più grande incoerenza di TWD 2. Perché le decisioni dell'utente tramite la voce di Clementine abbiano un ruolo significativo nella logica interazionale di gruppo che sta a costante sfondo delle tematiche di questo franchise, i comprimari presentati volta volta, perlopiù adulti scafati con esperienza adattiva e organizzativa di una certa profondità, devono necessariamente trovare costantemente pretesti per dare l'ultima parola a una ragazzina di dieci anni che, sebbene efficacemente rappresentata come estremamente matura, allontana ogni realistica logica di fiducia attuabile in situazioni estreme. Questa ricorrente fattura è resa ancor più evidente dal naturale allargamento degli orizzonti umani e situazionali che questa seconda stagione cerca di introdurre nel discorso. Nel primo TWD l'avvicendarsi di personalità aveva fin da subito una prospettiva intima, diadica, creata nell'ottica dell'approfondimento caratteriale che si esaltava nei ritmi lenti, in uno scopo vago ma sempre presente, nell'orrore della deumanizzazione della violenza, novità ancora fresca in un panorama postapocalittico "giovane". In TWD 2 lo sfondo dei personaggi introdotti è una distopia politica, una specie di contestualizzazione di una situazione alla Heart of Darkness, in cui la considerazione sul singolo scivola dietro, com'è logico che sia, a una valutazione sociale più ampia e complessa. Il giocatore viene forzatamente introdotto nell'ambiente distopico, e ogni interazione è volta a una riflessione sulla tipologia stessa della comunità e sul ruolo della libertà del singolo nella costruzione di una nuova prospettiva sicura. L'unione tra personaggi scarsamente intraprendenti e un loro approfondimento dal punto di vista biografico e caratteriale soltanto abbozzato crea intorno al giocatore una compagnia di maschere di comodo, con cui non si riesce a empatizzare mai, complice anche la banalizzazione dello scontro e della carneficina che il gioco si immagina concretizzarsi in una fase più avanzata del mondo postapocalittico. Non è un caso che il vero motore ultimo dietro alle situazioni e alle decisioni più marcate che vengono proposte nelle fasi finali, e che servono a giustificare un traghettamento verso un'ulteriore stagione, sia una figura recuperata a sorpresa dalla prima stagione, creando un senso di continuità accentuato dalla possibilità di importare i propri salvataggi dal gioco precedente in un meccanismo alla Mass Effect. Particolarmente clamorosa per l'efficacia nel tirarsi la zappa sui piedi è stata a mio avviso una delle ultime scene corali, in cui il giocatore è invitato a partecipare a una discussione ludica su un rapporto sessuale avvenuto tra due membri del gruppo. L'osservazione dell'ingenuità che si è costretti a simulare nelle possibili risposte, coerente con le conoscenze in merito di una preadolescente lontana da parecchio da una normale vita tra coetanei, rompe brutalmente la quarta parete, schiaffando in faccia all'utente tutto il paradosso di aver agito e ricoperto un ruolo fino a quell'istante del tutto non combaciante con la figura in cui viene richiesto di immedesimarsi. Sebbene l'effetto è probabilmente in una qualche misura voluto, lo stacco risulta così brusco e il rapporto con i comprimari così improvvisamente "normalizzato" da risultare almeno straniante e al peggio ridicolo, considerati i pregressi del corso degli eventi. La debolezza intrinseca e costantemente manifesta di TWD 2 non ne fa assolutamente un prodotto trascurabile, anzi. La maggiore compattezza stilistica rispetto al suo predecessore ne favorisce una più oliata e continuativa fruizione, accentuata dai già accennati ritmi più elevati: una vera e propria esperienza da giocarsi tutto d'un fiato. Basta tuttavia fare un paragone con un altro titolo che cerca di sviluppare, sebbene con mezzi e contesti molto diversi, il tema del despota segregatosi in una distopia "a fin di bene", Spec Ops: The Line, per rendersi conto di quanto una narrazione del genere abbia bisogno di un certo tipo di agente, e di quanto la scelta di mettere il giocatore nei panni di Clementine sia stata quantomeno ottimista. TellTale è tuttavia in costante evoluzione, e sono contento di notare che nell'attuale terza stagione la prospettiva è nuovamente cambiata a favore di una figura più realisticamente centrale.

Do you see my hours spent on this game? Well it took me 10 hrs to win the first prize. Then I screwed around the great wide web to get some tips. I realized at the end that the game is so freaking hard there is no use playing nice. So go bet high, go all in and if you see you are going to lose, hit ALT+F4 then re-enter the game.   And now for the good part:  The characters are amazing, its fun to see them chatting aroung and cracking some jokes about the others game ( or film, whatever ). The jokes are good, but they are not endless. And the ability to change the theme of the poker-hall was a great idea. And the music is fantastic, every set has its music mixed in this jazz-rock-something.  So if you know any of these characters, you know basic poker and/or want stuff for Borderlands 2 ( in this case you have to contact gearbox support to give you the prizes in-game ) and Teamfortress 2 you can pick this game.

game: Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous - Enhanced Edition
review: If there's one thing I've learnt about the Owlcat and their Pathfinder games - it's that all the bugs are appearing when you're already deep into the game. My party got stuck and literally cannot exit any location. I've tried to trigger other quest or reload - nothing works. After a week, no one from Owlcat support got back to me regarding ANY of the submitted bugs. Larian responds to their players within the first  10-24 hours. Larian's a blessing from the gods comparing to this sh1tshow.  UPD: I stand by what I've said after playing for 50 more hours. Objectives in some quests (The Art of Making Friends, Rapture of Rupture) did not move to completed, and I was forced to re-do them. This time, I'm stuck dealing with Staunton, as the game crashes after I defeat him in Drezen.  Look, guys, this is not how a fully complete game should look like. This is a beta state at best. I really thought that you would change your bug-fixing strategy after Kingmaker, but this feels like a slap in the face to everyone who's been waiting and donating to you.  I really like PWOTR more than Kingmaker. It's so diverse and immersive, and the role-playing potential is groundbreaking, but so far, the bugs and crashes overshadow all the good parts.   I DO NOT recommend buying this game until we get a confirmation that the devs clean up this mess and take accountability for the state of this, allegedly, fully released game.

本文想要提供一些建议以供制作组参考。  第一个问题是常常受人诟病的平衡问题。平衡问题往往由具体单位的数值引发争论。众所周知，在现实世界中的各种作战单位，它们的战斗性能并非完全可以用数值计算。同时，这些数值由于各军事集团的实力水平而不同。因此，真实战争中不存在所谓的平衡。但是，游戏中玩家与玩家的军事对抗却需要追求这样一种平衡，以保证玩家在对抗起点的一致。如果制作组为了达到这种平衡而修改作战单位的数据，那么游戏将失去其追求的拟真体验与历史性。 我们不妨从两个角度看待这个问题。 制作组可以使用数据双轨制从而解决历史性与平衡性的对抗。在玩家与AI对抗中，作战单位的数值与作战条件可以尽可能的接近历史事实。而在玩家与玩家的对抗中，上述数值则可以在考虑公平对抗的前提下加以调整。而这种调整包括但不仅限于作战单位的作战性能（质量），还可以体现在可使用单位的数量与种类上。一些玩家在多人游戏中仍然追求历史还原，这显然是不合情理的。众所周知，德军与苏军的军事工业水平与发展倾向在动态的历史中是不同的。 简单地说，这个解决方案就是将玩家对抗AI与玩家对抗玩家这两种游戏模式中的游戏数据分别设计，互不干涉，各自独立，在战役模式中尽可能地追求历史性，而在多人对抗中则追求平衡性。  第二个是关于北约军事符号的建议。在钢铁之师的系列中，北约军事符号的图标与Wargame相比，其背景、颜色、大小等设定显得不那么有辨识度，同时亦不够美观。或许制作组试图引导玩家使用默认的RTS图标进行游戏，但我仍希望北约军事符号的设计能够得到改进。  当然这只是些思路上的建议。具体实施起来可能需要考虑更多。  谢谢。   This article is intended to provide some suggestions for Eugen to consider.  The first is the oft-maligned question of balance. Balance problems often arise from arguments about the value of specific units. It is well known that the combat performance of various units in the real world is not completely numerically calculated. At the same time, these values vary depending on the strength level of each military group. Therefore, there is no such thing as balance in real war. However, player-versus-player military confrontations need to be balanced so that players can play "fairly". If Eugen were to change the numbers of combat units in order to achieve this balance, the game would lose the virtual experience and historicity it seeks.   There are two ways to look at it. Eugen can use a dual data track to resolve the historical versus balance conflict. In player versus AI battles, unit values and combat conditions can be as close to historical facts as possible. In player-versus-player situations, these values can be adjusted to allow for fair play. This adjustment includes, but is not limited to, the operational performance (quality) of units, but can also be reflected in the number and type of units available. Some players still pursue a balance of history in multiplayer games, which is obviously unreasonable. It is well known that the level and development tendency of the military industry of the German and Soviet armies are different in dynamic history. In a nutshell, the solution is to design the game data in the two game modes, player versus AI and player versus player, independently of each other. In the campaign mode, we should pursue the historicity as much as possible, while in the multi-person confrontation, we should pursue balance.  The second is the proposal on NATO military symbols. In the iron division series, compared with Wargame, the setting of background, color and size of NATO military symbols are not so recognizable and beautiful. Maybe Eugen team tried to guide players to play with the default RTS icon, but I still hope the design of NATO military symbols can be improved.  Of course, there are just some ideas. Specific implementations may need to be considered more.  Thank you.

Taken as a whole this game is really mediocre. I was recommended it a lot by my friends but I found the gameplay barely passable, the pc port terrible and story not worth the effort.  NOTE: Apparently issues with the port I experienced which required a mod to fix may have been resolved, albeit 4 years after release.  The story is the only factor that kept me playing the game which is saying something as I was bored of this game through 90% of its runtime. I really don't find it as deep or interesting as its made out to be and it would have been a better experience it wasn't artificially separated and rammed with filler.  I hear this is better than the first game/remake which is a joke because even my friends who love this game can't stand the original.  I've played a huge amount of games in my life time and honestly this is the most overrated one I can think of. I think there far more evidence this is a bad game than its good, which I can't say for any other that appear frequently in best game discussions.  Absolutely not for me, stay away. Your weeb friends are lowering their standards to enjoy this mess of a game.

来说说我对这款游戏的一些心得 睡狗和gta不同的是 gta许多地方都是值得探索 故事任务只是世界里面的一小部分 睡狗的任务占世界的几乎全部 剩下的小部分是比较无聊的收集要素 当听到这游戏属于狂刷任务和收集要素 可能你会觉得很无聊 但这款游戏成功让我玩得忘记时间  游戏剧情紧凑 对人物的刻画还算得上不错 因此在玩的时候较少会感到无聊 画面在当时也不算差 但也算不上顶级(人物脸模另当别论) 任务也很多样化 抢车 打人 救人 塞车 枪战 追击战 找女友ppp  战斗系统也算特别 招式多样化 并且配合服装可以打出不同的特效 睡狗还原了香港8 90年代应该有的东西 麻将赌博 广东话 上香 香港招牌 摆档 港剧式的剧情 以及最重要的一点--义气 这款12年的游戏缺点几乎没有 唯一缺点就是不能只交一个女朋友!!!

This game is incredibly fun to play with friends, and runs extremely smooth. The dwarves voicelines and humor in the game makes everything that much better. I've played Left 4 Dead and Minecraft both extensively, and this game truly is like a hybrid of both of those games.   The only negative I can truly see is the game getting a little too repetitive after a while. Same objectives (kill monsters, collect eggs, or collect specific ores) may make it difficult for me to play this game well over 100 hours. New features within the game that spices things up should change that, and with this game I feel like those changes are inevitable.  Extremely happy with this purchase, and can't wait until I see what the future of this game has in store!

game: Fallout New Vegas: Gun Runners' Arsenal
review: This dlc in of itself isn't so super amazing, but you should definetly find something in here that you'll love to use your entire playthrough! Personally for me, I love using Gehenna, a katana (that doesn't work with the katana mods) that is lit up on fire! I have also played around with a 12.7 submachine gun, which tears apart almost anything I've put it to so far.   One perk of Gun Runners is you don't actually have to go to Gun Runners right at the start of the game. So much as the first gun store you see in the beginning will have GRA advance models of normal guns for a decent price. Most Gun Runner gear also starts up at 100 percent (I know I've heard that it's 98, but your not allowed to repair them right off so I'm pretty sure its 100) so when you factor in how much it would usually cost to repair a plasma pistol, your getting your money's worth.  Oh wait, you say. Did you say gear? Yeah, I said Gear! While the armor they sell isn't very varied, If you somehow manage to scrap the caps together for it, you practically have a tank! at level 6 even! However they do charge through the roof for custom equipment like that. If it is specially named, or a high tier of armor, expect to be paying minimum of 3000 caps. and thats just the price for a piece of armor. They are extremely pricey pieces of equipment, however completely worth the cost. So if you manage to scrap up the caps to get a special gun from Gun Runners, Do it!  8.5/10

我不会死，所以你哥哥也还活着  玩完莎木你会发现在当时的世嘉就已经在下一盘很大的棋，不过在当时的背景下能够创造出这样一款游戏我觉得就是个奇迹。刚玩莎木1的时候发现很多的时候需要记路，很多的时候需要一个个去问，战斗部分甚至都基本在游戏的后半段[spoiler]差点忘了这个游戏还需要战 斗。。。[/spoiler]，可玩完之后会发现游戏中的许多亮点，电话功能[spoiler]在游戏一开始就铺垫好了，每天甚至都不一样[/spoiler]，所有人物的对话[spoiler]甚至NPC也会根据故事进程的不同而不同[/spoiler]，时间系统[spoiler]影响着游戏所有人物的作息，门店的作息[/spoiler]，天气系统，可以敲的门[spoiler]笑[/spoiler]，只有在相应时间地点才会触发的剧情，街机厅以及扭蛋机，QTE事件，还有华丽的招式[spoiler]没有强弱之分只有战斗时的运用，我手残有些招数从头到尾没用过。[/spoiler]。在打败了第一个强敌之后踏上了香港的旅程，故事才刚刚开始。  在玩到莎木二的时候，很多地方也得到了改进，比如路上的NPC除了说废话外甚至还可以带路，地图可以购买甚至标点。莎木2全程也算是在较大程度上还原了当时的中国[spoiler]熟悉的弹珠游戏，熟悉的二胡声[/spoiler]。在游戏的整体性上提升也不少，QTE事件的增加难度的提升战斗也贯穿全局，剧情也有不少的推进，直到最后来到矿洞我才发现[spoiler]1原来不是游戏开始，2才是。。。[/spoiler]。  最后总的来说这是一款需要你坐下来细细评味慢慢玩的游戏。[spoiler]当你坐下来，你会发现这游戏为什么吸引着我[/spoiler]

This is one of the best games I've ever played.  I tire of the same game very easily, most games I just play for around 15-20 hours (with a few exceptions). I sank 130 hours into this game now, and it's just perfect. I'm not tired of it yet, and it might be a long way there, which is really unusual for me.  I was looking at this game for a long time before I decided to try the demo. I bought the game directly after finishing the demo, it was that good.  I'm sure there are more usefull comments than this which talks about the mechanics of the game and such. I just want to add something I havn't seen many people talk about. How the game teaches you to play it. Going through the tutorial I really feel like I learnt myself everything, I was just told the very basic of the games logic, then I put everything together myself. I think it's really unusual of games today. I feel like most games treat you as if you've never seen a computor before and are four years old. I instantly got a lot of respect for the developer, for respecting my intelligence.  The game also makes a great job of easing you into the more difficult parts of the game. You start out doing very simple tasks and before you know it, you have a fully automated factory with intricate, complicated parts which you set up.  I honestly can say this is the most rewarding game I've ever played.  If you're unsure about if this is a game for you or not. Try the demo, it changed my mind directly!

Like most negative reviewers, I can't say that I didn't enjoy the game... The game is fun. However, there are a few glaring issues.  First of all, the game is a "casual" MOBA, which means that there are a lot of lax component. You can be matchmade 3v1 if things go wrong (2 bots with you), and that will spell inevitable doom for you and whoever is unlucky enough to get into your game. There is also only 1 queue, which you could consider "ranked" since there is a visible ranking (tier-based).  Next, as everyone mentionned, there are no servers, every games are P2P, this means that your games will lag based on the host's (chosen at "random") internet.  Otherwise, the balance direction is totally stupid and a disaster. The expansion came out recently, 2 out of the 4 new nauts I saw seems to be flat out better then 80% of the roster. I say 80% because there are still iabilities in the base game. For instance, Gnaw has a kit that makes it so he will inevitably get ahead (can kill "jungle camps" on spawn), and his kit also allows him to stay ahead when he's ahead (he can spew acid on the ground, which inflicts a DoT when stepped on, and has plants for insane sieging/defense)... So unless Gnaw or his teammates are bad, you're spiraling down to the ground. And even if we keep those aberrant data out of the calculations, it's a "casual" game with extreme champions (you will see quite often people 1-shot you or present you with very little interaction, like flinging for half the map).  If you got friends, you can buy it during a deal, it'll probably be a blast... but seriously, the game is not a "good MOBA".

At last I feel like I have a game where my RP choices truly matter. It's so much more involved than just Paragon or Renegade decisions. I feel like I'm really playing solo D&D, and I'm over the moon on all the little details. I am playing a wood elf ranger Paragon play-through, and fully plan on doing a Renegade (drow) run after. I am here for the story so I play on the easiest mode possible and combat is generally a breeze, letting me really focus on the story. I'm terrible at tactical games usually, and abysmal at big complicated bosses, so for this game to really work for me says a lot. I love it so much.

I want to give this game a good review, but I can't for multiple reasons. The main reason is that even with 35 in the game, I feel like I haven't gotten anywhere. I haven't even unlocked the first elevator. Now, this could be due to my poor skills, but 35 hours is a lot of time to put into a game with seemingly no progression. It's also incredibly frustrating when you're playing for an hour, die, and start at square one all over again. That's about it. I've never experienced any glitches or lagging. This doesn't go without saying I'll never play it again, but typically don't enjoy sitting down and playing this title.

Интересный сюжет, отличная атмосфера, приправленная блевотным гемплеем, мало того что бегают тупoрылые мужики с топорами, которые кроме раздражение ничего не вызывают, так и еще наитупейшие сцены сражений с птицами вместо того что бы зайти и переждать дома, нужно их засветить фанариком досмерти. Было бы просто шикарно и стильно не будь все  и вся портящего, ни сколько не интересного гемплея, я не могу себе представить кому может быть интересно бегать от фонаря к фонарю засвечивая фанариком мужиков с топорами facepalm Нравится море деревенщины и невероятно тупые поступки ГГ, в таком случае эта игра подойдет остальным не советую  В середине игры дико надоело светить фанариком и уж тем более перепроходить наискучнейшие лесные гущи если тебя закидают топрами гомосеки, скачал трейнер, но даже он не спас... Игра могла бы получиться отличной, хорошая графика, в игре нормально управляются машины. Намного было бы интереснее поиграть за какого-нибудь детектива с чем-нибудь сверхестественным или еще 100500 вариантов, но нет, был выбран самый скучный  Пройдя игру до конца напрашивается фраза: "Обколются своей марихуаной и е... другдру га в ж... по подьездам" с  А еще, он в конце засунул в бабку

130 saat oynadıktan sonra yazıyorum bu incelemeyi. Hatta biraz geç yazdığımıda söyleyebilirim. Oyunun mekanikleri savaş sahneleri gerçekten harika. Grafikler muazzam. Pek fazla bug yok oyunda.  Konu ilerlemesi falan oldukça başarılı.   Öncelikle şurdan başlayalım oyun harika bir son'la bitiyor. Tabi bunun bir oyun olduğunu ve orta dünya evreniyle uzaktan yakından alakası olmadığını söylemeliyim. Yüzüklerin efendisi, hobbit Sillmalirion'u da okumuş bir orta dünya hayranı olarak bu oyunun bir yüzüklerin efendisi oyunu olmadığını söyleyebilirim.   Oyunda Shelob'u ara ara konuşan bir kadın suretinde görüyoruz. Bu zaten başlı başına saçmalık. Dediğim gibi oyuna Orta dünya evrenin bir parçası gibi bakmazsak hikaye 10 numara.  Karakterin ilerlemeleri kazandığı skiller ve hatta bir kaleyi ele geçirme yada savunma açısından oldukça detaylı. Sevmediğim noktaları da var elbet, gerek yürürken gerek bir ork şefiyle savaşırken ansızın durup dururken hemen dibinde orklar çıkıyor. Sen bölgeyi temizledim diyorsun ama orklar bir yerden gelmesi dışında bir anda önünde arkanda hatta içinde bile çıkıyor.  Bunu özellikle bir kaleyi fethederken ork şefleriyle tek başına savaştığın yerlerde görüyorsun.    Oyunu kesinlikle tavsiye ederim.  Başlı başına grafikleri zaten adamı bitiriyor.

game: Business Tour - Online Multiplayer Board Game
review: super

Game has very little replay-ability.  Yes, you can play the game multiple ways, but the story is the same every time, and there are a lot of long narration scenes that you will see over and over and over and over again each time you play, that CANNOT be skipped, so you just have to sit there and watch the same thing again.  Would be nice if there was a way to say, "Yep, I've seen this 5 times already and really don't want to sit here for several minutes watching it again."

Clásico TCG con las mejores mecánicas e interacciones que tiene el género. Recomiendo el juego por nostalgia, por buenos momentos y por la complejidad que contiene el juego. Es un buen juego para iniciar a la gente en este mundillo, la verdad. Pero se nota muchísimo como de opresiva que es la monetización del juego. Cosméticos por todos lados, comodines por dinero real, eventos que cuestan más de lo que deberían...  Recomiendo este juego para empezar a jugar, luego, pásate a paper, conoce gente y hazte un grupo de amigos fuera, que es dónde mejor se disfruta este juego.  Llevo jugando desde la beta de 2018, el reset de las cartas que teníamos y los constantes errores de servidor. Y bueno, es esto o el magic online si quieres darle. Pero es lo que hay.  Los formatos son algo agridulces, la verdad. Tenemos al sempiterno estándar con sus cartas rotas y sus decks inamovibles. Historic con todas las cartas + la mierda inspirada de hearthstone (que para mí se carga la esencia pura del juego). Explorer como el wannabe de Pioneer porque el equipo de arena debe tener a 40 devs mataos a trabajar y a hasbro no le da la gana contratar a más para añadir las cartas que quedan. Brawl como mi favorito porque requiere tener 1 carta de cada al ser singleton. A día de hoy es lo único que juego.  Consejo para f2p: Haz diarias y el midweek magic, ahorra como 15k de oro para release de sets y podrás estar medianamente al día. No aconsejo gastar dinero en este juego, pero si se te dan bien los drafts puedes farmear gemas/oro y cartas de una manera facilísima.

Alright, I love this game, explosions are amazing, audio is amazing, the story missions are a bit repettetive but its still fun because your still destroying things 24/7. I love the fact of trying to evade the enemys in my car so I drive across this bridge in my tank and the police are hot on my tail, so I shoot the ground of the bridge and the cars fall to their untimley deaths to the pit of the ocean.   The driving is a bit wonky but this is Just Cause, the drivings not going to be perfect. The game is much different with a wingsuit, you also still have your parachute by the way... Great game, recomend it to anyone on sale.  10/10

Игра, наверное на любителя. Но я, в таком случае, весьма ё%%%тый любитель. В самом деле, круг моих интересов очень странен... Сам с собой дорогие друзья, да, сам с собой. Очень доволен. Это игра не про хардкор (один друг посоветовал мне "18 steel wheels", кажется, потому что она "хардкорнее". Не то чтобы я много играю в симуляторы транзитных грузоперевозок, но один раз довелось играть в ЯКОБЫ похожую игру... Её можно описать так:"Дорогу решили проложить по реке, проволился в дырку, помигал и поехал дальше...". И создатели Truck Simulator на эти грабли не нуступили. Может, стоит поработать над моделями повреждений, но в любом случае: выехал на встречку - штраф; сбил знак - покоцал тягач; перевернулся на повороте - вызывай эвакуатор (за +100500 тыс. $). Первые семь часов я играл честно. Именно про них я и поведую. Как и должно быть, в игровом мире я появился без денег и тягача, но уже с правами. Последнее позволило мне наниматься дядькой-перевозчиком во все подрят фирмы. Много я за это дело не получил, и, уже накопив на 1/2 грузовика, увидел кнопку "кредит". А вот уже с собственным пОрОвозом, я начал играть. Это было прекрасно: огромный, красочный, яркий мир просто влюбляет в себя. Европа была такая, что я как-будто побывал в её промышленной части. Мельницы, небоскрёбы, шахты... Кастомизация мира, словом, зашкаливает. Правда нашёл несколько выходов с карты, и это упоризм. Разрабам существующие недоработки, даже "недогляделки", простить можно. Есть кстатий и Великобритания, и она меня бесит (да, праворульные грузовики дороже и менее востребованны). Порадовался возможности кататься на корабле: заехал на стоянку, нажал Enter, звук кассы, и ты в Великобритании! Ура! Взял кредит - набрал персонал, ещё один - купил грузовики персоналу. Компанию продвигать не получилось, симуляция маркетинга, биржа труда - всё построено на случайности. И всё управление компанией сводится придумыванию названия, нанимнию рабичих, и предоставлению им грузовиков. К 7-му часу игры на мне висел огромный долг, вот тут-то я и понял, что взломать её можно банально, с помощью CHE 6.2 . Дальше я стал искать баги, страдать хернёй, словом - упарываться, и это не очень интересно. Кому стоит купить? Я купил во время скидок, рублей за 100. Выше уже писал, что понравиться может самым неожиданным людям, играющим в DayZ, BF, NFS м т.д. Я думаю, что она понравится всем, кто считает, что "Syberia говно, а Syberia II ещё хуже". Кламбур, но Я так считаю, и эта фраза есть во всём, что я делаю. Я взял саквояж и пошёл гулять, а вам рекамендую купить Euro Truck Simulator 2, просто, за красоту пейзажей. Syberia - говно, это писал Я, BB&GG

Madeline isimli inatçı olduğu kadar sevimli olan küçük bir hanımefendiyi yönettiğimiz zorlayıcı bir platform oyunu. Hikaye olarak anakarakterimizin bir dağ tırmanışını konu oluyor. Söz konusu bu dağ büyülü ve hatta hisleri var. Kendilerini keşfetmeye çıkmış insanlara yol gösteren yüce bir dağ kendisi...  İlk olarak belirtmem gereken şey ölmek sizi çıldırtıyorsa oynamayın çünkü (çilekleri de toplamaya çalışıyorsanız) en az 2000 kez öleceksiniz.Bunu dert etmiyorsanız sizi mükemmel bir oyun bekliyor. Gerçekten karşılaştığım en iyi zorlayıcı platform oyunlarından biri. Özellikle bölüm tasarımlarına hayran kaldım, aşık oldum... Gördüğüm en iyi bölüm tasarımlarına sahip oyun olabilir. Bunun yanı sıra anlamadığım bir şekilde bu oyunu oynamak aşırı güzel hissettiriyor, sevmeden edemiyorsunuz oyunu.  Oyunu benim gözümde tek bir eksisi var, o da chapter 9... Oyuncuya nasıl küfrettiririz acaba diye düşünmüşler ve öyle yapmışlar gibi... Oyunda hayran kaldığım bölüm tasarımlarının ve çok beğendiğim oyun mekaniklerinin ırzına geçildiği bir chapter. Aynı şekilde diğer tüm chapterlarda hissettiğim o güzel hissi bu chapterda kayboldu, hatta öyle bir kayboldu ki oyundan bıktırdı.

Interesting premise. It's nice to see how events could have played out differently depending on the choices you make. The game is very repetitive though. You need to go through the same levels multiple times to reach different outcomes. There are many different endings, but due to the repetition, you'll probably only play through a quarter of them. I wouldn't recommend this game for completionists. The hack & slash aspect is decent, and the storytelling is enjoyable.

Eh beh, il y en a des mauvaises recommandations.  Comme dirait l'autre, le problème est entre la chaise et l'écran.  Outre le problème avec les anciens CPU, faut arrêter de fumer.. D'ailleurs un patch pour ça devrait bientôt arriver non ? Vous avez bien attendu pendant longtemps pour ce jeu, bah cela ne va pas vous tuer d'attendre encore un petit peu dans ce cas.  Niveau GPU, aucun problème avec une GTX 660M, 970 et une 1080 (heureusement).  Pour le reste, tout n'est pas forcement intuitif mais bon, laisser enfoncer le clic de la souris pour passer de 30 à 60 FPS c'est vraiment si dur ? Ou bien appuyer sur E au lancement ?  On est pas sur un COD récent bien horrible, alors avant de venir vous plaindre, il est temps d'utiliser votre cerveau je pourrais dire.  OK, le jeu n'est pas le plus beau graphiquement, mais son jeu de couleur compense très facilement, j'aurai aimé pouvoir augmenter encore plus le FOV par exemple, et une petite frayeur par rapport au vaisseau de précommande et à son moteur. Mais bon, à part ça, je vois pas. Ah si, son prix quand même bien élevé. Mais dans tous les cas je ne regrette pas mon achat.  Pour ceux qui hésitent à l'acheter, n'écoutez pas toutes ces mauvaises langues. Dans le doute, vous pouvez toujours attendre quelques jours. Mais si vous êtes fana d'exploration, encore plus dans l'espace, lancez vous !

说起来有点惭愧，这个系列是老早就买了，但一直放在库里吃灰，最近才翻出来体验，不得不说是一旦接触就完全停不下来，连续干完前两部来到了这部，这部剧情可以说非常完整，无论是男女主感情还是回收之前的伏笔，最后也给了个不错的结局可以说看的非常爽，但问题也不是没有，首先是跟游戏内容没太大关系，但对玩家问题很大的就是汉化问题，翻译错误、排版错误、少CG等，尤其是最后与boss大决战是出现错误，非常影响体验有木有，气得我改成日语当生肉啃了，还好有近十年的宅龄，或多或少听得懂，但接触这类不多的玩家就要听的一头雾水，这点我只能建议各位买正玩盗了，抛去这些确实是部佳作，值得大家体验。  [h1]最后，双重性格的学姐我tm吹爆，动态HCG我tm射爆 [/h1]

I'm not a furry, I swear! I just really, really like anthropomorphic animals and the artistic potential you can get out of them. I mean, sure I drew what is essentially an anthropomorphic bunny as a new OC as of recent, but doesn't mean I'm a furry! Sure, I love looking at other people's art and it may steadily be becoming a part of my visual aesthetic, but I'll tell you yet again: I AM NOT A FURRY. I never will be, I would feel great shame if I were a furry. Furries have a bad reputation, hence so would I. Even if I were to BECOME a furry, I wouldn't join the fanbase due to how bad of a reputation they've got. Seriously, the pervs disgust me so. I'm not even kidding bruh. They disgust me beyond measure. Maybe if the reputation wasn't so bad, maybe I WOULD consider being a furry! But I'm NOT! And I WON'T! Besides, I would NOT have the patience to make a fursuit. Not that I've tried. Too messy, too much time! My back hurts just thinking about it! So yet again to conclude: I swear on my mommas Yeezy's, I AM NOT A FURRY!

This game feels great and with lots of potential. I feel it is a bit expensive compared with the volume of bugs but if the bugs are fixed it would be on par with car mechanic and pc simulator, just a gun theme.  If concerned about bugs (it is early access and newly released) read up the known issues. The soft lock and not being able to sell auction listings are pretty major. Someone wrote a workaround that involves reloads for selling fixed auctions, and i assume softlocking involves starting again (only happens when out of cash, so an early game issue as when you have cash you would be ok).  I ran out of motivation to work on the game more, but will definately come back to it. It has that gun store feel to it and i can see it being as good as car mechanic simulator, or a bigger version of pc building similator for sure.  Wishing the game well, and definately recommend giving it a go if enjoy simulators and can afford a gamble on a early access new release

The game disappointed my expectations. Animations are not always well-polished. Skill trees are more bargain than fun. You have some choice there, but it matters not. You either strengthen your army or learn spells and all spells do the same, they just have a different visual effect. Their miniature is not well-readable, all are so small and the same color, same shape, same background, therefore, I say magic is done badly too. The game lacks many components other Total Wars had and which were great. No settlement battles (need to use workshop), no inner politics.  What matters most is replayability. I remember myself playing Total War: Rome II. I playing for Getae again and again. Once, I attacked Scordishi, other time, I attacked Tribalii and so on. There were many possibilities how to actually develop your empire, how to expand, how to govern, who to negotiate with. It all is more or less minimized or completely removed from Warhammer.   For example, all dwarves usually have equal opinion of you and reject to negotiate. Maybe one tribe will agree to some terms. In Rome II, Hellenic factions were warring each other and the sides were always different. So each time you started, you could ally with someone else or not to ally at all. This was one, this was green for replayability. In Warhammer, you usually have to repeat same actions for sucess or similar ones.  Don't take me wrong. I support further development of fantasy Total Wars. But this one really failed for me, and a player should never have to rely on Workshop to just get core elements in (minor settlement battles, Greenskins X Dwarves balancing and other). Miniatures of spells can not be readed and it even does not matter, which one you choose. If it isn't  a buff, it will be a damage spell. Animation doesn't matter much. But for strategic use of buffs, it is necessary to have some diversity and comfortable managment of it all. Two other fantasy Total Wars will have to learn from this. Or players will learn from this one's failure.  On top of it all, I just want to mention Denuvo. I see why they needed it. If anyone played it cracked, he wouldn't buy it. There is no other reason to pay for protection, people sometimes play pirated games just to try them if they would like to buy it later. Denuvo itself kept Steam thinking I still play the game when it was off (I assume it was Denuvo).  There are also a few POSITIVE things. I really like the unique gameplay of all factions. One gets bonus armies when it fights a lot, the other's economy stands upon peasants shoulders, Empire can assign ministers, armourers and other national functions to its generals and some don't even use settlements.   I bought it from Humble Bundle for $12. I wouldn't buy it for more than that. Yet, I am still looking forward the next chapters if developers make it as amazing as I expected it to be.

Ultra-realistic tables, easy to play and understand. What's not to love? You'll find proper retro tables with bells & bumpers, plus multiple updates and remakes of those tables with more modern ramps, animated features & soundtracks. One thing I really love about this game is the option to buy INDIVIDUAL tables for as little as 79p, unlike other big-name pinball games that make you pay a high price for packs of tables you don't really want. This game also offers packs (and at good prices), but the option to cheaply buy that ONE table you really love makes Zaccaria Pinball the best option for scratching your pinball itch, whether you like really old, classic tables, or modern.

ein Klassiker neu aufgelegt. Die Story ist immer noch genial erzählt, die Stadt ist super detailliert und fühlt sich sehr lebendig an und sieht dank der neuen Grafik auch klasse aus. Das einzige was ich schon im Original schade fand: die Missionen laufen alle sehr linear ab und letztlich dient die große Stadt nur als Kulisse. Lediglich im Freeroam-Modus kann man noch ein paar Sachen entdecken, und hier haben die Entwickler für das Remaster etwas übertrieben. Es gilt viel zu viele Comics, Bilder und anderen Blödsinn für das 100% Achievement zu entdecken. Wem die Achievements egal sind, und nur für die Story spielt kann hier aber bedenkenlos zugreifen - wenn auch vielleicht nicht zum Vollpreis. Auch wenn das Spiel komplett neu entwickelt und vertont wurde ist 40€ schon etwas happig für 10-15 Stunden Spielzeit.

再玩一个小时就去干活……（然后五六个小时就过去了） 还能玩到这种原汁原味的RPG游戏真好，更别提还有这么好的光影与音乐……尤其是女神官初始的圣火城，登上她和伙伴小时候爱爬的山后看到远处神圣的教堂那模糊的轮廓，以及天空中不断闪闪飘落的雪花，配合悠然的音乐——那种感觉太棒了。虽然每个人物每一章的故事稍微有点瑕疵，但那八个性格与经历迥异的角色在这个世界中相互交织影响和发展的剧情非常吸引人。 游戏加了个破防机制和BP蓄力机制，还有地图技能都是很好的增加游戏玩法的机制，丰富的支线也很让人肝疼，就是有一点我个人觉得不太好，怪物好多……那种初始的地图有的时候会需要重新跑一遍（做支线什么的），但是怪物也会根据角色一行强度而增强，数量也会增加。说打吧，这游戏群攻技能并不多（15级之前基本就只有猎人抓的怪/神官一个/学者两三个/医师一个/商人一个/战士一个，其中我个人感觉就战士和学者的比较好用）用单体技能打也需要个两三分钟，跑的话失败的可能又很高，反倒更增加了时间。而且岔路也不少，基本走个十来步就能遇见一波怪，要是走了岔路再拐回来经常会遇见两三次怪，要是能减少低等级地图遇怪几率就好了。 瑕不掩瑜，八方旅人确实还是很优秀的游戏。SE定价神奇，感觉定在200左右还能接受，400确实……但要问后不后悔，还是不后悔的.目前只玩了20多个小时，感觉剧情才刚刚展开，期待后续。

흔히 볼 수 있는 총알피하기류의 게임이다.  스팀 호갱님들은 세일할 때 사기 때문에 가성비는 문제될 건 없다. 이런 게임들이 다 거기서 가기기 때문에...  게임할 때의 팁을 드리자면. 1. 업그레이드는 펫 위주로 합니다. 특히 펫 레벨 업그레이드 (3천원)는 1순위로 구매해야 될 놈입니다. 2. 어느정도 이런 게임에 자신이 있으시다면 40스테이지까지는 퍼펙트 클리어를 목표로 삼고,     무기 데미지 업그레이드와 펫레벨, 가끔씩 보상으로 주는 디펜스 터렛을 파괴시키지 맙시다.     (도전과제 때문에 거의 필수사항이 됩니다.) 3. 50스테이지부터는 보스가 두마리로 늘어납니다.     모아놓았던 폭탄을 요긴하게 사용하시고 모든 도전과제를 달성하시기 바랍니다.

The original Dishonored is one of my favourite games of all time, so expectations were high going into this one! While it's not quite as brilliant as the first game it's still very very good!  [b]Pros[/b] [list]   [*] The level design and world building are really impressive. The Jindosh Mansion and Stilton's Manor are particularly wonderful.   [*] The stealth gameplay is vastly improved.   [*] The new powers introduced with Emily are good, an interesting addition and well balanced with the old ones.   [*] There are multiple ways to go about almost everything, even more so than in the first game   [*] The atmosphere and sound are outstanding. [/list]  [b]Cons[/b] [list]   [*] It does not really make any logical sense to do a high chaos playthrough, the whole story sort of    [*] The overall performance is good, but the framerate will sometimes drop for no apparent reason [/list]  Overall highly recommended!

I was there when the show took off. I bought the OG Yugi starter deck and duelled to glory with my Dark Magician. Oh boy has this game changed. In this iteration of the game the deck editor and thousands of cards make it almost impossible to find the cards you need. Need a card that sends monsters from the deck to the graveyard? Hope you know the exact name of the card you want because there's no way to filter that from the THOUSANDS of cards available. Lots of available cards isn't a bad thing, but it does make finding what you need very difficult. As far as duelling goes, A valid strategy seems to be boring your opponent to surrender. I'm already getting sick of sitting through 5 minute turns where the opponent plays through half their deck in the first turn magically summoning monster after monster. I'm officially declaring the Yugioh TCC broken. This game is also expensive. When I was young my mum hated the amount of money we spent of cardboard. I understand how she feels now and you don't even get the cardboard anymore. Forget Exodia, forget the Egyptian god cards, the most powerful card in this game is your credit card.

The game has many flaws; there are quite a few bugs and T-poses, the game could have a lot more enemy types, seeing the same types of enemies through the game is boring. The game is also quite easy when you get the hang of the combat which is somewhat annoying since I was hoping for Sekiro type challenge.   All of that being said I still loved the game! It is so great to run around with a lightsaber, using force and killing stormtroopers. All the customizability makes the game super cool, all though I feel like basically all the ponchos besides the bracca one are ugly. The annoying part is that at the point in the game when you get to choose your lightsaber color and you have basically all the parts you have only 2-3 hours left of the game. If they implement NG+ or something of the type it would be awesome

oi hoje vou falar do game TOMB RAIDER: LEGEND, lançado em março de 2011. Foi desenvolvido pela Crystal Dynamics.  historia: Bem legal do inicio ao fim  e interessante. A historia contem algumas surpresas e algumas cenas epicas por ser um jogo da nossa querida lara croft.  jogabilidade: boa, só que um pouco dificil de se acostumar. na minha opnião o jogo poderia ser mais rapido, os movimentos da lara nesse tomb raider sao meio lentos.  graficos: são bem ultrapassados mas para sua época eles sao bem bonitos.  audio: A trilha sonora desse game é muito legal contendo musicas bem legais   dificuldade : jogo um pouco desafiador em seus puzzles   personagens : esse tomb raider contem os personagens tipicos da serie (lara croft,zip,alister) e outros personagens conhecidos como a amanda, anaya, shogo takamoto, toro nishimura e etc  customização:  esse jogo possui pequenos elementos de customização (roupas, melhorias na pistola)  desempenho : jogo muito leve e com alguns bugs   nota do jogo : 8,2

A while ago I finished all the available content and since this game literally made me fall in love with it, here is a review. I will talk about each and every element.  [h1]Gameplay[/h1] This game is without doubt a bit grindy, it is a part of genre. Although all the resource gathering was carried out so well, I never felt like "ugh, just 5 more of this and I am done with it, cannot wait", but rather the activity itself was fun and goals keep you going. 9/10  [h1]Graphics[/h1] Lots of vibrant colors, cute looking stuff, I certainly enjoyed looking at this game. Although the optimization could be a bit better. 8/10  [h1]Crafting[/h1] Main point of this game. You inherit a workshop and crafting is pretty much your main money maker. It is very easy, as everything you need to craft is explained though an easily understandable drawing and you know exactly what do you need and how to acquire, art in this game is just beautiful. 7/10  [h1]Fishing[/h1] Fishing is pretty much what you see in other games, I did not do that very often, as it was not that much of a fun. 5/10  [h1]Mining[/h1] To mine, you need to pay a weekly fee. This was something that nearly made me quit at the beginning, but you only need to realize is that one entire day mining pays for the fee and then you got 6 days on top of that. When mining you get a freaking jetpack and vision that lets you see collectibles though rocks, never seen anything like it and I love it! 10/10  [h1]Combat[/h1] So far there is just a sword you can use and upgrade in game. Combat is very tactical, you can have best weapon and die, you can have worst one and win, you rely on dodges a lot and once you master combat you can go through without being hit. There are dungeons, free to get into, but there are like 6 types of enemies? Also 4 levels of diffculty while last ones have a timer and you need to kill stuff without running out of time. One thing I did not like, each and every floor has the same boss which is fairly easy to kill once you know how. I had more problems with mobs sometimes than the boss, he was always piece of cake.  There is also skill system for combat, crafting and social. 7/10  [h1]Relationships[/h1] I really tried to get into this part of game but come on, why cannot this be like the sims, getting married after 3 days? Okay well the issue I have with relationships is this. Max relationship has 10 hearts, one heart is 100 points. And every day you may gift a person once. And gifts usually give 1-10 points while 10 being quite rare gift. And there are NPCs who give like max 3 points for a gift. So you see if you gift a person for 10 days with +10 gift, you get a heart. But normally you do not get +10 gift for them every day and on top of it you need to craft and mine etc., this takes forever so I decided not to do this. But there is marriage and each relationship gives off perks. 4/10  [h1]Quests[/h1] There is main story line and then there are commisions you can take daily. This is good source income and way to increase relationships but they are quite repetitive. Main quest is interesting but the learning curve is WAY too fast and harsh, as you go from crafting a sword to building a freaking multi part bridge. I was struggling really hard during early game. 7/10  [h1]Farming[/h1] You will not do this much, as it is not so profitable and takes too long to grow. 4/10  [h1]Some things I did not like[/h1] Game does not let you save anytime, only on the beginning of the day. Steep learning curve. Voice acting missing sometimes. NPCs have no depth, pretty much same lines over and over. Relationships take forever to build. Only one event in entire year. In the end game only thing you can do is grind commisions and it gets boring fast. Not much customization. Missing "unstuck" button, got stuck falling into an endless void when half of my dungeon did not render properly.  [h1]Some things I wish I'd known earlier[/h1] Game has around 25 hours of content as of now. Always try to stand in front of commision building at 8am, as the bastard will be there too and will try to get best commisions, every day. Passing out at 3am has no penalty, free transport home. You do NOT need to rush, workshop rankings reset each season. If you purchase mine pass, you do not need to mine each and every day, just 1 to make up for fee and then based on what do you need off it, I can mine 2-3 stacks of copper/iron is one day in end game. Make organized chests, this is SUPER important. When you need 5 of an item and you have none, do not just make 5, make more, you will need it later. Buy trees off the church store and plant them, long time investment. Do not buy things you do not need (land increase when you clearly do not fill up quarter of it) Do not put stuff close to the house, when you upgrade house, its size expands and you will have to clear those things up anyway. Dying in dungeon is not bad, you still have extra lives, I never had any consumables on me and beat everything. Wood at tree farm will wait for you if you forget to pick it up. You do not need to spend your skills points wisely, reset is just 1k. Always use wiki and look things up. Early game you should spend all your stamina, end game, does not matter much.

I enjoy this game immensely. Only fear i had was the initial problem with aiming where i felt that it was a bit unresponsive. It got fixed with some graphic tweaks though.  I've been chased by the police for killing civilians, i've sneaked around in big apartment complexes and found different routes through balconys to reach my goal. I've explored a lot and believe me there's a lot of secrets to be found. I love that you can succeed in this game with your personal playstyle. I'm a bit sad to see that the ones screaming the loadest will affect the people not yet bought this masterpiece negatively.  I play this on a 5 year old system: i7 8800, 16gb ram, nvidia 980ti. My recommended setting came at medium settings at 1440p but i lowered them to 1080. And it rund butter smooth.  I've been waiting for this game since i known it was in development. For me this is way better than any GTA game that people have compared it too. I just don't understand you who rate this game poorly.  All games have bugs and they will get ironed out eventually. So far i haven't encountered anything major or game breaking.  For me this is a 10/10

Só no CK2 onde você pode ser um Imperador com câncer, de 1 perna com 5 filhos, ou um Rei de 1 perna com 4 amantes. Um dos pontos negativos na minha humilde opinião são as várias DLC's desnecessárias, mas isso vai de cada um, se você for juntando seus trocos da cantina e esperar por uma boa promoção, da pra comprar tudo de boa (Diga não a pirataria grrr), enfim, é um ótimo jogo, recomendo para todos!

Poker Night 2  I got this game since it was super cheap and on sale. I gotta tell you, it was worth the price I bought it at.  The game play consists of you just playing Texas Hold Em' or Omaha with the same 4 characters all the time. There's Brock from a show I forget the name of, Claptrap from Borderlands, Ash from Evil Dead and Army of Darkness, and Sam from the Sam and Max games. Of course Max is there too and will be involved in conversations sometimes...and yea all the characters have conversations with each other all the time. It'd be from Claptrap trying to figure out a catch phrase to use to Brock questioning Sam's very existence. I gotta admit, you will find yourself chuckling at their random conversations they have.  There isn't much of a story besides you coming to your favorite hang out to hang out with your favorite characters in high costing poker...yea there is a small currency system. You will start off with 20 grand and you will have to buy in, in order to play poker. I forget the amount you need to buy in. I believe you can also buy the other player's drinks as well to throw them off their game. I never really got to doing this but I found it a neat feature once it got introduced to me.  For those of you who don't know Texas Hold Em or Omaha, you are required to learn it in order to play this game and be successful at it. It will not teach you how to play, it will just throw you in and say good luck!  After playing and winning a game or two of poker, you will find that you can have a chance to play for the character's prized posessions. Of course it seems like they don't want to give it up but they do. I never got to win one of these and when I was about to...I experienced a game breaking glitch that made me have to quit the game all together...yea don't do any actions too quickly or you will find yourself staring at the characters endlessly like that weird neighbor next door with a bad dress code.  7/10 If you can get this game for like a dollar or less. I urge you heavily to get it. Its not a graphics hog and you will have a couple hours of entertainment. If you need a cheap time killer, this is the game for you. This game doesn't have a whole lot of replayability unless you return to it after like a couple months of playing it. But it definitely is worth a playthrough or two.

Why this game now makes me miserable:  This was one of my favorite games of all time, and now it's almost always a miserable waste of time nothing like it used to be. You can see by my hours played. I've been playing since when hardly any extra nauts were made. I think only Swiggins was out at this point.   This game was a great alternative to other mobas because it was unique in its combat. I don't mean just because it's 2d, but because it had fast-faced platforming battles unlike the other mobas. Nauts, contrary to other mobas, had a very engaging auto-attack (left click) system which caused a lot of good toe-to-toe action sequences. This made it so even in a terrible situation, it was quite possible for a skilled player to beat someone who's bad regardless of the math of the situation. That is to say even if someone is way ahead, if they play like crap the better player could still win a fight.   Over time this all changed, offering less interactions per fight to decide the outcome. Left click is nowhere near the significance it used to be, and the game is now all about instant burst kills just like other mobas. Just like in League of Legends (back when I played anyway) winning a fight is almost all about cooldowns now because they've become too powerful. There are many nauts who if they hit with both their cooldowns, the enemy will be around 20% life. This used to be something hardly anyone other than clunk could do, and it was very risky due to his speed and size.  Now, after a new naut has been ♥♥♥♥ out about every 5 minutes, and everyone's burst potential has gone through the roof, fights end in about 5 seconds because everyone blows up the instant they start. Compare this game to card games in concept. If long ago when burst potential was much lower, the game could be considered to have a high number of control or midrange decks, all that's in the game now is aggro decks. The games are also much shorter than they used to be, again causing less interactions throughout a game.  The way they were like control decks is that it took much longer for someone to die, and because of this there were much more interactions/cards played in a fight; more time for skillful movement and aim to come out ahead, compared to the current aggro decks the game is flooded with.They need only to unleash all their moves at once and immediately kill you, rather than constant and deep engagement. It is also worth pointing out the chasing ability and cc in the game is now crazy. There are many long-range snares or skills that almost teleport you to the target at this point, either through speed or a grabbing ability. Hardly anyone used to be able to do this.  The fact there was a patch that intentionally increased the game's snowballing is also an offender in regards to this problem. The leveling system. It's one more thing that lowers the amount of interactions between two teams and causes there to then be less time for everyone's skill to show itself over a high number of long interactions. There was already snowballing in the form of being ahead in solar which is fine enough, but tacking leveling on is going too far.   There is also a bit too much rock paper scissors going on for the same reason as in LoL, which at least has draft picking to help with this. When you poop out a new character every 5 minutes, and amass a huge number of them, certain characters will completely shut down others. You cannot balance so many characters without causing disgusting hard counters that really mess up a match before they even start. This is a problem in Smash Bros Ultimate as well, because of the insane size of the roster. Some characters are just too strong against specific other ones.  I could have written this a bit better and a little less angrily, but I'm pretty upset. I was very attached to this game. All you get now is Chuchos killing you in less than 2 seconds without even having any help, all while still having insane escape capabilities. Look at clunk, who can do similar damage, yet has almost no range and awful speed/size. Having such high damage is supposed to mean your attacks are risky, like was true for clunk because he cannot dodge anything nor escape over a long distance. Now it's like everyone can just zip across the entire screen and escape almost everything, yet still have the ability to nearly instant kill like clunk. I don't know how this game got so out of control.  This game is nothing like it used to be, and almost all games that actually end in good back-and-forth now don't seem to have the newer nauts. Sometimes I have a great time, but it's almost always because the game is full of classic awesomenauts.   I should point out that the world, characters and music and art are all very high quality. That just isn't my focus in this wall of text.  I will continue trying to play this rotting gem of a game, but I expect I'll remain sad most of the time as I remember what it used to be.

TL:DR To hard and tedious for an experienced gamer. Buy on deep discount only. Otherwise pass.            Minor and vague spoilers ahead. I found this DLC to be brutally hard and unforgiving. There are 2 fixed characters, that are very interesting. The interactions between them is very solid when it happens. The problem is they leave the party with no warning of this happening. I built my team around having a rogue and a wizard in the party for the whole adventure. So I couldn't open locks for most of the last dungeon.             The combat encounters were very hard, many ambushes. I retrained a character to a monk so he could run into rooms aggro the ambush and run out safely so I could bottle neck the encounter in a doorway, which got tedious after the 10th room.            I don't generally like complex puzzles in games like this I am there for the story and the combat so i may be a bit biased on this but I hated the puzzles in the last dungeon just google a guide to it and you'll see why.           The ending is terrible, I wont spoil much even though I'm recommending a pass on this DLC. The climatic encounter at the end just kinda fizzles out and the tie in to the main story was non existent for me. I hear there are several endings but I didn't care to reload to try for a different one. A rescue mission seemed so appropriate during the main campaign and it didn't happen. Honestly disappointed, even sad about it.                     You can get most of the magic items from the DLC in the main campaign but the way they went about doing that was insulting. There are several stat increasing books available near the end I wonder if you didn't use them in the DLC if they would be available to the main campaign characters? Don't care enough to try again.            I've been playing games like these since baldur's gate, and the pathfinder tabletop since DnD 4E came out. I'm no stranger to the game systems here and I found this to be way to hard especially for an adventure with virtually no tie in to the main story and very little meaningful character development or reward. Towards the end I turned it down to story mode to finish it out.             In closing I found this to be a major let down on a wonderful game, I'd wait for a deep sale on this one. For 2$ go for it otherwise pass. If you do buy it make sure someone in your party can pick locks, has good knowledge skills, and don't be ashamed to turn down the difficulty.

操作感很强，熟练后游戏体验非常流畅以至于计时跑图时有一种让人上瘾的爽快感，想要重温那种爽快感大概是我一年来反复安装这游戏4次的主要原因www  未来部分（游戏主线地图后半部分[spoiler]根据收集的魂的数量限制死亡次数[/spoiler]）和一些隐藏区域相对来说具有一定挑战性，但熟练后总体来说也不会影响到跑图的爽快感（况且跑Any%不需要经过隐藏区域）。  游戏流程长度合适，大概和我一样非神仙也非手残的平均操作水平的玩家需要6～8小时游戏时间来完成全部主线地图[strike]并观赏核爆[/strike]，至此算是进入了这游戏的新手村，然后大概需要15～20小时来做出自己第一个95+%完成度的存档，再之后便是提高熟练度来计时跑图和挑战完美存档的过程了。个人感觉大致能够在1小时完成一个Any%(从建新档到通关观赏核爆)时就能体会到那种让人上瘾的操作感和速度感了。  话说speedrun.com俩个月前Any%的记录又被美国玩家Eenox刷新到30分27秒了。[strike]看这些顶尖玩家的游戏录像总有一种自己也能上天的幻觉。[/strike]    [spoiler]别看了，高速连踩鸟头抄近道的操作看100遍也学不会。[/spoiler]

The original HL blew my mind in 1998. The graphics convinced me to shell out for my first 3D accelerator, a Nvidia RivaTNT.  Black Mesa?  If I had to, I'd drop a fat wad of cash again just to be able to play it.  The graphics are stunning, yet faithful to the original. Xen in particular is f-ing beautiful.  Xen was my least favorite part of the original HL but in Black Mesa it's incredible -- I'm sad there's not even more time on Xen.  The quality here (of the storyline, the graphics, the sound, and the music) rivals anything the major studios are putting out in 2020.  I don't know how Crowbar Collective pulled this off.  Valve should hire them to make HL3.  Seriously.  p.s. the soundtrack is KILLER.  Listening to the Xen tracks as I write this.

Dead Island has some nasty bugs: lost thrown weapons, getting killed by opening doors or getting out of stationary cars. But compensates for those in so many ways…  It was made in a simpler, better times for gaming, before feminism infection. Women in game are hysterical babes; christians are not bad cultists. NPCs are stiff like it’s Bethesda game, but their lines are cheesy and fun.  The story, while I had low expectations due to the setting, was engaging and worth paying attention to the end – make sure that you play as Ryder in his short, but very intensive and quite challenging campaign after the main game. A lot of the side quests are a bit generic or daft fetch quests – don’t let those bore you, push main quest and next map may offer atmosphere resonating with you more.  A sort of new game plus mode and 4 characters, each with different playstyles, a lot of side quests, offer plenty of replay value.  Combat is brilliant for the time – competent shooting, and glorious melee. But don’t try to force a character into a playstyle ignoring its skill tree, it will hurt the experience.  Dead Island would make a great sequel to original Far Cry, inspired by Borderlands and Left 4 Dead.  Overall, it’s a very good experience, worth recommendation and a 7.5/10.

And you, who read this review, I envy you so much, because you're about to experience it the very first time. Don't look up anything, don't look for help, just play it. It will change your life, I promise.

Witam. Gra jak wiele innych gier - momentami nawet fajna, momentami nudna. Jednak w mojej recenzji skupie się nie na samej fabule, ale przede wszystkim na kwestiach technicznych. Zamieszczę również ostrzeżenie dla osób mających dość wolne łącze internetowe. Mam internet o prędkości 5 Mb/s i dla takich osób jak ja odradzam zakup tej gry.  Najpierw problem z instalacją. Gra ma prawie 100 GB do pobrania. Z moim łączem to 2 tygodnie pobierania ( nie włączam komputera non-stop tylko wieczorem na kilka godzin). Miałem pobrane jakieś 90 GB i w tym momencie wyszła aktualizacja - pobranie zostało zresetowane do 0 i rozpoczęło się od nowa. Minęło kilka dni ponad 85 GB na dysku i kolejna aktualizacja - cała instalka poszła i pobieranie zaczęło się od nowa. Minęło grubo ponad miesiąc i w końcu udało mi się ją pobrać i zainstalować.   Nie gram w grę codziennie, jestem osobą dorosła, pracującą i nie zawsze mam czas. Najczęściej mogę pograć godzinę lub dwie w weekend.  I tu znowu problemy. Co dwa tygodnie średnio jest aktualizacja - do pobrania tak jak dziś 4,6 GB i zamiast zrelaksować się po całym tygodniu pracy obserwuję po raz kolejny pasek pobierania.  Podsumowując - w moim przypadku, przy wolnym internecie zamiast grania tylko pobieram i aktualizuje. Swoją drogą co jest takiego złego w tej grze, że co dwa tygodnie są aktualizacje? Przecież aktualizujemy i łatami bubel techniczny - bo coś dobrego nie wymaga poprawek. Wszystkie produkty firmy Microsoft są takie same. Aktualizacja, aktualizacja i aktualizacja.  Mam na koncie prawie sto gier, ale takie zachowanie gry widzę po raz pierwszy.  Na koniec jeszcze raz powtórzę - jeśli macie szybkie łącze internetowe to OK - nie będziecie mieli problemów. Niestety jeśli macie dość wolne łącze - dobrze się zastanówcie czy warto się denerwować. Ja gdybym to wiedział nie zakupiłbym produktu.

Have you ever read a book where you were so obsessed, completely consumed and taken away by it? A book that is so good, that you can't stop reading it but in the same time are afraid that you'll reach the end at some point and even if you read it again some time you will never feel that magical first-time experience. I haven't had that feeling with a game until this one. I absolutely adore it! And I have barely played 8 hours and I am already so in love. The only thing I don't particularly like is that some dialogues are too long for me, but that's a quite insignificant drawback. I don't care what some s****y youtubers say, I'm into gaming since the early 2000's and I can easily say - this game is a masterpiece! Doesn't matter if you're 14, 25, 30, 40 or 50, you'll have tons of fun with Biomutant. Experiment 101, great job!

After one night of playing, this game skyrocketed to one of my all time favorites.  -Great story.  It drives you to move the story forward.  It's compelling, you actually care about moving the story just to see what happens next.  But it also throws side quests/stories at you that you care about too.  So much so that you really just want to do every quest and story line. -Great characters.  The personalities of the characters, NPCs, villains, are all awesome.  You'll love some, hate some, but they all feel very different.  It really makes the world they've created feel alive. -Guns, guns, guns, oh and some guns.  Don't like the shooter you have, grab another, find another, throw one away.  The variety of weapons is staggering along with the ways they operate.  You can really tailor your weapons to your characters abilities to make the type of combatant that you want to play. -Vehicles.  For fast traveling and fun.  This is introduced at just the right point in the game to keep things moving.  The vehicles even have weapons, so it's also even new combat while speeding up traveling. -Expansions.  The addon content really is great.  It's well integrated into the game, it adds tons of new content. -Great FPS.  This game runs super smooth.  I play 100% on laptops, and no not gaming laptops and this thing runs as smooth as can be.  Hardly any noticable FPS drop, even in the big boss fights.  Abosutely love this game for some straight up bang-bang-boom-boom fun.

Отыграл в эту игру сравнительно не долго, но купил сразу как она появилась в раннем доступе. Я был и являюсь поклонником Contract Wars, прародителя этой игры, поэтому времени на раздумия много не понадобилось.   Сразу описать свои чувства не вышло бы. Я ждал обновлённый КВ с фишками и графоном, а получил другую игру в том же сеттинге. Механика игры способствует высокой динамике,а физическая отдача определяет поведение в бою, в отличие от КВ, где на любых дистанциях рулили и рулят штурмовые винтовки с высоким уроном, тут в зависимости от карты и дистанций оружие подбирать нужно скрупулёзнее.  Из минусов хочу отметить невысокий онлайн, каждый бой одни и те же лица, но, уверен, эта ситуация исправится. Баги и прочие "радости" раннего доступа сейчас присутствуют, но по большому счёту они все не критичны. Многие девелоперы выпускают уже готовый продукт с теми же проблемами, как не очень хорошая оптимизация, некритические баги, а уже потом доделывают это послерилизными патчами.  Если вы живёте в России и для вас эта игра стоит 300 рублей, купить её, конечно же стоит. Ценник весьма и весьма классный, я же брал игру за 7$, что подороже, но я так же не жалею о покупке.   Жду прироста онлайна с релизной версией. Игру к ознакомлению рекомендую. 9/10

This is not just a typical management sim game where you are running a drug factory and producing various kinds of medicine, but with an addition twist of a puzzle which requires you to find the optimal concentration for each drug to be able to sell. I think this design saves the game from being an otherwise boring and repetitive game into something that is surprisingly fresh and pleasant. My favourite part of the game is about mixing two ingredients to produce a “Super Drug” which sells for a lot of money. You can really put a lot of brain power into this game to make the “Perfect Drug” which always challenges and fascinates me.

[h1] Mit gefühlt 10 FPS durch Hamburg! [/h1]  [b] Nach nun fast 3 Stunden ausgiebigen Testen und Fahren nun also ein erstes Fazit zur Release-Version. [/b]  [b] Da ist er nun endlich, der SubwaySim Hamburg! Vorab: Ich hab mich wirklich extrem auf dieses Spiel gefreut, da ich selber aus Hamburg komme und die U-Bahn und auch die U3 gut kenne. Doch leider kann ich das Spiel in diesem momentanen Zustand nicht empfehlen, denn das, was hier abgeliefert wurde, ist ein Spiel, welches scheinbar nur zu 70 % fertiggestellt wurde. Echt schade für diese schöne Linie und Stadt. Ich werde den SubwaySim hier oft mit Train Sim World (TSW) vergleichen, denn der TSW macht einige Punkte sehr viel besser, während andere Punkte hier besser umgesetzt sind. [/b]  [b] Doch kommen wir erstmal zu den positiven Punkten denn da gibt es doch einige. [/b]  [b] Pros [/b]  -Grafisch ist das Spiel natürlich Bombe, die Umgebung sieht wirklich wahnsinnig schön aus und jede einzelne Station erkennt man wieder. Auch der DT5 ist eine Pracht und gefällt mir sowohl von außen als auch von innen richtig gut, so sind auch die Anzeigetafeln in den Zügen animiert. Hier wurde sich insgesamt sehr viel Mühe gegeben.  -Es gibt tatsächlich Ansagen! Unglaublich, da bei TSW immer noch unvorstellbar. Die Ansagen sind nicht zu 100 % Original, da die echten aufgrund von Lizenzproblemen nicht verwendet werden dürfen. Die echte Sprecherin, Anke Harnack hat diese aber nochmal extra für das Spiel eingesprochen und auch hier wurde sich sehr viel Mühe gegeben. Auch die englischen Ansagen, die in den letzten Versionen noch gefehlt haben, sind mittlerweile implementiert.  -Vorhanden sind zum Release 2 Modi: Im Fahrplan-Modus fährt man einfach eine Linie um die und die Zeit von A nach B. Der Zug ist direkt aufgerüstet und es kann sofort losgehen. Dann wäre da noch der Experten-Modus, indem man eine Zeit und einen Bahnhof auswählen kann und frei so fahren kann, wie man will. Der Zug muss dabei selber aufgerüstet werden und konfiguriert werden. Hier kann man definitiv einige Stunden Spaß haben. Die Szenarien kommen scheinbar erst später, da bin ich wirklich sehr gespannt.  -Steuerung funktioniert und läuft problemlos und ist ähnlich wie im TSW. Das Fahren des Zuges macht sehr viel Spaß und geht einfach von der Hand.  -Die Region um den Hafen sieht wirklich schön aus. Hier hat man sich wirklich ins Zeug gelegt, auch wenn ein paar Gebäude ein bisschen verwaschen aussehen. Man erkennt viele Sehenswürdigkeiten wieder und es fahren auch Schiffe auf dem Wasser. Wäre noch toll, wenn man noch die ein oder andere Hafenfähre sehen würde.  [b] Kontra [/b]  -Zum Thema Sound wurde schon sehr viel gesagt und die Entwickler haben auch versprochen, sich darum zu kümmern, deswegen möchte ich da gar nicht weiter drauf eingehen.  -Performance technisch ist das Spiel eine absolute Katastrophe. Es kann einfach nicht sein, dass ich mit einem System was weit über den Mindestanforderungen liegt, so massive Probleme habe das Spiel auf Medium zu spielen und es auf Low immer noch extrem laggt und somit gar keinen Unterschied macht, ob ich auf Low oder Medium spiele. An andere höhere Qualitätsstufen ist bei mir gar nicht zu denken. Hier muss sich was tun, momentan ist es einfach nur ein Ruckelfest.  -Fahrgastinformationssysteme an den Bahnsteigen noch völlig ohne Funktion, obwohl vor Wochen versprochen wurde, dass das noch kommen soll.  -Das Verhalten der Fahrgäste ist absolut fragwürdig. Sie bleiben, obwohl es der Endbahnhof ist, immer noch in den Zügen sitzen, sie gehen synchron durch die Türen, laufen durch Wände und andere Hindernisse hindurch (gerne auch mal auf Gleisen) und man selbst als Fahrer kann auch durch sie durchgehen... Hier stimmt leider einiges noch nicht.  -An der Promenade am Hafen stehen ein paar Leute statisch herum, das war es dann aber auch. Ich jedenfalls habe den Hafen in echt noch nie so leer gesehen.  -Es existiert zwar irgendwie KI-Verkehr auf anderen Linien, doch sind dies scheinbar Geisterzüge. An der U1 an der Kellinghusenstraße bspw. steht immer „nicht einsteigen“ und es steigt auch keiner ein oder aus.  -Generell steigen an einigen Bahnhöfen keine Fahrgäste ein oder aus, was in Hamburg absolut nicht sein kann.  -Die Beleuchtung in den Tunneln ist absolut fragwürdig und baut sich erst mit der Zeit auf, so kann man leider auch schwer sehen, wann der nächste Bahnhof kommt.  -Beim Punkt HUD und Benutzerfreundlichkeit können sich die Entwickler echt mal eine Scheibe von TSW abschneiden... Das HUD ist absolut grauenhaft. Im Fahrplan-Modus wird nicht angezeigt, welche Station als nächstes kommt und wann man da sein muss. So weiß man leider auch nicht wie viel Verspätung macht schon hat und erfährt dies erst am Ende der Fahrt.  -Wenn man an einem großen Bahnhof (zb in Barmbek oder Wandsbek-Gartenstadt) das Gleis wechseln möchte und sich der Treppe nährt, wird man zum Bahnsteig einfach TELEPORTIERT!? Ernsthaft? Macht doch da einfach wenigtens irgendeinen generischen Gang hin, wenn ihr schon nicht die Original-Unterführungen umsetzen könnt/wollt. Aber so zerstört das leider völlig die Immersion.  -Einige Ansagen am Bahnhof Barmbek fehlen noch (Übergang zur U3 in Richtung Kellinghusenstraße)  -Es ist nicht möglich zu Fuß an irgendeinem Bahnsteig zu starten und mit einem KI-Zug mitzufahren. Wenn man im Experten-Modus in einen anderen Zug einsteigt, wird man einfach irgendwann durch eine Alphawand rausgeworfen.  -Zudem kann man sich weder im Zug noch an den Bahnsteigen hinsetzen.  [b] Fazit: Leider wurde das Spiel in einem unfertigen Zustand veröffentlicht, viele elementare Funktionen sind einfach noch nicht da oder funktionieren nicht/nicht richtig. Doch wenn sich die Entwickler wirklich Zeit nehmen, die oben genannten Probleme und weitere beheben, könnte das wirklich ein guter Simulator werden, der mit einer TSW-Strecke locker mithalten kann. Wenn man dann noch in Zukunft die Linien U1, U2 und U4 sowie die Fahrzeuge DT4 und auch den DT3 ergänzt und diese Linien nahtlos miteinander verbindet, sodass man von einer Linie zu anderen steigen kann, könnte das wirklich „Der ultimative Hamburger U-Bahn-Simulator“ werden. Doch der Weg dahin ist noch sehr lang. [/b]  Insgesamt gebe ich erstmal nur 3,5 von 10 Punkten.

Ну и вот дорогие друзья настал тот момент когда Fallout 4 пройден мною 2 из возможных 4 концовок. Счетчик в стиме показывает 101 час а из игры тем не менее совсем не хочется уходить она не отпускает тебя. Bethesda Softworks с ее фоллаутом у далось, то что не удавалось не одной игре сделать уже лет 10 как. Ты заходишь на 10 минут сдать тот маленький квест из цикла "подай принеси" и пропадаешь в пустоши забываешь про всё на свете "и не замечаешь как за окнами занимается рассвет" как бы высокопарно это не звучало. И ,что самое важное от нее не устаёшь. Ваш покорный слуга искренне не понимает какой механизм лежит в основе этой наркомании. Важно понимать, что называть её шедевром нельзя. В этой игре множество недостатков кривая анимация (кукольная), глючные текстуры, и местечковый сюжет. Но 95 % времени ты этого не замечаешь, ты погружаешься в живой, большой постоянно меняющийся мир который заставляет игрока жить по своим законам, постоянно удивляет и удивляет так что ты ставишь игру на паузу подымаешь с пола челюсть и идёшь курить. А потом возвращаешься потому что впереди сотни километров пыльных дорог обдуваемых радио-активными грозами, десятки маленьких интересных историй и... и дополнения которые Bethesda Softworks умеет делать лучше всех в этой части галактики.

Okay, I'm firmly against any sort of Facebook Games, and the company name "Zynga" has left a bad taste in my mouth for years.  BUT HEAR ME OUT.  This game is a very fast-paced MOBA, designed by those bastards at Zynga.  It was designed for the iPhone 4 and other Mobile Devices, and allows Cross-Platform play.    Is Zynga making a turnaround???  If this game is an example, I think that perhapps they are.  Solstice Arena is absolutely AMAZING for what it is.  An easy-to-play, easy-to-learn (hard to master?) MOBA that does it right.    It eliminates some of the rage that infects other MOBA's by not allowing you to type to other people in game.  You communicate in game via Pings, and in the after-game lobby you are presented with a button to make your character say "GG", a "Report Player" button, and a screen allowing you to add any of the people you just played with as a friend (I assume you can talk to them then).  All in all, it seems like a pretty ingenious design.  Keep in mind that it's designed to be simple.  Despite the horrid reputation of the developer, this game could easily be on par with bigger sells such as "Awesomenauts".   Plus, it's free to play, so why not give it a shot?  ***9/10, will play again :D

game: The Walking Dead: The Telltale Definitive Series
review: The Walking Dead: The Telltale Definitive Series, Skybound Games tarafından geliştirilen ve yayınlanan bir oyun serisidir. Bu oyun serisi, 4 Sezon, 400 Days ve The Walking Dead: Michonne'u içermektedir ve 23 benzersiz bölümde toplamda 50 saatten fazla oynanış süresi sunmaktadır.  Grafiksel Geliştirmeler: "Graphic Black" sanat tarzı, 4. Sezonun geliştirilmiş görsel stilini önceki sezonlara getiriyor. Ayrıca daha önce bu yükseltmeyi almayan bölümlere tam dinamik aydınlatma da dahil edilecektir.  Kamera Arkası Bonuslar: Geliştiriciler, seslendirme sanatçıları ve Clementine'ın hikayesini hayata geçiren diğer ekip üyelerinden oyunun yapımına dair özel görüntüler sunulmaktadır. Bu, 10 saatten fazla geliştirici yorumu ve "The Walking Dead'ın Dönüşü" belgesel kısa filmi gibi içerikleri içermektedir.  Oynanış İyileştirmeleri: Karakter performansları, dudak senkronizasyonu ve diğer oynanış ve kullanıcı arayüzü iyileştirmeleri, bu oyunun kesinlikle en iyi Telltale's The Walking Dead deneyimi olduğunu göstermektedir.  Daha fazla dijital bonus: Tüm sezonlarda yer alan 40+ şarkıyı içeren müzik çalar, sanat galerisi, oynanabilir ses hatlarına sahip 3D model görüntüleyici ve tüm geçmiş sezonların orijinal menülerini ve müziklerini içeren yeni 3D başlangıç ekranı gibi ek dijital bonuslar bulunmaktadır.  The Walking Dead: The Telltale Definitive Series, Clementine'ın yolculuğunu deneyimlemenin ve hikayesinin nasıl sona erdiğini keşfetmenin kesin yoludur. Grafiksel geliştirmeler, kamera arkası bonuslar ve sadık yeniden yapılanma, bu oyun serisini unutulmaz kılmaktadır. Eğer zombi temalı bir hikaye odaklı oyunlar ilginizi çekiyorsa, The Walking Dead: The Telltale Definitive Series sizi kendine çekebilir.

Great Tactical Game  I wouldn't call myself a perfectionist but this game defiantly made me one while playing it. All the different ways to complete the mission had me overwhelmed sometimes. The different settings helps the game not become boring for the player. There's always new ways to assassinate your target in unique ways. My first Hitman game was Blood Money and I thoroughly enjoyed it so I decided to give Absolution a try. Boy was I happy. I don't even think I'm halfway through the game while I write this review and I have 14 hours put into the game. If you like planning out things and watching them all be executed perfectly then I recommend you give this game a chance.
