东方月神夜（Touhou Luna Nights）一周目9小时全收集100%地图探索外加一次bossrush通关。由于我本人不是东方粉没玩过东方任意一款游戏，只是把本作当成一个普通的metroidvania玩的，因此剧情和音乐我就不懂也无从评论了。  作为一个类银河城，本作系统明显是偏向castlevania那一系的，攻击敌人可以掉落宝石和经验，经验可以升级，然后宝石可以拿来卖钱买各种一次性道具，这点给了玩家打不过去可以刷的机会（当然事实上以本作的难度来看没有任何刷钱的必要）。当然值得一提的地方是宝石捏在手里的时候本身会给玩家提供非常小的正面buff，然而图跑多了宝石多了buff就不小了，因此宝石也不一定非得卖，这个机制颇让人眼前一亮。  本作的地图说大不大，说小不小，本质上是一本道，然而地图中留了非常多的隐藏等玩家去找，给人一种非常扎实的感觉。然而这些隐藏的问题在于，由于游戏整体的地图做得过于四四方方，因此一旦某些区域在大地图上显示已经到头了然而大地图旁边的格子缺了一块立刻就会让玩家意识到那里有隐藏，一定程度降低了解密难度。地图设计上中规中矩，还是那种标准的给玩家岔路然而实际上只有一条路可以去拿道具或者能力解锁新的道路，并且五大地图（算上隐藏地图一共六个区域）基本都遵循跑图、拿新能力、使用新能力探索地图并熟练掌握、boss战四个节奏。整体流程不长，然而节奏紧凑，给人一口气通关的欲望。  本作的移动机制做的不错，战斗系统优秀但存在问题，时停时缓技能非常优秀。移动能力自带空中滑翔，中后期会解锁二段跳和时停状态踩自己的攻击技能做平台，大后期会解锁冲刺跑。在后期时停时间上去之后这些技能组合能做到整个地图想去哪儿去哪儿，基本的爽点有了。本作的战斗系统颇有意思，主角在离敌人近的时候会擦弹，擦弹可以回血，这一点虽然打算是给游戏提供深度，然而问题在于本游戏每离开一次房间该房间内敌人全部刷新，这样的话玩家可以在两个房间来回切换的时候刷敌人回血，这点大大降低了游戏难度。此外在boss战的时候，有些boss的攻击虽然强力，然而攻击空隙不小导致打血没回血多也降低了游戏难度。主角的攻击手段有扔飞刀和使用路上收集隐藏时拿到的各种技能，然而这些技能有一个在攻击的时候是自带霸体并且敌人此阶段对自己所有的攻击几乎全判定为擦弹，这甚至直接让这个游戏boss战无脑了起来。时停和时缓技能需要单拿出来提，因为这些技能即算输出也算移动技能。在时间减缓或者暂停的状态下，玩家可以操作得更精准并且在短时间内产出大量输出。此外后期的时候玩家可以通过时停扔飞刀然后踩自己飞刀跳得更高。有些特定的机关、敌人和攻击是不受时停影响或是受时停影响会产生其他效果，因而这一机制不但增加了某些敌人和boss战的难度同时也构成了本游戏绝大多数的简单解谜关卡，玩起来给玩家一种在玩braid的感觉。  整体来说本作作为一个打折46块的游戏，metroidvania该有的东西都有了，并且在此基础上还存在一定创新，是一个不错的游戏。

Ken levine y su equipo de Irrational Games nos ofrecen la tercera entrega de su obra Bioshock. En esta ocasión llamada Infinite.  Para empezar y como siempre en nuestros análisis comenzaremos por centrarnos en el aspecto técnico del juego referido lógicamente a la versión de PC del mismo.  El cual debemos decir que es fantástico, aunque en honor a la verdad, tenemos que puntualizar que ha pasado un año completo desde su puesta a la venta hasta el momento de este análisis. Dicho esto, el juego presenta una gran estabilidad en su rendimiento, incluso en sus configuraciones más altas y aprovechando con acertada eficiencia los recursos de nuestro equipo. También dispone e las tradicionales opciones de configuración para personalizar la calidad visual en función de nuestro equipo, sin nada más que decir salvo volver a recalcar el buen sabor de boca del aspecto técnico, pasamos a debatir otros aspectos.  Nada más comenzar la aventura nos daremos cuenta de uno de los puntos fuertes del título, la impresionante ambientación y nivel artístico que posee. No podemos dejar pasar este punto sin pararnos a comentar la fascinante localización y el diseño tan absolutamente creativo de Infinite. Y es que será un deleite ver la profundidad e inmersión conseguida en Columbia, ciudad donde se desarrolla la trama, y el sublime nivel artístico. Fantásticas recreaciones, acontecimientos,  converdaciones, eventos y demás sucesos que presenciaremos a lo largo de la historia.  Pasamos ahora al que supone el verdadero fundamento del juego, su historia. La cual es espectacular, creativa, profunda y sorprendente. La cual es digna de las mejores películas del mundo cinematográfico, y que nos guardará algunas sorpresas y giros una vez que avancemos en ella. Sin entrar en detalles ni spoilers para no estropear nada, a modo de introducción diremos que encarnaremos la Piel de Booker DeWitt, un detective privado que recibe el encargo de traer de vuelta a una joven muchacha, prisionera en una ciudad flotante bajo el mando de un "profeta" con ideales autoritarios y algo racistas.  Elisabeth - Este es el nombre de la co-protagonista del título, la cual tendrá una importancia capital en la historia, girando en muchas de sus partes en torno a ella. No podemos olvidar el enorme detalle y belleza a todoslos niveles de Elisabeth. Llenando con su encanto, inocencia y simpatía llena de matices nuestra aventura. Enriqueciendola y dotandola de variedad y riqueza. Una inmejorable compañera de aventuras, dotada de una inteligencia artificial digna de elogio.  En otro orden cabe destacar el magnífico aspecto y nivel sonoro de B.Infinite. Las numerosas conversaciones y diálogos tanto entre protagonistas principales como secundarios, los pensamientos del protagonista, los voxafonos.. todo con un nivel de detalle exquisito.  Es cierto que el juego tiene una duración estándar, nos ha llevado unas 15 horas completarlo, parandonos con detenimiento a recoger casi por completo las mejoras y coleccionables desperdigados a lo largo de la aventura. Y si bien quizás se eche en falta algún toque que le aporte algo de rejugabilidad, es un juego 100% recomendable y que no se debe caer en el error de catalogarlo como shooter, ya que es mucho más que eso. Sin duda lo volverás a disfrutar si eres un apasionado de una buena historia, con un mejor argumento y un final superior aún.  No podemos concluir el análisis sin recomendar fervientemente y sin asomo de duda el título  a todo aquel interesado en el. Toda una obra de arte hecha videojuego y que supone el broche de oro de la aportación de ken levine a la saga Bioshock.

游戏内容勉强，风格很好，玩法也有跑杀和攻击波模式可以让玩家在剧情通关后感受技术和地图的刺激，虽然对新手可能有的难上手，但是基本上可以半小时熟练，我8小时通关剧情跑杀攻击波，但还是能在无聊的时候打开跑杀或攻击波模式感受赛博朋克风的击杀快感，特别是杀完人后按x嘲讽攻击就会变的很帅！游戏整体来讲真的不错，新手玩家可以在其他视频平台搜索技巧（我有点憨，超级跳蹲跳大跳都是自己在游戏里碰巧打出来然后摸索出来的，不然应该能更快通关），游戏里的皮肤是可以用模块：在地图上标记可收集物品，来获取的，龙行鹤羽系列真的很帅，要不是一开始不知道可以游戏里拿我都不会买那些dlc了，生还者手套搭配很多武器皮肤都很绝！专业模式也能让我感受到强度和技巧运用的爽快体验，游戏真的不错，推荐！ 以上仅是我的个人观点，勿喷 以上

The relationship between Emily and Corvo feels forced and uncomfortable. I really like Robin Lord Taylor in Gotham as The Penguin, but I don't like the revaamped Outsider, he just feels wrong for the role and the remodel leaves something to be desired, he seems less ominous and dark.  The Gameplay is outstanding with fluid combat that feels more polished than the first game, more finishers, more gore, more everything in that department. The level design is more exciting, more places to go, more things to see, more, more, more.  I feel like the story is weaker and less interesting than the first game's story, having played through it several dozen times over the years. I don't feel the same draw to come back and play through high chaos and low chaos. It's just a bit bland for me. I was able to guess a lot of the major plot points before being given the "key" to the secret, so to speak. I wanted more depth and it didn't feel like it was there.  Would I recommend the game to others? It's hard to say. If you REALLY liked the first game as much as I did and replayed it endlessly, yes and no. I am disappointed in the story this time around, but the gameplay makes up for most of that for me and is what brings me back to the game more than anything. If you're a stickler for great story, maybe not so much. If you like fluid combat with fun abilities, definitely.  Unrelated to this game entirely, I am incredibly pissed about Death of the Outsider being it's own standalone game that adds nothing new to the series besides lore. Same Engine, same graphics, same virtually everything, but 30 dollars AND stand alone. Could have been a DLC since it's not going to be ANY LONGER than the DLC Knife of Dunwall, or Brigmore Witches. That being said, I will likely shell out the 30 dollars, cry more, and play the faux-dlc.

В какой-то момент игры на безлюдных просторах песков ты находишь другого игрока, у вас нет возможности общаться текстом или голосом.  И этот игрок становится твоим напарником до конца игры, абсолютно посторонний человек в любой точке мира ощущает те же эмоции, что и ты. Это самое светлое и приятное чувство, которое мне дарили игры ever.

На первый взгляд эта игра кажется обычным симулятором свиданий с анимешками для одиноких людей. Но это не так, даже если рассматривать её с позиции симулятора, она тянет на 8/10, но когда она "изживёт" себя как симулятор(т.е вы пройдёте все хорошие концовки всех 5 доступных девушек), то вам откроют тайну Совёнка и самой игры. Они будут отвечать на каждый ваш вопрос, выдавая ещё 2 вопроса сверху. До сих пор нельзя точно сказать, зачем вообще эта игра существует, какой смысл у её сюжета, чему она хочет научить. Но в одном я уверен - это шедевр. Непонятый быдлом, скипнутый мамкиными альфачами шедевр геймдева.

4х экономическая стратегия + карточный рогалик + выживание. Длина одной игровой сессии 1-2 часа.  Графика не режет глаза. Геймплей затягивает, но пока что вряд ли более чем на 50-100 часов. Сюжета нет. Очень низкие требования по железу. Запустится и на калькуляторе. Мне она показалось более ламповой, чем Per Aspera. Из минусов: Многие механики крайне не наглядны. Даже спустя 60 часов игры крайне условно понимаю как рассчитываются и перемножаются баллы поддержки и комфорта или как высчитывается показатель ожидания колонистов. Точно так же как непонятно иногда почему животные не хотят размещаться в какой-то зоне, даже если ничто этому вроде бы не мешает. И насколько я понял это не баг. Очень мало случайных событий, а сами события однотипны (построй что-то до какого-то срока, накопи ресурсов). "Убей 10 кабанов от мира 4х" Хотелось бы иметь возможность как-нибудь косвенно влиять на рандом. Например, слегка повышать или понижать шанс выпадения каких-то построек в ротации или шанса управленцев. Или точно выстраивать их последовательность.  UX/UI не самый приятный. Очень много лишних кликов мышью приходится делать.  Невозможно расселять животных/бактерии/растения щёлкая сразу по зоне, а не залезая в дебри меню при каждой попытке. Очень нужна возможность сразу на самой зоне видеть все возможные для размещения формы жизни, а не пытаться их все по очереди выбирать, чтоб посмотреть позволит ли игра туда их разместить или нет.  Очень неудобно ориентироваться в пространстве планеты. Непонятно иногда где ты находишься. Хотелось бы указателей направления. Читаемость игрового поля в лейт гейме очень сильно падает. Всё смешивается в кашу.  Периодически ловятся баги.   Было бы, возможно, интересно с т.з геймплея иметь вместо смертных управляющих возможность выбрать одного из списка бессмертных "ИИ" с заданными на всю игру абилками, которые бы очень сильно меняли геймплей. Как один из вариантов для DLC.  И было бы неплохо иметь режим в котором рядом с тобой гарантированно были бы какие-то нужные тебе ресурсы, чтобы можно было строить билд ордеры.  Хочется больше интересных ачивок. Большая часть из них зарабатывается сама собой без надобности что-то делать для этого.

玩了一个小时，快吐了，让一个从不晕3D的人玩得十分难受。 画面老旧不谈，整体色调过于阴暗，游戏内光线还不断闪烁，画风丑陋有断肢出现，加上人物动作视角僵硬，过场动画经常大幅晃动，一会儿就生理恶心到玩不下去了。 其实游戏细节和交互还是看得出来有一些的，风格类似于生化奇兵前两部，但处于完全下位。 只能说褒贬不一是有道理的，如果不是怀旧不要轻易尝试这种评价很一般的老游戏。

Esperaba un juego mejor. Desde luego no es para pagar 20 euros  por él (el precio en steam), no los merece ni de lejos.  Menos mal que me salió por 4,44 euros, pero quizás lo que más me fastidia es que podría haber sido mucho mejor juego.  Pros:  - Puede ser divertido en cooperativo, escuchando las cosas que dicen los personajes, y dándole tú a la expresión que te interese; a mi encanta darle al de Risas.  - No necesitas un gran ordenador para poder jugarlo.  - Muchos mapas y una variedad aceptable de armas.  - Opción de ponerlo en tercera persona utilizando la consola bind ("tecla que quieras") thirdpersonshoulder, puede ser muy práctico para los ataques cuerpo a cuerpo, a la vez que le da variedad, pero no es nada recomendable para las armas de fuego, ya que el apuntado siempre queda desviado.  Contras:  - Puede ser muy aburrido jugándolo sólo.  - En la descripción del producto, debería venir especificado de forma clara, que dos de sus campañas, "Defunción"  y el "Sacrificio" NO ESTÁN DOBLADAS AL ESPAÑOL, y no me hubiera vuelto loco pensando que hice mal la instalación del juego o que no tenía bien configurado steam. Me lo ha confirmado el propio soporte de steam un mes después de haber hecho la consulta.  - Encuentro muy fácil perderse en los mapas, y puedes terminar dando vueltas y mas vueltas por los mismos sitios sin tener muy claro hacia donde tienes que ir, y mientras no paran de venir ataques de zombis que corren como gacelas.  Debería tener algún tipo de señalización u opción tipo minimapa que te oriente. Una frase suelta que dice un personaje te da una pista de si vas por buen camino, pero lo encuentro francamente insuficiente.  Si te pierdes en el mapa y estás dando vueltas y mas vueltas sin tener muy claro hacia donde tienes que ir, te puedes aburrir hasta la saciedad.  - Puede llegar a ser bastante difícil en nivel normal, así que sólo lo juego en fácil; en nivel difícil ya es que me parece que el juego entra de lleno en lo ridículo con esa cantidad desorbitada de zombies que corren de forma desaforada.  Encuentro ridículo algunos de los tipos de zombis que te inmovilizan como el "charger" y no puedes hacer nada hasta que un compañero te salva. Lo encuentro innecesario, cansino, corta-punto, burdo, rudimentario y facilón.  - Desde mi punto de vista, este juego ha envejecido muy mal.  - No lo encuentro para nada adictivo.  - Gráficos limitados.  No puedo recomendar comprar este juego a no ser que esté como mucho a 3 euros, y ya creo que me estoy pasando.

E' un gioco FPS che unisce il map design degli Arena, lo shooting di Halo e la meccanica dei portali di Portal. E no, non è frenetico come un FPS Arena, però sa essere veloce e mobile comunque grazie agli sprint e al jetpack che permette di planare o saltare più in alto. Persino i portali ricoprono un ruolo importante in questo senso. In particolare questi ultimi potete posizionali in muri speciali presenti in buona parte della mappa e vi permetteranno appunto di spostarvi ovunque voi siate (persino utilizzando quelli avversari). Non ha meccaniche particolari che vanno imparate: il gioco infatti è molto semplice e si lascia giocare da subito. Ciò che magari spiazza è per l'appunto capire come utilizzare i portali, vera caratterista di questo gioco. Diciamo che finché non abbiamo gente contro che sbuca non si sa da dove, non sentiamo la reale necessità di utilizzarli. Se la si padroneggia diventa un'arma molto forte in nostro possesso. Le modalità sono abbastanza diverse, seppur c'è qualche somiglianza qui e là. Cosa che personalmente non mi tira molto è il fatto di avere solo 2 armi alla volta: si possono sì cambiare, ma comunque non puoi portarne più di 2 per volta. In un gioco del genere avrei gradito un arsenale più ampio. E' poi un gioco ben ottimizzato: con la mia 1070ti riesco a stare fisso a 144fps in 2K tutto ad epico. Inoltre e per fortuna non è un gioco pay to win, sebbene sia presente un pass battaglia che consente di sbloccare meri oggetti cosmetici. In definitiva ve lo consiglio se volete giocare un FPS tutto sommato semplice ed immediato da giocare, che occupa poco spazio sul disco e che è ben ottimizzato.

У меня такое чувство, что я видел эту игру ещё до 2009. Даже не знаю почему.  Когда то давно я пробовал "Path of exile", и на тот момент мне показалось что это скучная и унылая пародия на "Diablo". Но недавно, что то потянуло меня установить и поиграть. Как же она (Path of exile) великолепна. Мрачный и гнетущий мир полный монстров. Невероятной красоты локации. Завораживающие боссы. Как я раньше этого не замечал...  • Первое что расстраивает - подключение к серверам, которое бывает не с первого раза. Сидишь и тыкаешь между Германией и Россией в надежде на то что хоть куда то подключится. > И не хватает кастомизации персонажей. Я понимаю что в той же Дябле ты создаешь персонажа каким он есть, выбирая лишь его пол ... но все же хочется играть собственно созданным аватаром. • Второе же - чуть-ли не ежедневные микрообновления. БЕСЯТ! Собственно поэтому уже не в первый раз удаляю игру, так-как играю лишь в свободное время ... а обновления эти каждый день.

Em um liquidificador, bata o Leite MOÇA, o NESTLÉ Creme de Leite, o suco de maracujá e a gelatina. Coloque em taças individuais. 4.  Leve à geladeira até ficar firme, por cerca de 2 horas. TLDR: I only recommend it if you have friends to play with. The solo experience is bad.  Game is actually pretty interesting, especially in the first few hours. Lots of quests, lots to do on the map, rewards for exploring, rewarding progression (early on). I really like the concept of "multiplayer stalker" and its executed fairly well mostly.  It falls apart when you add PvP to the mix though. It sucks searching an area for a quest item and getting ganked by groups of enemy players. Lose everything you've collected that run, only to gear up, go back to the quest location and die to the players that are still there. If you have 1 or 2 friends, you wont have to worry about getting jumped as often, but by yourself is rough. I cannot recommend playing this game solo.

This game takes about an hour to complete, and what is there is very high quality, if unsubtle, storytelling and symbolism.  However, it leaves off with a literal 'to be continued' and none of the plot threads presented are tied up.  The game feels like the first act of a three act story, and due to this, I can't see recommending it anyone at full price, because it will leave you unsatisfied and wishing that the other two acts were available. If you an grab it on sale, it is absolutely worth experiencing.

Es un muy buen juego, de supervivencia, pero también de construcción, con una amplia variedad de armas y herramientas. Es el Minecraft de Steam (y de hecho que raro que sea Free 2 Play). Te aviso, antes que nada, que tu progreso puede perderse en un santiamén si te morís de hambre, sed, radiación o por culpa de las manadas de zombies. Los items respawnean aleatoriamente cada vez que te logeas. Pero algo importante que tenés que saber es que tu progreso puede o no ser distinto del de los servidores multijugador (en realidad depende el servidor), quiero decir, que dependiendo el server, podés tener o no los items que conseguiste en el singleplayer. Pero más allá de eso, el juego vale la pena jugarlo con amigos, ya que se pueden hacer muchas cosas, y sólo pesa 150mb! ;)  Edit: Además si vieras la versión Beta (que sería la versión de acceso anticipado, aún más anticipado que la que ves en las capturas) verás que se vienen unos cambios estéticos IMPORTANTÍSIMOS =D!!!

游戏非常好，但我觉得他可以归类为冒险游戏。星球大战的IP是非常宏大的，但这个游戏并不是开放世界游戏。更像是一款角色冒险游戏，游戏给我的感觉像是三位一体。特别是推球的那一章。开始的时候预告加上IP。我以为这是一款开放世界游戏，所以直接买了，播片部分让我觉得很热血星球大战风扑面而来。加上电影的配乐，以及电影的转场非常棒。但从飞船落地去神寺我开始后悔了，迷路，迷路还是迷路，但这里还好。奔溃的是后面的图。我在做第一章的时候以及丛林每个图基本迷了三小时路。其实最难受的是游戏并不是开放世界玩法，让我觉得和星战主题不是很搭。游戏打斗很不错光剑的声音配上原力很有绝地的感觉。如果是路痴最好谨慎购买，以及这不是开放世界玩法一定要注意。路痴一定要谨慎。比如我好几次都差点想砸掉电脑，哭了。其实最失望的的就是以为这是开放世界但后来发现不是心理落差太大。但游戏打斗做的还是不错的，画面也很棒，星战粉可以试试。

垃圾人做的垃圾游戏，游戏里面的也是垃圾玩家，这游戏你玩得好好的，但是如果某天突然出了个好东西，别高兴太早，因为你第二天就可能被封号，因为有人眼红了，你出了装备他没出，他给你举报了。然而你想申述，不好意思，服务器在国外，你还要翻墙去申诉。服务器垃圾，组队打10分钟掉一次，游戏里有改哥，改装备改游戏币等等，官方很弱鸡查不到这些改哥。说说我的封号经历吧，本人没开任何辅助外挂什么的，因为游戏里面名字可以重名，掉出好装备会在世界显示XXX获得了什么什么装备，然后呢，我和几个朋友一起玩的，起的名字就一样，我们几个人一起打装备，所以世界上就会经常显示XXX获得了什么什么装备，其实只是我们其中一个人偶尔掉的一件，但是名字一样，所以世界上就会显示经常出货，然后好玩的来了，有些人就开始酸了，说这人怎么一会儿就出货，肯定是开了外挂，然后直接举报，他不知道我们是几个人取的一样的名字在组队打怪，出货并不是一个人出的，然后这个傻逼官方居然通过了？？？666666，这是我见过最无能的官方，真正的改哥还在逍遥法外，没开任何外挂辅助的就直接封号，不过封了也好，这垃圾游戏就留给这些酸B垃圾玩家玩吧，希望他们把自己的亲吗献祭了早点出货。最后，谁买这游戏谁傻逼，退款，告辞。

THREEE, TWOOO, ONEEE, GOOOOO! A EQUIPE BROFORCE ESTÁ AQUI! Cara, esse jogo é uma explosão de testosterona, tiros, bombas, destruição e tudo que tem direito! O jogo simplesmente reúne diversos personagens de filmes clássicos como o Rambo (vulgo Rambro) e o Exterminador do Futuro (Brominator). Cada personagem com suas habilidade únicas e especiais super apelões (como o do Bro Lee). O cenário é totalmente destrutível; há uma grande variedade de inimigos divididos em soldados, aliens e demônios; gama enorme de personagens jogáveis; grande quantidade de fases e uma dificuldade que respeita muito o progresso e habilidades do jogador. Compra essa porra, BRO!

So basicly, I played this game predecessor with my good old friend Lex until it started dying out.  He later messaged me, dude you gotta play this game it's amazing.  I was like, yeah sure man but I ain't paying no 30 euros for that game. So last week the game went F2P and Lex said: Dude, you gotta download that shit. So that's what I did.  I went in, I skipped the tutorial because who does tutorials amirite? Then I took this bad ass looking Jade, who is a sniper and started wrecking shit. I was like DUDE, this shit is amazing!  No shitty minions fighting and pussy throwing abilities from a distance like a b*tch. No towers or base to fight. No monsters to kill, no shit to farm, just good ol'bloody carnage. You get in that game and you better f*** that enemy team up good.  So yeah got into this game, it was all fun and games. Dodge ulti with space, jump behind then and fuck em up. The enemy player then told me: "I hope you die of cancer" and quit the game.  Best gaming experience in 2017 for me, 10/10.

Ok, got to say the game is good. Nice story line and the play for the most part is great. There are a few things that I would love to see changed such as if you accidentally click a build you should be able to stop building it without wasting all the resourses and time. After all in real life we are never forced to continue building something we realize was a mistake. Then there is some issues with damage and wear on objects. for the most part it is excessive but understanding the game is trying to force people to keep moving and look for resources i get it. I think it could be done better by giving them more stuff to look for rather than them having to replace the steel bar they have been beating zombies to death with because it miraculously breaks or your gun wears the hell out or some such thing. I clean and maintain my real firearms I haven't been forced replace a single part on any of them in decades even with the tens of thousands of rounds through some of them.  All in all the game was worth the money and will provide a lot of game play.

First off, I'm running a fairly high-end PC (Alienware R17, NVIDA 2080 11GB Founder's Edition), while I have certainly experienced a few glitches/bugs, I have not seen anything along the lines of the issues that many others are obviously running into on the console side.  I will repeat what I've been saying since the 90's, PC is the best way to go if you're a serious gamer.  The game itself is very good, the game play, graphics quality, story line, all great quality and reminiscent of Witcher 3 play (another game I absolutely love and the main reason I even gave Cyberpunk a try given the bad reviews).  There are obvious signs the development was rushed and that english was not the first language for whoever was drafting dialogue and other texts, but it didn;t really take away from the game too much as what counts was working fine.  So I would have no issue recomending this game to players running a good PC rig, I can't speak to the console side.  I do run an Xbox as well, but do most of my heavy gaming on my PC because of, in my opinion, the technical constraints associated with the consoles.  I have a lot more options to chase and fix technical issues on a PC, including upgrading specific components as needed when compared to a console, which puts me in the herd with everyone else in begging and waiting for updates from the developer.  Great game guys, you just got cocky and lost focus after the success of Witcher, here's to hoping you guys get it sorted and we continue to see the amazing stuff you've proven you can produce.

Going Medieval is a farming and crafting town-builder game in a similar vein to Banished or Kingdoms and Castles—but it actually does innovate in this genre, since there are no pre-built buildings. Instead, you create your own buildings from individual blocks, similar to the base mechanics of Minecraft, though the mechanics here are a bit more organized and streamlined. It's a great combination of strategy/management and crafting/creative builder. The developer has also already released major updates and improvements, and seems really committed to the project. If you like building/management games, this is worth your time.

[table]     [tr] [td] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38553778-All-about-Strategy-Games/] Follow my Curator Page for more Strategy Games! [/url] [/td] [/tr] [/table]  Battle Bands: Rock & Roll Deckbuilder is a roguelike Deckbuilder that you can play with up to four friends.   [h1]Battles[/h1] You're controlling one of four bandmembers. Each Bandmember has 2 energy which you need to play cards. After everyone ends their turn, the enemy's band acts. That's the most it has in common with other deckbuilders. Instead of damaging the enemy, you need to generate hype. Each band has a hype gauge you need to fill (how much exactly varies from battle to battle). Cards generate hype but some don't and have other effects instead. Before you can play any card, you need to play a song. Songs are cards you need to play first. Each song has requirements and/or effects. A song can last for 1 to 10 cards. For completing a song you can get hype or some other bonus. Aside from songs and cards you can play to a song, there are special cards that are activated for the whole battle and give bonuses throughout your battle. There are dozens of ways to interrupt the enemy's song, reduce the enemy's hype or even put some cards into the enemy's hand.   [h1]Deckbuilder[/h1] Each band member has his own set of cards depending on his role (guitarist, etc.). The deck is always the same at the start of a run. Going into a battle, every member can choose one of three cards to be added to their deck or skip for money. Every card can be upgraded by playing them in battles. Some cards need to be played two times, some five times. A bar on the card will show how many times is required. After filling the bar and finishing the current battle, you can choose one of up to three upgrades for the card. Some events let you remove cards from your deck or even give you some. In the shop, you can remove cards for money.   [h1]Riff City[/h1] Is the roguelike mode. The map consists of dozens of nodes: Battle, event, shop, and arena. In events, there are different decisions to make, prices to win, or even something to lose.   Your band's morale decides how long your run lasts. You start with 6 of 10 hearts. For moving a node, you'll lose one. After winning a battle, you will get two hearts, losing battle results in losing some hearts. You can also get hearts in events. If you have 0 hearts left, the run ends. Another way to end your run is to fight the end boss in the arena. Items are permanent and can give bonuses or penalties. You can get them at events or in the shop. The tour level gets higher as you win battles, resulting in enemies getting stronger (more energy per turn, better cards, etc.).     [h1]Meta-progression and Microtransactions[/h1] After finishing a run, you'll get seasonal EXP, credits, and exp for the role you took (guitarist, bassist, etc.). Seasonal EXP unlocks new cosmetics at every new level (up to 7 per season right now), with credits you can buy new cosmetics. The most interesting thing is EXP for your role. Every role has its own level. If you're playing a run as a guitarist, just your guitarist gets EXP and unlocks three/two new cards per level up. The max level is 30 right now. After playing around 7 hours, I've reached season level 2 and guitarist level 11. This is a big grind. Oh, yeah. There is an in-game shop where you can buy credits for money (REAL money). I don't like that at all but as of right now, you can just buy cosmetic stuff with it.   [h1]Multiplayer vs. Singleplayer[/h1] You can play the roguelike mode with up to three friends or strangers online. If you do so, every player gets to choose one band member and acts like them. In battles, every member has energy and can play cards - when you're playing alone, the AI decides which cards your members play, etc. Also, when going into events, you often can decide between several options. If you're playing with others, everyone gets to decide and the option that has the most votes gets chosen. There's also an online-only mode called "royale" where you face off 63 other bands in an online tournament.   [h1]The Good[/h1][list] [*]Battles. They are fun, tactical, and addictive. It's something new to the deckbuilder genre and works very differently compared to other deckbuilders. This is an exciting and new take. I very much like it. [*]Multiplayer. It's a big plus to be able to play with up to three friends. The game is very much made to be played with others and I imagine it to be very fun. [*]Difficulty. The first few battles in a run are pretty easy and laid back but it gets significantly harder as you win more. I like that though I think it's a bit too hard in the single-player right now. I think that this is partly because there are just a dozen of different enemies and if you could easily play through a run in your third try or so, there wouldn't be much (new) left. [*]Meta-progression. There are many things to unlock and if you're into that kind of stuff, you can easily sink dozens of hours into it. [*]Artwork and music. The music is fantastic and the artwork is lovely. Every enemy is unique. It's a lovely made band, with their own song and own animations as well as set of cards. [*]You can customize your character and the van![/list]   [h1]The Bad[/h1][list] [*]Microtransactions. I'm not a fan of those, even though there are just cosmetic items to buy with in-game credits. I hope it stays like that. [*]Single-player. While it's fun enough to play alone, the game was made to be played with friends. There are downtimes waiting for the AI to act and since you can't decide which cards your bandmembers play it often feels like RNG. The tactical layer gets reduced by a lot when playing alone. Whatever you do is just 25% of what your team does - that's not a lot. If you're playing with friends, you can at least talk to them on discord and act together - as a team. [*]The Grind. As said above, in about 7 hours I've reached level 11 of 30 on the guitarist - one of four roles and level 2 of 7 in the season. To unlock every card with every role, you would need to play dozens of hours. [*]Too few enemies and events. With just 10 different enemies, it gets monotonous after a few runs. The Steam page doesn't sound like new enemies or events will be added but I've talked to one of the devs and they made sure to tell me, they will, in fact, add new enemies and events throughout early access.  [*]You can't save a run right now.[/list]   [h1]Conclusion[/h1] Battle Bands is unique. It's fun, addictive, and hard enough to be called a roguelike. Battles are totally different compared to your average deckbuilder and while in early access It already has dozens of different cards and every enemy is unique though there are just 10 right now. Being able to play the whole game with up to three friends adds a lot to the fun but the tactical layer suffers because of that when playing alone. Also, the grind is just too much. I like progression in every game but It's too much when you need dozens of hours to unlock all cards. Also, the EA text makes it sound like they are going to concentrate on cosmetics for the most part which I'm not a friend of.   Still, I definitely recommend getting Battle Bands if you want to play a new and unique deckbuilder. If you have friends to play with or aren't afraid of hopping on the game's discord and making some, this is definitely a day 1 recommendation.  [table]     [tr] [td] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38553778-All-about-Strategy-Games/] If you like my review and strategy games, please consider following my curator page on Steam! [/url] [/td] [/tr] [/table]

Ok this is a decent Faction DLC. It comes with the Usonian faction and their own single player campaign.  The Usonian faction is cool and unique. They have more unique air mechs like the big Samson air-battleship, but they lack the big ground mech like the Saxonian Kaiser mech.  The Usonian Single player Campaign is pretty good and entertaining to play through! I kinda wish it was even longer as i had fun completing the missions and liberating the Rusviet and the Arabians from their Oil and Iron!   Although the devs should make it so that the Engineers can build weaker Anti-Air turrets to fight enemy Air Mechs, as the enemy Anti-Air turrets in the Usonian Campaign were extremely dangerous and could easily wipe out your air fleet in seconds. What about dedicated Anti-Air infantry and Mechs?  I hope that this DLC was not the last DLC the Iron Harvest is getting. Hears hoping that we might get the Tesla and the Fenris Faction DLCs and their Campaigns!

Short version: Its awesome, beware bugs and lag.  I've been playing for 93 hours, and there are flaws, but I've loved all 93 hours I've sunk into this thing. The thing that keeps this game going for me is just the idea and exicution. The gameplay itself is wonderful, really reliant on teamwork and frankly, airships fighting each other without boarding is just friggen fun. But the bugs and the balance are desperate problems. Lag is sometimes like a mortal wound, bugs are lurking like traps to make you fall right through your ship, and the balance is being constantly ajusted. Such things have gotten much better since a year ago, when I joined, but I believe the developers are really working on their main project, which is adventure mode. Having only a small team working on both doesn't help either.  Also it's worth mentioning that the devs talk to the community in game almost constantly. The devs are telling us that they're working to fix the game's problems.

Скажи, помнишь ли ты ту вещь, что приковала Наш взор, обласканный сияньем летних дней, Ту падаль, что вокруг зловонье изливала, Труп, опрокинутый на ложе из камней.  Он, ноги тощие к лазури простирая, Дыша отравою, весь в гное и в поту Валялся там и гнил, все недра разверзая С распутством женщины, что кажет наготу.  И солнце жадное над падалью сверкало, Стремясь скорее все до капли разложить, Вернуть Природе все, что власть ее соткала, Все то, что некогда горело жаждой жить!  Под взорами небес, зловонье изливая, Она раскинулась чудовищным цветком, И задыхалась ты — и, словно неживая, Готовилась упасть на свежий луг ничком.  Неслось жужжанье мух из живота гнилого, Личинок жадные и черные полки Струились, как смола, из остова живого, И, шевелясь, ползли истлевшие куски.  Волной кипящею пред нами труп вздымался; Он низвергался вниз, чтоб снова вырастать, И как–то странно жил и странно колыхался, И раздувался весь, чтоб больше, больше стать!  И странной музыкой все вкруг него дышало, Как будто ветра вздох был слит с журчаньем вод, Как будто в веялке, кружась, зерно шуршало И свой ритмический свершало оборот.  Вдруг нам почудилось, что пеленою черной Распавшись, труп исчез, как побледневший сон. Как контур выцветший, что, взору непокорный, Воспоминанием бывает довершен.  И пес встревоженный, сердитый и голодный, Укрывшись за скалой, с ворчаньем мига ждал, Чтоб снова броситься на смрадный труп свободно И вновь глодать скелет, который он глодал.  А вот придет пора — и ты, червей питая, Как это чудище, вдруг станешь смрад и гной, Ты — солнца светлый лик, звезда очей златая, Ты — страсть моей души, ты — чистый ангел мой!  О да, прекрасная — ты будешь остов смрадный, Чтоб под ковром цветов, средь сумрака могил, Среди костей найти свой жребий безотрадный, Едва рассеется последний дым кадил.  Но ты скажи червям, когда без сожаленья Они тебя пожрут лобзанием своим, Что лик моей любви, распавшейся из тленья, Воздвигну я навек нетленным и святым!

I wish there was a third option to select ratter then just yes or no. I like the game but i can see that it is far from for everyone.  The game can be fun, but the overly grindy nature of some of the crafting etc might not be for everyone, and you dont really find that out till you are quite a bit in to the crafting, for example, to level furnating to just 75 you need 29k green wood, 10k iron ore, 500 ash stain. and that is just to get to 75 where 200 is max. Another issue is plain and simple, money making, if you are late to the game it can be a chore, some things just isnt worth much like iron ore, you would think it had a better price? well on the servers i play on, 1 US server and one EU server, on both iron ore sells for 0.01 or 0.02 if you are lucky. There is other things that can sell, but the competition is high on selling even the valuable things and they are dropping in price.  Storage can be a issue, at level 60 you can carry around 1500lbs, while a storage shed can hold only 1000 to start with and that can be upgraded as you level your zone standing up by 25 at the time. Houses can have chests in them that adds to the towns total storage you have, but still when you think about how much you need to horde to level a crafting skill it is no where enough for my taste, if they had doubled it that would be kind a in the sweet spot i feel.  There is quite a few issues i have with the game. There is atm to many exploitable things in the game and buggy stats, mechanics and such. This is a shame because the game sure can be fun at times, but then you meet someone who spend 5mins buffing up a bugged perk in the hatchet tree and they one tap you and things of that nature. If i was looking at the game i would wait a few weeks to see how they are doing on patching this things out, but as it stands people are more or less printing coin/gold even after the patch that comes out today, i just hope they add some kind a better tracking to catch the coin printers. There has been alot of talk about the whole family sharing thing, but that is just for the small scale printers, no one who is in it for the real money would be that silly that they used that glitch, and that is a issue that is not spoken off in the larger community sadly, nor is it being talked about for the devs either. Hopefully it gets resolved so i can say YES! this is a good game to get, but atm i am saying no.

This Chinese roguelite shooter-looter RPG takes ample inspiration from Borderlands, as well as other games such as Overwatch. The translation is sometimes worded strangely or vaguely, but 99% of what I've seen is acceptably coherent.  The game features (at time of writing) 5 characters, each with a Primary Skill (or ult) plus secondary skill (grenades or miscellaneous). Using a resource gained on runs, you can progress several generic upgrade trees shared across characters, and each character has its own linear upgrade progression. During runs, you can carry two guns (in addition to the default revolver-rifle, which scales with your lowest level gun), acquire upgrades in one of three categories unique to each character, and loot Occult Scrolls which provide various buffs and upgrades. Some have drawbacks, in addition to Cursed Scrolls which are almost entirely bad but usually gained in exchange for some other boon.  Like many Chinese, they are not overly coy about "stealing" ideas. You'll see this in the Tediore SMG, which can reload, or be alt-fired to take out its dynamite mechanism and throw it as an ammo-fueld bomb; as well as a gun modeled after Zarya's (only made out of bones and magical looking), with a firing function based on her black hole Ultimate. And of course, the enemy that is just Shark Roadhog.   It's worth mentioning this game uses some sort of system similar to Counter-Strike, wherein your movement speed is affected by the weight-class of the currently equipped gun. I do not understand why they did this, but they did. Just so you know.  Overall my friend and I have had a lot of fun with this game so far. We still have dozens of guns and scrolls to unlock as potential loot, and 3 more of the 5 characters.
great game. controls are clunqy and it has way more menus ans stuff than it needs, but man the story is great, even the side quests have a lot oof character.

I'd been eyeing this game for quite some time, and was bored during a weekend when it was on sale.  Unfortunately though, I'm just not really getting into it. There's two big components - the campaign map and the battles. The game has a Total War / Civilization like campaign map, and when units clash on the campaign map you start a battle that plays something like a board game version of an XCOM game.  Neither component is "bad", but neither has really been able to draw me in either. The campaign map is just mindnumbingly easy to the point that I've never had to worry about any resource whatsoever. The battles are sorta clunky, with units moving at slow speeds (and you can't tab to another unit and move it until the first unit stops.. unlike many games of this type).  At the end of the day I'd just rather be playing a game that does one of these things quite well, instead of a game that does both only passably. Either that, or I'll just fire up a Total War game.. which ultimately does both components far better, although it does have a real time battle system instead of a turn based one. I cannot recommend this sadly, though it does make me wish there was an option between "yes" and "no". It's not terrible, it's just that there are many other options out there that ultimately do a better job.

-Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning has a main story that is very well constructed, that does manage to carry you throughout the faelands leaving very little behind during the journey through the main story 9/10. -The enemies are rather intelligent and well put together to create a satisfying heroic experience. However the higher the level you become, the easier enemies are and does shorten the area to receive decent XP. That doesn't mean XP becomes a rarity by level 35, there are still a fair amount of enemies that give Good XP and can keep you leveling with a bit more effort each time, which is no problem if you genuinely enjoy KOA:R 9.5/10 The atmosphere of the game tells a story of itself; from lush sun bathed grass lands to dry, mysterious deserts to gloomy, dark, dangerous swamps, they all visually describe the living conditions and and what could be around any corner awaiting your next battle. 10/10 - The Characters, either being guards, civilians, merchant's, or soldiers, even those devoted to the God's all live sperate lives, have different occupations, and different intentions; but all come across as "regular" but once you look deeper, read more, hear more, and speak more you'll find that those who have identical occupations, are actually completely different people/ beings and I find that it is genius that the developers bury these differences deep in the characters and make you dig for the difference in everyone. 9.5/10 - The armour in KOA:R is some of the best in fantasy rpg, there are 3 classes for armour: Might (warriors), Finesse (scouts, rangers etc) and Sorcery (mages, priests etc.). Each of the three classes have great armour's to choose from and all offer the needed abilities of the class they sit in. Armour sets are yellow and are pretty unique, once a set is complete and the character is wearing the full set, a boost to defense, abilities, stats etc. is activated and provides great usefulness. The one of a kind armours are in purple, the are only one peice of equipment i.e helmet; they provide great use In terms of boosting stats or abilities. 9/10 - Weapons are just like the armour and all classes have their own types of weapon i.e hammer for Might, daggers for Finesse, and staff's for Sorcery. 9.5/10 The character development and building is great, you can obtain special abilities for all 3 classes, new skills, progress In skills and can create a true hero. If you don't like just being a single class you can have all 3 classes and have enormous access to resources and items as well as being more unstoppable. 10/10 Finally, the Dlc's / expansion packs. The dlc is new armour and weapons added for you class or classes all armour and weapons are amazing. 9/10 The teeth of naros, I can't fully explain; the experience is surreal, it's a new land with a city in the sky with Greek like influence heavily on characters and setting. If a higher level, you can level up really well in the teeth of naros, also the story and the side quest are amazing. They take you over every inch of the new map meeting, greeting and defeating along the way. 10/10 The legend of dead kel. A jaw dropping experience for new players, from rebuilding a fort and being it's ruler with servants and citizens, to treasure hunts while fighting long dead pirates and exploring the story rich island this expansion pack will make time pass and demonstrate how an expansion pack should be, a new experience. 10/10

Half-Life is a great FPS about surviving a secret government facility invaded by aliens after a scientific experiment gone wrong.  Half-Life is mostly linear (though it's a lot less obviously so than its sequel), yet the levels are still fairly well-designed, with the exception of some which are plain tedious (screw you, On A Rail.) The atmosphere is pretty good, though slightly lacking in environmental sounds, especially in Xen (an alien world you visit, which often lacks sound.) Most sounds come from nearby enemies, and those are great. They provide a feeling of tension, as you are frequentl in very tightareas and don't know where an alien (or more) is hiding. There's quite a variety of alien enemies, much more than HL2's 3 types of zombies: In total, 11 very different types of aliens, 2 bosses and 3 human enemies, all very different.  The gunplay is pretty satisfying, and there is quite a lot of variety: from standard weapons like pistol, revolver, shotgun and assault rifle wih a mini-grenade launcher, to crossbows, experimental cannons, alien hornet guns and living creatures that, when set loose, may attack you instead of your enemies! The AI also seems a lot smarter than most FPS, just due to the fact that it actually knows how to fall back when wounded to call more enemies.  The story is pretty basic (at the time it was fairly complex for an FPS, not so much today), and the ending is quite strange, but the locations you explore are fantastic, from laboratories to reactor cores to canyons to Xen, an alien world. The most irritating part of Half-Life has to be certain sections which have platforming. Platforming with the Quake Engine's momentum-heavy movement? Yeah, no.  It's still a great game, and well worth the purchase.

Игра деградирует в плане контента которого почти нет, пару пушек и одна карта в несколько лет такое себе,а и да один босс который в принципе изи как и все боссы в игре . Минусов в разы больше чем в любой наверное онлайн игре. Ужасные сервера с потерей пакетов, постоянные дёргания из-за которых не возможно попасть в хантов. Проблемы с пингом(хотя в других играх в принципе нет проблем с соединением) Про регистрацию урона и РАЗРАБОТЧИКИ СЧИТАЮТ ЧТО РАЗМЕНЫ ЭТО ЧЕСТНО ПО ОТНОШЕНИЮ К ИГРОКАМ настолько честно что пришлось забросить игру в соло ибо каждый килл=размен как играть? Что же мы получаем в замен ? Однотипные говно ивенты скины с которых можно получать через год а значит можно забить и потом когда нибудь получить нет никакой уникальности.. Получаем кучу длс ,точнее конвейер по их производству. Нахуя а главное зачем столько никому не понятно. Крайне не советую покупать данный шедевр криворуких фашистов которые хотят чтобы вы страдали и получали боль как в 41.

刀尖上起舞的游戏。  过了蝴蝶夫人和弦一郎的朋友，恭喜你通关只是时间上的问题。  目前四周目全成就，五周目开启双难，刚打完心中的弦一郎。即使打完所有boss，但至今仍未找到必过佛雕师的方法。 开启双难之前，从未重视过自己的架势条，但双难后打心中的弦一郎发现架势条涨的飞快，不得不又重新重视起来。 佛雕师后，壮年义父是我认为第二难的boss，打他除了要有进攻的决心，更需要有防守的耐心，在他掉五分之一血之前，架势条根本涨不上去。  在进攻时不要连续按攻击，如果对手出危的话，攻击动作未完成是无法避开或格挡的，所以最好按一下攻击，等攻击动作差不多完成，再按攻击。其次这就是个音游，很多玩家都有提到，可以根据对手格挡的声音判断下次操作是进攻还是防守，ting，ting，dang，格挡！一文字减少自己的架势条也是真的好用。  拜泪断不死，开门复苇名。

Day 1 - MONDAY  I begin in a house located somewhere in what I suspect to be the Finnish wilderness.  Wandering around my home I find a full case of beer and a pack of sausages.  A few minutes later of spinning and twirling the sausages around and I eventually learn how to consume what is surely a healthy diet of warm beer and sausages.  My immediate needs met, I continue to explore around the meager lodgings and eventually discover the door leading outside, only to be met with what looks to be my objective.  The sports car that surely every auto enthuist dreams to have one day, only it's missing every single part that makes it run, being only the car body itself.  In one word: Potential.  Stumbling further along, bright eyed and surely confident in my abilities and common sense to attach bits and pieces labeled "A" to slots marked "B", I find myself in front of what I assume to be the garage doors.  Opening the doors, my dreams and hopes of soon recreating scenes from the classic movie "Vanishing Point" are broken and dashed away by the seemingly hundreds of parts and pieces scattered around me with no manual or instructions in sight.  Never having actually worked on a car or engine before, I dive right into assembling parts of the main engine of the vehicle.  Further twirling and spinning, putting rods into slots and disks onto what should be spinning bits, a myriad of nuts and bolts and screws that I hope actually go where I think they need to.  I quickly become bewildered at one stage when I cannot attach a part to where it seems to need to go and submit to the daunting task of building an entire engine from scratch.  "Why can't this piece go there!?", "Did I get all the bolts screwed down!?", "You need THAT wrench to do that?!".  I relent the fact that there is no manual for engine assembly, but quickly reconsider that maybe this game hates me and if it were kind enough to even provide one, it would be written solely in Finnish.  I resign myself back inside the home after hours of tinkering and frustration, odd calls from the phone inside the house of people yelling at me in a language incomprehensible to me, and trying to make sense of the world around me, throwing what's left of the case of beer on top of the bed and drinking myself to sleep after what can't be happening, that I'm unable to complete what surely thousands of others have.  Sleep comes.  Day 2 - TUESDAY  I awake the next morning, my view shaking in what I can only guess to be from the massive amount of alcohol consumed the previous day.  I attempt to rectify this by drinking more beer.  It doesn't work.  I once again venture into the garage to assemble what bits and pieces of the engine are left when my eye catches the bright red bar in the upper left hand corner that I am apparently dying of hunger.  The fridge is empty, no food is in sight.  Panicking, not wanting to lose what work i've done so far I fumble my way into the drivers seat of the working blue van parked outside.  In my desperation and mad dash to where I think the main town is located, I run full blast at 100kmph after being sideswiped on the highway, straight into a tree.  The only memorial I have left to what I attempted is a spot in the newspaper of a patch of grass.   Day 1 - MONDAY  I begin in a house located somewhere in what I suspect to be the Finnish wilderness.   MSC is a very frustrating game.  A frustration that only adds to it's overall charm once you overcome these frustrations on your own, without any kind of documentation, tutorial, or set of directions.  After fully assembling the Satsuma, it's a piece of shit car that backblasts and overheats constantly.  But it's my piece of shit car, and I love it.

I'll need to find another way off the ship."  11/10  Would spend another 2+ hours in hiding again.

Hm, Shieldwall. What's that? So far five Missions in Ceasars' gaulicwar - campaign and custom battles for each published map, where you can also play as other cultures, in Capture the Flag(s) style, with Skilltrees and stuff.  Maybe you get punished in your first tries to win a match, but let's be honest: Who likes it too easy and with always the same flavor? The taste of victory will be even sweeter, when you get into the game.  There's charming design, intense fights, fresh gameplay (which somehow remind me of the fantastic game Overlord, hehehe) and those missions can last for up to 60 minutes each, so you have enough content for such a small Indy-game.  The Price is okay, the game is still in progress and Nezon Productions pumps out new missions after some weeks. Eight Bucks, i haven't regret to spend on for other things than Cigarettes and Pizza ;)  Hope you'll like it, too

Le jeu est excellent.  Les suites sont souvent moins bonnes, capitalisant facilement sur le succès du premier opus. Ici il n'en est rien.  On retrouve les personnages et leur excellent doublage. On est toujours dans un bac à sable (depuis le 2). La map est immense et nous fait profiter de l'extraordinaire batmobile. Franchement on prend plaisir à faire gronder le moteur tellement il en ressort une sensation de puissance ! Les cameras sont parfois un poil douteuses, ce qui peut être gênant, mais rien de très graves. Les challenges ...bof, quand on en a fait quelques uns on s'en lasse. C'est du détail. Et je pense qu'il faut être maniaque pour le finir à 100%, tout ça pour pas grand chose en plus ;) Bref le gameplay est jouissif. L'histoire ... un peu particulière, à cause du scénario.  Si vous avez aimé le 1 et le 2, foncez. Si vous n'en avez aucun et que vous devez choisir (sinon prenez les 3 :p) ... selon que vous soyez plus dans la narration, mieux vaut le 1 (asylum). Si vous préférez la liberté et les personnages classiques, alors plutôt le 2 (city). Pour la puissance de la batmobile (et quand même encore pas mal de persos sympas) alors le 3 (knight, celui là).

TL:DR: There are still mechanical reasons to play Warband instead of this game and until that changes I'm giving a thumbs down.  This review could be subject to change, depending on what the developers do in the coming months. However, as it stands at the time of it's "full release", I must unfortunately give it a thumbs down.  First and foremost, Bannerlord isn't a bad game, when standing on it's own. It is fun, it has neat mechanics, and if you want a modern game that allows you to feel like you are really taking part in a battle, instead of just ordering peons around, Bannerlord will probably be a hit.  So why am I reviewing negatively? While Bannerlord is a good game when standing on it's own, the truth is, it doesn't stand on it's own. Most of the people who bought into the early access of this game, including myself, where players of it's 20-y/o predecessor, Mount & Blade: Warband. This is important, because when you take a game considered to be a cult-classic, and tell it's fans you are making a sequel (technically prequel in this case). It comes with certain expectations: it should have everything everyone loved about the old, without the stuff they didn't, and a little bit of new thrown in. I shouldn't have any real reason to go play the old game instead, besides simple nostalgia.  In my opinion, Bannerlord succeeds in only 2/3 of these categories. It removes or improves upon much of the things people didn't like about Warband. It also adds a plethora of new features. My issue is that it seems to fail in the first category: having everything everyone loved about the old game.  This is no small issue, since adding new features to a game that doesn't even have all the mechanics that made it's 20-y/o predecessor great, such as suggesting courses of action to lords, marrying companions, feasts, and many more which I won't list for the sake of brevity, would seem to be a case of "putting the cart before the horse"  Now if the game was still in early access, I would have no issue. This isn't the case however. The developers have just done a "full release" of the game, and even mentioned considering DLC in one of their update articles. Why is this worrying? Because this could be an indicator that they plan to make a few DLC and then cash out with unfulfilled promises on an unfinished game (The ARK: Survival evolved fiasco comes to mind here).  This would be supremely disappointing. I'll cut them some slack though, because in their defense, they did say they would continue to update and work on the game, despite it's "full-release" status. And so that is why my opinion could be subject to change depending on what they do. If they come through, and finish the game like they said they would, and if it gets to a point where I truly have no reason to play Warband beyond nostalgia, then I will have nothing but glowing praise. If, however, they take the money and run, leaving us with a game that doesn't even have all the features of it's two decade-old predecessor, this review will remain negative.  April 18, 2023 EDIT: So it's been a few months, and it seems like the game is still lacking features. This isn't to say they haven't been updating it, but their priorities seem to be solely on adding shiny new things while features from Warband remain missing. Still holding out hope, but we'll see.

A game that has promise but comes up, unfortunately, lackluster, Sea of Thieves has intuitive sailing mechanics and fun aspects that can make for a satisfying and relaxing afternoon of play.  However, all of this is very harshly contrasted by the game being rife with bugs, a lack of proper content for those wanting something more than a sailing (and now fishing+cooking!) simulator - When the only incentive to continue with content is to accrue wealth and purchase cosmetics with said wealth, the game's small pool only gets smaller and more finite, if not outright tedious. Bugs have been reported over turning in quests but not receiving the payouts, incomplete quests that need redoing entirely, minor visual glitches (that can be overlooked, such as players rendering in as green skeletons or bald and underwear-clad characters because the servers have not rendered the data properly), as well as a lack of in-depth combat where the right-click block, almost certainly and without fail, does not block attacks from even NPC skeleton enemies makes for terrible pitfalls in an otherwise visually stunning and stylized game.  This is nothing to say of the online community on PC ports. If you're looking to purchase the game for a kid, the lack of friends-only matches or server selection may prove frustrating and draining. The community is absolutely riddled with griefers, boat-sinkers, macro-users, and no in-game support staff to report aggressive behaviors making for a hostile environment. Granted, from time to time, there are players that subvert this and engage in alliances, but those are few and far between. The players who stick around with the game and have collected each piece of content they can garner are left with nothing to do, it seems, and thus, turn toward other players to sate their need for engagement.  The game is fun, don't get me wrong.  But it is certainly not worth its price-tag. (It's CERTAINLY not worth "Premium Cosmetics", allegedly coming soon in the form of doubtless micro transactions where the game is already starved for content and it's only progression is in the form of unlocking, surprise, non-monetized cosmetics)  In fact, if you'd like an equally fun and non-stressful game with amazing visual design by Rare, Viva Pinata (while not even comparable in the least to a Pirate Themed Epoch) by far has still got to be one of my favorites.

Todavía le faltan muchas cosas, pero los creadores de Plague INC nos entregan otro juego entretenido, con una busqueda del equilibrio entre el desarrollo, la destrucción y la corrupción. No es fácil entrar en un tema tan caldeado como las guerras civiles de regiones "inestables" (sobre todo, por el presente de muchos paises periféricos), y creo que necesita mucho más en la política extranjera. Me refiero, esas zonas son bélicas por insurgencias frente a gobiernos apoyados por potencias como EEUU, Rusia, China y otras; fuera de eso, tal vez el sistema de eliminar insurgentes atrapandolos en una región sin escape es una idea interesante (sobre todo, para pensar el caso de la guerrilla cubana de los 50's en Sierra Maestra), pero no debe ser la única manera: no toda guerrilla se escapa y renace más fuerte como acá. En resumen: puede estar mejor, será necesario que lo haga en el futuro, pero vale su precio.

Funny things is: I installed this game a week ago from a CD I have since 2006, and now it's on Steam. Bought it anyway, more easy when I want to play it on other PCs.  Well, to the game. If you like the first 2 Roller Coaster Tycoon, you'll like this one. It's simple, it's a top-down view, you can only rotate the camera 90 degress, you know, basic Roller Coaster stuff. You create train tracks and streets as if you were creating roller coasters on RCT. There's no secret.  The soundtrack plays accordingly to the year you're playing, it's awesome. Very relaxing.  The game starts very very easy, so you can learn basics. However, when you reach harder levels, the difficulty rises significantly. Isn't easy to play against 7 CPU controlled rival companies when you have to reach a 90% performance Index.  You may have problems understanding train tracks, routes and signalling when you start, but nothing that a little search doesn't fix. Isn't something complicated, once you understand it will be easy. Also isn't not THAT important that you learn about signaling if you're not making crossed tracks.  Anyway, I have over 2000 hours on Locomotion using my old disc (I play this since 2006, on a Windows 98). It's simple, relaxing and can be really challenging on harder maps even if you KNOW how to play properly.

Let me state before I continue: This game does not boast EA's standard microtransaction scum. The monetization is very agreeable, and a player can play almost everything for free without issue (which I did), and subscribing has lasting benefits. See the article at the bottom for more details.  A nice MMORPG that balances classic mechanics with new ideas. As someone looking to scratch the WoW itch, this was a fantastic game for that. Even more, the added story elements, fully voice-acted cutscenes*, and individual storylines makes for a much more interesting adventure.   The only gripes I have are how little consequences player choice have. Allignment is affected by things other than the choices you make, almost as much as your character's actions. the second is daily rewards, which don't appropriately reward returning players but do result in burnout**  There's also a romance system where you can flirt with characters. I have not interacted with this system at all. However, it has led to an atrocious chat, so you'll have to switch away from it if you're anything like me (if you constantly chat about which characters you "find sexy", maybe you'll disagree).  I would still recommend this thoroughly because of the amount here. Not only is it fun to play and more interesting than plain grinding, but most of the game is available for free. Most restrictions are annoying at worst and inconsequential at best, and that's it. For example, FTP players have a reduction on the XP they earn, yet I ended up overlevelled in each area (which the game scales you down to accommodate for, so you still have a challenge). I also have little Star Wars knowledge (I haven't even watched the original trilogy in a while, though I plan to soon).  If you're looking for an MMORPG to play, I would definitely recommend giving this one a chance. It does require, like, three accounts to play, but you likely have 1-2 already.  *There are a few standard responses your character uses from time to time, and the animations have their own repetitions as well, but heck of a lot better than the wall of text of linear story WoW gives. **This game has weekly rewards (4/7 days in a week), weekly challenges (complete weekly objectives for points for rewards), and a subscription model (You're not gonna waste time you paid for, right?). Those encourage regular playing well enough, and the daily rewards are very poor (most rewards are unusable as a free-to-play player).  If you're curious, here's a thorough rundown on how SWTOR monetization applies https://swtorista.com/articles/swtor-free-to-play-vs-preferred-vs-subscriber-guide/

This can be a good game.  This probably will be a good game.   But not yet - it's extremely far from being completed and I'd strongly discourage anyone from paying $29 for it in its current state.  Edit 11/5/2016: Definitely seeing some improvement in the game, would like to reiterate both parts of my review - still not worth it, but definitely on the right track  Edit 9/17/2017: Coming along, but still very slowly. I like the direction this game is headed but it's so very far from complete.   Edit 7/30/2018: So apparently the game is now "released." But it's still suffering from the same problems it had all along. Bugs, memory leaks, clunky interface, and overall lack of endgame.  Edit 5/9/2019: Well, looks like they're done working on this game. Not complete, not worth $20. Very disappointing.

В очередной раз возвращаюсь в рим.... А между тем число часов подходит к значению в 500...  Не смотря свою невероятную первую любовь - This War Of Mine, следует отдавать должное такому параметру как реиграбельность. И по мне - нет на свете более реиграбельной игры чем рим. Немного фактов:  1) За 500 часов я так и не постиг все тонкости механик, например рассчет силы рейда до сих пор вызывает у меня недоумение. 2) Спустя 500 часов я научился предсказывать приближение пушистого сибирского, но вот избежать его кажется просто невозможно. 3) Имея 500 часов игрового опыта - я до сих пор встречаю события, которые никогда не происходили. Замечу - не комбинации, а конкретно события. Недавно мне к поселению прибавился мегатерий, он же гигантский ленивец. Знаю, что бывает и присоединение Трумбо, но это мне кажется совершенной фантастикой.  Главной причиной всего этого является само название... Генератор захватывающих историй. Степень рандомизации игры настолько фантастическая, что в неё хочется играть снова и снова. При определенных условиях, конечно же. Эта игра не про выживание, не про строительство и хомячество - она про совокупность событий. Конечно же, для полной остроты ощущений и драматичности необходим максимальный уровень сложности и "ответственный режим". И играть необходимо честно, а то рим способен и за хитрости наказывать.   Сегодня у меня случился "день сурка" - череда неприятных событий, заканчивающаяся гибелью поселенцев. Я решил воспользоваться хитростью, которая позволяет откатиться к началу дня, закрыв игру. Если не вдаваться в подробности - игра поимела меня три раза, и я уже возненавидел этот игровой день, так как каждый раз думал, что ну в этот то раз все пройдет гладко - и повторял кучу рутинных действий, предшествующих дальнейшей катастрофе. И на четвертый раз - меня загрузило ровно к тому моменту с которого я вышел. Кассандра меня просто унизила тремя разными способами. Рэнди так делать не умеет.   А игроки тем временем таки ставят максимальный уровень сложности, и обкалываются модификациями, вроде увеличения вместительности клеток или производства невосполнимых ресурсов, а то и выбор параметров стартовых колонистов. Игроки строят крепости, киллбоксы и автономные системы, превращают свою базу в склад ресурсов всей планеты, а потом спрашивают как отключить осады, десанты и подрывников, а то напрягает. И вот вроде бы какое мне дело, кто как играет? Но я чувствую боль от того, что многие просто не понимают главной мысли. Эти же личности потом пишут, что им стало скучно играть.   Самое интересное в этой игре - адаптивность игрока и рассказчика, которая всегда поддерживает высокий уровень напряженности. Если ты играя в рим расслабился - значит ты точно что-то делаешь не так. Практически из всех ситуаций в игре есть выход, зачастую с невероятными жертвами и в разрез с изначальной стратегией, но есть. Застали врасплох токсичные осадки? Беги на другую клетку! У противников невероятное преимущество? Придется переждать в дальних комнатах, жертвуя убранством. Внезапная болезнь положила всех поселенцев? Тебя спасет таинственный незнакомец.   Вопрос в том, выдержат ли твои нервишки? Стерпишь ли ты все удары, которые нанесет по тебе рассказчик? Сможешь принять утрату своего стартового персонажа? Построишь ли новую базу на пепелище старой? При таком подходе эта игра просто не может надоесть или наскучить. В игре нет ничего, что нельзя было чем-то заменить - помните об этом и учитесь наслаждаться процессом

Solid stealth gameplay for a few chapters, then it stops being fun very quickly. The no-kills limitation imposed on you at the midgame is laughable game design. Every time you shoot a guard, you have to expend a medkit to heal him or get a game over. Meaning if I get spotted, I can fight with my fists and certainly get killed by the reinforcements, or I can gun everybody down, not have enough medkits to heal everyone, and get a game over anyway.  Escaping isn't an option in most places so the only thing you can really do after being spotted is just let the guards kill you, every time. For the entire back half of the game. A nice thing about Metal Gear is that it doesn't expect you to 100% stealth it, and it actually gives you the tools to fight your way out of a bind. Shame that Unmetal didn't catch on to this.  The story and cast are bland and mostly serve as a vehicle to deliver the game's long, grating comedy scenes with endlessly recycled punchlines. By the last chapter it's so creatively bankrupt that it resorts to "Japanese people have funny accents" as a joke on its own. What an absolute mess. Would have been a hit if it was on Newgrounds in 2005.

Evoluzione ultima dello spin-off Championship per l'iconico Pac-Man, DX+ eleva al massimo la varietà di labirinti e di conseguenza le sfide nella scalata per raggiungere i piani alti della classifica. Reduce da decine di ore su Xbox 360, me lo ritrovo anche su PC grazie a un offertone che comprendeva tutti i DLC compreso il IIIrd championship. Definitivo, schematico, adrenalinico e psichedelico, il Pac-Man per i core gamers offre l'essenza dell'arcade classico rivisitato in chiave moderna, semplice ma efficace e con tanto gameplay. Il genio di Iwatani prosegue nella leggenda che ha ispirato tanti giochi da oltre 30'anni. Imperdibile.

game: The Lord of the Rings Online™
review: The game can feel pedestrian for some, but that's because you have to slow down and experience not merely the journey, but simply being places, and meeting well-loved characters and other players. The LoTRO community has drawn some of the more mature, kindest, and warmest people into little kinships across the few servers, it's well deserving of a place in your library, and you'll gain something by giving a little something to the community here. Действие Fort Solis разворачивается в будущем, в котором люди начали осваивать Марс и понастроили на нём несколько баз. Главные герои, Джек и Джессика, получают сигнал тревоги из Форта Солис. Будучи уверенным, что там не случилось ничего серьезного, Джек отправляется в Форт проверить ситуацию. По прибытии оказывается, что база находится в режиме блокировки, а весь персонал куда-то подевался.  По сути, Fort Solis – это симулятор ходьбы, в котором нам по классике нужно исследовать локацию, находить аудиозаписи и видеодневники и пытаться разузнать, что же тут произошло. Но, в отличие от других симуляторов ходьбы, Fort Solis использует движок Unreal Engine 5, из-за чего игра выглядит потрясающе. Художники тоже постарались.  https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3026197932 Джека озвучивает Роджер Кларк, известный по роли Артура Моргана из RDR2, а ещё одного персонажа озвучивает Трой Бейкер. Во время исследования Джек постоянно общается с Джессикой, которую озвучила актриса Джулия Браун. Она звучит довольно приятно. На мой взгляд, за счет картинки и хороших актеров игра получилась очень атмосферной. За сюжетом интересно следить. Но он оказался короткий, игра проходится всего за 4 часа. Да и от концовки я ожидал большего. Хотелось бы увидеть какие-то последствия.  Но главный минус игры – это скорость главного героя. Он настолько медленный, что я ловил вьетнамские флэшбеки с игрой «Everybody's Gone to the Rapture». Но даже там можно было хоть немного ускориться, а тут нет. Если бы герой не был настолько медленным, игру можно было бы пройти в 5 раз быстрее. Учитывая, что тут ещё и карта неудобная, я думаю, что разработчики сделали это специально, чтобы искусственно растянуть прохождение.   https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3026565063 А ещё жаль, что тут нельзя загружать отдельные главы. Я пытался обшаривать каждый угол, но собрал примерно 80% записей и плакатов, а переигрывать всю игру заново с учётом черепашьей скорости мне как-то не хочется. Но, несмотря на минусы, игра мне понравилась. Это красивое и атмосферное приключение. Так что могу посоветовать.
如果喜欢玩建造游戏的肯定会觉得这游戏很好玩，但是并不适合我这样的玩家！游戏还是很好玩的！
